Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: jeniec
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of scary reveiws on Trip Advisor, which I take with a grain of salt of course I was so happy to see that this hotel was not the scary roach infested dump people said it was. I will begin by saying that people were complaining that the breakfast buffet was pricy. Wll 3 adults and 2 kids who eat free, was a whopping $35.00! That to me is great, nowhere here in Edmonton can 5 people get a breakfast anywhere for that price. The food was good and hot and there was a great slection of your typical breakfast foods including fruit and yogurt. Okay now the hotel. Yes it may be more like a motel but who cares, We booked a kids suite with our pacakge and then after I saw the 2 room suites. We checked on at 9:00 am on a Saturday and I asked if we could upgrade. Yes no problem $20 more a night......done and done! The room was older, again wasn't there to hang in the room but it was huge, couch and murphy bed for Grandma on the living area, there was a bar area with a fridge and microwave. Then the bathroom was again hige and very clean. The maids were very good at leaving extra towels as they must have noticed there were 5 of us. Then there was the bedroom, again huge, 2 double beds and a closet and its own air conditioner as well. Also had a table and chairs. We were on the 2nd floor room 800 and it overlooked one of the pools. Not the one with the bar but that was okay it was a quick walk. The staff was very friendly throughout the hotel, everything was clean the pools were really nice. The food in the food court was good, lots of choices and the grocery part was also very handy and reasonable priced. There are so many restaurants around the hotel that the kids eat free at if they are 10 or under and it is a short drive to the Disney Parks as well. Location, location, location that is for sure. Would I stay there agan, in a second and I will tell everyone I know that they should stay at the Seralago as well. We travel a lot and I know that there are always nicer and fancier hotels to stay at and by all means if people want to spend the money to stay at a Disney Hotel then good for them. Personally I like to find hiddem gems like the Seralago and stay there and be able to afford many family vacations a year.

Reviews.Title: “great time at seralago”
Reviews.Author: ricky b
Reviews.Content: Great family resort. Spectacular value for you money. Jazuzzi & pools open till midnight, friendly staff, free WIFI, fridge in the room, good location, and lots of games for kids - it exceeded our expectations. The only minor problem was matress - could feel springs through the sheets - but perhaps we're just being a bit picky :-) Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Overall ok”
Reviews.Author: Tammy B
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at The Seralago on April 14th-20th/2012. We stayed in room 102. It had 2 double beds. First , the tv kept shutting off on it's on. The maintenance came while we were out. Not sure what they did. But it didn't fix it. Then the picture started getting distorted every now and then or it was going to a snowy picture, like the cable went out. We told maintenance and he said he would have the manager on duty call us. Didn't happen! I got back in the room in the evening, had a drink and a candy bar. Sat it down on the night stand for about 5 minutes, and ants were all over it! The maid service was great! Monica did a great job. When we checked out, we told the manager on duty about our problems, he said he couldn't do anything about the tv! He couldn't comp us nothing for that! He did comp us the drink and candy bar I lost by letting me pick out a drink and candy bar at the store they have in the lobby. I expected better customer service from them! Their motto on the literature in the room says they will make the customer happy whatever it takes! Crap! And they also state in the brochure that the pools are heated, that's crap too! The pool was cold at night! We asked about that also to no avail! I did loveeee the spa/hot tub! It was very relaxing at night! The rooms were nice but a little outdated. The bathroom had painted tiles on the walls.And the room had a working fridge and microwave that came in handy. They did have a shuttle to Universal. It was great. But if you do ride the shuttle, make sure you tip the driver that takes you and picks you up. The drivers are different from each trip. I gave them a dollar each trip. I didn't have much, but I gave what I could. He had to do a pick up from a high end hotel, and no one tipped him anything! I don't think these guys make much! Hey! The shuttle is free. Tip them a little!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at Seralago!”
Reviews.Author: AleksEydelman
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood was 'blah', but Seralago was the nicest place there. The staff were nice, the room was good, the 2 pools and jacuzzis were a great time! I loved that the pools and jacuzzis were open until midnight. Also the bartenders at the pool bar were REALLY nice, we much appreciated their extra effort for us :) Since we were there for the parks, I did not much care about the neighboring area and enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star hotel for a 2 star price”
Reviews.Author: julia m
Reviews.Content: We came here after our horrible experience at champions i wish we would have came here first the prices were very affordable the room was clean the beds just a little uncomfortable there were no roaches so we were very happy with that the pools are so nice and heated! they have a 24 hour game room for the kids their restaurants should be open more but we mostly ate out anyway seralago is in a great location there's a place right down the street called old town with tons of rides and shops we had a great time staying here and most of the surrounding restaurants will give you a discount if you show your room key we will definitely be staying here again and i would recommend to anybody who wants great value for their money

Reviews.Title: “A cheap nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room had a funny odor and the floor was not clean. The room we stayed in had a mattress that we could feel the springs. There was no padding on the mattress either and when we asked for a few extra towels they never brought them. As well when I brought to the attention of the staff at the front desk that the steel bed frame was sticking out and cut me and my 12 year old daughter on our shins. They did nothing about it, we just toughed it out but for sure will never go back nor recommend anyone to stay there. The rating on the the web site was misleading"IT WAS NOT A 3 STAR HOTEL"maybe a one at best. I have been to Mexico in the 80's and things were better in Tiajuana!!! We just toughed out our stay and tried to spend as little time in the hotel room, we could not sleep because we were uncomfortable. Oh to mention the microwave that seemed to never been cleam and was form the 80's that would burn any thing and the timer did not work!!! I went through hotwire and got to stay at the Ramada for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Our Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Seralgo Hotel and Suites while on a family vacation. Since we were going to Disney we were asked often if we were staying on Disney property. I am so glad we stayed here at Seralgo. The rooms were clean, the pool was great, the people were friendly and we could not have had a better time. I think this was the best vacation ever and Seralgo played a big part in that!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: mbernsen
Reviews.Content: Originally we booked this on Hotwire for $21 a night, once there we upgraded to a kids suite. My children (ages 2 and 5) were THRILLED when they saw it. I suspect they would have been happy spending our entire vacation just at the hotel given that they offer such kid-friendly amenities. The kids pool, playground and game room were wonderful ways to wind down after visiting the parks. The food that was offered was good (especially their pizza-- LOVED IT!) although I did not pay to eat their breakfast as it was pricey compared to other buffets just a few buildings down in either direction. Their shuttle service is convenient, with several pick-up and drop-off times. Staff was very friendly. It isn't a secret that the hotel needs some renovations; the curtains were obviously in need of cleaning with black mildew on their surfaces, the bathroom had dirt all along the top frame of the door (again, easily seen even for someone of my grand height of 5 feet). Bottom line: the kids enjoyed it, which is what counts in my book. For a family on a budget that still wants to experience the magic of the Orlando area, this is a great hotel to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: manxholidaygirl
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms here for three adults and two children, mainly because of the free shuttle to Disney and the price. It is a typical American style Motel, but the rooms were clean and comfortable and we had communicating door as requested. Yes it is fairly basic, but had all you need in the room, including a microwave and coffee maker, but, but much than a similar priced hotel in the UK. We arrived one evening ready for a day at Disney the next, with departure the following day (two nights). The children loved the kiddies pool and playground, our adult son found the main pool just right first thing in the morning for a serious training session. The free shuttle buses to Disney were on time and the journey wasn't far, two shuttles in the morning 8am and 11 am, we got the 11am one and were in the Magic Kingdom in half an hour. Disney was just as bad as we imagined (Easter Break) with long queues and rip off prices, but hey that's Disney. The kids couldn't wait to get back to the hotel and the pool. Grandad very sensibly stayed at the Hotel and enjoyed his day relaxing by the pool with a good book. Breakfast was buffet style and reasonably priced, even though the staff were rushed off their feet they were friendly and helpful. Would recommend it for a cheap hotel near Disney Complex without Disney prices. If you don't want to drag cases up a flight of stairs I would suggest the ground floor rooms,

Reviews.Title: “seralago hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was nice there i will go back there again bed were a little bit uncomfortable service was very attentive hotel was close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Michelle A
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for 3 days and have no complaints. We had 2 rooms booked and we were put on the second floor. We didn't realized there weren't any elevators and the stairs were too much for my mother and grandmother. There was no problem with switching them to a ground floor room. The buffet was nice and the restaurant staff were very friendly and efficient. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants and right next to Old Town. Plus very close to Disney. Would defiently stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sucks”
Reviews.Author: Jesse G
Reviews.Content: The worst experience of my life! Roaches in the room, very impolite staff and the maids were terrible. I will never stay here ever again!!

Reviews.Title: “Scary...”
Reviews.Author: NahirC
Reviews.Content: My family and I went on a weekend trip to Disney World, last minute trip, and my parents suggested this hotel since they have stayed there before. The hotel was ok, bathrooms were small, the beds were hard and the pillows, well, your head sunk in them. The last day of our stay, THANK GOODNESS, we woke up to 3 police cars and crime tape downstairs. The police would not say what happened but once we went to check out, we spoke to the front desk, they said there was a medical emergency. When my mom said it looks as if someone was killed, the person at the front desk confirmed it!!! This will be the last time any one of use will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel but everything you need”
Reviews.Author: valeriecolleen
Reviews.Content: As others ha written the hotel looks as though it has not updated the rooms since the 70's but they were clean and well maintained. We booked the "suite" which comfortably slept 6 of us. You couldn't beat the price and location. It had 2 very clean pools and alot for children to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nezar E
Reviews.Content: Visited a while back with my family stayed for a week,easily accesible and a nice look great games roomPeaceful stay.Only thing i would say is that the rooms are a bit cramped in and pretty small but apart from that it was great!

Reviews.Title: “great location for Disney”
Reviews.Author: endlessvacation
Reviews.Content: The Seralago Hotel offered a good value for our recent visit to Disney World. Although it could certainly use some sprucing up in the bathroom, we found it to be quite comfortable. The room was plain, but sufficient for our needs, comfortable, clean beds with fresh sheets, blankets, and bedspread. Each day the soap was tossed out and a fresh bar was left, as well as a fresh bottle of shampoo, even if the first was half full. Towels were aplenty, changed daily. At the large pool there were plenty of towels available as well. The towel bin was kept full all day for your use. There was a good sized hot tub, and an additional pool in the other area of the property. The main pool had a great bar and food pavillion for reasonable prices, with a daily drink special. We ate the juicy hamburg/fries special at the pool several times, even splitting it once as it was so big. It was spring break so a lot of families were there, but we didn't find it too noisy or too crowded. Food was available on site for breakfast and other meals, and many restaurants within walking distance made in unnecessary to have a car. (KFC, Red Lobster, Italian, Ponderosa, Burger King, McDonalds) There was a small grocery store walking distance down the street as well as a liquor store. Their free shuttle to the parks was convenient. We did not find any bugs in the room or anywhere. The property was relatively clean, did find some cigarette butts on the pool deck which apparently does not get swept each night, but chaises are always realligned. They hosted a great egg hunt for the children. We would definitly try it again. The biggest issue was the bathroom could/should be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: USA4eva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks during March. Very busy because the American children had started their spring break, lots of teenagers at the hotel, however we didn't experience any noise at night the complex was quiet. On arrival we were unable to have our rooms together as requested, but a very helpful gentleman on reception changed our rooms, so the 2 rooms booked were only 5 rooms away which was quite acceptable. We had a king suite which had a sofa and a fridge and microwave. Bed a bit on the firm side for me, but that's just my preference. The furniture a bit worn in places as you would expect from the large turnover of people that stay here, but paintwork and carpets were clean. Rooms were cleaned adequately and towels changed daily. Unfortunately no safe in the room but they supply a free of charge safety deposit box at reception, this was a bit inconvenient but very safe and always somebody to attend to you, no waiting. This is a very large hotel complex and our room was quite far from the reception, bar and restaurant area, but usually we were in our car and could just pop in to reception on our way out or home in the evening. There are a couple of pools, didn't use them, but the area seemed lovely and they were always well used. We walked a few evenings for meals and drinks to the Old Town which is located about 10mins walk from the hotel. Also many shops and restaurants across the road. Felt safe walking about during night time, security presence very prominent. We would definately consider staying her again the next time we visit the area. Great location for visiting the Disney theme parks, about 40 mins from Sea World and Universal, depending on traffic. The weather was a bit cool some evenings but overall very pleasant day and evening, a nice time of year to visit, not a drop of rain for the 2 weeks :)

Reviews.Title: “Poor room with NO BATHROOM FAN!”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the year before and it was mediocre so I decided to give it another shot. They gave us a room that had no bathroom fan. The room looked like it was from the 70,s as far as updated amenities. They need an exterminator also because there are roaches. The bed was very flimsy and anytime the other person moved the whole bed wobbled back and forth. Most electrical outlets didn't work. Poor WIFI reception. I would only recommend if and only if one is on a strict budget, and even then Red Roof Inn or something similar might be the better choice being this was basically the same except with bigger pools and a few more amenities. I booked this through Hotels.com and had to pay in advance and a forfeiture of money if canceled. Needless to say I will be complaining.

Reviews.Title: “A must for overnight and week long Vacations.”
Reviews.Author: Sandrabrandon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels, motels and Inns growing up but this place has become mine And my families favourite place to stay while in Florida. We only stayed for the one night before we checked into Disney but I can honestly say that I will stay there again whether it's for one night or one week. Thumbs up all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Disney with Sister”
Reviews.Author: trighett
Reviews.Content: Hotel was so much nicer than I expected, especially for the price I paid. We only used the pool once. It was nice. We basically just slept there. It is a great location for going to Disney. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what u pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: Smithson M
Reviews.Content: Just got back after spending 4 nights in Orlando. We stayed at Seralago because of the rates. If you can afford to pay a little more I would definitely pick somewhere else to stay. This place is not a hotel it's more like a motel. The room we stayed in smelled really musty and it was in need of major updating . It would have been perfect if we were in the year 1970. The a/c in our room sounded like an airplane was landing over head......ok that was the bad.... Now for the good..... The food at this place was really good and not to pricey. The pool was real big and heated which was nice for the kids. Also the playground was nice for my little kids who spent some time there. Like I said if you could spend a little more to stay somewhere else I definitely would but I would stay here again if I couldn't find something better within my budget.

Reviews.Title: “Would have slept better in the car!”
Reviews.Author: emcclay
Reviews.Content: Had to book this last-minute as something came up in our plans. We spent 5 nights at Disney's Coronado Springs Resort and had an extra day of park time. Booked this based off of the value. Check-in was fine and the girl at the front desk was super nice. We arrived at our room and our door was open already. This led to finding mosquitoes all over the place. I saw little bugs between the door and TV where the wall meets the ceiling. There was also a dead moth under the bathroom door! Our room smelled musty, maybe from the A.C. The bottom corner of the bathroom door frame had rusted away. The bed passed my bed bug check. I know Florida water has sulfur in it, and this water really did not let you forget that! The only good thing about the room was the cable TV. I will never, ever stay off Disney property again. Good thing we were only here for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nedlin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. It was only 15 to 20 minutes from Disney and lots of places to eat close by. Not that impressed with the buffet which was $8 plus tax. We were basically only there to sleep as gone from 9AM to 9PM. Room was newly painted and clean. Mattresses could be updated but better than some. Staff was friendly. Did not use any of the pools or other facilities but seem to be quite a few families there

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryW34094
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and it is always a great place to stay. Rooms are clean, employees are friendly and very accommodating. We have stayed with children and they love the pool, playground, arcade and puzzles in the lobby. Very close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Beverly K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights. We had no complaints at all. The staff was friendly and very helpful with any questions we had. Our room was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping was very prompt and met any request we had. The Pool area is very nice, prefect for a family with young children. They also have a play ground area. The bar by the pool is nice. When you buy your first drink, you get it in a souvenir glass and get refills at a discounted price. The only area I think they could improve would be to offer the shuttle to and from the parks more often.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Vieraeveedhnick
Reviews.Content: My friends are Leaving for Florida Friday and asked me about seralago. I begged them to to stay there besides the roaches and dirty sheets rooms smell musty. Overall a horrible place. Please don't stay here

Reviews.Title: “Just an okay stay”
Reviews.Author: stephthegreatxo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. The front desk staff wasn't exactly the friendliest, seem kinda bored with their jobs. The room was okay. The bed was uncomfortable, tv had some issues. The room was mostly clean except for the bathroom. The walls were paper thin so I could hear everything outside. The room was fairly cheap though, so I guess you get what you pay for. I didn't get to use the pool but I walked around &.it looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the Budgetminded”
Reviews.Author: twan60
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for years and keep coming back when we need a quick place to stay in Florida. The rooms are clean and the pool is amazing. Love the family feel of this hotel. I will always come here first when I need a hotel in the Kissimmee area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the $”
Reviews.Author: jolianne01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean with many amenities for a very, very reasonable price. It is not the newest and most updated facility but for the money it cannot be beat. There are two big (heated) pools and two hot tubs, volleyball court, full service restaurant and quick service snack shop with coffee, and more! If you are doing Disney, Sea World, and/or Universal on a "budget", definitely give this place a try. The staff is very helpful and friendly. It was peaceful and quiet when we were here. Overall I was very happy with every aspect of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot! Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn1413
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Seralago this week, and had a great time! No, it's not the Taj Mahal, but it was clean, was in a convenient location and had everything you needed. The hotel overall was a bit dated, but so are a lot of the other hotels in the area and we didn't spend enough time in the room itself to be overly picky. The room was your average room, we had 2 doubles, and there was a mini-fridge and microwave which was really convenient for making your own breakfast or quick lunch. There are 2 pools which were moderately busy during the day, but even still we always got lounge chairs and beach towels were always plentiful. The only comment we'd have is that it would have been good to have more shaded areas. There were only a few umbrellas at each pool so we had to get up early to reserve. There's an arcade, small shop and restaurant in the lobby and the guest services had lots of great advice and sold attraction tickets right there. And there were tons of restaurants and small attractions within walking distance. I'm sure if we wanted to find things wrong with the hotel we could have picked it apart, but for a group wanting a reasonably priced hotel in a convenient location, we were completely happy with the result. And we'd definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst than a bad motel.”
Reviews.Author: Luargenta
Reviews.Content: This place is worst than a motel. The smell, the humidity and the stains on the courtains and carpet are just outreageous and disgusting. We went to the front desk to report a noise coming from the next room alarm clock, and the lady asked us to find out which of the room had the alarm on! The outside lamp entering the rooms were flipped. It was a nightmare, not a place to recommend and not cheap either. :(

Reviews.Title: “Not my type of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Falisa C
Reviews.Content: I made reservations online for spring break...Wow, not what I expected at all...Me & my husband requested to look at the room first. I shouldn't even went that far with it, this hotel is terrible. I know the price is very reasonable, but the hotel is bad. The room looks very cheap. If you want something nice & comfortable...This is not the hotel. My final say...if you uphold certain standards for yourself & family don't make the mistake coming to this hotel. Now, the people that claim the hotel is great & gave a high rating-obviously you have low standards (as far as hotel stays). Don't want to be mean, but, really?? 5 stars!!! and for hotel Seralago management, please update your website, it's misleading, perhaps the video was taking when the hotel was first built. Even better, remodeling is overdue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kimerson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days in March 2012. Our 10 year old loved the pools, the hot tub, the game room, and the snack bar. They are very kid friendly. The employees were all very polite and helpful. There was no coffeepot in the room but when I requested one they brought it right over. The room was okay. Nothing spectacular but for the price we didn't expect that. It was clean and fairly comfortable. Not huge and I have definitely slept in more comfortable beds. From reading reviews I was a little worried but we had a pleasant stay here at a very good price. Overall, it's a good bargain... close to Disney, within walking distance of 'Old Town' and several restaurants, with tons of kid friendly activities for when you aren't at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: ndnpassferfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 3/12-3/17/2012 and loved it. The kids loved everything about it. The 2 pools, the game room and the food court. The rooms were really clean and nice. I did have a slight problem with checking in. I called in my reservation and was promised a kid suite for all the nights except for the first night. That was okay. I understood how busy it gets down there. When I came to retrieve my keys for my kidsuite for the additional days, I got the look of fright. They did not have me booked for a kidsuite. AT ALL! Also, they dont honor the Florida resident discount or the LEO discount. Except for the fact that I almost had to have a come to Jesus about the kidsuite, we had a really nice time. I really recommend it for families. For older people, request a room away from the pool and the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: lobsterdiver007
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying we are NOT picky people and don’t complain or write reviews (good or bad) about the places we stay. However, this hotel warrants it. I felt the need to say STAY AWAY FROM THIS DUMP! I was surprised that it received so many rave reviews. This has to be the worst hotel we have ever stayed at. Don’t let the nice pictures on their website fool you. It’s old, worn out, smelly and dirty. The front desk staff wasn't overly friendly and didn’t go out of their way to be helpful. The first maintenance man we encountered was surly and rude. The second was a very nice guy as was the bartender by the pool. We were in a 2nd floor room right next to the stairwell. With the old metal steps and paper thin walls, we heard every person who came and went. Most of them sounded as if the were wearing heavy boots and stomped their way up and down the stairs. The room was dirty and smelly. The bed coverings had seen better days and should have been replaced 10 years ago. We thought the “kids suite” would be great for our 2 year old but she pronounced it “dirty, dirty, dirty” and “dark” we had to bribe her to get her to sleep there. The lighting in the entire room was poor. Only 2 lights worked making the whole room dreary. We did not feel comfortable opening the curtains since the window faced the walkway going past our room. We used the TV for light. While the TV was on, about every half hour, something would happen with it and it would get snowy, go off then come on again to the Lifetime channel, no matter what channel it was on when it went off. Being a Disney good neighbor hotel, I expected more Disney programming but it was limited to one Disney Channel. There was a small refrigerator and a microwave located next to the bathroom sink. The fridge, no matter the setting froze everything and the microwave didn’t work. There was a coffee maker but no coffee. The first night, the sink began to leak as it drained. We used towels to clean up the mess and called the front desk. It took 4 calls. During the 4th call in 3 hours, they claimed maintenance already fixed it. They finally came at 10:55 pm to unclog it, even though it wasn’t clogged, it was leaking. On the initial call we requested clean towels. Over the course of the 3 hours, we received 4 towels 4 different times (all brought by the same guy). We ended up with 16 towels! The second morning we were there, the toilet overflowed. Maintenance was on top of things and said the toilet needed to be replaced and it would be done while we were gone. When we returned that evening nothing had been done so we requested a room change. They could not accommodate us so we cut our vacation short and came home. On our first evening there we ordered food from the bar area by the pool in which they automatically add a 18% tip for calling your name to come up to the window to get your food. The food was just okay and over priced. The heated pool was only heated on the first day and was very pleasant to swim. The next day it was chilly. We were told the heater wasn’t working and if we didn’t like it, we didn’t have to swim in it. The only plus I could find was it is very convenient to the Disney Parks…if you drive. The shuttle times are limited, crowded and inconvenient. I guess things could be worse, like the lady we met at check out who had been locked in her room for 3 hours because she couldn’t the door to unlock. It took maintenance an hour to show up and then a couple of more to figure out how to take the door off the hinges. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone nor would I stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not Stay Here! We left after 1 night!”
Reviews.Author: joe s
Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel EVER!!! Everything in the room was really outdated. The mattresses were so bad, you could literally see the springs coming out of the mattresses. The 'kids suite' was disgusting; nothing in there was clean. It was sticky, smelly, and some of the walls were vandalized with profanity written on the walls. The microwave and refrigerator were in the bathroom, YUCK!!! The bathroom was gross and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months, there was dirt and hair on the floor. The carpet looked and smelled bad. Nothing about our stay here was pleasant. Our flight into FL was really late, so we stayed there just that 1 night, and we moved to another hotel by 11am the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting left after 1st night!!!”
Reviews.Author: Akr0916
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay at this motel and we checked out after the first night. This place advertises it as a hotel and suites... Disney Good Neighbor Hotel well it's anything but! The room smelled moldy and musky. Our bed was the worst! You could feel the springs coming through the mattress Which stabbed you in the back. we addressed this to the staff. They acknowledged there was issues with their mattresses and stated they would give us a mattress pad for the bed but never did. And my husband itched the entire night in the bed! I was afraid to walk on the carpet barefoot it was that gross! There was caked on dust and dirt in the a/c vents and our unit sounded like a train was coming through our room! It was so loud! This place was gross and I cannot believe all the positive reviews it has!! Stay away from here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the price”
Reviews.Author: S C
Reviews.Content: My friend and I shared a suite for 4 weeks and were very pleased with the personnel and amenities. The pictures shown on the site are a true representation of the rooms. The Vineyard Restaurant was open for a buffet breakfast until 11 a.m., but you could also order from the menu. There are hot & cold small meals in the tuck shop and at the pool-side bar. The decor is slightly out of date, but the personnel are wonderfully cheerful and seem eager to be of service. Any problems you encounter are dealt with immediately. There are two pools, each of which has a separate hot tub, and one of the pool areas has a children's pool and a playground. There is bus service right outside the front door and additional restaurants are within easy walking distance as are grocery and liquor stores. The free shuttle is a real money saver. There is a very small one-time charge if you have brought a pet and the area is safe, well-lit and has easy access to major thruways, without any of the noise issues usually associated with this. Many of the people I met there have been coming for years and I'll be returning as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on a limited budget....”
Reviews.Author: craftigal1
Reviews.Content: Close to everything I booked on priceline for 29. A night

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Cheap Rate”
Reviews.Author: NoraVincent
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Westjet Vacations, and being that it was a cheap rate, I was not one to complain. We were at the very back of the hotel ( motel), so we had a bit of a back end view...we were not on the pool side, but the rooms were clean and the maid was good, she did have the kids stuffies lined up when we got back at the end of the day...the water made my hair yucky, but that may have just been the FL water. The shuttles in Feb were not at all convenient though, so if you are relying on those, either plan on getting up at 7:30, or be late for the Disney and Universal openings. We had a car, so that was a bonus, as the shuttles left at 8:50 or 10:50, and not a minute later. We arrives to catch a shuttle at 8:51, and it was gone. The bonus was the fridge and microwave in the room, which you dont get at Disney hotels, as well as the closeness to Walmart ( with a car). The one thing that bugged me was that being I was a single mom with 2 kids, there was a thin door between me and the adjoining room, which kinda was freaky. The walls are thin... We didnt go to the front of the hotel at all, so I cant comment on the service or restaurants, it was too far of a walk (15 mins), so we stuck to the back end. The pool was clean, the hot tub was hot, and the pool towels were readily avaliable. All in all, if you can get this for a good price, awesome. It is close to Disney, if you have a car, and safe enough, there are enough restaurants close, and the maids were awesome. Would I stay there again? Maybe if the deal was good, but I would probably find a cheap flight and get a hotel for $39 once down there.

Reviews.Title: “Not Again”
Reviews.Author: mmb0027
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the hotel parking lot it became very apparent the hotel was built in 1973….although part of it is painted to look very cheery. The lobby does not look like a 3-star lobby. However, the little general store and cafeteria was a plus. We did not use the pools or any other amenities that were available as we were only there one night. There is outside entry to the rooms. I also noticed they had a breakfast buffet for only $7.95 in a restaurant. We did eat at the buffet the morning we checked out and it had the basics…eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, pancakes, fruit, muffins, etc. and it was not too bad. Drinks were extra. We ate on Sunday and apparently on the weekends they don’t offer the a la carte menu…only on week days. However, be aware they automatically add a 18% tip for basically just bringing you drinks. I thought this was a bit much considering we did most of the work being it was a buffet. In fact, we just ordered coffee and she sat two cups and a little pot of coffee on our table so that was the end of her service for us. As mentioned 18% is a bit much for so little service. We did not see anything posted that this was going to happen…just was surprised to see it when we got the ticket. We got the standard room with two double beds. I was surprised to see there was a small refrigerator and a microwave. Strangely though there was no coffee maker and the only way to get coffee in the morning was to pay for it at the store or order it at the buffet. The room was clean and average. The beds were seemingly old because when we sat on them after entering the room we bounced up and down. We both sank down when lying down and had to sleep in separate beds to avoid really sinking in. My biggest concern was I would not let my children play in the room because there was a rusty, metal door stop. It looked like some kind of metal piece you would buy at Hope Depot and it was bolted into the floor. The door stop was flat and was even sharp at the edges. I did not notice it until I was right on top of it walking by the door and literally stepped right on it with my shoe! Thank goodness. I am sure if I was barefoot or even in socks I would have cut my foot to the point of needing stitches and maybe even needing shots because as I mentioned it was rusty. Talk about unsafe. We literally put the phone book on top of it so neither of us would accidentally step on it again. Also, it surprised me so much when I stepped on it, I lost my footing and almost fell. Good thing I was not wearing sandals or flip flops! One plus I will mention though is we saw security everywhere which made us feel safe especially because we did not get back to our hotel room until after midnight. The staff was friendly and when we called the front desk to ask for a luggage rack, it was brought to the room immediately. The location is very close to the major attractions, shopping, and restaurants. Over all our experience was not horrible but I doubt we would stay there again, definitely not for an extended amount of time, due to the hazard in the room and we can stay in a newer, less tired looking hotel for an equal amount or even cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Motel-like rooms, some very worn out”
Reviews.Author: Lfolsen
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Seraloga february 2012 for $273 on a Family package deal. Don’t let the website fool you, the rooms are very motel-like in spite of the kids theme in the family rooms. Our first room was very worn out, with springs felt through the mattress and light switches that didn’t work. We were moved to another room which was similar, but in better condition. The pool area was ok, but nothing more. The kid pool area was not very interesting for kids aged 5 and 8, and the playground likewise. Breakfast was included, and consisted of a very basic buffet with dry pancakes, powdery scrambled eggs and cardboard bacon. Overall we weren’t impressed and the only justification for the price was the extras we got from the family package which could maybe be valued at $50 if bought seperately.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: megan_bro_2012
Reviews.Content: Yes it's outdated. Yes it's not right next to Disney. But it IS clean and it's within walking distance of Old Town and a few burger joints! The staff is friendly and the pools are amazing. I've stayed here 3 different times and the rooms are always clean and beautiful. It's not going to be perfect but it's very nice! :) I highly recommend it! There's a little dinning area and a shop right in the hotel where you can get your basics. There are always things going on for kids. They had an arcade when I went and I passed hours and hours of the rainy days in there. Theres a free (yes I said FREE) bus that runs allllll over the place! This was the best place I've stayed at in Florida. I'd go here before I went back on Disney property!!! Those other people are just being too picky. I love love love love love Seralago!!!! <3 It is VERY family friendly!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at Seralago for 10 days......”
Reviews.Author: dawma s
Reviews.Content: This place might be a little dated but it was very clean and comfortable, the bed was soft the 6 pillows in the room were great, the employees were not only helpfull but they always greeted us with a smile and a hello, there is a diner and a store in the lobby and a resturant, they have a bus that takes you to all the main attractions and it picks you up in the parking lot and brings you back, the customer service gal Lisa printed a map for us on how to get to different places, heated pools , we love Seralago and will go back and stay again when we can, thank you for making our vacation so nice, we stayed for 10 days and enjoyed every minute of it ! also your tight in the hub of town, resturants and shopping is next door and accross the street, from Ed and Dawna in snowy Idaho.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love!!”
Reviews.Author: sly_t53
Reviews.Content: Don't let the negative folks out there ruin a good thing for you, this place is wonderful! Clean, well maintained, extremely helpful and friendly staff, and a really great value! Oh yes, the location is great, and the 3 times a day free shuttle service outstanding, as well. Not to mention the room service food very delicious and economical and ample! I was well pleased in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but opting for onsite Disney next time”
Reviews.Author: Mi2Boys
Reviews.Content: This was just an OK hotel. Our room was a bit dated but with newer paint, but was very clean. We had lots of towels and room was completely cleaned everyday. The pool was nice, the hottub was nicer and they provided towels outside for poolside use. We loved having a fridge and microwave and did cereal and fruit for breakfast so we didn't eat there. The location was pretty good. Lots of restuarants and Old Town within walking distance. Now the bad. The walls are so thin and we could hear the people in the adjacent room talking all night. They werent even being loud, just normal talking. We also heard every shower and flush they made as well. People stood outside our room talking all night and we could hear doors slamming and suitcases being drug downstairs in the morning. It made getting a good night's sleep very hard. We were pretty cranky by morning the 2nd and 3rd nights. Not a good thing when you are headed to Disney all day. My biggest flaw with this hotel is that the cleaning lady kept leaving our curtains open all day while we were gone so everyone walking by could see into our room. We left all our electronics, Fire, 3DS, etc. on the table the first day without thinking about it as it has never been an issue before. I thought it was a huge safety issue. To me it just encouraged the idea of theft. We made sure to zip everything into our suitcases after that first day. I mean, who does that?? No hotel I've ever stayed in. Overall it was just an OK stay. I think we will be opting for onsite next time. We really just slept there and headed right back out. We could do that at Disney without even having to get up and drive the next morning. Just walk out and catch a bus. For what we paid, plus the cost of parking at the parks we wasted our time more than anything.

Reviews.Title: “It's a shame”
Reviews.Author: Tanya G
Reviews.Content: The room has a great concept with the separate kids area, my kids absolutely loved it but.....as soon as I walked in the room the first thing I saw was a roach. I killed it and pretended nothing was there to not alarm my husband and kids. Little did I know they were crawling everywhere. At one point I opened a drawer to get my clothes and the roaches were walking all over my clothes. It was incredibly disgusting. I WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but that's it”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times on spur of the moment trips to Disney when properties were sold out or too pricey. Rooms are not the most modern, worn furniture, worn carpeting, very musty, and wet ceiling stains. Breakfast is passable if you so choose to take it. Not advised though. The pool is a gamble if you like to see yourself swimming with some nasty tourists. Parking is horrific. And lock your doors. Security roams the place but I didn't feel secure. Again, if you're on a budget then go for it but spend the extra 20 a night elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline V
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very dirty! The first room smelled very strong like stale cigarette smoke. It appeared like a room some people would rent by the hour. We asked to move to another room. You could tell the staff had sprayed some airfreshener to hide an unpleasant smell. The beds were horrible and old. I entered the bathroom and there was a big roach sitting on the floor which I quickly killed. My daughter found a toenail on the floor and soap in the soap dish with a hair on it. When using the shower, the handle fell off. The water stank and when I phoned the front desk to find out if it was drinkable \i was told that it was not recommended. I then tried to get some botteled water out of the pop machine, but it was sold out. I had to wash down my meds with pop, as I had no access to clean water.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Survey= ZERO......BEDBUGS at the Seralago!”
Reviews.Author: Bill2go
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seralogo on Thursday, Feb. 2 in room 171. My wife turned the covers down on one double and said, "that's disgusting, I won't sleep there". Not wanting to be a complainer, I offered to sleep in that bed. As it turns out, Momma knows best...BEDBUGS! The next day I discover half of my chest and back were covered with bites. A swath c. 2 to 3 inches wide from the middle of my chest to the middle of my back was raw and itching (pictures available).I meet with a pharmacist at the Walgreens in Ft. Myers who confirmed it and a Hydrocortizone treatment. Six days later the symptoms still persist. To paraphrase a popular refrain from a Johnny Cash song, "Momma don't let your children...STAY AT THE SERALAGO". There are hundreds of children that stay there every week. I can't imagine any one of them having to endure this kind of pain and discomfort with open, leprosy-like sores on their way to and from the happiest place DisneyWorld. I recommend travelers not book any more reservations at Seralago until there is a clean bill of health by the local, county and state health agencies, Sincerely, Bill Dublin, OH

Reviews.Title: “cant beat it for the price”
Reviews.Author: sabinafam
Reviews.Content: I thought that for the price the hotel was great! I thought it was going to be a roach motel due to the price and I was suprisingly shocked! Super clean great to go with large family the 2 room suite has 3 queen beds and a sofa sleeper. It had a sink counter and microwave and frige excellent

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Florida. We found the hotel to be clean and fairly quiet. My only problem was that we were way at the back and had to walk a bit to get to the front office. I would stay there again. It was close to a few restaurants ( a little bit of a walk), Denny's restaurant was close and it has great food and excellant service. Karen from BC

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all”
Reviews.Author: denisse l
Reviews.Content: The first day there we found a cockroach in the room, so we ask to change the room. The rooms need to be updated, the curtains are disgusting, I read the reviews and book it anyways, We were in a budget . Would not stay here again. The hotel is in a great location, right near old town, which was great cause we walk at night time. All the resturants are near by.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to get back to what it use to be....”
Reviews.Author: Laurie O
Reviews.Content: Started staying here back in the day when it was a Holiday Inn. Was a great place to bring a family (difficult to find big enough rooms for 3 kids). But has steady gone down hill. Lobby and pool areas still nice, but rooms need some updating and cleaning. I stay here when I can get a good price, but when they're prices are up, I move on. Without the discounts, not worth staying. When things clean up a little bit, I will go back to always staying there. Until then, will shop for best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CarCrazyMarc
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel for your trip to Walt Disney World, you simply cannot do better than the Seralago, especially if you're bringing the whole family with kids. This hotel is clean and very well-kept, and the per-night prices are unbeatable. It is an off-Disney property, but the ride in to any of the Disney parks is short and very convenient, whether you take your car or the hotel's complimentary shuttle. It's a longer drive to Universal and Sea World, though. If you're planning to go to those parks, I would choose a closer hotel. However, if the majority of your time will be spent at Walt Disney World, and you'd rather not pay much for hotel accomodations, the Seralago is ideal. Understand that the hotel is not fancy, and is not themed like the Walt Disney World hotels. However, the Disney hotels are ridiculously expensive. The Seralago is basically just a place to sleep with great pools and recreation. One great thing about the Seralago is its location. It's right next to Old Town, which has shops for grownups and plenty of rides and attractions for kids. The newly opened Fun Spot is there, too, with its terrific carnival rides. Actually, parents will want to ride these old rides, like the Tilt-A-whirl, just for the sheer nostalgia factor. As far as safety goes, the Seralago has a dedicated safety office right on property, and security guards patrol the grounds at night on golf carts. I have stayed here many, many times and I've always felt secure. So, if you really want a lovely, spotless, themed hotel on Disney property, by all means go there, but be prepared to pay hundreds of dollars per night (note that the Disney budget hotels are not all that elaborately themed, and the rooms are very small; there are ALWAYS screaming kids all over the place, too!). If you'd rather not spend a lot on a hotel, are willing to ride a bit to the parks, and you can accept the fact that this is just a hotel, the Seralago is for you. One really cool thing they do have are their kids suites with a queen bed for parents and a fort inside the room with three bunk beds for the kids- really cool!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: Every year I stay at the Seralago in January for the Corvette Show. The service is good, staff is friendly.Pool is warm. Rooms are a little dated but clean. Great location if you want to walk to Old Town. Will be back again next January!

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice.”
Reviews.Author: kwajalein92
Reviews.Content: While the hotel lobby was nice, the rooms were very run down. We did not feel very safe during our one night stay. My 11 year old daughter would not sleep under the covers. She said it was too dirty. She used blankets from the car to sleep on. But all this being said...You get what you pay for. It was so inexpensive, and did the job of a place to crash until our hotel for the week opened up. I would not recommend this hotel for an extended stay, but a one night stay it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: celi_31
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a nice and cheap place to to stay i definitely recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average place to stay for a couple nights”
Reviews.Author: vaughanvc
Reviews.Content: no 5 star location but definitely no roach motel eithter. rooms were surprisingly clean. no foul orders. no dirty sheets. no corrosion or rust on the bathroom fixtures (which is rarely the case nowadays). not the most appealing looking establishment when you first drive up to it but its definitely not an eye-sore. if on a budget, definitely a place worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jcardo01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the value and location. Short walk to old town and restaurants. Short distance from disney and highways. Quiet and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but still acceptable quality”
Reviews.Author: Sticasale
Reviews.Content: Taking into account we spent some 50$ a room during Christmas vacation you cannot complain too much. The room has seen better times, is a bit worn out but still decent. Safe is included. Breakfast is a little scam, very little selection of food, even with "kids eat free" you end up paying 30$ for a family of 2 adults + 2 children because the beverage are expensive and tip is automatically added on the bill on the total cost (which is rude in my opinion, furthermore it's a buffet so waiters just bring you drinks and I would recognize tip on the drinks only). If you have a car, you'd better to drive West to the first light and stop at the breakfast buffet, we paid 16$ there for the whole family. Some personnel at the front desk is not respectful, we were waiting for a baggage delivery to the hotel and one evening we simply asked whether the baggage had been delivered to the hotel during the day, it was impossible to get a reply that evening (security guy was not available to check and front desk girl simply didn't care about us and kept jokying with the front desk boy), and the following day it it took some hours to them before finding our luggage in one of their deposits. It was all the luggage we had and had been lost for a week by the airline, so we were quite eager to get it back. Position is good, few miles from Disney and a lots of restaurants at walking distance and a nice amusement park ("Old Town")

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! great place to stay x”
Reviews.Author: Toni O
Reviews.Content: nice friendly place to stay while on holiday with my family! the staff are really helpful and friendly especially sammy. :-) Seralago is in a great spot close to the parks, very close to old town and loads of places to eat. We had a fab time here, when we was'nt at the parks we spent our time in the pool which my two young children loved x i would love to return x

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service - Will never go back”
Reviews.Author: roli p
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we ever stayed in our life. The front desk staff was very very unprofessional and rude. Room service was bad. We will never go back to this place ever again.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay for visiting attractions.”
Reviews.Author: bigcop73
Reviews.Content: For the fourth time I stayed at the Seralago, and it is still the best place for me, my wife and kid. It's near the parks, it has a pool, a little grocerie, it's near Old Town, there is plenty of retaurants around, the room maids are very professional and kind, there's a free safe for values, a little game room with ticket games, 2 restaurants serving breakfast to supper, and free parking. And it's less than an hour drive to the ocean. I'll head back there when I'll be going to the parks, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Disney & restaurants & with family activities on site”
Reviews.Author: YvanBlondeau
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults + 2 kids 13 & 14) stayed for 12 nights in Dec 2011-Jan 2012 over the xmas holidays. We payed for a regular room, but got a suite, probably because the hotel was full and we were staying for 12 nights. We certainly enjoyed the extra space. We had booked along with our 7 day Disney pass using visitorlando.com (link available on hotel's site), and we got a good deal (approx $1900 for hotel & tickets); better than buying directly from hotel and/or buying tickets separately. Experience was excellent. Room was clean and spacious and had all the basic necessities. Hotel was quiet despite being full. We very much enjoyed the heated pool and spa; towels are available by the pool. We also used the tennis courts which are a bit out of shape, but still useable. We actually saw some wild deer right by the tennis courts. We had our car (travelled from Montreal), and so going to Disney World from the hotel was very easy, being there in 10 minutes or so. Staff was courteous and helpful whenever we needed stuff. It's a refurbished 70's style hotel, so don't expect grandiose looks, but it's very well maintained and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: cmanfra
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation at Seralago for a few reasons: 1. I got a discount on my room rate for being a member of the teacher's union. 2. They had suites available to sleep 6 people. 3. It was centrally located and was very close to the attraction we were visiting that day. On arrival it took a little while to get checked in. It also took a while to get checked out the next morning. (They could use more staff at their front counter.) They were pleasant to me when checking me in and directed me in where my room was located and where to park. Food is available to purchase on the property even though in my opinion it was a little pricey so we actually went off the property to eat. The room itself was spacious and had the amenities we were looking for, considering it was just a one night stay. All things considered, we were pleased with our night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel within budget”
Reviews.Author: somu_traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and professional.Good service.Very courteous and prompt staff.The checkin and checkout process was smooth and efficient.Rooms are little small but service quality is very good.The hotel is very centrally located and also provides punctual service to all Disney parks and Sea World plus Universal.The only drawback is the Universal Shuttle returns at 5:00 PM and there is only one shuttle.If number of shuttles are increased then service can be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and place but the sheets were not cleaned.”
Reviews.Author: trip215
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in our vacation to Disney. The place was good ,fast check in and check out and a good price.As we were not in the hotel for the day just to sleep after all the walking in the parks we went to bed late at night.When we noticed late at 11 pm the bed sheets were all wrinkled and with spots. We couldn't call no body at that time to change them and it was really nasty to see that.The next day my son told me his pillow case was also dirty.he needed to get a towel and put it on his pillow to sleep.The other hotel areas of the hotel they looked good

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for yor money”
Reviews.Author: mikehungary
Reviews.Content: we have spent twice two weeks in this hotel with two small doughters (3&6). Used the kid suites, which is very good value for the money. Location is excellent, service is fair, room was clear. Went once into the breakfast restaurant, but there is tons of good restaurants around the place. Only low light is the very noisy old a/c. I really recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “well......”
Reviews.Author: LLL24
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much based on the price and reviews. I chose this hotel because there were very few that I could find that offered a kids suite at a very reasonable rate.So the kids area was cool,although only one of the tv speakers on the wall worked,barely.They were barely hanging on.The room smelled very moldy the minute we walked in.I sneezed almost immediately. The room was clean looking but felt very dirty.The bed must have been 20 + years old.U could feel every spring! We were only going to be there for 2 nights so I decided to just deal w it.It wasn't a terrible time but definitely will seek other accommodations next time.The locations was great,very close to Disney and the restaurant service was nice.It definitely was a "ya get what u pay for" situation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ovrit
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very enjoyable. Staff was extremely pleasant. We stayed 4 nites, very spacious room. Located near to Old town, Disney World, and all of its parks. Downtown Disney is about 20 minutes from here. If you are with appetite, there are buffets near, or a simple meal is close proximity. Shopper at heart? area malls are within a short drive down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: tcdare
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were pretty anxious.However it was unfounded as we had a very good two weeks with them.The convenience of being so close to Old Town and the many eateries far outweighed the fact that it is an old hotel in need of updating.The maid came every day and the towels were changed each time.The bathroom did need renewing but they had painted over the cracks to try and make it look ok.We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on that.I would definately stay again.Take a kettle and a picnicset and you will have all the equipment you need.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: cgaz86
Reviews.Content: we paid extra and booked the birthday pkg when we arrived in our room we expected to see the "Goody BAG" and there was nothing i was told to come to the lobby after getting there i was then told it would be brought to my room about 45 mins later they knocked on the door and handed it to us not what we expected this was last Wed 11/23 then on Saturday my actual birthday the front desk girl just said to tell them it was my birthday they would have it marked down when we arrived however they had no idea what i was talking about the waitress hardly spoke english which we will get to in a minute, but after scuffling for 20 mins she said ok eat and we will have the cake ready but eat slow because the cake was frozen.... REALLY not what i expected!!! Now let's get back to the part where we speak ENGLISH and ONLY ENGLISH the first day we ate breakfast was 11/24 Thanksgiving the lady spoke very poor english and i didn't apperciate when she did speak english she would mid-sentence be speaking spanish, i understand many guests speak spanish and i have no problem when we go to a theme park listening to English and Spanish instructions but especially in a hotel i expect to be spoken to in ENGLISH the other problem i have is when a family came in that did speak Spanish which happened many times she spoke and joked around with them us it was just heres your drink and clear the table then by... The other thing with not speaking spainsh is Saturday night 11/26 i went to pick up drinks and a sandwhich from the lobby area when i was checking it she told me the total in Spainsh I DON'T even look like i would speak spanish why would you tell me the total in Spanish???? Now let's get to the room we liked the layout and the kids liked the bunkbeds and that's all i can say about that the tub was clogged everyday and the carpet stinks BAD!!! Last but not least Saturday our free day we came back to our room around 3 to take showers and get ready for my birthday evening anyways right after getting in the shower around 3:45 the maid finally comes to clean the room which is rather late, the rooms should be cleaned mid morning not late afternoon when everyone is resting.... This is FAR from a "resort" or even the pictures on your facebook. It fits every sense of the word MOTEL - all outside corridors, park in front of rooms, motel look and feel thru out complex, cheesy lobby area, etc. Nothing that is appealing. Needless to say i feel as if i wasted $265 on a dump.... we frequent Orlando area Dinsey/Universal passes and only live a few hrs away hoped to find somewhere we can stay at least once a month but it will NOT be the Seralago.... What a waste of Thanksgiving/MY BIRTHDAY....

Reviews.Title: “MOTEL at best...”
Reviews.Author: nitadj33
Reviews.Content: This was a one night stay that I needed at short notice. For the price it was fine just for that: one night. For those who are looking for a true vacation stay, this is FAR from a "resort". It fits every sense of the word MOTEL - all outside corridors, park in front of rooms, motel look and feel thru out complex, cheesy lobby area, etc. Nothing that is appealing. I can say the room was clean and had a fridge and microwave, but if you are looking for contemporary looks and amenities forget it! The tv had a 'back' on it (that old). This was definently out of my element and I won't be returning bc of my taste preference. It served it's 1 night purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: beebefamily
Reviews.Content: As a family traveler, we have stayed in many hotels and we have found this one to be a great stay . Yes the Seralago is a older dated hotel, but was a great deal for us. The room (family suite, highly recomend if you have kids) was clean and neat. Yeah the carpet was frayed at the entrance to the bath, and the king bed was a little too firm, but the kids loved their own space, and us parents were comfortable as well. The maid service was good and they cleaned around our schedule, the pool area was great, warm and clean. Overall the Seralago really tries to take care of your needs, and its location is fantastic. Remember, when your paying 40-60 a night don't expect perfection, expect a good value.

Reviews.Title: “No...then YES”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessinjax
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights on Priceline. The room faced the parking lot, it ittok me 6 minutes to examine this room, door frame looked like someone broke in, paint chipped on it and walls, furniture were Goodwill rejects, no fridge/micro....huge hole in bedspread, horrible blanket/.sheets. The young lady at the desk apologized when I told her my report and that his room looked nothing like the internet pics...we moved to a suite facing the pool, separate area with TV and bunk beds, clean, Tv, micro, fridge, we then were happy. Do not get room facing parking lot...and have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, hidden gem almost!”
Reviews.Author: sweetsuzypie
Reviews.Content: Booked a stay here in June and in October to hang out in orlando and go to disney. This hotel is like a hidden gem, even tho its not really hidden. The prices are great!! $34 the first time and $50 for the second stay including a buffett breakfast!!! Very clean, has a fun lobby with ticket place and arcade. The best part of this hotel is that its walking distance to old town, so you can go and hang out and walk right back, check out the auto cruise. Also its super easy to access disney from this hotel! Cant wait to stay here again. Also has a convenience store and a place to get food like pizza, strips, wings etc during the day and the bar has a refill program!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and great price !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lewisarm
Reviews.Content: We had decided to not stay on Disney property because it was so expensive. We got there and to our surprise it was very clean. Big room with a microwave and small refridgerator. They offer a store two resteraunts as well as a candy shop. It was very close to all of the parks and you could even walk over to Old Town to see the sights and the car cruise's. Lots of places close to eat from $ to a full $$$$ sit down dinner. We were near the pool so there was some noise but we knewother us. we weren't staying at a nursing home and it didn't bother us. Would deffinatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Toni S
Reviews.Content: It clearly states on the website that Florida Residents may receive a special rate and free breakfast for each day of their stay. None of that happened. The room was not clean and the towels were hard and very small. Mind you I wasn't expecting the Ritz for the money we paid, but I did expect a basic level of service and cleanliness. In addition, at the time of check-in, a woman accosted us about buying discounted tickets in such a way that it was worth it to pay the extra money for the parks to get away from her. She asked VERY personal questions and seemed quite judgemental when we answered them lol. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK!!”
Reviews.Author: sugar51404
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a year or 2 ago with my family and it was great. Great room, beds, decor, breakfast bar. Stayed here this past weekend with just my hubby and it was just OK!! The room smelled, the curtians were dirty, around the bathroom door was all rotten like. The water pressure for the tub was terrible, took forever to fill the tub. The TV was oldddd. There were no bedbugs and the beds were comfortable. The check in and check out was fast n friendly. If u r just there to sleep and gone at parks most of the day then it is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great prices! Pretty nice hotel. Save money here and have more to spend on entertainment.”
Reviews.Author: IamKimberly
Reviews.Content: We decided to save money on the hotel so that we had more money to spend on entertainment. The hotel is a GREAT deal. The hotel is a little bit older, and the furniture and amenities are a little older, but the rooms are very clean. The hotel has a very nice food court with yummy pizzas and a convenience store. There's also a restaurant with a nice breakfast buffet. For the price range its very well kept. And it has a very nice pool in the courtyard. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “BE AFRAID BE VERY AFRAID”
Reviews.Author: Shaliag
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Seralago this pass week 10/6-10/10/11 It was a nightmare, the rooms are very dirty and the smells from the carpet is very very bad. When was the last time the carpets were clean? May be when they first open the doors to this hotel. Read the reviews and please believe what you read. Because at this hotel you get what you pay for, if you want to go cheap be cheap. But DON'T EXCEPT THE DIRTYNESS. Old does not necessary mean dirty, but this place is DIRTY FOR REAL. And if you have children do not expose them to the dirt. They showed me 8 rooms and the all were very bad, but because I could not get a flight out or another hotel room I had to make the best of it. We stayed out more then in and it rain, the whole time but out was better then end. The last room that they showed me we decided to stay in. but I put my suit cases in plastic bags and went to walmart to buy bedbug spray. And plastic sheet protectors on top of the bedspread I dare not look under the bedspread, We slept on top of the plastic with new sheets brought from walmart and I also use towels and wash clothes brought from walmart. I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO ANOTHER CHEAP HOTEL EVER EVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: newf-couple c
Reviews.Content: ,I stayed there from Sept 21 till the 25th,,it was a pleasant enough experience,,the rooms are a little old,and dated,,the beds were ok,and the maid service was good,,only problem lack of bathroom tissue, The pools and the grounds are well maintained,..I will check out this hotel on My next visit to the area

Reviews.Title: “a small price to pay”
Reviews.Author: LisaFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: I have been to kissimee many times, not for a few years though. First time to the seralago. Its a nice clean place, plenty of staff, not all willing to help though, the staff who don't generally get a tip are a bit lazy. On arrival in my room, was overwhelmed by the musty smell, phoned front desk straight away, they said they would send someone right over, they didn't, I had to phone again six days later, then they sent the maid, who went back and said there was a slight smell... I don't think so. They offered me another room, I was settled in by then, if they had came when they said they would, I would not be unpacked, or they said go out for four hours and we will spray it, thunderstorms outside and torrential rain, so that option was knocked on the head. Functional room with a fridge and microwave, which was a godsend. The 'food court' was a counter in the gift shop that was so dis-organised, they took one order at a time, cooked it, then took another order. Pool area was nice, good atmosphere and clean. The furniture in the room had seen better days and the beds were sunken in the middle. I had a lovely maid, Eliza. I stayed for 8 nights, would go back for a cheap no frills holiday. The surrounding area has changed so much, a lot of hotels and attractions shut down. Old Town used to be so atmospheric and nostalgic, not now, It is characterless, big investors have put in rollercoaster type rides, it has lost its quaintness, if you want rides etc, go to the big disney parks, Old Town is silly trying to compete. The seralago is well worth the money. Along the road, about a mile is a publix supermarket, its a nice walk and good bargains, the flea market, just before you get to publix is worth a visit, be careful of the parrots, I got bitten, not sore.

Reviews.Title: “Basically clean but, the maids won't let you sleep later than 8:45am!!”
Reviews.Author: tokyopm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights, the 1st morning, the maid banged on the door until I physically opened it, pretending not to hear me, to ensure that my lazy gringo butt was awake and preparing to leave her room. Not cool since we arrived late the night before after a 12 hour drive to Orlando! So I got to spend my 1st day at Disney with only 5 hours sleep. THEN the second morning I had the do not disturb sign up so she and two other hotel workers staged a birthday party on the breezway outside my room at 8:30am!!!! Shouting happy birthday and chattering in Spanish for about 10 minutes then leaving. So if you are from out of town, or plan on enjoying the nightlife, I can't reccomend Seralago. The maids are out of control. Also the sink's drain pipe leaked all over the floor and the cable tv lost signal every 15 minutes for several minutes at a time. Other than that, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Should've listened to the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: crystie576
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews both good and bad but went ahead and booked a room for our stay this past weekend, thinking it couldn't really be that bad...I should have listened. The rooms were old and dated. The beds were so uncomfortable and springs coming out everywhere. The shower was dirty and mold on the walls, the light switch for the bathrooms were literally coming off the walls that I was scared to plug in my iron to use it. My 13 year old woke up with red welps on her but not sure it it was bug bites or from the bedding. My daughter and her dad stayed here years ago and said how nice it was but something along the line has happened because it was one of the worst hotels we've ever stayed in. I even had to argue with housekeeping to leave, that we didn't need anything, she didn't speak english at all so eventually I called the front desk to see if they could get her to leave. Guess we got what we paid for. I will never stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “roaches!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adrielsgrl
Reviews.Content: we went to Orlando for my sons birthday and when we found this hotel we deiced to book it now i read all the reviews from the good to the bad but we thought we would still give it a chance i mean after all all hotels are gonna have bad reviews.so we booked from September 4,2011-September 8,2011 and we got the birthday celebration package the price was great so we went for it.Now at check in the staff was friendly but their is where the problem began the birthday package brings a "goody bag" that is in your room when you check in well this goody bag wasn't there when we called the front desk and asked they made a big deal about like if we had taken the goody bag and just wanted another one they had security come check the door and everything when they finally gave us the good bag it had a lot of junk food i dont let my kids eat to much junk food so not the best thing it also had to have tokens and the breakfast pass and it didn't so we had to call again and by this time the staff was rude.By that night we needed more towels and cups will my husband went down to the lobby to ask and they said they will bring it right up will they never did so we had to call an extra 3 times to get what we need we waited a whole hour they said they guy that brings the towels was busy when the guy finally came to the room he told us that he wasn't even busy!! our 2ND night was good no problem but on our 3rd night is where the real problem began we got back from a whole day at the parks only to find roaches in our room they were coming out from the carpet and they were in my kids clothes which was in their dresser when we called they told me that they can upgrade me to suit but to be honest we were gonna be there only one more night and my kids were already sleeping.we talked to the manger the next day and he had to refund me 3 nights so i only payed for one night.i will Never stay there again. i wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone i don't think that your kids should have to worry if they are gonna have roaches on them while they are sleeping!!!! its true what they say you get what you pay for. i would honestly consider the bad reviews cause i didnt and everything the reviews said happen to us!

Reviews.Title: “Seralago Review-Family Trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: MariaG43
Reviews.Content: The buffet breakfast was absolutely horrible. We chose to eat elsewhere every morning. There is an IHOP right down the road. The room was nothing special. It was old and dated, but clean. The cable on the TV kept going out. The hotel manager was not apologetic about either complaint that we offered on checkout. If you are looking for a place to just sleep, this may be worth it. If you want something more-nice pool, acceptable food, and a room that you want to spend more time in (beyond just sleeping) this may not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee Y
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed at the Seralgo for 1 week, Their AC was leaking and lamp was broken we talked to them about these but nobody come to repair. The most importent was my wife got badly itch all over her body after stayed in the hotel. Doctor say "is bed bug bite". We never going back to this hotel anymore. Whoever go to this hotel need be careful their bed. I hope they could take seriously about the problem won't happen to the next guest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but not well kept”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit1215
