Reviews.Content: The location was great very close to the big parks, and close to other things to do around the hotel, most stores and restaurants are walk able. Rooms were okay, enough space for four people and luggage's. Pool was nice very well kept, and open early and closes late (no lifeguards).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: jslatteryjoinery
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seralago 8/26/11 for 2 x weeks,and after reading some bad reviews we were a little worried about our choice. However i am a great believer in the first impression is a lasting one and we were very pleasantly relived with our choice. The Seralago was great value for money,the staff were very friendly & helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them.The rooms were of suitable size for a family of four and were always clean and any request (albeit few) were met with a prompt response.All the staff are worthy of employee of the month. The Seralago is in a great location for all the parks and there is plenty of resturants and bars within easy walking distance. We would be recommending the Seralago to our friends & family and would hesitate to stay there again. I fail to see how anyone could find a problem with the Seralago and we hope to return in the not too distant future. GREAT HOLIDAY !

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle1082
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. We stayed here for 3 nights and everything was just as it appeared on the website. My kids loved having their own area with their own xbox! It is a older hotel but a great place to stay with friendly service and a smile. We did not want to leave. We will be returning on our future vacations!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie S
Reviews.Content: We reserved this room of the internet using Bookit.com, the pictures looked nice and it said shuttles to Disney, so we thought we would try it. After driving 18 hours we went to check in, the lobby looked ok, then we got to the room! We walked in and were horified! The couch and chair had rips in them, the carpet looked like it hadn't been vacuumed for awhile, the curtains had mold on them, I sat in a padded chair trying to decide what to do and nails poked through the chair and ripped my shorts! The room was suppose to be a two room suite, they counted the living area as a room with a murphy bed in the wall! There were bugs in the room, and there was a space between the door frame and the door that almost any small animal (mouse, lizard, etc.) could get in! Needless to say we did not stay there and they (bookit and/or hotel) still made us pay for the first nights stay!!

Reviews.Title: “THIS MOTEL WAS AWFUL. WOULD NOT RECOMEND ANYONE STAY THERE”
Reviews.Author: Diana H
Reviews.Content: Saw mold on back of curtains before we even went into the room. Was to be a 2 bedroom suite. Was not! bed in wall in main room. Furniture in room dirty and torn. Filthy did not stay found another place to stay. Is suppose to be a Disney recomended motel If Disney was aware they would not want to be associated with them. Would Not tell anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Practical, and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: AdmiralBeasley
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at Seralago Hotel and Suites. The past two years I brought my mother on vacation with me. The rooms are clean and the location is practical, not far from food and fun. Also the onsight restaurant, pool, and store adds to its practicality. The Seralago Hotel & Suites is very affordable and family friendly. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Picture are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Jeff B
Reviews.Content: We went here on our honeymoon. We loved the pics that were posted on the sights that we found, but when we got there....great disappointment. I could tell by the look of the facial expression on my wifes face, that she was very upset. Thankfully we didn't spend much time in the room, and when we did, we wanted to fall asleep as fast as we could since we could not stand being in the room, and had already paid for it. It says that it's one of Disney's Hotels, but I'm sure it would make Walt himself, roll over in his grave. I DO NOT recommend it and it is worth it to spend more money to get a better place to Enjoy your vacation. I wouldn't stay here if we were given 2 free nights.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Friendly Hotel on 192”
Reviews.Author: Charles F
Reviews.Content: My family and I are Florida residents, so we go to the Orlando area quite a bit. I admit I am surprised when I see negative reviews about the Seralago. We have stayed at this hotel I believe a total of 4 times, and each time was fantastic. The staff is always friendly, more than wiling to go out of their way to accomodate any reasonable request, even the housekeeping & security staff express their concern for you to have a pleasent stay. I admit that our last visit we decided to try a different hotel, just to change thngs up...BIG MISTAKE! This resort has everything a family could need. From great rooms, wonderful poolside area, the kids movie theatre, playgrounds, and all within walking distance of stores, restaurants, and Old Town. I just made our reservation for a long weekend in September with my family and we ALWAYS look forward to what my kids call our "Seralago Vacations". It's become one of the staples in our weekends in Orlando. Thank you to the Seralago Staff & Managenment for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with bonus of free local car show. We'd go back.”
Reviews.Author: Pamela B
Reviews.Content: Although we hadn't originally booked this hotel, on arrival we found our booking had been moved to Seralago. We found the hotel staff extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was on the ground floor, spacious enough for the 4 of us. We didn't use the microwave, but the fridge was clean and we used that daily. The room did smell a little damp, but I put that down to the sheer humidity in Orlando? We had clean towels every day. Bedding could have been better, (some cigarette burns on top blankets) but was sheets were clean. Buffet Breakfast was excellent, filling and just too much by the end of our 2 week stay! The restaurant staff were so friendly they seemed like actors, but since they managed to keep it up every day for 14 days, we know they're genuinely "nice people" so we were happy to tip them. If we didn't have change - we didn't notice any drop off in their attitudes. We ate lunch in the restaurant on one of our rest days and it was pretty pricey (as you'd expect from any hotel really), but portions were true American size and the food tasted good. It was a burger/microwave heat up type of restaurant which was ok for lunch. The only piece of advice I'd give the management is - get rid of those disgusting sofas in the reception!!! They were once lime green leather suites, but now are simply blackened, cracked leather and are so unappealing. I didn't notice them when we arrived - I was too anxious to know our booking transfer had gone smoothly (and it had). But my husband noticed them straight away and didn't really want to stay there if they proved to be a reflection of the general cleanliness. Thankfully, they didn't. But really - bin them. They're not adding to the decor and their right in the reception area! They need to go!! No chairs would be better than those. Pools seemed very popular with guests -from first thing at breakfast time until quite late at night - we were just too dead tired after Disney/Universal etc so didn't actually use them at all. Rooms are air conditioned and the unit we had worked excellently. Room service staff were honest and friendly, if not great with English language, since most of them spoke Spanish, but this didn't matter at all - honesty is the priority when you're leaving your things in their care while you're gone. The gym is really just a tiny room with 4 pieces of equipment, so my husband gave that a miss - although given how tired we were (this was our first trip to Orlando) I don't really think he would have had any energy left to use it anyway no matter how big it was. The real bonus of staying at Seralargo was being right next to "Old Town". The hotel's in a fantastic part of Orlando where every Saturday night car enthusiasts bring out their beautifully and lovingly restored cars dating back from 1920s and 30s, '57 chevvies, cadillacs, dodges, right up to VW beetles and campervans. It's incredible and you get to see a real piece of the US. Locals come out, music is played everywhere and there's lots of great fun fair rides for everyone (if you haven't had enough of rides already!) There's some absolutely death defying bungee rides if you're really daring or downright suicidal! And a fantastic atmosphere, and not one piece of rubbish on the floor in the whole area, despite the fact that there are literally hundreds of people walking about and lots of food, drinks, sweets etc on sale! It couldn't happen in England. And best of all there's a parade of the cars just before they leave so you can hear the roar of their engines. I loved it and I'm no car enthusiast! We'd have missed all this if we'd stayed on Disney! Seralargo gets my vote and it's only 1.3 km from Disney I think. We'd definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again. There's a cinema room where kids can select whatever film they like. Ours never used it since they were always too tired and we had a TV in our room anyway with a million channels. There's a games room in the reception area - our 2 kids loved that - there's an ice hockey table, simulator games etc. They spent a few hours having fun in there. Great hotel all in all. We've already recommended it to our friends who are going to Orlando next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 356Laura
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying in the two room suites. Close to the Fun Spot, Old town, and restaurants all in walking distance. Disney is a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Jake7987
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a few weeks ago and the staff was terrible. You couldn't get a hold of anybody and when you finally did they didn't speak english and just ignored you. plus the maids were knocking on doors at 8am to try and clean the room. Just terrible.

Reviews.Title: “As always we were pleased with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Teresa O
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay in the last three years, we love the location,close to everything. The staff is doing a great job. Yes it may be one of the older hotels around but great for the the value, the great pool area and playground when you want to wind down and get kids to start to settle down. I called room service and in less than 10 minutes room housekeeping was on the way . Thanks for another great stay. P.S. Take an additional half a day and walk over to next block at the Hot Spot. My grown son and 6 yr. old grandson never miss Hot Spot when we get near Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: wbpWheeling_IL
Reviews.Content: Thought the room was a little out of date. Needed a better TV. Beds were comfortable enough. Requested a room away from the pool and no smoking, they accomodated. I would not reccomend their breakfast buffet it was not worth $8 per person per day. They had a shuttle to Disney and to Universal. The shuttles were not the best buses nor great times to go and return for Disney but had 2 going and 3 coming. Universal shuttle was 1 going and 1 coming, but coming was only at 5:30 PM, you lose a lot of hours in the evening and night. Again I will say though not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay for visiting attractions.”
Reviews.Author: bigcop73
Reviews.Content: For the fourth time I stayed at the Seralago, and it is still the best place for me, my wife and kid. It's near the parks, it has a pool, a little grocerie, it's near Old Town, there is plenty of retaurants around, the room maids are very professional and kind, there's a free safe for values, a little game room with ticket games, 2 restaurants serving breakfast to supper, and free parking. And it's less than an hour drive to the ocean. I'll head back there when I'll be going to the parks, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky room”
Reviews.Author: RapNYC1982
Reviews.Content: 8/16/2011...They gave us a stinky room. We asked for another key and got another stinky room. No apologies, no redress. They were nice about it when we checked out and went elsewhere, but otherwise very disappointing. Stay away from the first floor rooms in back of the second building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ForidaNative62
Reviews.Content: We just completed our second stay at the Sera Lago. It was a rat experience for the price. We found the room to be clean and well kept. The breakfast bar is hard to beat! the grounds are well maintained and security is always around. We already have reservations for our next stay. I recommended the Sera Lago to a co-worker for their Disney trip. They had the same positive experience we did.

Reviews.Title: “Never again will we go to Seralago”
Reviews.Author: Vieraeveedhnick
Reviews.Content: Every year we go to Florida. And every year we look at Seralago from super 8 across the street. Well at Seralago we were unhappy. The roaches !!! The rooms were not as seen on the computer. They are tiny we were moved from one room to another. And it was worse the air conditioner didn't work. So we checked out went to super 8 across the street and finished our vacation in a clean room. So for anyone check first lift up the mattesses in the kids bunks and make sure you don't find spider webs ! In one word horrible ! Management needs to update everything !

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: erivera0711
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and cleaned. Staff very friendly. Close to many attractions and pools were clean. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift!!”
Reviews.Author: Guatequero
Reviews.Content: Please spend some money and restore rooms the location is good and the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great Services so-so accomadations”
Reviews.Author: fun4dispat
Reviews.Content: I am not usally a review writter but i decided after my stay here it was worth writting about. I would agree that the property is a bit out dated, but i think it is pretty well taken care of despite that. The couches in the lobby are old, and the rooms are a little old too but overall it is a great family location for the price. They have great pools, a game room for kids, and near EVERYTHING!!! Food Court isnt as bad as people are saying. they sell quick things like pizza nd fries. My kids liked it and the staff in there was really nice. My only major complaint was that my first night there our smoke detector went off early in the morning and woke us all up. I called the front desk and the girl apoligized and said she would send someone right away. A security came, but coulndt fix it. I decided to go the front desk, obviously pissed off at that point, but I have to say the little moslem girl at the front desk made me forget i was even mad. She was so sorry to me and my family. she told me she would get me into a new room right awya and have security help us move which they did she upgraded us to a room by the pool for free which my kids loved. she also have us free breakfast for the next morning which my kids also enjoyed she was really the sweetest little thing ever. she most be on something to be so nice and cheerful at that hour of the night though Anyways to say the least, our stay was very good and enjoyable after that and i really shouldnt have been to mad in the first place with the front desk or security. nonw of us can control technology. would stay again, happy kids,equals happy me and great price

Reviews.Title: “Never go back”
Reviews.Author: disneyrocksFlorida
Reviews.Content: Once again, we go to Disney often. Hotel.com suggested this hotel. Bad decision on our part to say " yes". First room air did not work, they changed our room, second room the beds looked dirty, called and they came and changed the sheets, but the beds were so small (full size) and they sagged in the middle......bathroom was not the cleanest either and the easy chair had stains on it. Overall it is obviously a budget, beyond budget motel. Would not recommend this hotel. Pool was fair, kids like it fine. We have many other hotels in the area for the same price that are much, much, much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great, good value and close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Belton_family
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and 12 year old daughter stayed for 2 weeks from 16th July. The room was cleaned daily (including clean towels, soap and shampoo). I would guess that the hotel was built in the 80s and has not been updated since but you are paying for a cheap place to stay, about 7 miles from Disney and 14 miles from Universal. We did not hear noise from any other guests and parked our hire car directly outside our room. We had a room with 2 double beds, a bathroom with shower over the bath and also a small fridge and microwave, hairdryer and iron/ ironing board. You do need to take own (or buy) plates, cutlery etc and there is no kettle - we bought a pirex jug and heated water in microwave (although if we go again would take a travel kettle). We found that the hairdryer didn't work at 9:30pm, we informed reception and it was replaced by 9:40pm. There are 2 swimming pools with towels provided, one with an area for small children and a bar. Both pools were fairly quiet but we found that the other pool was more quiet and 50 metres for the laundrette. I would put in a load of washing go for a swim for 30 minutes, go back and put clothes in the dryer and go back to pool for 45 minutes. We did not use the very small shop or cafe etc. Seralago is right next to old town. On Saturday nights they have old cars there, we didn't find this out until the Sunday so didn't go. Between Seralago and Old town you will find a small supermarket (although if you have a car Walmart and other larger supermarkets are within 3 miles), KFC and Pizza hut. Opposite is Macdonalds, Dennys and Pondarossa. You must try Pondarossa at least once for breakfast. All these are within very easy walking distance. Golden Corral is great value (out of main entrace turn left past the first major junction, on right side of road about 1mile). While there is a Chinese buffet opposite near Macdonald, on our last day we did find Icheban, we wished we'd found before. Out of main gate, turn right approx 3 miles on left side of road. It is great value but can also get discount by picking up discount ticket books from Seralago. Also went to Chillis twice (not as cheap) about a mile further on from Iciban on opposite side of road. We would certainly recommed Seralago. If what you want is a place to stay while you visit Disney, Universal etc it was great. If you are looking for somewhere that you intend to spend all day every day then i can not answer this and perhaps you should be in Spain!

Reviews.Title: “Passing for Low Budget Stay. Would try another place.”
Reviews.Author: esusprecise2
Reviews.Content: Seralago staff was professional and friendly, breakfast buffet was tasty and clean, and location was convenient to Theme parks, restaurants and Super Walmart. These were the perks of staying there. We were working on a low budget so this hotel was convenient. However, I must admit I didn't feel that safe being on the first floor since its not a gated hotel. I had a poolside room which wasn't that comfortable because of the noise level. When I was ready to relax I had to wait until a thunderstorm came through or for midnight to strike when the pool closed. People were rowdy at times but it was duable. I like having a mini-fridge and microwave however, I think next time I would prefer a more updated room with a full range kitchen. the room was outdated one of my lights in the room didn't work becuase the socket wasn't working either so the room wasn't that well lit. My second day there the back of the door broke so that really didn't help with feeling safe. I managed to stay here but if I could afford to stay some place more updated, quiet and safer I would. When I booked this place I was looking for convenience and low budget. I paid for what I got. I would only return if I couldn't afford to stay some place else.

Reviews.Title: “BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Jennyvsa
Reviews.Content: In the photos looks like a great hotel but thats not real. The room is diferent, the light in the bathroom was molten and the bathroom door not close. In the room had a cockroach. The furniture is old. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great price but dirty.”
Reviews.Author: heatherlp1973
Reviews.Content: the prices at the seralago are great and affordable and they are not to far from the theme parks.their lobby is excellent with a nice size store and pizza place and a fabulous game room.the younger staff at the front desk was great, but the older staff was rude and blunt. they allow you to pre-register which is great...by doing so you can leave your car in the parking lot and use their shuttle bus...and you can stay at the parks late without worrying if your room was given away because you have not checked in. i would advise anyone going here that they check in early and check out their room. i knew i was getting a fabulous price $59.00 a night plus tax......so i expected small rooms, old tvs, chipped floor tiles and old ac units.....but lets face it 59.00 is a fair price for a hotel....so i did expect clean rooms.... our mistake was to pre-register and then go to disney, we got back to the hotel around 11 pm. we were tired, hot and agervated with their horrible shuttle service that alls we wanted to do was crash...well when i got the the room and went it, the room had a horrible damp smell and it was humid as hell...old ac...ohwell great price....i sat on the bed hard and lumpy...ohwell great price.....turned on the tv that was way off color...ohwell great price. i then went into the bathroom......i noticed water and soap scum in the tub like someone took a bubble bath and never rinsed the tub.....no i was looking around i found hair all over the bathroom, and urin on the base of the toilet....i calle the front desk.....they had us go to another room.we went in and i went to the bathroom and when i shut the door i noticed urin stains on the back of the door with hair stuck in it.....i told the kids do not do anything and examined the room, there was hair all over the bathroom, a used bar of soap in the shower, and something sticky in the sink....i was so mad.....i knew the beds had to be dirty......i pulled the sheets back and i was almost sick........there had to be at leaste 50 long black hairs in the bed along with food crumbs...and drool stains on the pillow case.i told my husband that they will think i am a complainer so i took pictures.......it was now after 12 30 am we were so tired and so fed up we just wanted to sleep.i went to the desk and the younger girl aplogized and wanted to move our room, the older lady said to upgrade them at no charge to a pool side room...mind you the pool was closed and the up grade was only 10 bucks more.....the third room was much better..but the ac did not work, also they state that their rooms sleep five people so you figure they have a pull out sofa chair or something......they did not . the next morning i complained to the supervisor who took care of the matter aplogized and refunded me and provided excellent customer service...but my second day at disney was ruined because we were so tired. i would ask to look at their buffets before paying for them.....they were small and nasty....lots of other places in the area to eat. i also want to make note that my sister had her room in area where i orginal was and when we were sitting out in front of the room we watched the maid go into my orginal room,now the kids had craweled into one of the beds...so the sheets and blankets were all pulled back and it was clear thet someone had laid in the bed...which by the way was full of hair. well we watched the maid go into the room with no sheets and no new towels and come out only 5 minutes later...she never even vacumed the floor that my kids dropped a bag of chips on. she came out locked the door and went to the next room....i went and looked in the window....she had made the bed using the same sheets and blankets....that we complained about being dirty. also this hotel has alot of young people that party and drink all night.....and were very loud.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: maria516
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel back in 2010 to go on a family vacation, i was really excited and my girls couldn't wait to get to the room "kids suite". In the way to the room the hallway was wet and smell bad but i ignored that. But when i got to the room OMG the rugs were so dirty, and the smell of the room i can't even explain. (moldy, smoke,feet idk) The beds were old, hard, they even sound the blankets had holes in them and cigarrete burns. I started crying i couldn't believe how bad this was. i felt so bad for my little ones. Another thing was that there were people outside in the parking lot with really loud music and just hanging around there we didn't feel safe in this place. I went back to the lobby and told them i need it to cancel my reservation. but they told me they couldn't return my money right away since i didn't book directly thru the hotel, and also they couldn't return my money for that first night even when i didn't stay there which it was ok. Well i left the hotel that same night and went to a better one. Will never go back to seralago! I do not recommend this hotel if you have kids and are a clean family.!

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back!!!!!!!!!!!! amazing”
Reviews.Author: tinkbouzigues
Reviews.Content: we're a french family ,and we're stay 2 times on seralago! is the perfect place for family! wonderful breakfast,2 big pools and more............... the best prices on us 192 !!!!!!!! i love this place!!!!!!!!!!!!!! thanks again

Reviews.Title: “We booked again”
Reviews.Author: SarahJimThorpePa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Seralago in 2010. We have been coming to Kissimmee for 20 years and have always stayed along US 192. We were well pleased for the $$ and we are already booked for this year.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Stay”
Reviews.Author: nadiaandpeter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The rooms were functional and clean - although the kitchenette didn't have a kettle or oven, so wasn't much use. The pools were pretty good and the staff were friendly. The shuttle to Universal was good - the hotel is only about 20 mins from Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple, functional and practical”
Reviews.Author: ERNEADE
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days the week of July 4, 2011, of course without any problems. Nancy the receptionist who greeted us during our check in was very friendly and courteous, so were the rest of the staff service and cleanliness of the hotel, who attended our room daily, kept clean, tidy and towels were changed every day. The no-frills room was acceptably large and functional, comfortable double bed, air conditioning, hot water, TV, microwave and mini fridge and internet. Ideally, a very good price, good service, very clean and friendly staff, I recommend it for anyone wishing to stay in a hotel acceptable, simple and close to the Disney World parks.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Beada69
Reviews.Content: Checked in with 3 other families, i was the one in charge of finding hotel, we were suppose to have poolside room, as we made reservations over year ago and made special request due to small children, we ended up being on second floor 2 buildings over from pool, finally got to room, carpet dirty, toliet seat broke, grandaughter fell off when trying to use it reported these issues they never came to fix them, worst of all my sons prescription medicine was stolen from the room, reported to security, they stated they will follow up with whoever cleaned room, we never heard anything further, rooms was not cleaned daily, had to call to request fresh. Towels and staff not very friendly, this was absolutely worst stay ever, definetly do not recomend this hotel quality inn suites same price and much cleaner safer place to stay

Reviews.Title: “SERALAGOOO!! IS THE PLACE TO BE.....”
Reviews.Author: Crazi4disney
Reviews.Content: We first booked 5 nights at Seralago in 2009, and loved how it's so clean, and pet friendly. We decided to book it august 2010 for 5 nights, since we had such a great time a year before. Let me tell you this place never disappoints, honestly we stay at this hotel because this the only hotel where my dog does not cry and bother the neighbors because for some reason he feels comfortable here than any other hotel. My family also love it not because it's cheap but they are so close to everything the staff is amazing/ crazy helpful and they have the best pool. I can see other reviews people who weren't so lucky....but so far I love this place, I don't recommend it to people who are picky. Because yes it a little downgraded, I really recommend it to people who just need a place to sleep and want to be near all the attractions. As far as bed bugs, any hotel you go your at risk. So tip of advice always check your bed in ALL HOTELS you go to, if you find some report it and they'll change your room. It's not the hotel that magically just carries them, they come from other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews on Seralago before you book it”
Reviews.Author: sveitch
Reviews.Content: Not a nice hotel at all. Fairly old and not updated. Our King suite had wet carpeting at the door and all in front if the air conditioner. The TV had BAD RECEPTION and the remote control did not work because the sensor that should be in the TV was missing. There was a hole in the front of the TV where the sensor should have been. The small shampoo and conditioner that is provided in the room had already been opened and used. The bathroom light was constantly flickering because it was burning out " I think" and you could see the dead bugs in the bottom if the light cover. There was a small refrigerator and microwave in the bathroom area so I guess that's why they call it a suite. We found out, after the fact, that the hotel had been reported more than once for having bed bugs. I did not experience that myself but we did not stay more than one night before checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Once I saw the property, I was sold on visiting this place!”
Reviews.Author: photographybyjerry
Reviews.Content: I have nothing to say negative about this place. The staff was very friendly and polite. Even the housekeeping staff went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable.It was great to just lay around the pool and sit in the tiki bar by the pool for a refreshing drink or eating those buffalo wings. I hope to stay there longer next time I visit the orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “loved the seralago hotel”
Reviews.Author: maham91
Reviews.Content: The Seralago hotel was a great hotel. The shuttle was always on time going and coming from disney and universal. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I'm in a wheelchair and the staff at Seralgo did everything they could to accommodate me with a accessible shuttle and room. I will definitely be staying at the Seralago during my next trip to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed Room330!!!”
Reviews.Author: barbkeown
Reviews.Content: We booked a 7 night stay not knowing what to expect based on the mixed reviews. I'm pleased to say that we were impressed with the cleanliness and service. Our 3 year old loved the bunk bed and his own space. We were glad to have our space ad well. The location of the hotel is only 15 minutes away from Disney. There is a McDonald's across the street, as well as a Publix to get snacks/drinks. We had a mini fridge and small microwave in our room. Happy to report NO seafoam green or pink. Our room was yellow. We had plenty of clean towels. The playground was nice and the pool area was big. We stayed on the ground floor and our view was of the pool. The staff was very kind and nice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel stays EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: reirish
Reviews.Content: Our reservations were for two 1st floor rooms poolside. Instead we got upstairs, which was awful for my 78 year old grandmother and no elevator, and no pool in sight! We decided to deal with it since the staff didn't seem too friendly. But once we got in the rooms, they were completely filthy. The carpet was disgusting and there was an overall dingy feel and the batteries in the remotes didn't work. The rooms are cheap so again, we decided to just make the best of it. That is until I noticed the dog crap in the corner of the closet. I was so grossed out!!! We called the office immediately. They said they would change our rooms. 20 minutes of waiting later we got moved. This time we at least got first floor but the pool was even further away...which is apparently a good thing since someone took a dump in it. Again, these rooms were disgusting and while checking out the microwave discovered a melted Styrofoam cup with water in it. Apparently the cleaning crew were also on vacation. Once again, the rooms were cheap, so we dealt with it. We decided the next morning to go with the breakfast buffet. The pictures on the website made the buffet look amazing! Much to my surprise it was this tiny approx 5 foot buffet with hard/cold food filling it. It was the worst breakfast buffet I have ever had! The waffles were hardened, the eggs and bacon were cold, and I don't even want to get started on the fruit or their sorry excuse for breakfast potatoes!! We also decided to stay at this hotel because of the on site family theater...which again, to our surprise, played NOTHING! The Seralago Hotel website plays up this hotel soooo much its ridiculous! I will NEVER stay here again!!! EVER!!! There are PLENTY of cheaper hotels that are MUCH MUCH cleaner and have a FREE breakfast!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs n Roaches. Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: FamOFive4707
Reviews.Content: Ok great location to everything, walking distance too. lobby don't sit on sofa dirty, game room love, food place clean ok but pricey never ate thier. breakfast area clean but food wasn't all that good was cheaper n better to eat else where. pool we enjoyed. Now lets get to the very bad part, the 1st room the curtain to the kids suite was dirty, n the carpet the sheets had spots on them had to get them change, around 4am is when my daughter scream n said something was crawling on her (didn't know what it was till i google it now n match it w/the pic we took in the hotel) I call them to tell them their bugs in the room. switch room while the kids were sleeping except the oldest, after putting the kids it their bed looking around went to my bed n of course a little guess baby roach was on the end table so got paper towel n kill it. lets just say we were happy when we weren't in the hotel room. maids never change our sheets they clean up though n the staffs were not friendly @ all well except for the manager when i went to him first thing in the morning n told him what happen n show him this picture that my daughter took of the bugs on her bed. he gave us 1 of our nights free n free breakfast for 3 of us the other 2 were free anyway. (all this bug thing happen within the 1st night we check in) Not Disney friendly @ all Family of 5

Reviews.Title: “CRAP IN THE POOL-DIRTY CARPET AND DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: 8kids
Reviews.Content: disney has this place on the wrong list!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!! Carpet was filthy and dirty!! Someone crapped in the pool, so they has to close the pool...kids had no fun and i would not go back here ever! Management did not refund any monies do to their nasty room and pool! DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Disney you need to not tell people to stay here! It is unhealthy and unhappy for the kids and family members that you recommend to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: Andrewblaylock
Reviews.Content: The beds aren't comfy. Our curtain was missing so sleeping in was impossible. The bathroom floor hasnt been moped in what looks like years. This place could be nice. It's a shame it's a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: BriteEyz58
Reviews.Content: The room we were given was clean but we can't say anything good about the rest of it. One of the beds was broken! The clock had no power cord or battery and there was no coffee maker until I called and got one brought to the room. There is more but I think a hotel with a broken bed is enough.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Needs are Met”
Reviews.Author: DVazquez
Reviews.Content: This is not a five star hotel, but this does have everything you need. The staff is nice and the rooms are clean and spacious with lots of beds. This place is located close all parks… just minutes away  Yes, the furniture is out dated and so is the building, but it is functional and very affordable. We will be coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: faith010
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in June 2011 for two nights. Very convenient to I-4, many eating options close by. My room was typical of a budget motel ( basic). The room was clean, and the staff was pleasant. Didn't eat in the on site restaurant. Pool area was clean and the onsite store is affordable and is well stocked. Overall visit was very good. ** This is a hotel for those who drive**

Reviews.Title: “Very cool... Kids suite great”
Reviews.Author: Cclov
Reviews.Content: The room had a king sized bed... Bunk beds and another bed how awesome is that and looked like a tree house... There was an x box machine... There is a fridge and microwave... The downside is that once you get into the resort it looks like a motel from the outside... But once you get into the room and close the blinds its Better... It was clean although my feet were dirty from walking on the carpet which probably is a no no but it was fine....

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel...we will not be back”
Reviews.Author: sweetiec
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with 2 small children and found this hotel to be a bit outdated. Room service was not up to par...Our toilet in our room overflowed and we had to call maintenance twice to come clean it up..which took about 45 minutes. The room was small (we had a kids suite). We were led to believe that the room was spaceous but instead learned it was one room that was cut into pieces to make two rooms. The saying "Kids under 10 eat free" is not true. They make up the cost by charging the adults the price it would be for kids to eat. If you eat outside of the hotel..it is the same price. There is no deal at this hotel. If you are a family on a budget (as we are), the hotel was ok but you definitely could find another place to stay for better accommodations. I would not recommend this hotel at all and will not be staying here again on my next visit.. YOU CAN DO BETTER SOMEWHERE ELSE!!! TRUST ME!

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely love the Seralago Hotel. I wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: CindyElizabeth82
Reviews.Content: For the past four years whenever I go to Orlando I stay at the Seralago Hotel. I feel as if they truly value me as a repeat guest. The staff has always gone above and beyond to satisfy me. I am extremely happy with their customer service. :-) The hotel itself is within minutes of the theme parks. Its atmosphere is family oriented, nice, comfy and cozy. The rooms are super tidy as well as the swimming pool area. The jacuzzi is the best ever!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: mangelo77
Reviews.Content: Let me first say I am a travel agent so I know sometimes people can tend to make things sound worse then they are when they are upset so I take reviews with a grain of salt but trust me when I say this place does have bed bugs. We drove over from Tampa the night before to spend the next day at Disney so we only needed a place for the night so I figured this place would be fine since we really only needed a place to sleep. We stayed there a week ago and now my daughter and I have bed bug bites. When the bites showed up on us the other day I did some research and sure enough the bites are from bed bugs. All in rows of 3 to 4 bites. We now must clean the entire house and pray they did not travel home with us. Beware, the rooms here are at a good rate but you will spend more on cleaning products once you get home to get rid of bed bugs not to mention the bites you will have on you're arms and legs so it is not worth it in the long run. You get what yiou pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Feces in the Pool!!?/No Bar-B-Que Grills??”
Reviews.Author: jmarti2324
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 17 - June 20th, 2011. Here is a brief overview of my stay followed by an extremely detailed review: 1. I was lied to about the fact that grills were on the property. Went out bought my own grill. Was told that I couldn't grill on the property even after being told that I could. Wasted my money. 2. Whirlpool tub didn't work. 3. Sister's I.D. was stolen from our room. 4. Someone took a -- in the pool twice while I was there. 5. Both air conditioning broke in our 2 room suite and had to be completely replaced. 6. Unsure of how clean the pools are. 7. I say the sleep quality was average. Cleanliness was average (found left over items from other guests I give it a 2 star on value. The Spa was nice. Not great, but nice. The swimming pool served it's purpose, however, I have a habit of nibbling my upper and lower lips and tasted saltiness while I was in the pool. Pool water should not be salty... From close up the water looks normal but from far away it has a green tinge. I'm developing a rash. Not sure if those 2 things coincide. Just as a warning: IF you're planning on staying here for 1 night, you might just be okay, but it's not good for an extended stay. If you're just tired and want to get off the road and have a hot shower that's all this place is good for. You'll see a lot of reviews that'll say the hotel is outdated and it's very true. Personally, I like an 80s vibe in places. If you're looking for a modern hotel, you will be sorely disappointed. Even to look at it it's really old. Sort of like the hotels that become home to crack heads and fugitives. Now, on with the in depth review. First of all, I want to say that despite several problems that I incurred at this hotel, I was willing to give it at least a 3 star review because the problems were minor. However, on a grander scale, putting it all together made me realize this hotel doesn't deserve 3 stars. I will start off by saying that the reviews here are so mixed because some of these issues are not going to effect everyone, however, it is important to know that staying at this hotel will be risky because any one of the negative reviews could apply to you. My mistake was thinking that I'd be one of the lucky few. Okay, to start, we booked a 2 Room Suite for $85 a night plus $25 taxes for a 3 night stay through "Stayhereplayhere.com" - Its' even cheaper if you agree to do a time share. We had a whirlpool tub in our room which was a very nice size. Very roomy, however, the jets did not work so basically it was nothing but an over sized tub. The next day of our first stay, my sister's photo I.d. went mysteriously missing while we were all out. We literally checked every corner of the suite and it was gone and there is a pending investigation and based on other terrible ratings on this site, other people has experienced missing items as well. Again, I was hoping I'd be among the lucky... Before booking the Room, I knew I'd need to do some bar-b-queing so that our family would have something to eat for dinner on one of the nights we stayed. I was pressed for time and it was looking more and more likely that I wouldn't have the time with my proceeding schedule in the coming days so I called the hotel and asked if they had Grills on the property. I was told that they do. I was content and trusted the judgement of the upfront personnel who answered the phone. So we arrive to the hotel and on day 1, I didn't see any grills anywhere but I didn't need them at the time. Mind you, I have meat that has been marinating for 2 days and needs to cook before it spoils.... So by day 2, I absolutely needed to go ahead and get it on the grill. There are 2 pools. One in the back where I rooms were, And 1 in the front building where the standard rooms are.... When I didn't see any grills, I called up to the front desk to ask "Where are your grills?" - The girl at the desk gave a strange answer. She said, "Usually by the pool." -- Evidently, she must have thought I asked, "Where do we grill at?" because I figure if the grills are by the pools, they either ARE or they're not. Anywho... We went to the pool in the back and realized there were no grills and we swam and decided to grill later. It wasn't until the next day, when we were informed the back pool was closed because someone actually used the bathroom in the pool (#2) but the front pool was opened. Now mind you, I know the hotel doesn't have control over what people decide to do... after all, we all have an expectation that people WONT do nasty things like that... but my disgust came with the fact that they only had a maintenance guy come and fish the feces out and the pool was opened no less than 12 hours later.... How in the hell could you have cleaned a pool thoroughly enough to be swam in again. This happened twice in the same pool during my 3 night stay, by the way. So anyway, after finding out the pool was closed, I decided this was an opportunity to see the grills at the front pool. Low and behold, there were no grills. I called back up to the front desk and was told there were no grills. Now, at this point, I've talked to 3 people about grilling and neither of them told me about an anti-grilling policy. IN FACT the first 2 lead me to believe that grills were not only at the hotel but were accepted. So as upset as I was, I was still going to give this hotel at least a 3. I had to go out and buy a temporary throw away grill from the store for $10 along with the coals and lighter fluid. On the last night, I proceeded to take my grill, meat, and supplies to the pool just outside of our room in the back and again, it was closed because someone had taken another -- in it. I made my way up to the front pool and set up everything and began grilling. We were grilling for a good hour and a half and everything was fine. Then up walks the maintenance guy who was extremely nice... I have no complaints about him. He said, "I'm sorry but there is no grilling on the hotel property." Then I proceeded to explain to him that I had been told or lead to believe that grilling was allowed by 3 different persons. 1st, the person who told me that grills were already there. 2nd by the girl who told me grilling was done by the pool. and 3rd by the guy who told me there were no grills. All 3 of them had the opportunity to tell me that "There is no grilling on the property" and none of them did. In fact, the first 2 told me it would be allowed. He said, "Oh, okay, well I'll have the manager come out and speak to you then. Just tell him what you told me and he'll make that decision." -- Again, he was very nice about it. Before the manager came out, a security guard, an old Spanish guy in his $60 came out with a serious little look on his face... Had a very "Scarface" type demeanor and said, "You gotta put that out... You can't have that grill out here..." --- And the smug little attitude he had wasn't inviting or courteous... we were literally being treated like criminals. He wouldn't even make eye contact with us... He said something into his walky talky and people were staring at us... And as I was explaining him that I was waiting on the manager... he kept telling me I had to put it out until the maintenance guy showed up and reconfirmed that I was waiting on the manager... After some hesitation he finally stepped off to the side and eventually left for a little bit... After about 10 minutes, the hotel manager came out and talked with me and I explained my situation. I told him that I wouldn't have honestly 1) spent my money on the grill and supplies (over $30 total including coal, lighter fluid, the grill, and utensils) had I not been told that grills were on the site before I booked and that my entire stay was based around that lie. However, I informed him that the coals were dying down and I was on my last bit of meat and I'd be done momentarily... He then told me I could leave the property and grill my meat on the side of the street in front of the hotel... While I understood his position, that was a bit insulting. After having stressed how much of an inconvenience this ordeal was, he eventually asked me how much more time I would need. I said, "About an hour..." collectively he and the security guard who had joined him said, "Ohhh no no no.... an hour?? That's too long... this needs to be put out soon... No we can't do an hour.... Then he looked at the security guard and told him to give me 15 minutes..." I was cooking exotic meats... the meats would have been ruined if I had to stop cooking them, wet down the grill... take the grill to another location... and try to relight it... It would have been a waste of time, money, and meat. Luckily, The guard gave me 30 minutes and I was done by the time he got back, however, I had more meat that I needed to grill. I asked to be compensated in some way and the manager" Chris Richardson said flat out that he wasn't going to compensate me. I wasn't asking for a free night but considering the fact that I had to go out and buy a grill and spend $30 on supplies that I'd never fully utilize, I felt I was owed some type of compensation and he refused... The moral of the story is, the hotel got my money on false pretenses and were unwilling to make their wrong right. I will absolutely never choose this hotel again. I would have paid double what I paid to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: MsPainn
Reviews.Content: This place was horrible. I read some of the reviews n I can't believe how some ppl can say this place was nice. We had a suite n it was very dirty. The beds were very nasty. On the beds they had no fitted sheets so the mattresses were always exposed. They didn't clean the room for the whole four days we were there. Never changed the linen we had 2 do it ourself. I mean I can definitly go on in on. They say the breakfast is complimentary but no. The kids ate free which was a plus but the breakfast was horrible me n my children had to go across the street to mcdonalds after I already paid that's how bad it was. All I can say is when me n my children got home we slept for two whole days strait from lack of comfort form our entire stay. I hope someone would think twice before they stay at the seralogo hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place - do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: neveragainjoe
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel experience in my life. It began with wrong directions by the front desk. They took us 45 minutes to the east rather than the west. After we arrived and unpacked we found that our door would not lock - the key card did not work. We packed up the kids and our stuff and moved to another room at 10 p.m. Two days later our key card wouldn't let us in. Back to the front desk. Another day later we returned to our room after being at Disney all day only to find that the door was open. Key card did not work and the lock was not turned on. Room was unlocked and unsecure the entire day! Toilet ran all night. Neighbors kept us up by talking outside our room until 1:30 a.m. We called the front desk 4 times and were told they were taking care of it. Never happened. I spoke with Joe at the front desk. He joked that I didn't know his name so he would be off the hook for all the issues. Joe, I remember your name and the crappy service we received. Finally at check out we spoke with a manager who said she would call us with a resolution. She never called us and never logged all the issues we encountered. We will never stay here again. Oh, I didn't mention the drug deal going on near the pool or the clientele this place attracts. Save up your money and find a better place down the street.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: LPOIRIER
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Seralago Hotel. We found everyone that worked there was very helpful and friendly. We were in a suite and we loved it. Our housekeeper was Ana and she kept the room spotless. It was well worth the money spent . It is very inexpensive compared to staying at some of the hotels in the area. It is a 5 minute walk to Old Town and there are so many places to eat right by the hotel. You can walk to any of them. They had 2 pools that were beautiful and kept very clean and they had piles of towels for you to use there. It's a good family hotel and I would stay there again the next time we go to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained, needs updating in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: fma05
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Seralago Hotel and Suites for 22 years. They were formerly Holiday Inn and we loved it because they had a children's program. Now that my children are young adults, our needs are different. We now reserve a one bedroom suite that gives us ample room, a full kitchenette and two tvs. My biggest suggestion is that they must get a full size refrigerator in the units. The mimi fridge dows not cut it when there are more than two people staying in a unit. By Florida standards we also end up paying quite a bit more than the norm, but the hotel is well maintained and has great pools and a volleyball area. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet, very nice pool area with friendly bartender.”
Reviews.Author: JaxTraveller50
Reviews.Content: This is a well kept older hotel with great rates. I would definitely stay here again. Great for singles or family. The king sized bed was a bit tired but still fairly comfortable. The room was very clean with a micro and fridge.

Reviews.Title: “We Are Going Back, This Place Was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jackblack81
Reviews.Content: 2 very clean swimming pools and hot tubs, the staff was very helpful and friendly. the room we stayed in was a suite and it was great, it was very clean and well taken care of. it is however an older place and not up with technology but we went for a vacation not to play on a HD TV..... Overall I am going back here every time I go to Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ken167
Reviews.Content: We used bookit.com for our vacation. The kids suite is not a suite. Beds uncomfortable. Toilet over flowed first night. Desk clerk refused to send someone to fix token machine in laundry room with 2 hours remaining for laundry to be open. Families were not watching their children in pool area, 2 girls almost drowned. Not a good stay, would recommend finding somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: dnbhenn1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great rooms, customer service was good, staff was great. Loved Resturant n food. Will definetly stay there again. I'm not sure why reviews were mixed but we loved it. My family of five loved the kids suite n pools

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: jerseydi45
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times & always had a wonderful time. Staff is always helpful& nice. I am going there again in june & am looking forward to another great time.

Reviews.Title: “This place is straight from the 80's!”
Reviews.Author: vacaymaam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family and thought the pictures on expedia looked nice. Expedia made the property sound like a great place to stay for the money. While I do admit the location and price are good,the hotel itself is run down and looks like its a throwback from the 80s. Once I checked in, my family and I were placed in a room at the back of the property across the parking lot from a retaining pond turned swamp and area where ferrell cats roamed free. Once inside, the smell of old feet and mildew are a treat for the senses. I didn't even want to take off my shoes to walk on the floors. The mattresses were hard and old as well as the pillows being stained yellow from years of other peoples use. I became sick from allergies and broke out in a rash after the first night. The decor looks like it came straight out of a saved by the bell episode. I didn't think merlot and sea foam green where color palates that were pleasing to the eye ever! But somehow this hotel managed to use them in every area of the place. The only upside to this place was the fact that they had a bar so I could drown my sorrows to forget about the fact that I was not staying in a nice hotel...I was staying in the armpit of Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “IGNORE THE BAD REVIEWS”
Reviews.Author: Minky2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for 2 weeks, location is great, staff couldn't do enough for us, they very very helpful, room was clean and tidy and had everything you need including hairdryer, tv, alarm clock, iron and ironing board, microwave etc., Housekkeping was excellent, beds very comfortable, swimming pools and hot tubs were clean and well maintained, has everything you need onsite and felt safe and secure here, found the Seralago to be great value. Will definately be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest beds, but the greatest value, especially for families.”
Reviews.Author: Petwriter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for those travelling with small kids. The Murphy bed adds a comfortable alternative to the pull-out sofa. The beds are not very comfortable, but they aren't too bad. This is the perfect place for those who just want a place to flop after a long day at the parks. It is within walking distance to the bazaar where there are lots of wonderful things to see, rides and restaurants, shopping and sometimes car shows. We got a full kitchen suite and a second regular room and it was more than adequate for five adults and three kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place good value for money”
Reviews.Author: skanoerse
Reviews.Content: Central in the main hotel area along US 192, well maintained nice rooms,poolarea etc, more quiet than we expected, close to everything. A good place to spend a vacation close to Disney and Universal. Lots of thing to do for kids around here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: CubanQt115
Reviews.Content: It was our first time visiting Disney and I must say I no problem what so ever w/ the hotel service. Very clean and friendly staff. Beds were comfy. Cable worked just fine as did the fridge and microwave. Shower was clean and water pressure was nice. Heated pool was welcoming since the temperature wasn't too hot yet. Literally minutes away from Magic Kingdom. Next to major shopping areas and w/i walking distance to Old Town. Def recommend this hotel to others and I will def revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: tlvsgreen1
Reviews.Content: on my first night stay I was asked to change my, because I was told that i could not be in a poolside room with my 2 12 lbs shitzus, when i had called and booked the room Book I t. com told me it was ok because of the size of the dogs. but I was ok with the change and I understood. So they put us in another room in the back part of the hotel the first night when we went to sleep my daughter kept telling me that it felt like she was getting bitente by something, i told her it was probably from the chlorine that was in in the pool and that it probably had a reaction to her skin. The next day we spent it at Universal studios, we got back we went in the pool and then went out to dinner. By the time we got back from dinner we were exhausted, we layed down to go to bed and my daughter said she felt like she was getting bitten again, we pulled up the sheets and low and behold, it was infested with bed bugs, my husband picked up a few of them and went to the front desk and told them what was going on and showed them the bugs and they said, I Quote "we are not Bed Bug Experts" and asked if we wanted a different room and my Husband told them no we dont want to go thru this again we would just like our money back so that we could leave.. While my husband was up at the front desk I proceeded to pack up our stuff and sure enough the bugs were in our suitcases and all over our clothes, thats how bad it was. I decided to look at my daughters legs and arms and sure enough she had bites all over her. Well to make this story short they would not refund my money they told me I had to fight Book-it.com for my refund. I know for a fact that once you check out of a hotel that was boked thru another web sight they automatically get there money. Needless to say, we wound up drving home to Cape Coral at 1130 at night and stripping our clothes off as we were driving because the bugs were on our Clothes. So Yess I want to thank you Seralago Hotel for not only ruining my vacation but also my Mothers Day that I spent washing and treating my Family Clothes, Bombing my card to kill them and also having to wash and treat my dogs for the infestation I would never reccomed this hotel to anyone, just for the fact of the nonshalontley of it all it was just no big deal to the manager, like I was suppose to suck it up and and bear it

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaydine
Reviews.Content: Serelago is a nice family orientated hotel. staff are friendly and helpful. Good location as it is right next to Old Town and various fast food shops. Walgreens and a supermarket are not too far down the road. Good shuttle service to Disney which is free. The rooms I agree are in need of refurbishment. I have a poolside room which was good as I could leave watch my children from the room while they played in the plyground or in the pool. The hotel also offers a lovely hot tub and the drinks at the poolside bar are reasonly price. The mini market within in the hotel is good value too. All in all, this is a good hotel, good location.. staff are friendly, helpful and the hotel is good value for money (for what I paid). Also felt safe at the hotel as after dark you could definately get a good nights sleep. I would definately stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: mtrhodes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Kids Suite for a week with small children. It needs some love. The tiles in the kitchen area and bathroom were cracked and missing pieces. The ceiling material was coming down in the bathroom. The floors were nasty. I made the kids wear socks the whole time. The bed was comfortable and the tvs worked good. I would stay there again if need be but will look around and pay a little more for a room that is more updated next time at Disney. The pool was fine...nothing exciting and no one cleaned up and people were smoking in the pool...yuck! You get what you pay for is the moral to this story.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Leafs79
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and air conditioned. Staff was excellent. Breakfast buffet in hotel was good. Lots of decently priced restaurants near by. Pool and hot tub nice, although hot tub could use a little up dating. Flea market close by, although kind of boring.. Old town okay but displayed vehicles need repairing. Outlet mall shuttle available. Good shooping there. City transit right in front of hotel took us to Wallmart and other places for a $4.50 all day pass. Good value and safe. The hotel is not the Ritz but for middle classed people who are on a budget this was a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “good location for walkers...”
Reviews.Author: chillinsmokefree
Reviews.Content: good location if you like to walk, service desk was good, taxis are expensive. shuttles are ok, but the times are pre set. There is a large fleamarket one way down the street, another the other way. Old town next door was kind of cool. Poolside option means you look at the small, busy pool 50 yards away. The bathroom was deplorable. (painted over bath tub, and tub surround with black mold noticable. Not for the faint of heart. Linens were clean However, I would not come back here. The price was what got me. Cheap. When you go cheap, you get cheap. I should have known.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of good amenities but te rooms need a lot of work!”
Reviews.Author: Goldnvalli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. We had a poolside room. The pool was great. It was heated and I especially liked that it was a salt water pool. The breakfast was conveniently located to the room and the food was good. The kids enjoyed the gameroom that had great games for the kids. Unfortunately the worst part was the room. It was very old and dated. The tiles on the floor were chipped. The bathroom was tiny. The beds were small but comfortable. I don't think I will stay here again. It was too dated for me bit the overall experience was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Families”
Reviews.Author: mikevoltage
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some mixed reviews on this sight, but after staying there for 4 nights we were very pleased. Room was clean and housekeeping was excellent. The staff was freindly and professional. KFC and Red Lobster are right next door and Old Town is just a short walk away. The breakfast wasn't bad, but after four days of the same thing it gets a little tiring. Definitely a hotel for families on vacation and not so much for the business traveler. We'll defintely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place for a short stay but only if you have kids and a vehicle.”
Reviews.Author: Usedtobebarbie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on price and the ability to separate the kids and adults (in the kid's suite) while only paying for one room. I was nervous b/c the reviews here are mixed. I'll try to comment on the good as well as the bad so others can make an educated choice re: this hotel. The hotel was easy to find and the location was convenient - close enough to do Disney stuff w/o the 24/7 Disney influence and the Disney prices. We had a rental car so we could zip over to Disney within 10 - 15 minutes. I wouldn't want to stay here w/o a car though as their Disney shuttle doesn't run very often and we wanted to be able to easily get to restaurants, grocery stores, etc. When I booked this hotel I called and asked if it's possible to get a kid's suite facing the pool and the lady on the phone said that all the kid's suites are poolside. I booked over the phone and said that we for sure wanted the pool side. I wanted the poolside room b/c I knew there would be times where our infant daughter might be sleeping, or the other kids might be sleeping in the room and DH and I would like to sit outside the room and read, have a coffee, etc. w/o waking the kids. When I checked in though I was told that they could see that it said poolside on my reservation but they didn't have any poolside kid's suites left. I explained that I was told they were all poolside and the girls said that was a mistake. I didn't make a big issue of it. The girl at the check in wasn't very apologetic for the mistake and although she was basically friendly, she didn't do anything extra to be welcoming or hospitable. We drove to our room and I was surprised that this is actually a motel, not a hotel. Basically it's a two story row of rooms where you park out front - no hallways. At first this bothered me b/c it seemed very highway truck stop motel like, but it actually ended up being convenient b/c we could easily get things to/from the room and could grab things from the car quickly w/o any effort. The room itself was quite dated and quite basic. When I first saw the kid's suite I was very disappointed. It was a small wooden divider that was about 6ft tall, just sort of set up in the room. The kids loved their little "cabin" and were thrilled with their own bunk beds and tv. The room was clean and I didn't see any bugs, mold, etc. as other mentioned. The bathroom was fairly basic and I was surprised that the Kitchenette area was a counter in the bathroom shared w/ the bathroom sink. There was a microwave above the counter and a fridge under it. Our toilet kept running all the time unless you jiggled the handle to get it to stop. We figured this out after finding the running water toilet noise annoying. The crib provided by the hotel was one of those metal cribs that many hotels use. It was quite old and didn't really fit together all that well but it sufficed. After being in the room for about 20 minutes I was kind of feeling disappointed with our accomodations. In particular I was frustrated that there weren't any chairs outside the room to sit on and I was really hoping to switch to a poolside room. I called the front desk and asked if they had any 2 room suites by the pool explaining that I was lead to believe we'd be poolside when I made the reservation. I was told we could upgrade for $20/night. I asked if the manager would be willing to wave the fee given their mistake in booking and was told that we'd be getting a lot more space so they couldn't wave the fee. I then mentioned that they had the room sitting empty and really they'd still only have one suite to clean so really it wouldn't cost them anything for us to switch and they'd have a much happier customer and the guy on the phone said something like, "I don't think we could do that". I then asked if they had any poolside kid's suites available for the next 2 nights and he said they did and we could move the next day in the middle of the day. I then learned that they don't have any chairs outside the poolside rooms anyways so it would be a hassle to move and not much benefit. So after all that I thanked him and said we might as well just stay with what we had and save everyone the effort of moving. We stayed 3 nights in total and it worked out just fine. The beds were comfortable, the room was serviced well each day and we slept well. We spent very little time in the room so it was basically just a place to sleep at night. We were awakened a couple of times by people arriving later at night (car doors closing, people talking, etc.) but it wasn't too bad. Every night around 11ish the sprinklers outside our room turned on for 10 minutes and were quite loud but we fell back asleep easily. The pool area was really nice and the pool was a nice temperature. The pool bar/restaurant looked nice although we never used it. The baby pool could use some fresh paint to make it look a little more appealing - it's sort of yellow stained looking. My kids had a fun swimming and hanging out on the pool deck. I used the laundry facilities which were handy and convenient. We only tried the restaurant on the first day for breakfast and we found the selection to be limited and the quality to be low so we ate elsewhere for all our other meals. I tried to buy Disney tickets at the hotel but they charge a $5 convenience fee per ticket and their tickets are the same price as buying at Disney so I decided to just buy straight from Disney. They offered to sell me discounted tickets if I went to see their timeshares which I declined. Overall this was an okay place to stay if you have kids, have your own vehicle and are looking to save some money. They could improve their hotel greatly by freshening up the decor and by recruiting staff that care about the guests and make the guests feel more welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: stevieb71
Reviews.Content: After reading some scathing reviews by quite obviously small minded people I felt obliged to redress the balance. I booked the Sera Lago Resort through a British Airways Package. The criteria I used in chosing the motel was price, location and facilities. After reading some extremely mixed reviews before we flew out there was a slight concern that maybe it had been the wrong choice. I have to say that I as well as my family were delighted with the facilities, the room, the beds, the cleanliness of the place and the service we received during our stay there. The only thing that I could critisise was the heated pool was cold, but that could be easily explained due to the record cold temperatures that Florida was experiencing during our stay there, and was in no way the fault of the hotel. Our 15 night holiday started off with a disaster, our initial flight delayed so we were transferred to a later one this was also delayed so we missed our connection in London this meant we had to stay overnight in a hotel there. the next morning 1" of snow fell so they closed the airport. We finally took off 3 days later but couldn't get to Orlando as the flights were full so went via Tampa which meant rearranging car hire at the last minute. On the flight over my 6 year old son developed food poisoning, vomiting and soiling himself several times on the flight over. Not the best start to the holiday I'm sure you'll agree. We arrived at the Sera Lago deeply relieved at what we found. The weather as I have stated was around freezing for several days when we were there and although this impacted on our enjoyment of some of the parks it was reassuring to know that we had a nice warm and welcoming room to go back to. Yes the decor is a bit dated and could maybe do with a wee update but to be honest it is no worse than the vast majority or American motels. They are all styled very similarly and although some are now revamping their rooms the vast majority are the same as they were. As for the people who moan that they didn't get something for nothing get a life! You are in Orlando to have fun and see Mickey Mouse not sit in a motel room moaning. P.S. we saw no cockroaches anywhere around the Sera Lago, but we did at one of the hot dog consession booths oposite the lake in EPCOT ! you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “It is a great place and location”
Reviews.Author: JayHowe
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very clean, staff was very friendly. I have already made a return reservation, we stayed in the Kids suites and would recommend them to anyone traveling with smaller children..

Reviews.Title: “Seeing is believing”
Reviews.Author: Sashamoo
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical at first after reading some pretty bad reviews and although it may not be the Ritz, it definitely served our purpose. We were looking for something affordable, clean and with a pool. What we got was a room that was spacious enough for a family of 5 (cleaning lady came everyday). pools for all ages, a small playground right behind the pool area, a mini arcade area, a mini movie theater area (you can pick your choice of movie if no one else is there) an on site mini food court, a breakfast restaurant with an amazing staff, etc... The King size bed wasn't the most comfortable but after a day in the pool, walking around Old Town or visiting any of the attractions, who cares! We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “family motel ok for simple stay Not recomended for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: sks-ngp
Reviews.Content: in todays world Internet is very important thing , you simply can not live without it. I stayed here for 9 days but each day the hotel staff responded with we are rebooting and we are working on it, wait till monday etc., was elusive answer with simply no resolution for full 9 days for even slow smooth Internet access. The internet access was too too poor with heavy packet losses, with my block at the end, even the signals were poor, even they suggested to work from lobby, there also many times Internet ceased to work.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: desireewilcox
Reviews.Content: The place was not the place described on expedia. It was a seedy, dumpy motel. The rooms were worn, and old, not well kept and dirty. There were cobwebs in the room, not to mention mosquitoes. The bed were horrible and it overall gave us a "we won't be happy here feel" and so we called expedia and were switch to another hotel THank goodness or our stay would have been ruined.

Reviews.Title: “CHANGE THE "H" TO "M" FOR MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: nickl1
Reviews.Content: Pictures can be deceiving.. Looking at the pictures that they show on the website make you believe that this place is a fun, value for your money. Other than where they are located, there is no other advantage to this place. As we checked in the first clue should have been that were were asked to pay the total for our reservation up front. As I looked to my left while checking in, I was looking for these resturants that were advertised.. NOT LIKELY! As we drive around to our room, my son shouted "they should change the "h" to an "m" because this is not a hotel!! The bathroom doubled as a kitchen; YOU HAD NO WHERE TO RINSE A UTENSIL! the refrigerator was so small you could only place 2 16oz bottles in the freezer. The lined did not smell fresh and when you sat on the bed, it immediately touched the floor! I cannot believe that Disney or AAA would endorse a place like this!! We have been to the Kissimmee/Orlando area multiple times over the past 20 years and this is the worst place I have ever stayed! It is worth it to drive an extra 5 minutes and stay at a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ThatToddGuy
Reviews.Content: If you have money to burn and are looking for a 4 or 5 star hotel, then this is definitely not the place to stay. I was very leery of going to this Hotel because of all the bad reviews I had read about it. But after staying there for a week with my family, I can honestly say that it is a really good deal. They have lots of things for the kids to do, (ie: two heated swimming pools, sand volleyball court, basketball, nightly theater, game room, etc.), they provide a bus service to Disney's Magic Kingdom & transportation center, and they are right next door to Old Town. I have been to Disneyworld many times before, and mostly we have stayed at a Disney Resort because of the convenience, but you are then a prisoner of Disney and have to buy all of your overpriced meals & extras from them. Staying outside of Disney's grasp was a great way to save a lot of money. Although, as I said before, if you are looking for a 4 or 5 star hotel, then this isn't the place for you. The rooms are kind of old, and could use a little more maintenance, but for the price trade off, I feel it is well worth it..

Reviews.Title: “Don't let any money when you leave!”
Reviews.Author: danie2524
Reviews.Content: The room was fine, the bathroom was so small, there is a hole in the side of the door, so we can close the door because of that. The location was great, near Walt Disney, Old Town and a lot of shopping. The pool was great, really hot. The last day we was sleeping and the maid was bagning at our door, and we wake up like what's going on ? And she said : Oh I tought you were leaving today ... And we said no tomorrow and she said oh beacause it's my last day. Well after that we decide to go for a breakfast, and when we were back, my change (not a lot about 5$) was gone!!!
