It's not a lot but don't let money in your rooms when your not there ! It's not fun during vacations!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, budget friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DawnK_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very kid oriented, casual and fun. Close to anything you could possibly want to do while staying in the area. The staff I encountered during my stay was efficient and very friendly. The rooms are clean and the pool and play ground were well kept. If you're looking for a clean, fun, budget friendly, and fun place to lay your head while you visit the attractions, or just want to take a weekend to chill at the pool, this place is excellent!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Set your expectations low and don't bring valuables!”
Reviews.Author: usmcbfly
Reviews.Content: I waited a little while to write this because I wanted to see how the hotel would handle the situation. Since they haven't really handled anything, I will write my review. The hotel is very old, the bed was very big and the kids suite was neat, in theory. That was about it. We stayed for 4 days and after the first horrible nights sleep we honestly should have left. Lesson learned. On the 3rd night of our stay my wedding rings were stolen from our room. The hotel completely sided with the maid. Said they were going to call the police and over an hour later, still had not called. It has been over a week and my rings still have not been found, no one has been questioned. The police were finally called at 11pm, they were notified at 7pm. It was a heartbreaking experience and needless to say will never stay there again. If you are in a pinch and HAVE to stay there. Don't leave anything of value in your room!!! Also, to add insult to injury, they tried to charge us for the call made by the police to our room!

Reviews.Title: “FUN, CHEEP, AND GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: amx-borders
Reviews.Content: We have stayes here 2 times and now have our 3rd trip booked. We love the fact that you can walk to alot of the attractions FUN SPOT AND THE MOST AWESOME OLD TOWN. THIS PLACE HAS THE COOLEST SHOPS AND AMAZING CAR AND MOTORCYCLE SHOW IM TALKING 100'S OF THEM. .The pools are so nice the best way to lay around and relax. There are 3 of them! The staff is great and very helpfull. We had called for extra pillows and towels befor i could hang up they were at our door it was great..We had a single room our 1st visit but the 2nd we had a 2 bed room suite. WE HAD A 10 YEAR OLD, TWIN 13 YEAR OLDS, A 16 YEAR OLD AND US TWO ADULTS AND WE HAD PLENTY OF ROOM. The only complant i heard was only one bathroom and it had no exhaust! SO ALL IN ALLL THIS IS WHERE WE WILL STAY EVERY YEAR YOU SHOULD TRY IT.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, but property needs refurbished.”
Reviews.Author: marykatmp
Reviews.Content: We left the resort today early because we found mold in our room. We had one of the kid suites, and while our kids loved it because of the bunk beds, we had mold in our room, around the windows and the shower, the surround sound system in the kids area did not work, and there was hair in our shower. Gross! I was given the opportunity to check out another room, but there was mold in the shower there too. They gave us 20% off of last night and are processing a refund for tonight since we had already paid. I am disappointed since my kids were excited to have bunk beds, and the great reviews, but we were really unimpressed by the rooms and buildings as a whole, not to mention the health concern that mold raises. One of my kids is allergic to mold and was coughing all night, it is just not worth it .

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a friends place.”
Reviews.Author: adair_j99
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel for five years now. The staff has always been very friendly and helpful. We have stayed in standard rooms and the two room suites, anywhere from two days to a week at a time. We have always traveled with children and they have always been welcome. The restaurant has ALWAYS had awesome breakfasts, the pools have always been clean and wonderful, the hot tubs perfect for soothing the tourist pains away. While the hotel is older and not 4 star where the buildings are concerned, it is clean, comfortable, very friendly, family oriented and competitively priced. Just minutes from all the theme parks, easy to navigate to and from, near all kinds of shopping and food too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you are a trucker”
Reviews.Author: alexlabelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more of a motel showing its age. All rooms face outside so you will have no problem hearing those late nighters arriving, parking, slamming doors, etc. It is a step up from the local truck stop motel. As far as cleanliness is concerned, the bathroom looks like it never had a good sweeping and the bathtub probably date back to the inaugural year when Disney opened. The quality of the clientele has something to be desired. The Neighbor next door was packing heat (huge handgun) tucker under his belt . I though I was vacation in Compton! 2 of us got sick when we came back with a cold most likely from the germs in the room. I would definitely avoid this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: NJNan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while visiting my daughter who was working at WDW. I arrived mid week and it was great, quiet, very relaxing. It got quite crowded over the weekend with a large school group which kind of ruined my experience as tons of load preteens and teens were running and yelling everywhere. Had a few problems with my room key not working. Great value as many hotels in Orlando are quite expensive and not worth it. Pool area was nice -- there was food on the property (not greatest quality but OK for a quick bite) and lots of choices close by. Easy drive to Disney and lots of other attractions. Staff was very helpful -- I left behind my hat and they made sure it was put away until my daughter could pick it up. All in all a pleasant surprise and affordable stay.

Reviews.Title: “better view through internet than face to face”
Reviews.Author: dloove75
Reviews.Content: When we looked for a hotel to stay in Orlando, FL through the internet the Seralo Hotel view where awesome we loved how they display everthing so we eventually did booked with them for Feb 2011. When we got there yes, the staff was very nice but, when we got to the so called suite omg!! It was one room w/ a wood diver the beds where from the 1950's so hard we had a back ache. My daugh was complaining her bed smelled like old. I felt like i was in a cheap motel not hotel .....

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, kids loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: 77firefly77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Very friendly staff, clean, was great for the kids. There's a gameroom, pizza place, small convience store, breakfast buffet, pool, hot tub, kiddie pool, & playground. THe kids' suite was great also, the kids loved it. They had their own space with bunk beds & their own tv. Great location near everything & right next to Old Town, about 5-6 min. from Disney. We stayed 2 nights & absolutely loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “basic but does the job”
Reviews.Author: mlbrazeau
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic but fufills the need if you are looking for a place to crash. The bathrooms could use an update but the rooms were clean. There are two large pools which are heated and a whirlpool as well as arcade/games room and some fast food options on site. Not a bad place for the the price if you just want a place to crash after days of touring the amusement parks and sites in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Old but spacious, suitable to rest your head.”
Reviews.Author: EnjoythejourneySA
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a good location and although it was old or appeared that way it was clean apart from the carpets. Staff were friendly and we were not left wanting or needing anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good value...just set your expectations”
Reviews.Author: OttJoe613
Reviews.Content: This is an older, very large motel...with 2 large heated pools and 2 hot tubs. Pros; staff is great (I complained about my mattresses...and they showwed up 15 mins later with 2 new mattresses!)...pools were large & heated...close to many great restaurants, free shuttles to- Disney, Universal & Seaworld, cool little theatre room- where guests can request the movie at the front counter, wifi in the rooms (sometimes have to move around to find it because the signal is weak) and 2 for 1 drinks at Happy Hour 6-8! Cons; very dated- rust around mirrors, doors, toilet roll dispenser...poor water pressure- be prepared to flush 2-3 times!...a bit of a walk if you are in one of the back buildings...older tv's....most everything needs replacing- it is beyond sprucing up. Overall...for the money, very good value...i was about $550 for 9 nights. So if you go in expecting an older motel with adequate facilities/ rooms...you'll be happy with the value you get.

Reviews.Title: “It was like Haven or Butlins cheap chalets”
Reviews.Author: CanadaLynne
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed with the room and the hotel to be honest, and I certainly wouldnt rate it a 3 star! The rooms are very dated and old and a lot of the fittings were rusty and it reminded me of a holiday camp in the UK. I didnt expect luxury at that price but I was shocked at how poor the rooms were, some of the furniture was falling apart, the microwave was a brown wood panel effect one that also had rust inside the door, but the fridge was ok to store bottles of water etc. The beds were clean and we did get clean towels every day but the air conditioning unit outside the room had the front panel falling off it. The hot-tub was lovely after a day walking round parks, but the pool had broken tiles around the side, however there were clean towels to use and they seemed quite new. The internet was so old & slow and we didnt try the food in the restaraunt to be honest, theres a Pondarosa over the road so we used to go there for breakfast. The staff were lovely and very accomodating when I asked for a room change, but once again the reception area was a bit run down and tatty but the location was excellent. I spoke to a guy who had stayed here for the past 14 years but I certainly wouldnt stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Value”
Reviews.Author: Kerri-Ann15
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at our stay at the Seralago last week. After reading some of the other reviews I was quite worried at what I would find when my teenage daughter and I arrived last Thursday. The front desk staff where very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. Yes the room was quite dated but it was clean and everything was in working condition. The location of the hotel is perfect if you are visiting any of the parks and if you're not, there is more then enough to do around you within walking distance. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: jjcanuckOtt
Reviews.Content: We were there to golf and not spend time in a room. The sink had no pressure and the tub was slow to drain and the beds were badly made (kept coming apart as you slept). Big deal. But charging for a local call was really nickel and diming. Other hotels offer it free and free internet in the lobby and Wi Fi. We had to pay for internet too. The pool felt warm (saw people swimming) and the hot tub was 102F. We didn't eat or swim or hot tub or use the bar or the little store or the phone while we were there. There are way better deals outside. Walk to: Sizzlin Grill was best for breakfast. $3.99 plus $1.89 for coffee and Logan's Steakhouse was best for beer at Happy Hour $2.99 for 20 oz and Nachos were great plus free peanuts. Old town was fun to walk around at but is typical Amusement Park crap. Good access to golf courses

Reviews.Title: “They don't tell the truth”
Reviews.Author: texasholdemsdarlin
Reviews.Content: We called before checking in and asked about the internet service, we where told working find it is in all rooms. Again at check in we asked about the internet service was told it is working great. As we where going to our room we saw a tech person and asked him is the internet working? We had to get online that evening and that was the main concern as to where to stay. All three times we where told it is working fine. We could sign into the hotels network great signal, but could not get on line from there. Called the main desk was told it was being worked on and had been being worked on all day and they would try and have it on that night. Called back and hour later was told we are not sure we think the tech guy went home. We liked the location and the look of the place and it would have been a regular place to stay a few times a year, but after asking three people and being lied to we will not stay there ever again. Had they said we are having problems we would have still not stayed but on our next trip would have called them first. So they got one night and will not get anymore we moved up the street for the next 3 nights of our stay. Even with Fun Spot net door and all the noise of the rides screaming kids, would still have been ok. We wasted a night of work that needed to be done online set us back a day.

Reviews.Title: “great place for a great price!!”
Reviews.Author: Elle20
Reviews.Content: I want to advise your readers that this place has been given such bad reviews and I almost did NOT book because of, but I am so glad I do not head other people and must check it out for myself. This motel is right next to old town and its little quaint shops you can stroll through at your leisure on a cool winter day like we had in january and it was still a delight. Our room was really nice and had everything that you needed. But my favorite part of the motel is the pool. It is awesome and wanted to try it out, but we hit a cool spell in orlando and 60 degrees is not swimming weather! We will definitely try it next time, though, cause we are coming back....

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for a Big Family”
Reviews.Author: hardtack_n_lace
Reviews.Content: We spent half our Disney vacation on site and half off site. While staying in a Disney resort has a certain magic to it, Seralago offers a excellent value and lots of room. We had a family suite and it was VERY roomy. We had a huge bathroom, a bedroom with two beds, living room with a pull out sofa and a murphy bed. More than enough room for our family of six. There was a fridge, microwave, sink, and bar in the kitchen area. Lots of closet space too. The rooms were clean, beds comfortable, tv had good channels to pick from and free wifi. Our only complaint would be that the pool wasn't heated quite as much as the one at Disney. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place if you are a family looking for good value. Area is very convenient too. From the number of pets were saw, this must be a very pet friendly motel too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your Money”
Reviews.Author: reddenc
Reviews.Content: Rooms dirty, bed linen not clean, bathroom door would not close. Had reservations for 3 nights but let after the first night and was told that I would be charged for a second night. Checked out any way, but only was charged for the night I stayed. Would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value, ok food, good place to stay with kids.”
Reviews.Author: HeatherWilk76
Reviews.Content: Check in was a lengthy process even though we had reservations, just because so many families were checking in all at the same time at peak check in time, so no fault of the front desk. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in the Kid Suite. It was fun for our 3 kids in their own "room" with bunk beds. The king bed we slept on was very uncomfortable (too firm) and the sheets kept coming off. (I think they were too small for the bed.) The bathroom was very small and you had to "shuffle" around the large door to get inside. The "kitchenette" area was a nice small with a decent size countertop, however it doubled as the vanity/sink area. We had a few maintenance issues: one lamp would not work, another lamp did not have a bulb in it, and we complained about the sheets coming off. Management was more than accommodating in fixing these issues for us. They gave us a free buffet breakfast at the Vineyard Cafe for our troubles. The lobby was nice, with a little convenience store and arcade. There was a time share desk, which I mistook for concierge, and when I tried to ask a question about the hotel, they went into their spiel. I was annoyed by this, and just walked away. The hotel provides a free shuttle to the Disney Parks and we used this to get to Magic Kingdom. The pool area is huge and very fun, with music and a little Tiki Bar that has fabulous Pina Colodas. The area was quite busy and crowded with families until late, but it didn't disturb us. It's nice to see so many folks having a good time with their little ones. We ate at the Vineyard Cafe twice, and the food is ok, not gourmet, but not too bad either. It has typical buffet foods, but you can also order ala carte from the menu if you wish. With 3 little ones, the buffet is just easier for us. Before we left, we used the laundry facilities. They were clean and nice, but very expensive. Bring change because there is no change machine there. We had to purchase something from the convenience store in order to get quarters. Overall, I would say this is an ok hotel. I would stay here again with my children, but if it were just my husband and I, I would stay elsewhere. It is clean, the food is ok, the pool area is nice, but the bed was not comfortable. The value is very good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great deal. Nice common areas. Dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: abcdebeatty
Reviews.Content: When we arrived I found that the hotel was in a perfect location for our purposes. Real close to Old Town and near enough restaurants that we could do some walking. Also located close to I-4 or side roads for easy access to the theme parks. (within 10-15 minutes in light to medium traffic) Appearance of common area: Outside is nicely landscaped and building looked well-kept. Only 1 entrance in/out (good for security). Lobby was clean and open. Pool/Hot Tub was very nice, clean and handy pool towels. All rooms had exterior entrances on 2 floors only. All very near the pool area. Staff: Half very helpful & friendly and the other not the best. Excellent security staff. Room: We stayed in a room on the back side of the first building on the first floor. At first the room looked like rooms in most economy priced hotels. It included two full sized beds (not queen), table top TV, a tiny mircowave, and a very small fridge. Both located in the bathroom wash area located outside the toilet/shower room. There was 1 cabinet to put food. There was also a table and 2 chairs, but NO OUTLETS near enough to plug in a computer or other device. Cleanliness of room: The carpet was very disgusting. If you weren't wearing socks you could feel the grime on the bottom of your feet. If you wore socks, they got very dirty (we always wore our shoes). They vacuumed daily, but doesn't look as if they were ever cleaned. The bathroom was clean and mildew free, but no fan for venting. Comfort: Full sized beds were small (bigger would have crowded the room). The mattresses felt well-worn and the pillows were flat. Chairs were covered in a plastic-type material (that I'm almost sure were never wiped down), and uncomfortable to sit in for any length of time. Housekeeping: We were the first room from the service room, so the first to get the door knocked on to be cleaned (finally found magnetic privacy note three days in). We received daily towels, beds made, counters wiped down, trash dumped and a vacuuming. Pretty normal. There was a day or two where we received no service. I was surprised that the cleaning staff left a tip envelope for doing what I was paying the hotel for. Misc: Room near service area. The staff was not so quiet outside our room at 7am. They also had golf carts and wheeled carts pushed by our rooms earlier than that. Made it hard to get that last hour or so of much needed rest. Food court is overpriced. Breakfast buffet was ample (fruit, bagels, eggs, bacon, tomatoes, potatoes, sausage). Game room had some good games, but the "prizes" were a complete waste. Driving down 192 east of here, I'm not sure if you can find a much better hotel. Most looked similar outside, don't know what was inside. This was definitely a second class area compared to the overpriced hotels on I Drive. I don't know where the happy medium is?? I paid half the price of normal rates in a great on-line deal. There is NO WAY I would ever stay here at regular rates (avg. $80/$90 night). The condition of the most important parts of the room were too disgusting or uncomfortable (and I don't even have that high of standards). If I paid full price, I would rather stay around the corner at Tropical Palms for the same price for a private cottage.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: gemandlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stop gap when stranded in Florida after the volcano eruption stopped flights. The hotel is a budget hotel, rooms are dated in style but clean. Staff are friendly. There is a nice pool. Breakfast is over priced, there are a lot better places to eat. Overall not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what you pay and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: msladydade
Reviews.Content: I stayed with Seralago Dec 22-26 and at first I was leery , because of the reviews on Yahoo. But I have to say the staff was excellent I was checked in and in my room within 15mins very timely, the prices in the store were reasonable and the room was nice we stayed in the kids suite and my son, brother, and sister loved the room. We are so ready to come back. Everything was great except for that chinese buffett across the street from you guys next to macdonald's my son throw up all the food in the resturant and before we could get back across the street my brother throw up all his food.

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap, great location and worth the dollars.”
Reviews.Author: larry_nyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here via Priceline for under < $30, all in, for one Friday night. It bills itself as a resort and while it does have a pool, small cafe, and store onsite, but to call it a "resort" would be a stretch. I checked in quickly due to the very high number of staff at the counter. They were friendly and helpful. There were many, many kids running around and everyone around me was not from the U.S. Most were Europeans. There's a free shuttle to the amusement parks and it's surrounded by restaurants. WiFi and parking were included. For the price, it can't be beat. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and affordable. You're not getting a top end hotel here but you will get a safe hotel to explore the area.

Reviews.Title: “great staff good location”
Reviews.Author: andrewmackzn
Reviews.Content: After making a mistake and booking the room for a week later on expedia the hotel where fantastic the GM agreed to a refund and the staff spent over an hour on the phone to expedia helping me out. Tho a very busy hotel the guys where great. Room was good, clean and very fair value. Just round the corner from theme parks this one worth a look if you need a clean, safe place lots of free parking and nice and central. Internet in rooms would be a nice touch but its free and fast in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: Doogie86
Reviews.Content: Ok, first of all think about the price you are paying and how close to everything you are. I'm not going to sit here and say this place is the Ritz, but it certainly isn't a roach motel. There are good things and bad things about the place but at the end I feel as though it was worth every penny. When I first arrived I went straight to the room because some of my family had already arrived ealier and check in. As soon as you pull around back you may stay getting a weary feeling because the place doesn't look like a resort. It's more like if a roadside hotel, and condo development from the 80's butted heads, but overall the grounds were well kept, and plenty of staff and security were on duty. Now I work in a hotel as a manager so my family can get a little restless with all the criticizing I do when we travel, but heres the good and the bad: Once I had got settled in we needed to go down to finish checking in the other two rooms our family would have as well. When we got to the front desk there was only about 5 people in front of us but it took almost 30 minutes to finally get to the desk. In their defence it was a very busy weekend. Once we finally got an issue with the reservations figured out (families fault not theirs) we decided to go back and get ready to plan the rest of the night before we went to Disney the next day. The rooms were a very good size and overall the cleanliness was pretty good. No hairs in the bathroom ( a pet peave of mine), no grime or gunk in random places, and clean sheets. The only issue with the room itself was that it could use a fresh coat of paint and to have the carpets cleaned. Really though, it wasn't that bad considering the traffic that goes through that place, probably running an 80-90% occupancy most of the year. Another thing that bothered me is that they have a Tiki Bar by the pool that closed at 5pm, and then you had to go inside the main building to the bar. Not that big of a hassle but when you have a nice bar right there by the pool, it doesn't make much sence to close it down right when people would like to wined down and relax by the pool, especially since the weather was so beautiful. Hoping it was just a seasonal thing. Great staff. Every person I encountered was very friendly and seemed to enjoy working there which is a great thing to see. There are two very large pools and both well kept so even though it was busy, it wasn't crowded at all. As I said in the title, the location can't get much better for the price. Literally maybe a 10 minute drive to the park and the majority of that time is spent actually driving into the park. In the main building is the bar, a shop, and even an arcade which was fun to enjoy with the kids to pass some time that night. People now a days need to understand that places go through normal wear and tear, and things break even if there is a ton of prevenitive maintenance. I myself found this place to be quite nice for the age of the building, and other than some carpet/furniture cleaning and painting, it's pretty well kept. If you go to Disney and are only paying 50-80 a night, you shouldn't be a person that expects the world. Compared to the hotels I've worked/stayed at, this place does a wonderful job for the rates they charge. If you want fluffed pillows, a sauna, and gold coming out of your faucets, this isn't the place for you. If you want a place to relax, have a soda and a pizza before and after a long day/weekend at the parks then this is the place for you. This isn't for picky people that complain about not getting more than one shampoo, or complain about the walking distance from the room to the main build

Reviews.Title: “Family Values”
Reviews.Author: TomandSian
Reviews.Content: This is a good $50 Motel. Nice pool area, but it is open until midnight. Families might appreciate a quieter room away from the pool. Professional and courteous staff, average breakfast, good location for restaurants etc

Reviews.Title: “My fav hotel”
Reviews.Author: cvalentin21
Reviews.Content: I Love the seralago hotel stood in 01/2009, 03/2010 and going back in 2011. It is comfortable,clean, has a great pool, and a great breakfast buffet. p.s. Chino does great tatoos across the street at the flea market

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, great staff”
Reviews.Author: katfowler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed here and appreciate the value. A small problem at check-in was quickly fixed by Rick. All staff are very polite and accommodating. We did the meal plan that included breakfast. We were told that the buffet wasn't available during off season so ordered off the menu which is very sparse. I found the food quite tasteless this time. Even the buffet on the weekend was bland. I was dissappointed in the lack of healthy choices. Everything is high fat and sugar. They ran out of peanut butter, sugar-free syrup and bananas. Didn't seem very organized but the wait staff was very helpful. We really enjoyed Diana in the morning - she always had a smile for all. The shuttles to the attractions is one of the reasons we stay here and we found the times they ran worked well for us. The option of the transit bus from the parks filled in when we needed it. Our room was worn but clean and we noticed alot of repairs needed around the property. One ice machine was still broken from 2009. All in all, it's good value and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “WE HAD A LOVELY 3 WEEKS STAY.”
Reviews.Author: gillyjoce
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 3 weeks stay at this hotel. The handicapped room only had a full size bed in it, within 30 minutes, the manager, Brody, arranged for it to be swopped for a king size. (There were no other handicapped rooms available). We did not eat in the hotel. but found the bar prices very reasonable. After reading some of the other comments, we wondered if we were in the same hotel. All the staff were very friendly. The room, pools,laundry and outside areas, were all clean and tidy. I agree the bed was sprigy, but you can't please everyone. If you can walk. you can get into Old Town, in 10 minutes. and over hwy 192 there is plenty of places to eat. we will be staying at the Seralago next time we are in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Close to park, inexpensive, but poor service and cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: digitalhermit
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 622 of the Seralago this past Halloween weekend. We have stayed there twice previously. The hotel is very close to the Disney parks, and is a Disney themed hotel (though not an official Disney resort). The hotel itself pops up first on many of the travel sites because of its location and price, which are its main features. The Seralago is located just off Osceola Pkwy and just a few minutes from the attractions. There is adequate parking, a swimming pool, complementary breakfast, and a once-a-day shuttle to the parks. Most of the rooms have a microwave oven and a refridgerator. A coffee service was missing, however. Per night price was under $50, which is perfect for value-oriented customers. Also note that there are no elevators so guests who require them will be placed on the first floor. Unfortunately, after a couple bad experiences I won't be staying at the Seralago any more. We stayed there earlier this year. Our room key didn't work. This in itself is no big deal as equipment does break. The problem was the response of the staff. We waited almost an hour while they contacted security, had security determine that "Yes, the lock is bad," then another 15 minutes while they fixed the lock. They didn't even offer another room. They didn't even apologize. Not even a single "I'm sorry this happened." On this last visit checkin and key worked fine. It was late so we went to sleep quite early. The next morning I noticed the filthiness of the bathroom. There was large areas of black mildew around the base of the toilet bowl. There was even hair caught up in it. As I didn't notice it previously I didn't expect the hotel staff to offer a discount on my next stay or something like that. But I did expect that they'd at least fill out a complaint form or make it appear that they were concerned about the room quality. Alas, no.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, alirght rooms. Good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: amberlpatrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Seralago for our last trip to disney. My main goal was to find something close to the Disney parks, rather inexpensive, and NOT gross or in a bad area. I was happy with the pools, playground, bar & food, location (right next to what was basically like our countyfair), and price. The refridgerator in our room wasnt up to my standards, but overall I was pleased. The pools were graet sizes, but the toddler pool reaked of chlorine & almost smelled like straight bleach. Id imagine it is because the little ones might pee in it, but I didnt even want to put my son in it. Good value for the money overall.

Reviews.Title: “nice headquarter for trips to the nearby parks (Disney in our case)”
Reviews.Author: baslau
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place that was not too far from Disney, reasonably priced and most important without cockroaches (as many lowerpriced motels are full of these little friends according to reviews on Tripadvisor). What we found was a very friendly lady at the desk when we checked in around 10pm, a clean room with a very comfortable bed, a nice pool and little supermarket that fullfilled all our modest needs. We experienced this motel as the ideal place from where we could spend 2 days in Disneyworld's parks, as we really didn't need more than this the little time we spent awake there. The only minor discomforts were that some water was lying on the bathroomfloor without having used it and the actual on/off button of the television broken but using a pen to push it worked just fine, that's it.

Reviews.Title: “not to shabby”
Reviews.Author: debi647
Reviews.Content: I was concerned after reading some of the awful reviews here, but was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The cons: The rooms are "well worn" and poorly lit (several of the bulbs were burnt out) Pillows old and "lumpy" There was not enough electrical sockets, for example, there was a great size desk, but no place to plug in the laptop, so I ended up sitting in front of the fridge working off that counter. Hair dryer did not work The pros: For the money it was a good place to stay. We were staying at the Rosen Inn in orlando for a few nights before moving, and while the Rosen Inn got great reviews, it wasn't all that much better then the Seralago for the $$ The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful Its in a great location, plenty of places to eat, and next to Old Town Filled with families, and not over crowded at the same time Pool was clean (but a little cold lol) Laundry room was easy to get too, clean Micro and fridge worked loved the dinning area in the lobby, for quick and easy snacks Our room attendant was pleasant,and did a good job keeping the room tidy and clean plenty of towels (Rosen Inn fell short in the towel department lol) So all in all the benefits far out weigh the negatives for me, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “if you are on a budget, stay here”
Reviews.Author: missy_fufu
Reviews.Content: amazing value for money, all clean and nice room. Used the hotel to fill a night between a Universal resort and Disney resort after and was nothing short of impressed for the money I paid. Both resorts had 4-5 stars and where NOT as clean!!!! Stayed the 4 years ago and only have great experiences. Ask for a more quiet room in the 900's section. Tip: take the shortcut into Disney Animal Kingdom on Sherbert road, off 192.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: rafacuba
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is not a hotel, it is and looks like a cheap 2 or 1 star motel. It is not a 3 stars either, that's the biggest lie out there. I believe the star rating should be given not only for the amount of amenities offered, but also for the quality of the service and rooms. This is an old motel and the quality of the rooms/services leaves much to be desired. You also need to use your car to go to the reception or the restaurant, since this motel is huge, like one of those big housing projects, and distances, depending on the location of your building, can be long. This was may experience: The first night we had to wait for more than 20 minutes in line to chek in (it's a cheap hotel so it was busy and there were only two employees). The first room they gave us smelled like cigarrettes and since we don't smoke we went back to change it. The second room smelled like something was burning in the bathroom so I went back again to get a new one. The third one they gave me is what they call a "suite". This one has a bunk bed and a king size bed. The king bed had several dead bugs on the bed's sheets, and the air conditioner made such a horrible noise that we had to turn it off; but we were so tired by then that we decided not to go back to the reception. The following day they moved us to a new room (thank God!) and this time the room was clean and smelled clean, as it should be. The problem arouse the next morning, when at exactly 7:00 o'clock in the morning a Chlorine Truck (one of those used to clean swimming pools) started to make a strong noise that lasted for more than 40 minutes. When I called the reception to complain about the noise so early in the morning, someone called Kevin told me that the truck came to make a delivery and there was nothing they could do to stop the noise. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant only once. It was OK, but beware of the cheap price, it was $7.00 per person, but when you add the beverages it can become expensive. The orange juice, for instance, cost $2.99 and it tastes like synthetic car oil. We found a cheaper and better quality breakfast in a restaurant across from the hotel. I would not recommend this motel to my enemies, but if you are on a tight budget and don't care about sleeping in run down rooms and old, bad quality mattresses, this might be for you. My only recommendation to the companies offering this hotel is to change the star rating: this is 1 or 2 star, not a three star. On my part, I will never use Hotwire again, they say the only offer brand quality hotels and booked me in this unknown cheap motel.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay so far.”
Reviews.Author: hferguson710
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times. As a smoker, I usually opt for a smoking room. Their smoking rooms are way in the back of the hotel, very run down as is the case with most hotels and the beds are horrible, but they're clean and bug free so that's usually fine for me. This time we opted for a non smoking room. Man, what a difference! The furniture was nicer, the beds were super comfortable, over all it was just better. As usual, it was clean, the service was great. The cable was out on saturday morning, but I don't go on vacation to watch TV. My only complaint is about their shuttle to Universal. While it's great that they've added the new service, I was sorry I opted to take it. The seralago probably has very little control over the shuttle once it leaves the property. It picked us up at 8:45 right on time. The driver was a miserable woman who argued with the disabled elderly woman who was going to Seaworld. Tacky. It seemed like it might have been her first day driving a bus, because she almost hit a few cars. When we finally arrived at Universal AN HOUR AND A HALF LATER, I had had it. How does it take an hour and a half to get from the Seralago to Universal?? I have made the drive many times and I know it only takes 20 minutes tops with traffic. I asked her where we meet the shuttle home, (being my first time taking it) and the driver looked at me like I was crazy for asking her such a ridiculous question and yelled, RIGHT HERE! The ride home was better, different driver, not much faster though. I only took the shuttle to save $20 on parking, but I think next time I'll just pay.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: wdolphin
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this Hotel for 3 years now. I have refered lots of people tothis hotel. For the price and location you can't beat it. We went for Girls Weekend Getaway September 17 and 18th we had a blast and it was the first time I stayed in a suite. Very nice for the money we paid for it. They always email me I have them on facebook so they let me know about all the promotions going on. Now they hav shuttles to universal. Which is great because that is the only time we didnt stay there is when we would g to universal. Now we have no excuse. This is really a nice,clean fun place to stay with kids or getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Seralago- cheap but grungy”
Reviews.Author: fast72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Seralago Sept 16-22. Our room was on the corner so it was pretty quiet. Our bedding had holes in it. The carpet was very stained and the room smelled like mildew. Our TV didn't work much and when I looked behind the dresser that it was on, there was old stained boxers behind it! Our wall above the mirror also leaked water which may have contributed to the bad smell of the room. There are two nice pools with hot tubs. The pools were open till midnight which was nice, however, it looked like they weren't cleaned too often since there were a bunch of dead bugs floating in the water as well as garbage on occasion. It was nice to be able to park your car in front of the hotel room. This resort was somewhat close to Disney World but I would not want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse ever!!”
Reviews.Author: deniseiowa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here when it was a Holiday Inn, and it was great,about 15 yrs. ago, so I thought we would try it again!! OMG!!!! It's all I could do is to spend the entire night here!!! Yuck, how disgusting!!! The pool and whirpool, is all this hotel has going for it!! The rooms were old and very smelly and disgusting!! There was a huge gap underneath the door, so bugs and whatever else couldget in!! This totally turned my family around searching for hotels anywhere. I always look at all of the reviews now. We travel several times a yr. I should have really asked for my money back, it was that bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel for a good price...”
Reviews.Author: Cshellz2010
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel for a good price . Excellent breakfast and a verY helpful staff at front desk esp. Rosie.... Overall a good 11 night stay with everything one needs for a vacation in Orlando visiting theme parks during the day and returning to a comfortable bed .

Reviews.Title: “Slightly less than average stay not far from Disney”
Reviews.Author: RoninOtter
Reviews.Content: There's nothing special about the suites here. They're average for Route 192 lodging near Disney. The rooms are on the run-down side, and our suite's door opening to the outside wasn't very secure (the security lock was loose, and the door was difficult to open and close.) On the other hand, it wasn't very expensive, and we didn't have any serious problems while staying there. The location for the price is the real selling point.

Reviews.Title: “it's friendly, fun, and a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: carolynmayo
Reviews.Content: Seralago has wonderfully friendly and knowledgeable personnel. The 2 HUGE swimming pools are always clean as are the beautiful grounds that surround them. The buffet breakfast in their restaurant is wonderful and the staff in the restaurant is efficient and VERY friendly...and there're many food options as well as ordering from their menu. The grounds are always very clean and beautiful. The location is great with their shuttle to Disney as well as other attractions...and right next to 'Old Town' amusement/shops/games park. There are tons of good restaurants within walking distance. It's an amazing location...and it's a 'Disney Good Neighbor Hotel' which means it has special arrangements with Disney...such as acquiriing tickets, etc. there...also arrangements can be made for other parks, shows, etc. there....It's a WONDERFUL HOTEL and the prices are amazingly reasonable....with lots of specials for all groups of people all year....Seniors...Returning Military...Birthday and Reunion Groups...Florida Residents...AARP...AAA, etc., etc. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, cant wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: shazwott13
Reviews.Content: I took my foster children, ages 11 and 13 to Orlando for their first ever "real" vacation. I have a close friend who lives in Orlando, and he said that this area of town is not a bad part of town and would be safe for a single mom with kids. I chose the hotel because as a foster parent I am required to have seperate beds and a seperate sleeping area for the children, and this was a very afordable way to do that. I was very happy with what we got for the price we paid. It wasn't a 4 star hotel, but how could you really expect it to be when you get so much for so little? I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Second time a Charm”
Reviews.Author: mharris2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seralago once before wasn't good, but i gave them a second chance to make it right. I was very pleased, the suite that me and my family was in was wonderful. It have enough space for everyone to sleep comfortable for 5 adults and 4 kids. We enjoyed our stay, and is very glad we gave seralago a 2nd try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for kids, but don't think this is a "resort".”
Reviews.Author: BikiniWearingMama
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with this in mind: "We just need a place to sleep and shower, with some activites for the kids." This is exactly what we got. We had a kids suite- One large room with a section divided off for the kids. This gave the kids and my husband and I plenty of our own space. Beds, Beds, Beds definitly NEED replacing! Very "springy". Although my husband and I really are not too picky. This fact didn't ruin our vacation. Some of the staff were VERY accommodating. (Rosie at the check-in desk was very helpful). Girls are the "attaction" desk want to sell you tickets to the parks for cheap if you take a timeshare tour across the street. This WILL TAKE 3+ HOURS of your morning, but you could save alot of money. Be prepared to stand your ground if you don't want to buy into a timeshare and you just want your cheaper tickets. Rooms were very clean. Our maid, Rosa, did a wonderful job. Kids loved the swans she made out of towels. We NEVER felt unsafe staying here. We saw security checking the grounds even in the wee hours of the morning. Parking is free. We drove from Michigan and never used their shuttle service. Be careful because the shuttle service is only for Disney Parks....NOT Universal Studios Parks. We stayed at our hotel only one day to "relax". Pools were clean. NO Lifeguards. Kids had a great time in the pools. There is an arcade and a club house for movie watching, but these are things that you can do at home so we didn't stay indoors alot. We never ate at the breakfast buffet....didn't look to pleasing. Although (2) kids, 10 and under eat free with a paying adult. We went out to eat breakfast at the IHOP instead. There is a mini carnival next door to the hotel. Bumper cars, ferris wheel, go-karts, etc. This hotel is close to all the main attactions in Orlando. I would recommend this hotel only if you don't plan on being here all day, every day. If you are looking for a clean, cheap hotel that is kid friendly this is definitely the place for you. Can't bet the price....we paid $60 per night (summer special) and had a wonderful, unforgetable experenice with our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: MamaJojo123
Reviews.Content: As a family, we've been to Orlando a number of times in the past few years. We always stay at a Disney World resort for the majority of our time in Orlando, but often will stay at a local hotel/motel in Orlando on the day of arrival to Orlando. I was drawn to the Seralago by the colourful and enticing advertisements, as well as the seemingly reasonable rate. The hotel was offering the breakfast buffet at a "discounted" price if it was purchased in advance, so I went ahead and made the necessary arrangements and payments. Once we arrived to the hotel and checked in (we had a rental car, and parking was included onsite, so that was a plus) we were given a ground level room facing the pool. As soon as the door of the room opened, we were hit with a strong musty smell. The room was dark and dingy, and you couldn't exactly leave the door open or open a window. Upon further inspection, the bathroom area was old, cracked floor tiles as was the counter by the sink. It was not dirty - we would not have stayed if it was - but just very worn and old. We opted to just sleep there - we had already paid in advance, and we did not want to go searching at that point. We changed into our bathing suits and hit the pool - which was in my opinion, the best part of this sad hotel. In the morning, the went to our breakfast buffett. It had to be one of the worst buffets I have ever eaten at. The hot food was cold, the rolls and danishes looked and tasted as though they had been sitting out for a day (or possibly more) and the fruit literally tasted rotten. When you consider that there are dozens of restaurants in that strip where you can buy breakfast for a very low price, the offering at this hotel was just horrible. We will not be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: lynne19523
Reviews.Content: Had a great 5 night stay with my adult son. Read the reviews before we left and thought we would take a chance as the nightly rate was so low and we would be spending lot of time at Disney. The room was clean, staff was friendly and vey well located close to red lobster Pizza Hut ect. The shuttle was great but we found we could go back and forth to Disney on the city bus for $2 and it ran every half hour. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: beamrr
Reviews.Content: This was the WORST vacation ever!! First of all, the 2-bedroom suite is very misleading. It is actually a one bedroom with two beds, and the supposed second room is a bed that pulls out of the wall in between the kitchen and living room. The staff is very unprofessional, they threw out personal belongings before checkout. The onsite manager showed no concern and was very rude. The food in the cafe is awful, including the warm juice that is served. The pools are not only pumped with tons of chlorine but with sand as if they're trying to make them a beach. The poor kids eyes were so red that they didn't want to get back in. I will be back to Orlando next year to make up for this trip, but I definitely will NOT go near or even consider the Seralago. The fitness center is a JOKE!...a bike and a treadmill.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: SupKem
Reviews.Content: As if you could ever run out of things to do in Orlando. But if you need to take a laundry day this is the place to be. The pools here are big and open till midnight, there is a hot tub, a store with a grill. an arcade, a chapel, a movie room and it's all just ten minutes from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “nice comfy place”
Reviews.Author: YLMIndia
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this place just for staying over in the nights when your mornings are spent visiting Disneyland ...! no complaints

Reviews.Title: “I have to say this - we arrived at 10pm...”
Reviews.Author: PansieFL
Reviews.Content: I have to say this - we arrived at 10pm, checked out by 7:30 an I regretted every minute spent there. The air conditioning unit was so old and loud, we had two choices - on or sweat to death - so the room was sub zero. It smelled, was dirty and I agree with other reviewers on this...my family felt unsafe. Got up in the morning and we were going to grab a shower quickly - the bathtub and shower curtain had mildew all over it. That was it for us, we filed a complaint, got the so what attitude and left as quick as we could - do not spend your money here, just for health reasons don't!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Impressed with this Resort on a budget”
Reviews.Author: 4realguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for two nights before we were to check in at our resort. This is a very nice place for the price. It is like a resort itself. I am told that it is an older Sheraton or Holiday Inn resort. It is definately better than any hotel in the area. The 2 pools are heated very large. The hot tubs were very hot. It is a good place to come to after leaving the parks or before going to the parks. The rooms are bigger than average with fridge and microwave. It is close to everything and I would recommend it if you are not TOO picky. It is not a luxury resort, but a resort on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Asked for a Better Hotel or Trip!”
Reviews.Author: EllingsworthFamily
Reviews.Content: From the Reservation to the Check out the Hotel was more than fabulous! We arrived a few hours before check in and they were so great! we went to a nearby restaurant and eat lunch ( there are lots of yummy inexpensive place nearby to eat) before we had even finished out meal the front desk had called and told us our room was ready! The room was clean and comfortable! The Pool and Hot Tub were fantastic! The Store and restaurant were great, the staff was so helpful, they really couldn't do enough for us! It was my birthday so we had the birthday package, a great gift bag, cake and breakfast were a real treat!!! The Staff even helped my Husband surprise me with my new diamond ring!!! What ever we asked for they were more than accommodating. The first night the bed was uncomfortable and all we had to do was call and they brought us a new mattress! The Cleaning staff were so professional, I had gotten sick and they were right there to clean up for me.. BEST HOTEL VALUE IN ORLANDO!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: tllambert9
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I booked two nights in this hotel. I was very disappointed when I got there (which is why I'm writing this review). The first thing my children said when I opened the door was the the room smelled. There was a horrible odor of cigarettes in the room. The room needed updating desparately. I always judge a hotel room by the bathroom, which was in desperate need of a good cleaning and an upgrade. I had to keep reminding myslef that it was very inexpensive. After this trip, I decided that I will never again go the "cheap" route again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: beckygary
Reviews.Content: We loved this place so much we stayed 2 extra nights. Our room was clean. The beds were nice to sleep in.our room was facing the parking lot and it wasnt noisy. you couldnt hear your neighbors at all. The pools were nice so warm just like bath water. we didnt want to leave the hotel just being in the room and pool was nice specially after going to theme park for the day it was nice to come back and relax.. tv had a few good channels not to many to choose from.We was in second building close to the back and our internet was good. We had fun in the little game room. We ate breakfast buffet one morning it was good and fresh. The cafe hamburgers was good. The pizza was very good to.I have nothing bad to say about this hotel we had a fun time and enjoyed ourselfs very much. My husband step on a gecko one morning in our room he just picked it up and put it back outside they are out side in bushes. We had to have seen around 20 of them just walking around the side walks.I dont believe any of the negatives here cause our experience was the best one. Thank you very much seralago.. Cant wait to come back ..

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money-no privacy though if you have children”
Reviews.Author: blessedlife
Reviews.Content: If your staying for a couple of days or don't have any children, this hotel is for you. Clean basic room with 2 double beds. Small refigerator and low wattage microwave. Internet access was limited in the back where we were. Was fine in the lobby or in the laundry room-free of charge if you bring your laptop. Make sure you're close to the lobby if you need internet access. Small game room and grocery and cafeteria. Food was overpriced but what you would expect from a tourist location. Remember KFC, Denneys, McDonalds, Burger King and Checkers are all in walking distance. Also the fun of Old Town. Can do laundry for 5.00 per load. Great location. The only downside is if you're with your family your child is right next to you in the bed, no privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for your buck!! Excellent service/Great Price - DON'T LISTEN TO THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS”
Reviews.Author: Mercyme017
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel after lengthy research. We rented two rooms and were able to be right next to each other. They were very professional and the breakfast buffet was very good for the price. In the restuarant is were we met "Sam". He was such a great waiter we requested him every day of our stay. He was friendly, accommodating, and really made us feel welcomed. We really only used the room for sleeping so really weren't that upset that the rooms weren't that impressive. We were close to all the attractions we wanted to attend and the pool being open til midnight was great. Our kids had a great time in the arcade and the lobby was very well organized and neat. I would highly recommend this hotel. Again, the rooms aren't the most modern, but if you are on vacation, you shouldn't be spending so much time in the room anyway.... :-) We loved it and would go back to this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and close To Everything-Take it for what its worth”
Reviews.Author: slipperyice
Reviews.Content: We're a family of 4, 2 young girls age 3 and 9, we stayed 5 nights at Seralago Inn and Suites. The first night was in one of the "out" buildings, very small. After that we upgraded to a suite, for 10 bucks a night just spend the extra and get a bigger room that opens up to the pool. The staff are mostly friendly, although the security guard seems to have a Barney Fife attitude and can be a little annoying. The location and cost are enough to make me go back. I don't go to Florida to stare at the hotel walls and decide its no fun here because it needs remodeling. If you want a Hilton go to a Hilton otherwise realize what your paying for and don't bother whining. Its a cheap hotel close to everything.......... Old Town is next door, restaurants as far as the eye can see and only 10 minutes to Disney or Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “what is the truth about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: elizkris52
Reviews.Content: oh please - how confusing are these reviews they are either really really great or really really terrible. Am heading there Aug and am terrified it will be as bad as some are saying. In reality when we arrive we will have been travelling from ireland to Chicago then after few hours waiting off to orlando - we will be "on the road" so to speak, for 23 hours - all we will be wanting at that point is a clean room - a good nights sleep and off to enjoy all the attractions - we don't expect to be staying in the room (except for sleeping) but we do need it to be clean at least. Is there anyone out there who can tell the real truth about the place? 'druggies etc etc that's a really scary review - does the hotel not respond to these reviews? HELP

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Rip-Off EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: jesuss1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply put a "dumping ground". The rooms are small, dirty, smelly and poorly maintained. We had to upgrade to a suite and paid extra $$$. I firmly believe this is a hoax they give you the disgusting rooms so you have no other choice but to upgrade and pay them extra. The have no computers for their guests to use as a courtesy. You have to pay a $1.00 for 4 mins. to use the internet; in addition a $1.00 per pages printed. Staff was not very helpful neither did they speak much English. The bath tub was clogged and backed-up every time we took a shower in the UPGRADED suite. The class of people staying there is to say the least not family oriented. Drunks, druggies, nasty and scary. We felt like we were in the ghettos. Do not go there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Place is a dump, management incompetent and rude”
Reviews.Author: chard13
Reviews.Content: Had the worst experience ever at this hotel. When making the reservation we told them we were bringing a pet. Was quoted a price and was told it included the pet fee. No mention of additional fees at time of check in. Checked into our room and wanted to wash up but no soap anywhere. Stayed in room for about 3 hours before going out for groceries and dinner. Upon returning we found we were locked out of our room. Had to trek down to the lobby only to have to wait in a line to speak to someone. They told us they locked us out because we did not pay the pet fee. This was their error but instead of apologizing for their mistake all we got was an argument like it was our fault. I have never dealt with such incompetence and rudeness. The night manager said he left a message on our phone regarding this issue. We saw the light blinking on the phone and called the front desk on two occasions and told them when we tried to retrieve messages it said there were no messages but the light continued to blink. At no time did they tell us there was any problems with the bill. They also had our debit card on file so they could have just added the fee, Instead we were locked out of our room for about 45 minutes with groceries that need refrigeration and out take-out dinner getting cold. Place is pretty rundown and dumpy, don't really see value here because your not getting any thing of quality (either room or service) would recommend spending a little more money to stay at one of the many Disney Value resort hotels within Disney , at least then you would be dealing with a class act.

Reviews.Title: “Place is a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: scdude69
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay for a surprise trip to Disney World. Found the place online and saw a lot of good reviews. I have to ask what were those people thinking? Seralago is a straight up dump. Would never stay there again. Rooms are nasty. Heck we even had an old bar of soap at the sink. Dont trust the good reviews. If you do you will get burned.

Reviews.Title: “Won't find better value for what you get in return”
Reviews.Author: Nightowl50
Reviews.Content: OK, first let me say that this is NOT a luxury resort. If that's what you're looking for, you'll need to pass on the Seralago. But, for someone like me, traveling with three young children and on a budget, it doesn't get any better. I was able to get a room with a king bed for myself, and a separate "sleeping area" for my kids at a VERY affordable price, and the kids loved it. The pool area was HUGE, and very well-kept. I sat under a nice covered awning at the outdoor bar and enjoyed a couple of cocktails in the shade right next to the pool while my kids swam for hours. We had dinner in the great market/food court, and it was very affordable and actually pretty tasty for a snack bar. The breakfast buffet was much more than I expected, and two of my kids ate free, which was an added bonus. The kids also enjoyed the arcade, although some of the games were out of order and the others were a bit pricey compared to other hotel arcades we've been to. The location was fantastic, although we were not there for Disney this time, and getting in and out of the hotel was a breeze. The kids loved having their own space and TV, and having the microwave/fridge in the room was a nice extra as well. As far as comfort, the rooms were typical of an older motel, a bit dated, but clean. The king bed was a bit worn and "springy", but served it's purpose. We were fortunate to get a first floor room, right by the pool, which was great, but we were also close to the lobby, so the foot traffice by the room was a little noisy. And, while the kids enjoyed it, the pool being open until midnight was a bit much from a noise standpoint. My only complaints were that there was no DVD player in the KidSuite, which most other similar types of accommodations have, and the selection of X-Box games at the front desk were limited. The television lineup was limited (no Cartoon Network?), but again, I'm sure many don't come to Orlando to watch TV, so not a big deal. And, as typical of most resort hotels, there was a hotel "concierge" in the lobby that actually was a timeshare salesman, so getting information meant having to dodge a persistent badgering of trying to get me and my kids to take a tour at one of their properties. A question of directions was answered by a single-word answer, followed by a sales pitch that I repeatedly said NO to. Didn't like that at all. Again, if you're in town to experience the whole "Disney" thing and are looking for total pampering, this isn't the place for you. But if you are looking for somewhere that's clean, affordable, and has enough amenities to keep the kids happy, then give this place a try. We'll definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly very front - Great value for your$$$”
Reviews.Author: Concierge4You
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I took my 6 year old boy and spent a week there. Very friendly front desk and very helpful. The night audit was a little bit rude. The hotel has a great location, close to Walmart and lots of dining options. Forget about the hotel's food, not that great. The hotels room are very nice and clean. I only found a roach on the last day of my stay, I was not very mad as I am familiar with Florida in the summer, but still was not a great thing. The Disney shuttle was great but the pick up was always late. I highly recommend staying at this hotel if you are looking for value and on a budget. I recommended this hotel already to my clients and they loved it.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont stay here you are so missing out on excellence!”
Reviews.Author: michellesantana
Reviews.Content: The service was completely excellent! My son and I arrived early they allowed us to check in and even though they didnt have my "envelope" they went to get it and gave my son tokens to play games. The room was very comfy. I enjoyed the feel of the room. The location was excellent! Very convient. The staff was all great and very helpful. I have No complaints. My son informed me as we were leaving that he wants to come back. So we will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for Your Bucks”
Reviews.Author: toohotofachick
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have been on their Facebook page and talking with the Sales Manager thats whom does it And she promised us things would be done and she did just that. She delievered it all. From Housekeeping, To everyone it was a pleaseure and they will greet you at every time they can.Had issues with connecting doors but enegerneering showed up not even 5 m inutes from being called. Food courts were awsome and tallanted. Its a good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deanna94
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time, Front desk was fantastic and very friendly... Made us feel at home... Will be back for more fun...

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: srgill
Reviews.Content: We stay every year for 4-6 weeks.It is an older hotel but very clean and comfortable.It is close to everything.Great amenities like pools and hot tubs.The staff is great and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Seralago - Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: april231979
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say how GREAT of a time we had in Orlando! The hotel was fantastic - the staff was friendly, thorough, and always helpful with a smile! The free shuttle to Disney was so convenient and everything else was so close by! The kids really enjoyed the pool - we made good use of it during our week there! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “was great”
Reviews.Author: bonesnreb
Reviews.Content: hotel was great.. hot tub broke a few times but was quickly fixed.. beds werent all that comfy but it worked. value was the tip top best n if u needed something they were quick to get it to u.. will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price....”
Reviews.Author: jtaylor824
Reviews.Content: We looked at several hotels (along with the reviews for each) before deciding on the Seralago. Got a great summer sale rate, around $40 per night, and overall the stay here was not bad. Room needed some updating but was clean. Pool area was very nice. Staff was helpful & friendly. Location was great. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: vpoore
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only okay, nothing great, but we didn't need great, just a place to sleep. The pool and hot tub were very nice and clean. Our room was old and used, but it was clean. Good thing it had two double beds in it, because one of them was hard as a rock and we couldn't sleep in it. The lobby looked nice, but the breakfast buffet in the restaurant was a rip off. The food was only warm, not much variety. Only good thing about it is the waitress gave us two large "to go" cups of coffee. Shuttle to Disney worked out well, though the times to get back to the hotel were 4 1/2 hours apart, 5 or 9:30 (or later) pm. We found ourselves exhausted and having to hang around for a few hours when we were clearly "done" with the park. If you stay here, you may want to consider taking the 2nd shuttle into the park (like 10 am) and staying late.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at Seralago!”
Reviews.Author: stacy347
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a week long stay at Seralago and we already miss it so much! This was our first time staying off-property while on a Disney vacation and I can honestly say, I don't feel like we missed a thing! The staff was great, the pool was sparkling clean and the perfect temperature, the rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable ~ we will definitely be back as soon as possible!! The only thing I do have to caution about is the shuttle service ~ be to the lots at least 10 minutes before the time they give you as we found that the drivers will leave a bit earlier than the schedule says and we had to grab a taxi one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: gianj856
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seralago May 4 -11 and had a wonderful visit. The room was nice, the furniture had some nicks but was maintained and dust free. The shower had wonderful water pressure, toiletries and towels were replenished every day. The maid service was excellent altough our room was on the late list for cleaning but that was ok. The pools were fabulous and not overcrowded. One day there were no pool towels so we let the front desk now. The pool had towels within 10 minutes. The front desk was helpful with directions or suggestions and they were willing and capable of checking me and a friend from Wisconson in for two different flights, including printing out the boarding passes. The location is convenient to everything from Disney to Walmart.

Reviews.Title: “THE GREATEST HOTEL YET”
Reviews.Author: codskynwill
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that if you want to stay in a hotel and enjoy the area and the activites in the Kissimmee Florida area you need to stay at the SERALAGO HOTEL AND SUITES, This place is a great place to stay with your family. The rooms are VERY roomy and you have enough room to move around the room and not have to worry about bumping into each other... They have a kitchen area in the room which is really great and a fridge and microwave for your convenience. The pool was big enough where you werent crowded, and you didnt even have to worry about having a towel they had a cabinet FULL of towels. They even had an exercise room that you could visit if you wanted a good workout and what really topped this HOTEL off was that they had a LAUNDRY ROOM where you could wash your clothes and not go home with dirty clothes.. Now that was just GREAT to have... My kids had FUN during our stay, heck they didnt even want to leave to go to disney world because they wanted to stay and swim the whole time we were there... THANKS SERALAGO FOR THE GREAT HOTEL AND FOR THE GREAT OPPORTUNITY... SEE YOU IN THE FALL.....

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was old, dirty and nasty; demolition is the only solution.”
Reviews.Author: redducati42
Reviews.Content: I was taking my kids to Blizzard Beach and all the Disney hotel were full. Usually I stay at the lower priced All Star Resort hotels at Disney. I didn't expect much for the $50 price of the room, but when I arrived at this hotel property, all I could think was horror in my decision. I looked at the photos and reviews on expedia and they were all misleading. The Seralago is a very old, dirty, nasty HoJo type motel that could NEVER be cleaned to look like the photos I saw. As far as competing hotels, it is a NO BRAINER to spend another $20 to $40 a night for a clean, nice hotel. If I was trying to save the extra money and couldn't afford it, I would stay home and not go.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on clean, simple stay”
Reviews.Author: jsdive
Reviews.Content: This was once a fabulous resort. that was many years ago. Times have changed as have styles. However, even so this represents a great stay. It's very reasonably priced. Spotlessly clean. And the tile, paint, fixtures are all in very good condition. It's in a very good location not far from the entrance to DisneyWorld. If you want a simple, clean stay be sure to check this out.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but Horrible”
Reviews.Author: sam1993
Reviews.Content: the main enterance and the lobby was amazing, ubt the room was horrible!!! we called for the housekeeping to get us pillows and they said ok but when the guy came in he was like it's not guranteed to get more than one pillow... we had to wait for an hour to get a 1914 crib for the baby that kept crying forever!!! I don't recommend it to anyone who wants comfort but if for cheapness sure!!! Also, the pillow's smell was awefull we put towels not to smell the bad odor...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for family time!”
Reviews.Author: NDametto
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised how much we enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean and cared for daily; the service we received from the time we arrived to the time we sadly left was wonderful. The pool was excellent and the kids just couldn’t seem to get enough time in it even though it was open from 8am to midnight. The shuttle service to Disney was fabulous and very convenient. The local “City” bus stop was right out front of the hotel, so that made it very easy when you want to work off a different schedule then the shuttle bus or if it rained. The service in the restaurant each morning was great. The staff always made it enjoyable no matter what time we decided to stroll in (7am or 10:30am). Being right next to Old Town was also a bonus, there is so much that you can just walk to, there is never a moment that you have nothing to do unless it is by choice and you just want to kick back and relax by the pool. We could not have asked for a better place to have stayed with the kids. We all enjoyed it very much!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: mybettyboop
Reviews.Content: My husband ,son ,grandson and myself stayed here and there was something for all of us .My grandson turned 10 while we were there .They had a Birthday bag in the room when we arrived and on the day of his birthday the gave him a cake and we all had breakfast on the house it was great they sang Happy Birhtday as well .The resturant was very well priced and very good food .The four of us could eat for less then $ 25. And had enough.The staff was freindly , rooms were very clean and a nice pool . I would go again enjoyed our stay .Also very close to everything you would need for your vacation .

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad value”
Reviews.Author: bandora
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove up to Orlando needing a hotel for a Friday night and having no reservations so we didn't have very high expectations as long as it was cheap there was hot water and no roaches. We drove by the Seralago and it looked ok in the outside, old but well maintained, non pretentious and all the cars are people seen looked like normal budget travelers, not some of the "crowds" we had seen at other hotels we had driven by. We had a coupon and got a discounted room within minutes. The check in staff was efficient and for $35 a night I was shocked that they offered to help with our luggage. The room was basic but decent. Some people would have been horrified at the stain in the carpet but having braced myself for the worst I wasn't bothered by it. The staff was very friendly across the board, everybody said hi as you walked by. The beds were comfortable and the AC worked very well with no smell of mold like at many other area hotels. The hotel is very big and we got a room that didn't have neighbors on either side so we didn't have any noise issues at all. The pool looked nice although I didn't use it. The food court was basic but did offer very good prices and I liked being able to pay the same price I would pay at 7eleven for snacks at their convenience store. The breakfast buffet was a good value but the food was typical low price buffet fare, not very good but edible, the selection was limited but there was enough variety to fill up on. I still would recommend going to Ponderosa or another buffet for breakfast but having it on site proved to be very convenient. Overall I am happy that we lucked out by just driving in and using the discount. It is no luxury hotel but it was a lot more amenities than similar hotels in the area for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay, rooms average at best but good value.”
Reviews.Author: GulfSider
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay for a Disney weekend. The hotel is old and the rooms are hit and miss but they have a good lobby/food area and reasonable pools for the kids. We use this hotel when we go to Disney because we just need a place to sleep and spend a few waking hours over a weekend. If we plan to spend more time in the hotel, we book at something newer and nicer. It is very close to the gates of Disney. We are going back one more time next month.

Reviews.Title: “the stay was pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: Sruti
Reviews.Content: room was clean and noise-free. room service was good. very close to disney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the $”
Reviews.Author: Lookin4RR
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Seralago twice in the past 2 years. This is a older hotel that has nice ammenities for the value. Pros: Price, Kid Friendly Activities, Disney Shuttle Bus, Food Court, Microwave & Refridgerator in room, 2 Pools, Security, & Location. Cons: Water Pressure terrible in rooms and Internet connection very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Forget high speed wireless internet in your room”
Reviews.Author: LoveMySpouse
Reviews.Content: Before I booked online, I made a long distance call to make sure they had the hi speed internet they advertise in the rooms and was told 'oh yes'. We get there and, naturally, we could not get internet in the room. When we called down one person said they would look into it. Called again and was told someone might come up and have a look at the closest router. Still nothing. Called again and was put on hold and left there until the phone hung up. Called back and they said maybe in the next half hour someone might be able to look into it. Nothing ever got done. When we called another time, another person said you can't get it in all the rooms, only some. So to sum up, we never got any free wi-fi the 11 days we were there.
