Check -in and out was friendly, but the people who we called/asked for help with the wi-fi problem were not. The heated pools and hottubs were good and the rooms are average, old furniture but clean, not an issue, lots of families/kids running around although every day we were in the lobby there were people complaining about things/looked unhappy, one group was checking out early, so perhaps there are other issues that we did not come across. The water was sometimes a little bit of an issue, you would go from great hot flow in the shower down to a trickle, literally! We really were hoping to find a new spot that we could visit each year we go down, but unfortunately, when they advertise something they don't have, it leaves a bad taste in your mouth. So basically if you want a hotel with free wi-fi, don't come here unless you want to sit in the hotel lobby which is what we had to do with some work that had to get done.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret & Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: amsPembrokePines_Fl
Reviews.Content: My son who is 7 years old and myself stayed her 4/2/10 through 4/4/10. We really enjoyed our stay here. They have 2 olympic sized heated pools , a childrens pool an inground hot tub, and a very nice colorful playground right next to the pool. There is a lovely bar right at pool side. The Virgin Pina Coladas were one of the best that I have ever had. They have a large game room for the kids, an indoor movie theatre, basketball court, tennis court and volleyball. My son totally enjoyed this resort. Infact he wanted to stay here instead of going to any of the Disney Parks. They have a really nice and inexpensive breakfast buffet with hot and cold food. Kids 10 and under eat free and for adults $6.99. The rooms were clean. In fact I could smell the bleach and disinfectant when I first entered which was a plus. Now the edge of the carpet was a little worn but that did not matter. The beds were very comfortable. The other great thing about the hotel is the location. It is directly next to the Old town amusement and shopping area so you can walk to it and it is only a 10 minute drive to the Disney parks. The service was great. I really enjoyed it and would definitely stay here again. The other nice thing was on Saturday mroning they had an Easter Egg Hunt for the kids and the Easter Bunny also appeared . It was FABULOUS!!! This hotel definitely caters to kids and families. I paid the AAA rate which was about $61.43 per night and in my view I got more than I expected. Finally check in time was at 4pm but they let me check in early at 1pm and were just great about it. The staff really goes out of their way to make the guests happy. I loved this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice Before you Stay. Not good for the bucks!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Do not be deceived! This place is not good for the bucks. Rather this place really sucks. I recently visited this hotel with a school band group from GA. We arrived at 7:00 p.m. on Sunday March 29, 2010. The outside entrance of the Hotel was beautiful. Upon entering you think you are staying in a first rate hotel. After entering the actual hotel room, I was very disappointed. The hotel rooms are outdated. The beds are worn and in need of being updated. The carpet is molded and stained. The bathrooms are old and outdated. The table with chairs have chips around the edges not to mention stains on the seats. To make matters worst there's an odor that cannot be covered with Lysol spray. Rooms are so outdated that some of the outlets did not work and I was not able to charge my cell phone. Do not think of staying at this hotel. Take your $60 and stay in a much nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Checked In and Checked out 5 Minutes Later”
Reviews.Author: WanderingBeen
Reviews.Content: Yuk! The room was musty, the bathroom had mould on the cabinets, and the beds looked as if they were about to collapse. Can’t say much about the rest of the place because the room itself left such a bad impression. Don’t be deceived by the website. This place is old, poorly maintained, and kind of scary.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't laugh you will cry!”
Reviews.Author: fostermomma
Reviews.Content: I am not even sure where to start. We had rented a vacation home but needed a place to stay for one night until we could get into our home. I booked it on line due to the pictures and the price. When we first pulled in it was somewhere around 10:30pm and it was extremely busy and busteling. I wondered if I would regret getting a vacation home and not staying where there was alot going on. There were 3 people in line in front of us and 2 people working. It took 30 minutes to check in. As we drove around to our room I realized I had indeed NOT made a mistake by renting a home. There were buses of kids everywhere running around. The pools were all full of kids yelliing and carrying on. (It was after 11 pm) When we finally found our room in this compound of buildings we had to lug all our stuff upstairs (no elevators). When I opened the room truly all I could do was laugh. It was pitiful. Keep in mind we did not pay 30.00 bucks a night as even that would have been a rip off but 60.00 a night for the worst room I think I have ever stayed in. The beds came to my knees and I am only 4'11"! The carpets were gross, I would not even use the microwave. When my husband and I climbed into the bed it just collapsed in the middle....The springs were poking through and the box spring was broken down. There was hair ALL OVER the tub. And to beat it all was a nice little envelope soliciting tips for the housekeepers. THEY GOT A TIP FROM ME ALRIGHT! If it hadn't been so late with a very sleepy 3 year old I would have left and gotten another room. THe website is extremely decieving unless you are fortunate enough to have the room they updated for the pictures for brochures etc. We ended up running the A/C and the Tv all night to drown out the yelling kids and doors slamming everywhere and then hoped and prayed we did not leave with bed bugs or worse from this dump. WIth the location it has the potential to be great however; it appears they can still make their money and not have to update or fix anything as long as they have the big school groups of kids coming. The one bright spot was maintainance. When the blow dryer basically blew up in my hand when I turned it on, I called the front desk and they were there in about 15 minutes or so to replace it. For 60.00 I was not expecting the Hilton but was expecting a room that had been at least updated in the last 30 years. My room had not been! All I wanted was a comfortable bed and a clean room. Not much to ask for or so I thought!

Reviews.Title: “Best BANG for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: cgonidakis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. Everything was great overall. Some of the down falls were no coffee maker in the room, we were in 3 different rooms and all the beds were older, pillows were not the best, the bar was not open most of the time, you could by beer from their cafe but it was the same price as the bar, restaurant on site was not open most of the time, breakfast was ok, pool was great, laundry service was great! Worth visiting the time share person in the lobby. We saved $160 on 2 universal passes.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: phonicks
Reviews.Content: First, I will tell you what we did not find at this hotel: 1. We did not find any rude staff. 2. We did not find any bugs of any kind. 3. We did not find any unsafe situations. 4. We did not find any trouble connecting to the wireless internet. 5. We did not find anything to complain about. What we found was just a really nice place to stay while we were there to go to the parks with our children. We booked a 2 room suite, poolside, for 5 nights and our entire stay was under $400.00. Our room was spacious, very spacious. Our room very, very clean! Everyday when we came back it was fresh, nice smelling, and clean! I think the housekeeping staff does a wonderful job! The pool area was wonderful. Even though we were there on a cool week, the pool was so warm my kids jumped right in. The entire pool area is gated so small children can not get in unless their parents let them in. The front desk employees were professional, friendly and quick! All the other employess we met (maintenance, housekeeping and security) were constantly present, and very friendly. I certainly did not feel unsafe at any time, as everytime I left my room I seemed to run right into a security person....early in the morning, and late at night. The atmosphere at the hotel was very fun. We met families from all over the United States and several from abroad. Everyone was on vacation, relaxed, and friendly. From the hotel to the parks is a quick and very easy drive. We did not use the shuttle service because we didn't want to be on a timetable. But the times were printed and given to you upon arrival if you wanted to use the shuttles. Overall, I thought it was a great place, an excellent value, a fun atmosphere ...and very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best part of Seralago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brampton1967
Reviews.Content: Humm, what can I say about Seralago Hotel and Suites ? (Glass half full) It's a great location. It has a heated pool. Free wifi in room. (Glass half empty) It's an old and tired Hotel in need of some attention. I'm staying there right now as I write this. The rooms could be MUCH cleaner. When you snap the bed covers you can tell they are dusty and in need of washing. Same goes for the drapery and carpets. The ice machines are filthy. I think the main problem is that this place see's a lot of visitors and the cleaning department is lacking. I won't say its a bad place to stay but I think for a bit more money you could get a much nicer place. On my next vacation to Orlando, I will not stay here again. If your on a budget go for it but if your not, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place For the Money”
Reviews.Author: AGenua
Reviews.Content: Seralago may be an older hotel/motel but for the money I think it was worth it. I stayed two nights and our room had 2 double beds, a fridge and microwave. What I was most happy about was it also had free wifi. I could have paid more at a Disney Value resort and not had ANY of those amenities. The staff was nice and check-in was a breeze as was check-out. The buffet breakfast though isn't anything to brag about. It was mediocre and not really worth the $8. Most of the food was cold when it should have been hot etc. Another thing was the sports bar. It was supposed to be open at 5pm, it never was open as long as we were there. No biggy. The hotel is close to many places to eat and easy to get to. We did not use the pool or outdoor amenities as it was too cold out but they did look really nice. So if you want a no frills place for a good rate this is it. The beds were fine and the room was clean. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for traveling with Children”
Reviews.Author: tigerfangr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. Only 3 or 4 miles from Disney. There were many businesses located within walking distance including a KFC, McDonalds, Walgreens, Publix, etc. It was also right next door to Old Town which is a fun little shopping district with an attached carnival style amusement park. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. They have desks located right in the lobby where you can buy tickets for local attractions and ask questions. The grounds of the hotel were great. Two courtyards with two sets of pools. One had a large heated pool and hot tub, the other another large heated pool, hot tub, shallow kiddie pool and jungle gym. There was also a nice little arcade off the lobby as well as store and restaurant. We never ate in the hotel so cannot comment on the food. The rooms themselves were classic 70's style motel rooms. Nothing luxury about them at all. Older TV's and bedding. The room was as clean as it could probably be for it's age but still a little on the dingy side. But realistically for $48 per night it was still one heck of a deal considering all the amenities of the hotel itself. The hotel also offered a complimentary shuttle to Disney which was a nice way to save on parking. It was timely and the drivers were friendly. Took us straight to the park with no additional stops. Overall I would recommend for families looking for a place to stay where kids can have fun on a budget. Just don't expect a "resort" experience because that's not really the kind of hotel this is.

Reviews.Title: “LOOKS ARE ONE THING BUT THIS PLACE IS MUCH BETTER TO STAY AT”
Reviews.Author: PARENTSAND3
Reviews.Content: Family of 5, mom and dad, 17 yr old son, 15 and 13 yr daughters. Stayed Feb 13 - 20 2010. We had a room facing the back pool. It has a bus to Disney and the day it was late the manager was explaining that the company had technical problems and will be arriving shortly. It did. My son has Down syndrome and behaves more like a young child and in the arcade there was a game to pick soft plastic balls. He finally won one and was nice and loud. The clerk heard him, did not complain or asked us to quiet him down but instead asked if her wanted a couple of balls that she had behind the counter. The breakfast is not the greatest but great when you want to leave early and no time to go out to eat. There was danish and hot foods including egg, bacon, potatoes, cereal and fruit. Rounds about $ 8 an adult Ie over 10 I think. The back pool was great. Ten pm air temperature about 50 pool temperature about 75. Tennis court / basketball court not in the greatest condition but for us it was perfect. We also played badmitdon and volleyball. They have all the equipment again not the best but playable. Within a mile or so, plenty of restaurants and shops and Old Town. Usually we were exhausted at night but our last night we walked around Old Town and actually played mini golf. There is a Publix to the left and buy your groceries there. A lot cheaper than the hotel and Target down right. Our room was two rooms, 2 double beds in one room and a Murphy and sofa bed in the other room. Plenty of room when the beds were not opened. Only problem we had was the shower water temperature keeps changing to cold. The tap in bathroom had no pressure. WARNING One night one of the rooms was broken into while the guests were out. Do not know the details as I overhead the guest asking for the manager but for the rest of the stay on every walk I did at night or day time, there was security walking and driving around. We did not have any problems or any real concerns about security. They have vaults at reception. Overall a great experience even if the weather was not the best. We also did not have a car and took mini vans. Get a driver you like, get his card and if you a lift deal with him. It is faster and more pleasant. Our guy, Adam, when we could not make it he had somebody ready for us.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.No huge complaints.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewArchAngel
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Disney World for a few days and this hotel offered a low price so room was what I expected.I thought it was fine.It was clean, but not spotless.The mattresses were a bit hard but not terrible.They offered free bus service to and from Disney at three times 8:15, 9:30, and 11:00 and three return times at 5:00, 9:30, and 10:15. Its about a 15 minute ride. You can get a fine breakfast buffet in the main building for $8.00 or grab something on the run for cheap from the store in the lobby.Sometimes there are some loud traffic in the parking lot that might be a problem if you are a light sleeper. All in all we had a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: jennyjr
Reviews.Content: Pros: Close to old town, activities, restaurants and Disney. Cons: Rooms are very old and small. You can hear noise from outside and the room next door. Also the beds were very hard. Since this hotel allows animals, the room next to us had a dog that wouldnt stop barking, crying and sctraching the door at all times even 1am. We told the front desk and they clearly stated that small animals are allowed, but they would look into it so that the dog may be quited down, nothing was ever done. Also there free internet can only be obtained from the lobby, not from rooms.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great, especially if you have children.”
Reviews.Author: strider954
Reviews.Content: My wife had to go out of town for 10 days and I really wanted something special for my 2 children ( 7 and 9) on a weekend visit to Orlando from Fort Lauderdale. (Without paying a fortune at a Disney Resort! After all, very little time is spent in the Hotel.) I found Seralago's website and their kids suites looked nice. Then I read a few very negative reviews. I started thinking that maybe the good reviews came from "unsavory" individuals who lived in a tent or something. I really was convinced to stay away but decided to take a chance. What a surprise! My king size bed was very clean and comfortable, the entire place was very clean. My children never stayed in a place that had their own kid themed room - they chose the Igloo. Bunk beds and a single bed; reading lights; a desk their own TV with xbox. Bring your own games or rent for 4 bucks each. A real cozy fort with portal type windows . They were thrilled. It was very cold and the swimming pool was steaming hot and very clean. Front desk was very friendly. Gameroom was fun but play for fun, not for ticket prizes. Breakfast Buffet was really nice. Mine 7 dollars and the kids free. I cant vouch for the other rooms in the hotel but ours was great. I paid around 70 dollars and I will definitly go back. Tim ps: Old town is walking distance and was a lot of fun. I'm a business man and stay at a a lot of 4 and 5 star Hotels - this is not one. But the complainers, I think, were either "snooty" or maybe:did they get a bad room? Everything looked great to me.

Reviews.Title: “We have fun at the Seralago”
Reviews.Author: gagirl98
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at the Seralago when we go to Orlando, FL. We have stayed twice so far and we have not been disappointed. The rooms are clean which is important when you are traveling with young children, it is safe and quiet. My childrens favorite places are the play area, the pool, and the arcade. The other things we like about Seralago are; the friendly staff, the on site restaurant that has a corner with a tv and picnic tables just for children, and the close proximity of the hotel to restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “what a bang for my buck”
Reviews.Author: marylou098
Reviews.Content: stayed in 11/09 & liked it after reading some negative reviews i was wondering how it could charge in a year we went in 1/10 to seralago & still found it to be a great relaxing motel our room was large clean comfortable cozy & cheerfully decorated 2 large pools tennis court volleyball 2 hot tubs kids playground small cafe reasonably priced small market beautiful grounds close to so many shops & restaurants close to theme parks & dinnershows will we go back next year ? you betcha!!!

Reviews.Title: “shabby room”
Reviews.Author: queenjojo
Reviews.Content: The motel had a nice lobby and a small grocery store. The hotel provided a complimentary shuttle to Disney which was great. There is also a shuttle to the outlets, but it cost $10 per person and the driver was not the most friendly person. Beware of the person in the lobby that will try to sell you a timeshare by attending a free breakfast. The room we had was shabby. It needed updating. The hot water was cold and the cold water hot (bathroom sink). The microwave looked like a time bomb. The room did not have a room safe nor a coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: mspzo
Reviews.Content: At first we were disappointed as the rooms are just like standard motel rooms, I'd say 2 star. The TV was a bit temperamental but we got the hang of it on the end. The maid came very day though and changed the bedding and towels. However, once you get used to it you do feel secure and it does have everything you need, i.e. fridge, iron/ironing board, plenty of closet space, etc. Just be aware before you go that it is set out like a motel, not a 'traditional' hotel. The front of house is very presentable and the staff were very friendly, the safety deposit box service is great and extremely secure. We had a problem one night with noisy neighbours but called security and they came out straight away. There are two pools, one which had all the families based around it and the other which we were based next to was empty, which was lovely! There was also a jacuzzi and gym and volleyball court but we didn't use any of those. There is a store for your essentials but there is another one about a 5 minute walk away which is much cheaper. There is a games room too. Plus you get free Wi-Fi in your room which was very handy! The best part of staying here was the location. It is right next door to Old Town, FunSpot, and a Pirates Crazy Golf course which meant that we always had plenty to do in the evenings. You must eat at Flippers in Old Town, they have the best pizzas anywhere! Right by the hotel is also a KFC, McDonalds, Ponderosa, Burger King, Pizza Hut, Checkers, and loads more. The best places we ate were Red Lobster (their bread rolls are to die for), Logan's Roadhouse, Flippers, and Bennigans. BE AWARE - the Chinese buffet across the street gave me food poisoning! We were also disappointed with the Ponderosa. The waiters at all of the restaurants were very friendly. We did not eat in the hotel as there was so much locally. Further up the road is a Walmart and a Publix, Publix is much cheaper than Walmart! Also, Publix do a few Disney toys at a much cheaper price than in the parks! The best service at the hotel was the free shuttle bus to Disney, which was great. It left in the morning or at lunchtime and came back at three different times at night. Very easy to use and free! It takes you to the Ticket & Tansportation Centre, from which you can get the monorail to Magic Kingdom or Epcot or the bus to any of the other parks. That can be a bit fiddly as for some parks you do need to switch buses but there is a helpdesk at the Centre who will write it all down for you. You have to pay for the shuttle bus to Universal, Seaworld, etc. but compared to getting a cab it's much cheaper and the drivers are very accommodating if you want to change your return time, etc. Our driver was caklled Tim and he was great. You do have to book the night before though, and there are pay phones in the hotel lobby if you don't want calls charged to your room. The drivers will also take you to the airport for a much cheaper price than a taxi if you ask them (we got a normal taxi to the Seralgo from the airport which cost $70 and the one we booked with Maingate on the way back was only $50). For the Disney bus we tended to give the driver a dollar each trip, although you don't have to, and for the bus to universal we gave $5 for the round tirp. The paid shuttle also goes to Orlando Premium Outlets, which is a must if you like your bargains! We got Levis for £15 and Ralph Lauren tops for £10!!! If you are planning on gong to Busch Gardens from the Seralago, the shuttle bus will pick you up from Old Town which was incredibly convenient. You do need to book this though, and I think it was every day except Saturday. All in all, the Seralago is a great base to do Disney a lot cheaper. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mortified”
Reviews.Author: kymmers40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and have never been at such a low rated cockroach inn in all my life. Here are a few things I found in my room, Smells of mildew ,water standing in the shower when using it, no hot water in the shower, a short in the lights, no covers over outlets,mold under the shower mat, full size beds not queen, no coffee pot. I asked for a roll away bed and when they finally brought it up I asked for it at 6 pm and did not get it until midnight.(6 hours later) they had to confirm 3 times before they gave me the bed and I had the receipt to show I paid for it. This was a very low grade place to stay and would never every go back. Very behind with the times and when they can no longer rent a room out they lock the door and never fix it!!! Sick place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “For the price it was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: allie-gator
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for a few days before going on a cruise and we chose this hotel strictly based on price. We were not sure what to expect, but we thought it was pretty good (again for the cost). We ate at the restaraunt once, it was fine. Nothing special, but it was okay for what it was. We found the front staff to be very friendly and helpful. The rooms were out dated and not as clean as I would have liked but it was no big deal. We enjoyed there 2 large pools and hot tub. It was right next to the Red Lobster and a miniput which we loved. We loved the fact that you could walk to a couple of places to eat, a store, mini putt. We would for sure go back.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Neanyray
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean and staff was helpful. Shuttle times were clearly posted. They even added additional shuttle times b/c of the time of the year (new years) to accomodate the guests. Food Court in the hotel is a huge help. We were able to buy things such as snacks and quick breakfasts before heading to the parks. One review of this hotel said that they "cater to seniors". We were there the week between Xmas and New Years and there was nothing but familes there. We were inthe parks all day so we really did not take advantage of other hotel offers (free kids movies each night, arcade, etc.) but it was a nice place to rest your head after a long day at the parks. Great family-friendly hotel. Great value! Would most definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: morvarm
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families. Yes, it is a motel, but the room was very clean and you probably won't be spending much time in there. But, there are many pros that have us going back. 1. Great pools - the pools are huge and they also have a kiddie pool 2. The have new, very nice playground set by one of the pools - my daughter loved it! 3. It is super close to disney world - it was only a few miles away and was very easy to get onto the road to disney 4. The street it is on has a ton of restaurants and fast food places 5. The staff was very friendly 6. You can't beat the price - on our next visit we are getting a 2 room suite for $64/night and it has a small kitchen area, which is needed when traveling with small children

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...?”
Reviews.Author: toni621
Reviews.Content: I realize you get what you pay for, but I must say, I do not feel that $65+ per night is cheap, and it should not buy you a substandard stay, but here it does. The beds were extremely uncomfortable with springs all over. We might as well slept on two pieces of plywood as we woke up with sore ribs, shoulders and hips. The room itself is in need of serious updating. There was a hole in the wall that I put a shoe over because I was afraid of what might come thru for a visit in the middle of the night. The room has a microwave, but if you use it, it will automatically shut off the tv. They cannot run at the same time, too much electricity being used I guess. I called the front desk to ask for an extra pillow and was told they ran out. The breakfast "buffet" that you pay for in advance when booking was horrible. Everything is generic with pre-packaged muffins/mini bagels, and I don't know how you make eggs taste bad, but they manage to. They also had churros on the buffet, but they could be used as hockey sticks. A table next to us complained about how stale they were & the waitress said they're always like that because the steam from the buffet makes them rock hard. We were spending all day and night at the theme parks, so we weren't in search of a really fancy place with a ton of bells and whistles. All we really wanted was a comfortable bed to sleep in after 10 hours at the parks, and a good breakfast in the morning to start our day. We did not get either. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra $15 a night and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is a ZERO!”
Reviews.Author: Mia1TampaBay
Reviews.Content: Love Old Town but keep searching for a different hotel! This is not the one!!! The front desk person "Rosie" was the most unprofessional persion I have had the "pleasure" of speaking to in my travels. Very confrontational and lacks anything close to an ounce of skill in customer service. The hotel room had an odor. The carpets were filthy. The shower had a stream of water that constantly ran. The furniture was so old it felt dirty to sit on. There are much better places to stay around Old Town for the money.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE FRONT DESK STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Ricko_09
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. They make false advertisements. I came with a coupon that I got from a magazine and they wouldn't accept it even if its still valid. The lady in the front desk area treated me so bad. Its certainly not a customer's fault for having a coupon. If they dont accept it, then they should better not advertise it. And they should treat their customers with RESPECT.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, just a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: BarbieZ28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while on our first vacation to FL. The hotel was pretty clean.. although no one cleaned our room for our entire stay - no maid service. The hotel is within walking distance to the famous Old Town, but other then that there really isn't much going on. If you are looking for a place to lay your head at night this is it. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel, go some where else. Overall the hotel is basically an indoor campground.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad budget choice”
Reviews.Author: ebbtide2
Reviews.Content: The Seralago is what it is--- an inexpensive, close to Disney alternative for those on a budget. Nice pool area and adequate, if not elaborate food choices. It is just old and is showing its age...rooms need refurbishing. Lots of chain dining choices nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.......”
Reviews.Author: Ga24
Reviews.Content: Went on trip with 5 other families for a baseball tournament in Disney...Everyone was kinda anxious about the rooms due to the nightly cost of $40 and what it would be like..Well we were in room 713 (2 double beds) and it was an excellent value. The proximity to Disney is 3.0 miles and it is extremely easy to get there and back..Old Town is next door and it was a fun night there with the group..Hotel has game room, little bar ($2 drafts) and convenience store(too expensive as usual)..Walgreens, Dunkin Donuts, Cracker Barrell, 7-11, Burger King, Publix all are within 2 miles of hotel...1 person in our group had the "suite" and it was really nice for an additional $20..The maid for our room was better than any service we have had at 5 star hotel, and I am not kidding. Great value. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My Grandaughter's summer vacation”
Reviews.Author: AngelicaReyes
Reviews.Content: This was agreat location. It was close to everything.Really nice .Next door was the downtown park with plenty of attractions.Walking distance to the House of Pancakes, Red Lobster, And many more restaurants. The plus was having all Disney attractions at such a close distance. Two big heated swimmig pools.Not a five star hotel, but service was also great. I have stayed in resorts and I must definately will return to Seralago.

Reviews.Title: “stay away!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gman45678
Reviews.Content: i would say to anyone not to go there it was so dirty and soooo many bed bugs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a one nighter, maybe two!”
Reviews.Author: stuffliquidation
Reviews.Content: We were over nighting in Orlando for 1 night and chose this place because of reviews and price. Typical $30 motel, nothing fancy, pretty clean and adequate for the night. It was OK. Their are better cheap motels in Kissimmee.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly and lots of bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: vacations4us2
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst place I have ever stayed. It was located around back and I was concerned about our safety in the dark parking lot. The room was so dirty that I didn't even open our bags. Although I didn't think I should have to pay extra for a clean room, I was told that if we wanted to move it would cost more. I paid the money and was moved to a room with bunk beds for the kids. The second room was slightly cleaner and less musty but really run down, dark and depressing. The carpet was gross so we kept our shoes on in the room, the fridge was broken, the sink/kitchen area was cramped and the beds were uncomfortable. On the first day the kids went to the pool and met a few little friends. I must say the rest of the hotel was fine. The pool was great for the kids and the food was, not good, but okay. The common areas were dated but reasonably clean and bright. All and all we decided to give it a try. On the third morning my son woke up with red spots all over him. I knew right away they were bed bug bites. I checked my daughter and found a few marks on her as well. Now for eveyone who is saying, what about all the people who stayed and didn't have bed bugs. I was told by our doctor that only about a 1/3 of people react to bed bug bites. Needles to say we checked out. We had asked to speak to the manager every day since we arrived, and leaving finally got their attention. The manager said he could move us to another room but it would be about the same standard as the one we were in, too little, too late. We did find another room, a condo in fact. It was closer to disney, clean, included breakfast and was the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location with lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: DeeRayNewfoundland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my 10yr old stayed here for 6 nights. It was a great hotel for the price and I would return there. The rooms were nice as I expected for the price I paid .The pool was huge and the games arcade was a pleasure for my son. The convenience of the shop in the hotel was perfect . The staff in the cafe were great . We ate there for breakfast everyday the price was reasonable for me and my son ate free.I got exactly what I was looking for as a single parent traveling with my son. If I wanted a Disney hotel I would have gone to Disney..Serelago was right next to Old Town and in walking distance of lots of shops and restaurants .Free shuttles to Disney was great and the shuttle company was very helpful, as well the shuttle to the malls and universal were perfect.If you are on a budget this is a great place to stay with all it's extras.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill fast”
Reviews.Author: duaned
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Seralago every year since 2002 when it was still a Holiday Inn and have always recomended it to others as a nice hotel for a great value. This year however my opinion has changed. I realize that everywhere we go there are budget cutbacks and the hotel industry is certainly not imune to that. When I checked in they had me down for a non-smoking room despite when I reserved I wanted smoking. Between the time I reserved and the time I got there (a month) they had somehow changed all but 6 of the 615 rooms to non-smoking. Maybe they thought I would quit in between and not notice. Anyway at check-in I requested and received a smoking room. I asked about wi-fi service and the lady told me they were having some problems that I should try it to see if my room worked. After settling in I tried it, found out it did not. Went to the back pool are, no luck; went to the front pool area no luck, went to the lobby no luck. Went back to my room still no luck. Called the front desk, she connected me to purchasing and went to voice mail. Called the front desk again, she said she would send someone. No-one showed up. Later went to the front desk after shift change, he had someone from main re-start the server and then everything was fine. We stayed four nights and the maid service did an acceptable job but they will actually tell you they will be off the next day and if you are going to leave a tip to give it to them otherwise they won't get it. Carpets need major cleaning, mine had several stains on it. Beds are awful, if you run your hand across the top of the mattress you can feel exactly where each spring is...my head seemed lower than my feet there was so much sag in it. I remember previous years seeing mattresses delivered all the time. I'm not sure which infuriated me more, the mattresses or the noise. As if trying to sleep on an uncomfortable mattress isn't bad enough, some of my neighbors every night I was there weren't there to sleep. There were several rooms both to the east and the west of me in which there were many college aged people staying. I could tell when I seen them taking their garbage baskets to the ice machines to fill up. And then they would be running back and forth between each others rooms...until 4:00 AM. I know that for a fact, because that's how long it took me to get to sleep. I that someone must have complained because I seen the security drive by in his golf cart and stop, look at the building and then drive away. Must have been too much effort to get off that nice cushy seat. Yes, you better believe I'm on a tirade. There is a LOT of competition for business in this area. Some are dumps but there are also many better ones for similar prices. By the way, if you google Seralago Condotel you will find that Seralago is listing each of the units for sale which will explain why the employees don't make any effort. I would Never Never Never stay here again. I feel totally betrayed after being very loyal toward staying here and telling all of my friends coming to the area.

Reviews.Title: “it's near everything”
Reviews.Author: bigcop73
Reviews.Content: I just spent 8 nights a the Seralago for the third time. It's situated 5 minutes from Old Town, a place with shops, bars, play arcade, etc, and is near the big parks and 20 minutes from Orlando airport. The rooms are clean with a microwave and TV.

Reviews.Title: “Dive!”
Reviews.Author: Robsmama
Reviews.Content: Old, musty, bad mattresses, loose fixtures, Pet deposits are more than the room costs and you feel like you are in the dog house if banished there. The hotel is in serious need of improvement. Yes, the cost is small but there is a good reason for that, Substandard accomodations. They also charged us twice on our credit card for the pet deposit that is already really high and out of line for what you get anyway. Don't take your socks off here. Don't let babies crawl on the carpets. Take some lysol spray and fabreze with you if you book here.

Reviews.Title: “Seralago=Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: ZuGenMusic
Reviews.Content: I am a touring musician and have stayed in hotels all over the world. From 5 starts down and I must tell you that the Seralago is up there with the best. I can't tell you enough good things about the hotel: the room was roomy,clean, and the microwave and refrigerator was a huge plus especially with a 2 year old. The service was that of a strong 5 star hotel. The food court, arcade, restaurant,pool,pool bar, Oh My God Fabulous. And as if that wasn't enough the price is just right if you want to save, and just a 15 minute bus, car or cab ride away from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay....”
Reviews.Author: sunstar1978
Reviews.Content: We went to Orlando for our honeymoon and had the Seralago as part of our package. This was a huge mistake! When we arrived we were given a room with two double beds, which being on our honeymoon, did not work for us. We upgraded to a king size room for $50 extra and found the room to be ok. We had to call for towels since they had not prepared this room. The tub was slightly too tall and had to really be stretched to climb into, the tiles were not clean or all together, there was not fitted sheet on the bed which was annoying at night, the mattress had springs that poked us each night, even after we requested our mattress be flipped (which it was but didn't help). The hot tub outside near the pool was a deathtrap. The stairs to get in were so uneven and the railing unsteady that I almost fell in, then the bottom was all broken apart and gritty. The small food stand in the store was not very exciting with little variety and was expensive. The shuttle service to Disney made me wish I had rented a car instead because it didn't run often at all so there was no coming back early in the day for a rest. I was not impressed at all!

Reviews.Title: “Could do with a revamp.”
Reviews.Author: elporko
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel as part of a package deal and paid very low rates for it (off season). We have mixed feelings about this hotel. Our room was adequate in size but starting to look very worn. We had problems with out toilet (blocked up 4 times, stopped flushing once) but the maintenance staff turned up all most instantly after we rung reception. Our room faced the main swimming pool which closed at midnight, so when a bunch of bikers stayed at the hotel and partied at the pool until midnight it was had to get to sleep. The water pump for the spa (next to the main pool) has a high pitch scream when it is being used so that also doesn't help the sleep either. The reception area, games room, shop and restaurants are all excellent. You really need a rental car for this location (but that goes for almost all of the Orlando area). There are a lot of restaurants near this hotel, most are fast food, which was fine for our budget. We got what we paid for, but this place would be 100% better after a good revamp.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting! AND dangerous! Attacked AND car broken into!”
Reviews.Author: lauren32063
Reviews.Content: Soggy wet disgusting old carpet Smells of mold and old pet feces/urine No one on the staff speaks English Would not give refund and gave me run-around Had my car broken into and then they tried to get in my door! Bedbugs & other critters Honestly, I was miserable. If you have no standards, this is the place for you. Otherwise, spend the extra $18 a night and go across the street to the BRAND NEW Holiday Inn! and then ride Seralago's free shuttle at 8:10 am!

Reviews.Title: “Seralago Kissimmee - Value for your $$$”
Reviews.Author: kying
Reviews.Content: I paid a visit to Disney Florida last winter for christmas and new year celebration. Since I am traveling with just my sister, I decided to hunt for a decent hotel with good facilities. Seralago Kissimmee is located about 10-15 minutes drive from the Disney MagicKingdom parking lot. So location wise, THUMBS-UP! Free parking is provided as well for the residents of the hotel. If you choose not to pay the expensive parking rate to park in disney, the hotel actually provided shuttle services to the main transportation center. However, there are only 3 shuttles in the morning and 3 at night. Thus, planning is a must. I got a great deal, $59 bucks per day and I got a $75 bucks discount for staying more than 5 days. So it is a real bargain. Room is decent and clean. Not as spacious as you imagine but come on, less than 40 bucks a night after discount, I would not complain. All basic amenities are in working condition. No major problems in the room. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend looking to save a little bit on accommodation. Disney entrance ticket is so costly, thus saving some money on hotel would definitely make the trip more worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Use to be nice !!!”
Reviews.Author: scissors65
Reviews.Content: I live in Florida on the West coast and go to Kissimmee quite often for pleasure, and have stayed at the Seralago a total of 4 times. The first few times were very nice, clean, comfortable, a great deal for the money (prices were less than $50/night, at that time). The third time the rooms were quickly showing signs of wear and tear, and not as clean. The fourth and the LAST time I stayed at the Seralago, the rooms smelled, were damp, the mattresses were saggy and uncomfortable. Carpets were stained, and linens just were dull and dingy. There are so many other hotels in this area, for almost half the price that are much, much better. Very disappointed because I use to love staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!! Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: monawhite_rose
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I wanted to go to Disney World without paying a lot and so he found a vacation package on westjet for this hotel, we would only pay $40 a night at this hotel. It said it was 3 stars and close to being like a Holliday Inn. We got to the hotel and the lobby looked ok, but once we got to our room which was all the way on the other side facing a bush area by the road (it looked more like a motel than a hotel) we could see that the door looked like it had previously been broken into with a crappy fix up job! And when we got into the room is stunk like wet dog or wet carpet, it didn't look very clean either. My fiance and I booked a room with Disney at their value resorts as fast as we could and got out of the Serelago hotel ASAP. The price was not worth feeling like we would be robbed while we were gone in the day or while we slept or feeling like we'd be sleeping with bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: smile804
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed there the first week of September, 2009. Staff was friendly and helpful. Pool was great. The place is dated but for the price not too bad. The rooms were a bit musty but turning up the air conditioner helped. The only problems were that the maid turned down the air conditioning every day so that your clothes were damp when you returned in the afternoon. Also, the sheets weren't changed on a daily basis and not having a fitted sheet for the bottom sheet was annoying. But for the price and the location (close to the parks and Old Town) it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I could not afford the nice Disney hotel that hosted the conference and so this was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: FLtrppr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a conference on Disney property. It was a great room for the night. I even got a discount at www.getaroom.com. The room was located by Old Town in Kissimmee. It was a quiet room with a connecting door to the next room. The staff was friendly, the location was great, the rooms were older but clean. It was well worth is value!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: GUYfromRI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 8 nights and enjoyed it very much.. We had our dog with us and they allowed it. The rooms where great and fit just well. The staff was very nice and very helpfull. It was way better than we expected it to be. The location is great and close to Disney and other things. They have two large pools that offered alot of fun. I would tell my family and friends to stay there..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family travel needs . . . would stay again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: LolaV
Reviews.Content: My family and I - husband and two children ages 9 and 5 - stayed here in late August '09 for 4 nights. We are an average, budget conscious family - not looking for luxury hotel, but don't want a dump either. Just someplace comfortable, safe and convenient. The Seralago fit the bill on all. We booked an INCREDIBLE rate of approx $35 per night directly through the hotel's website and using the AAA discount. Breakfast was an additional $13 a night for husband and I and the kids ate free - so basically, the $13 fed 4 ppl. First, the rooms. Please understand that they are outside entrance - basically motel style. We were on the outside part of the building, meaning, not facing the inner courtyard where the pool is (poolview rooms are slightly more $$). I found it great b/c we parked our car right outside our room and walked right in. Some ppl like this, some don't - whatever floats your boat. There was not much noise throughout the evening with other guests going in and out - never bothered me at all. The A/C worked fine. I turned it up full blast when we first entered the room and w/in a little while, the temp was cool and comfortable. The beds are not luxury, but they are comfortable, and we all slept fine each night. No, they don't have fitted sheets, as previous reviewers have noted, but they have flat sheets tucked in. With an adult and one child on each bed (two double beds in the room) we did not have the problem of ending up on a bare mattress - it was just fine. The room size was standard and fine for us - two double beds, a chair, dresser, television, desk w/two chairs, open closet, dressing/vanity/kitchenette area (sink, mirror, small fridge, and microwave - no coffee maker), enclosed bathroom w/toilet and tub with a showerhead. Oh yeah, my only complaint - in order to fully close the bathroom door, we had to lift up both the toilet lid and toilet seat so that the door could pass and then close. Kind of a pain, but whatever, it's minor. Had no problems with water pressure. Bathrooms were clean upon arrival and cleaned (along w/the room) every day. I did ask for extra towels, and was given them no problem. I used the small refrigerator - just had some water bottles and soda cans in there - and it worked fine - well, that was after I adjusted the temp - I put it on colder when we arrived and then it was fine. It seems they lower that and the a/c, but that's understandable to save on electricity. There was no coffee maker, but I don't drink coffee anyway. :-) Breakfast was ok. If you get the breakfast w/your reservation, you are given vouchers upon check-in and you present that to your server. Server will bring drinks and take any egg orders if u ask - like if u want fried eggs instead of the regular scrambled that they have in the buffet - they don't take orders for special omelets or egg whites, etc. The buffet was pastries, eggs, bacon, bread/biscuits, sausage, pancakes, fruit, and two cereals - standard fare to fill you up, nothing fancy - so, we did just that, filled up to start our day and we were on our way. DO leave a tip for your server! They were all very very nice & very accommodating. Speaking of nice staff, ALL staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful. We drove down to FL and arrived in the early afternoon, so I called ahead to see if there'd be any possibility of an early check-in. I spoke to Gabriella at the Front Desk who told me that it would not be a problem. Great! We got there an hour later and were promptly in our room - no delays. We spent time at the pool which was wonderful. There was a separate, gated-in, kiddie pool area for the little ones. There were plenty of chairs, some tables, a hot tub, and towels were provided. The bar/snack area was open for a bit, and we got pina coladas which were not that great. :-( Pool was clean, not too crowded, warm, just perfect. Inside, by the front lobby, there is a cafe/snack/convenience store area - u can go in there and buy snacks, burgers, pizza, sunscreen, soft drinks, coffee, juices, etc, at any time - you can even charge purchases to your room. They even have autograph books to take to Disney in case u forgot urs. :-) Disney is only a few minutes away down the road and Universal Studios and Sea World are just a bit longer away down the I-4 - no more than 15 mins or so. There are TONS of place to eat up and down the road where the hotel is. Nearby is a Super Target (make a right out of the hotel entrance and follow the road for a few miles). Hotel is easy to find, very convenient. All in all, as I said, we had a wonderful stay at the Seralago, and I would most definitely stay there again. This is not a place for those used to luxury hotels and/or the discriminating traveler. If you're a down to earth, regular, family traveler, then this is a great place to leave your stuff, rest, sleep and hang out at for a bit before u make ur way to other attractions for the day. I hope this review was helpful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sera-lago = Nightmare-alago! (P.S. Don't Let The Bed Bugs Bite)”
Reviews.Author: the-nicoson-tribe
Reviews.Content: We decided to try the advertised Hotwire specials for the first time. Although there was a catch - the catch was that we wouldn't know which hotel we would get until AFTER we booked. So, for $28.00 per night, we thought it was worth a "test." Besides, Hotwire claims that this hotel was in the same category as a Holdiay Inn at a 2 1/2 star rating. We decided that if it was a bad idea, we'd just go somewhere else and call it a learning experience. Well, it ended up being just that--a VERY bad idea and an interesting learning experience! We had never heard of this Seralago, and after booking through Hotwire, doing research once we got the hotel name, I started to get nervous. First, when we arrived, the lobby was so dated and dirty. Of course there were TONS of exciting eye-catching things for kids in the lobby, so we went ahead and checked in since our girl was excited about the arcade. We were offered to "upgrade" because the Hotwire rooms are all the way in the back in the area they have a hard time renting out. So, we paid $5.00 more per night to "upgrade" to a room by the pool. We were given the keys to our room on the second floor and drug our luggage up the stairs as there is NO elevator. When we opened the door, the musty, damp air hit us in the face. Being upbeat and optimistic, I tried to "freshen" up the room by cranking up the a/c and spraying air freshener in the air. We started inspecting the room. I suppose you get what you pay for. The room was not what I would call clean by any means. Hair, soap scum, old grout stained brownish-black from years of dirt, carpet stains and ancient bed-linens...this was NOT in the same category as a Holiday Inn! (Hotwire, please do better research!) So, we realized that there was a high pitched sound coming from the pool pump. It was SO loud that when we called the front desk to get moved, they could hear it on the phone. They offered to move us to another room on the other end of the pool. (This was, by the way, in the first building-right behind the lobby.) When we got the keys another room, we took our luggage in and started inspecting the room. After about two minutes of looking around, my daughter asks, "Mommy, what kind of bug is this on the headboard?" I ABOUT FELL ON THE FLOOR! IT WAS A BEDBUG! NOT ONE BUG, NOT TWO BUGS, BUT THREE BEDBUGS WERE FOUND MOVING SLOWLY ON THE HEADBOARD!! We called the front desk and DEMANDED a refund. (Which, we had to go through Hotwire and they did make it right for us. I appreciate all that Hotwire did to correct this mishap.) In any event, I will NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone! Please take this review into consideration from an honest, over-protective, germaphobic mother and try find another hotel-even if it does cost more! ALWAYS CHECK FOR BEDBUGS IF YOU MUST STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Rooms Cleanliness suuuuucks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yahit
Reviews.Content: This is a pet friendly hotel and I expected the rooms to be more cleaned. The carpet were dirty and ripped, the bed was very hard and uncomfortable. The room smelled like humidity. Overall it was an awful experience. I will not stay there. Management, please make sure you inspect the rooms before registering a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Very safe budget hotel in a convenient location with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: swimangelmom
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter and I stayed there July 20th to August 4th, 2009 while my husband stayed home. I never once worried about safety with the security on site. My daughter went swimming after the last shuttle brought us back from the parks at 11:30pm without hassle. The area has lots of shopping and restuarants nearby including 24 hour stores within walking distance.. The shuttle drops off at the WDW ticket & transportation center which is actually faster than stopping at each park. WDW transportation is available to each park from TTC. If you want to leave the parks at a different time than shuttle service, public transit, running every half hour, can be taken from the TTC which drops you off in front of the hotel. The bus takes basically the same amount of time as the shuttle with seating available. Across the street from the hotel is a bus stop for public transit to WDW TTC running every half hour. As well, public transit can be taken from WDW TTC to Seaworld. It took us around 15 minutes. However, taking public transit to Universal studios is a hassle and time consuming as you have to transfer twice with 15 minute waits between each bus. The food in the food court was excellent with large portions and reasonably priced. I just wished it had stayed open later. Midnight would have been nice. A complementary shuttle to Universal Studios is the only other amenity that I would add. If we ever go to Florida again, I would stay here again without considering any others. The amenities available outnumber those at any other budget hotels. If you cannot afford to stay at a WDW resort hotel, stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Room Size Misleading”
Reviews.Author: WorldBouncer
Reviews.Content: This is more of a motel than a hotel. The room that we booked was a "kids suite" so that my 13 year old daughter would have some privacy. Well, as it turns out, the room was nothing more than one large room with a six foot partition (sort of like in an office) that didn't provide enough room for the kids side and no privacy, not even a door. Since the partition left a 2 foot gap from the ceiling on two sides and had no door, we had to put up with conflicting television volumes from each "room" which was annoying to both my daugher and my wife and I. Other than the problem with the room, the stay was nice. The pool was awesome and room service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: mljl143
Reviews.Content: My Son and I stayed here for our Disney trip. The room was clean but sleeping was uncomfortable.The A/C was hard to regulate. Pillows were the pits and no fitted sheets on beds they were flat sheets tucked in.So a couple of turns and the bed was bare mattress. What really irked me was we had NO water pressure to take our showers NONE.Even the sink had no pressure and the drains could not be plugged to take a bath. We will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations By far”
Reviews.Author: mrsprisha
Reviews.Content: My husband, children, and I stayed here for 5 days. We were more than impressed with the hotel and its many services. My husband was a little weary because he know I am a true bargain shopper, but once he seen it, he didn't believe the price. He was actually looking for a balloon price at check-out. Our rooms were very clean and we had enough clean linen for everyone. Now for me, what really seal the deal was my husband left his phone in the room when we checked out. By the time we realized it we were in Ga( we drove from TX). I called his phone and asked the housekeeper to take it to the front desk, she agreed. But, I didn't think she would. I figured she would keep it...NO, she did exactly what i asked her to do, and the hotel mailed it to us. Of course we had to pay for it, but it was cheaper than buying a new phone. Thank You Seralago Hotel and Suites honesty goes a very long way with me. We will see you guys next year. -The Lowe Family

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect for us - cleanly place with great staff and security!”
Reviews.Author: MisterZero
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online through Expedia for August 2nd through the 8th and never had a problem with it at all. It is located in a perfect section of Kissimmee which is close to everything. SeaWorld, Wet N Wild, Disney and Universal are all just a few minutes away! It is also right next to Old Town which is pretty cool but sort of overcrowded. For the price I think it does VERY well. We stayed in a regular room which gives you two king beds, a sink area and a bathroom. There is a fitness area and free high-speed internet. Housekeeping is good at keeping up with the place, the service at the counter has been perfect since day one, there is a guest service counter inside which can book a timeshare tour for you which gets discounted or free Disney tickets. We did not do this but it's a deal if you have the time. There is also a snack area inside which sells food like a small convenience store. Breakfast is in the mornings until 11AM, I think they said it was $13 for adults but we just went to iHop down the street. There is a food court next to the convenience store inside. It has it's own private bar which is a huge plus, good prices on drinks for after the kids fall asleep. There are two pool areas, one with a hot tub, kiddie pool, and bar. Very cool set up. It's also nice because the pool areas are open until midnight! We always felt safe here because security is always hauling around the building in case there are any problems and to ward off any. I don't really have any problems but I do have a few nitpicks. The bathrooms were painted cheaply by spraying the ceiling and it looks kind of crummy. This could just be because I'm a painter by profession and that's a big no-no in my book. There were some small ant looking bugs on our night table one night, may have been bedbugs, but none of us were ever bitten, there were none in the beds when we checked. Another problem is that people kept taking our parking spot in front of our room and we had to park across the small lot. I think they should number their parking spots to avoid this annoyance. I'm sure anywhere would have small issues like these, but this is all I have as far as bad. This hotel has been great! There are so many pros to staying here- location, amenities, staff. It's great for a family on a budget, but I could see how snooty people could have issues with it, as it is in an old building. My family definitely recommends it!

Reviews.Title: “Seralargo Hotel- you are the tops”
Reviews.Author: minibuster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Seralargo Hotel in Kissimmee from the 13th June 2009 for 14 nights having watch the short video on the web site prior to booking the hotel. Our stay at the Seralargo was nothing but brilliant,the staff were so helpfull, the hotel grounds, swimming pools, food places ,reception all exceptionally clean and well kepted. Our room had a TV, digital safe, ironing board, iron, hair dryer, fridge,microwave in fact everything we needed. We have been to Kissimmee 8 times before and our only regret is that it has taken us 8 visit to Orlando before we found the Seralargo. Would we stay at the Seralargo on our next visit, guess what, without any doubt whatsoever From Freda and Alan Rutley Hillingdon United Kingdom ( email rutley.fantasia@tinyworld.co.uk)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Kids- We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: ergOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!!! It may not be a 5 star hotel, but the Kids Suite was super!! The restaurant staff, housekeeper and some of the front desk staff were very very nice and helpful. We had the breakfast buffet. For the 5 of us the price was perfect. The food was pretty good. They had grits, eggs, pancakes, sausages, muffins, breads, cereal and you could request special items as well. The pool is saline/salt water and was very nice. The kids suite was great, the kids had their own area with a TV. There was an x-box with game controllers as well. The king sized bed was confortable- on the hard side just the way we like it!! The hotel was very close to Disney and SeaWorld. Lots of shopping in the area with WalMart and Target down the road. Lots of restaurants in all directions. The only bad points were that the building is a little dated, where you can hear people easily through the window area (not walls or ceilings) and our bathroom light had a some sort of short - we had to hit it sometimes to get it to turn on. We called the front desk a couple of times, but never got it fixed. I would definitely go back again!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Harleyme
Reviews.Content: A great price and location. You can walk to old town that is right beside it. With money tight with a family this is the best bang for the buck!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY AT SERALAGO”
Reviews.Author: vingenny
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel tru STAY HERE PLAY HERE, thinking I was getting a deal and nice place to stay with my family. I requested the Kids Suite. When I checked into the Kids Suite room 222 I almost past out. I'd I been an Asthmatic only EMS would be able to get me out. The room had cigarette smell so bad that I could taste it in my mouth. I called from the room and they upgraded the room to a 2 room suite, which was a little better. Basically Seralago is like an apartment place not a hotel at all. The bathroom had no ventilation, no elevetors, the stairs were very dirty. Don't get exicted by the front hotel pictures and the room pics. And also for the people that smoke in the non-smoking rooms at the hotel it is just not cool. If you don't care about your lungs people like myself do. I would never stay there anymore. Genevieve O'Donnell GA

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Momof4VA
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the whole staff at Seralago! My daughter and I spent a week in Kissimmee and was absolutely blessed to have picked this hotel! From the front desk staff to the cleanliness of the room. Very impressed! We were welcomed by Eleanor, a very friendly staff member who called us shortly after check in to make sure everything was ok with the room! The room was great! Very clean and welcoming! We got the King with a sofa bed and it is just as it appears in the virtual tour. There are two sets of buildings with rooms and each had a pool in the center. Music playing just loud enough that you can hear it while laying in the sun but not so loud that it interferes with conversation. One set of rooms had the volleyball court and the other had a Jacuzzi/hot tub. Towels were available at the poolside every day so you didn't have to worry about your own having to dry before leaving the area. The breakfast buffet was awesome. We ate there every morning to a different variety of foods and fruits. From cantaloupe and honeydew to watermelon and french toast sticks to pancakes, hot cereals, eggs, bacon, sausage, gravy and biscuits, hash brown. Juice, milk and coffee with a smile from Sami and Myreta (spelling? sorry!) as servers! Everyone was wonderful and catered to our needs in a genuine way. The dining area had a TV for kids and handed out coloring pages each day so the children had something to do as the parents finished their meals. Then they posted them on the walls. Quiet at night but one of the most kid friendly places we have ever stayed at! the lobby had a restaurant, bar, convenience store with foods and pizza, drinks and ice cream, etc. There is a ticket counter for discounted tickets to theme parks and an arcade for the children. No lifeguard on staff meant that the parents were with their children which allows for control on the children. Beach balls, mattresses, tubes and diving toys were all allowed in the pool which made the children that much happier to be in the pool. The water went from 3 ft to 9 ft in the deep end. Something for everyone with an outdoor poolside bar that serves snacks and drinks for all ages. I can't say enough about this hotel! When we come back to Florida we will definitely stay at the Seralago. Close enough to the fun but far enough away to enjoy the lesser traffic. A mile and a half from State Hwy 4 right on Hwy 192 (W Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy). Thanks to everyone who made us very comfortable and welcome in our stay. Jason, thanks for the pre-check in confirmation of everything and to the computer specialist that came to our room as soon as we called and got my wireless hooked up in no time! Every time I called the desk for something they were very fast to respond. All things I called about were easy fixes. Thought the light bulbs had burned out but come to find out, the cord that they were plugged into wasn't plugged into the wall well enough. The only concern that I had about this hotel is that the bath mat in the room was like an air cushion once the water started to fill it. I almost fell a couple of times because it isn't stable under your feet. It is set very high like an overlay tub was put in when they remodeled or something. It sort of left a musty smelling odor but it wasn't enough to smell in the room. Just in the bath when the door was closed. Thanks everyone at the Seralago!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: MISUKZ
Reviews.Content: Seralago is one of the best hotel I've stayed at for the past 7 years. The staff are very friendly and polite. The room service is great. They have a game room that kids will enjoy. You have to see it to belive it. It's a great stop for tourists. I recommend do not stay at any HOWARD JOHNSON OR MASTER'S INN HOTEL!! Seralago is your way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Service was less than spectacular”
Reviews.Author: HarryDVC
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights prior to an extended Disney stay. Only requirements we had were - a clean place to hang for a bit before heading over to Disney and a decent price. Overall the Seralago met those requirements. We didn't arrive until after midnight so the lobby was basically empty. Check in was quick and efficient. We had a Kid Suite room. Smaller than I expected, but it served its purpose. The room is designed for 5 people - why only 4 bath towels?! We added breakfast for 2 adults for $13.00/day - 2 kids ate free, so we only had to pay for our teenager. The breakfast was only $7 or $8 so we only saved a buck with their add-on! The food was average. Slightly above what one would find at most motel "free" breakfasts. A couple of hot selections - nothing to brag about. No breakfast potatoes - just a big 'ol pile of tater tots!? The first day our waitress said we could order fried eggs w/ toast from the kitchen - which we did. The second morning our server didn't even mention it. We spent our only full day there away from the resort as we went to the beach. We left early and noticed the housekeeping cart nearby. We got back around 3:30PM to find our room had not been serviced. We called and were told someone would be there in a few minutes. So off to the pool we went. Nice pool - it was clean, pool bar nearby. Not too bad. Back to the room at 4:30 - still not clean. We call again and that's when the service issues kick in. The phone agent was nasty - accused us of leaving the do not disturb sign up all day - nope! Then she said they routinely service rooms until 5PM and we weren't missed. Interesting - as we noticed most rooms that had their blinds open had been serviced and there were no signs of housekeeping activity?! Asked to speak to a manager and you would have thought we were asking to speak to the President of the US!! She wouldn't give us a manager for anything!! Another call back and we were placed into the manager's voicemail. We had dinner reservations so we had to get going, too. We used the wet towels from the AM (all 4 of them) and got moving. I went off to go to the front desk and when I opened the door the manager was right there. He offered nothing - no explanation, just rambled on about how he wasn't familiar with housekeeping processes, but would have it corrected. It was then that the people staying below us arrived back at their room to find it also wasn't done. Okay - this review is going on way too long - bottom line is that the housekeeper forgot to do our room and the one below us for some reason (last rooms on the row). In the grand scheme of things should be no big deal, but the way we were treated trying to resolve the whole thing was really unacceptable. The staff was very rude. When we returned from dinner the room was finally done and lots of towels were left! Again - not a bad place for a quick stay. I wouldn't want to be cooped up there for an extended stay though. They also need to take a close look at their customer service attitudes as well.

Reviews.Title: “Average-Ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Polkadotsmile
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was rated 3 stars and the overall look of pictures from the hotel looked good. After booking Hotwire reduced it stars to 2, so I was a little worried. When we arrived it looked great from the outside and was close to Disney so I was a little relieved. The service inside was anything but fast and friendly, but I took that with a grain of salt. We were given a room in the back building, it seemed with not too man other guests. It was quite some distance from the rest of the hotel. We booked on Hotwire, so we thought oh well maybe this is where they put those that get the discounted rate. We walked up a flight of stairs (No elevators) to our room. The room was big and spacious. There was a refridgerator and table with chairs. The linens and furniture were old, but clean. The room smelled musty, but not smokey. So this being said- We stayed the night. It did the trick and we were off to our actual desitination the next day. Overall- if you plan to stay here-don't expect a new hotel. The rooms need a little remodeling and a little TLC. The appearance is fun as per the website, but a little disturbing after you stay there. My 16 year old son said it looked like an adult hotel with cheap frills to make it look kid friendly, like strangers with candy. We won't be staying there again. That being said I did have a friend who was in a worse hotel nearby, who called me to see what I thought about this hotel as she needed to change from the other. I told her what I thought and she stayed the night and was much happier than where she had stayed. So be sure to shop around and trust this website and not the other travel websites as they tend to changes their star rankings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mamaschrubba
Reviews.Content: I needed to make a trip to Florida to move my daughter to Florida. I researched many places and read many reviews! The reviews on Tripadvisor and the price I booked helped me make my decision to stay at the Seralago Hotel and Suites. We stayed for 4 nights. The place is just as it looks on the site. Although it is far from new it is clean and safe. The pools are refreshing and the location is PERFECT! My only complaint was that the free internet really didn't work unless you were outside or near a window. But, that is really nothing to complain about. When we arrived out toilet was running, upon contacting the front desk someone was sent up to fix it within an hour. I will defintely stay here again. We didn't use the restaurants on the premises but a lot of families surely did! The staff was friendly and helpful! A family staying here will have extra money to take in the Orlando attractions! Well worth the money spent! There is an entertainment park right next door but I didn't have any issues with that no noise no riff -raff.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 13 nights and found the hotel great for the price”
Reviews.Author: tas148
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I understand why the reviews are love it or hate it..we started our stay in a room that was really run down and then asked to switch and got a very nice room. We went through Hotwire and got a great rate for the hotel, when we got there we upgraded our room for $20 a night to the kidssuite. A kidsuite is the same size room with a room made with dividers...traveling with three kids it was worth the $20, they got their own TV and some privacy. Also, it seems that the rooms on the inside are nicer than the outside, so I would request one of those. Some of the kidssuite's have Xboxes in them and some do not, also request one with an Xbox..these are the one's that have been remodeled. Laundry room was very nice and clean and all of the employees were very helpful. I would stay here again. We really had no problems, we switched rooms to get the xbox and they even moved everything for us while we were at Disney. Oh, also the room had internet in it. They said all of their rooms now have internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ScrewyLewie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here almost every time we go to Disney. The location is great and is only a few miles away from the Disney main gate. We only use the room for sleeping and showering since we spend the majority of our time at the amusement park, so obviously we don't need a fancy schmancy place to stay. It's relatively quiet at night, and we've never felt unsafe staying here. They offer a free shuttle to the parks, although we have never used it, since it's only about a five minute drive away and we prefer to come and go on our own schedule. The staff is always friendly and prompt and the price is great. With their awesome military discount, we have never paid more than $40 a night. Their restaurants are okay, nothing spectacular and a tad overpriced for the quality. I'd save my money and go to one of the many restaurants that are within walking distance. I've never been to the bar because it's usually closed by the time we come back from Disney. We've stayed here on about six separate occasions and have only gotten one really awful room (shower was broken, sheets were dirty, door hinge was falling off), and with one phone call to the manager, we were immediately moved to a much better room AND given a free night's stay. There's a tiny game room, inside the lobby with a few crane games, pinball machine, basketball game, etc. It's a good place to keep the kids entertained for a while. Although I have yet to swim in the pools, they've always looked nice and pristine. My only major complaint about the hotel is the lack of wi-fi in the rooms, but they do have wi-fi in the hotel lobby. Hopefully they'll get with the times and equip the rooms with internet access soon. I highly recommend the Seralago to anyone traveling on a budget. While it's definitely not a five star resort, it's quite comfortable for the price you pay and you can't beat the location (unless you're actually staying on Disney property!)

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the Switch-a-roo”
Reviews.Author: wrecktek
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at this hotel for a children’s suite. Showed up at the hotel at 7:30 pm to check in with my family. I went to the counter and they gave me my room key, I go to the room and it’s a room with 2 full size beds. Obviously its some mistake I think. I go back to the desk and they tell me they are sold out and they do not have any children’s suites left. I spoke to another person that had the same issue. I spoke to a third person who was given a room of one night but then would have to move to the room they reserved on the next night. Seems that they give the rooms to the folks who pay full rate for the rooms vs anyone that has a discount. I asked why they didn’t tell me up front.
