All I got was a blank stare from the staff behind the counter. I guess they just figure that you will take any room they give you and you should be happy. The manger was of no help. At first they said there was nothing they could do, and then offered me 50% off. Finally, they did offer me a room at $25 per night and a hand full of arcade game tokens but it ruined a nice weekend for the family. If you get a discount rate be aware that you will probably not get the room you reserved! The rooms are tired and beds are full size beds and only 2 pillows per bed. Rooms only had enough towels for 2 people and requests for more towels went unanswered. We had to take pool towels back to the room. Towels were very rough and thin.. Pool was crowded. Even though they say no smoking its not enforced and due to the bar at the pool and everyone smoking around the pool it was difficult to enjoy the pool area. If you are a smoker it would be fine. Room fixtures worked fine and seemed to be clean. We did not eat in the restaurant on site. Arcade room had one pin ball machine, 4 prize machines, air hockey and car driving and motorcycle driving video games and a couple of others. Most games took 2 tokens which was about 50 cents. For the price you can stay in nicer accommodations in the area. I might stay there again, but I would look for better accommodations in the area first.

Reviews.Title: “seralago great hols”
Reviews.Author: siouxLiverpool
Reviews.Content: perfectv location next to old town great comfy beds excellant cleaning service bar reasonable but rarely open great pool and spa .pools perfect hot tub very hot and relaxing wonderful laundery lots of lizards and frogs out side. park car outside your door clean towels every day cant wait to go back hair dryer. iron hanging space and air con staff helpful and friendly good security.dont listen yo bad reviews unless you expect luxury and are really fussy i had one room for me husband and son was great

Reviews.Title: “Good price, clean, good facilities, great experience”
Reviews.Author: Judobum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seralago from May 5th to 12th. It was myself, my wife and our twin six years olds. We booked a kidsuite room and it was excellent. We had the circus themed one and the kidsuite was completely enclosed, like a seperate room inside the room which was nice for the kids to be able to have their tv loud without bothering us and vice-versa. The fridge and microwave were adequete and worked well. It was a bit dated looking but very clean and well kept. The pools and pool areas were also well kept and clean. Staff at the hotel were always helpful and courteous. The maids did a great job on the room every day we were there. Being right next to Funspot and Old Town was nice. There's enough space and barriers that the noise at night isn't noticeable, even on bike night where there were tons of motorcycles racing in and out of Old Town. There's lots of restaurants and grocery stores in the area and it's a quick drive out to the major attractions. We loved our time there and will likely stay there again on our next trip down. Can't beat the price and the location.

Reviews.Title: “returned after 4 years, still a great bargain !”
Reviews.Author: lynn509
Reviews.Content: No major improvements have been made since our last stay in May 2005. The pools and grounds are clean and well kept. The room was once again clean (even the windows)-but the furnishings and bath are outdated. The restaurant & shop are great. We selected breakfast from the regular menu-(the buffet looked ok) and were pleased by the selections & quantity. The hostess was very nice. The front desk were quick and polite to change my room when it was not in the location I had requested. Overall, another pleasant stay at Seralago.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Neya
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Seralago Hotel after a 2 night stay. We wanted a budget hotel near our home for a quick weekend getaway with our daughter. Overall the trip was very pleasant. Check in and out were very quick. We book a standard room with 2 twin beds for 2 nights breakfast included. The room and hotel are outdated, you can tell that the building was repainted many times. The bathroom mirror was faded, faucets with a little rust on them, a lamp in the room had a loose screw on the knob, the bedroom door was stuck and we had to push hard to open it. There was a small fridge and microwave, iron and ironing board, a small shampoo bottle and bar of soap. The fridge kept our beverages very cold and we did not use the microwave. The hotel had 2 large pools, playground, tennis court, basketball court, volleyball court jaccuzzis and kid's pool. The fitness center had only three exercise machines. The pool area was nice and clean, but the paint on the bottom of it was peeling. They were plenty of clean towels. Breakfast was ok. They offered, fresh fruit (orange and grapes) some sweet rolls, pancakes, eggs, oatmeal, bacon and sausage, orange juice, coffee, V8. Not very tasty but good enough to start the day. The service and location were awesome. Everyone was very polite altough our room was outdated it was kept very clean. The grounds, pools, reception area were all clean and I didn't notice any "old hotel" smell which I hate. They were security driving around all the time and we didn't feel unsafe at all. This is more like a motel than a hotel. We only paid $50.00 a night(Fl resident rate) with breakfast so we can't complain. I personally would not pay more than that to stay at this hotel/motel. We did not use the arcade, movie theater or the restaurant/snack area because we spend most of Saturday and Sunday at Animal Kingdom. We use the pool once, room and breakfast twice. This worked for us for a quick weekend getaway, but I wouldn't stay longer than 3 nights. Hope this helps! Neya

Reviews.Title: “very good value for such an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: johnThorp
Reviews.Content: Found this htoel very good. It is more of a motel type accomodation, very good value for the location. 5 minutes by car from disney and at the very start of international drive. For people not from usa 50 cents is two 25 cents or quarter pieces, the last toll booth you come to before departing the highway is unmanned and I had to pay 15 dollars fine as I did not have the 50 cent. This hotel is not the ritz, but you are not paying ritz prices. swimming pool and jacuzzi are huge , loads of free clean towels, the restaurant is good ,buy the vouchers at receotion for even better value. Right beside a place callled old town which is good fun at night, loads of eateries around, the red lobster and I would recommend Denny's. I will be ack again.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: Schternli
Reviews.Content: We booked our two night stay at the Seralago Hotel and Suites before embarking on a Disney Cruise. We paid *well* under their advertised price (more than half off), and were really expecting a dump. In the end, we were pleasantly surprised! The staff are incredibly friendly, the rooms are clean--albeit a little worn, and the pool and common areas are great. (Our kids loved the pool and playground.) It is a straight shot to the Disney parks, and the free shuttle saved us money on parking. (Shuttle departs the hotel at 8:15 and 10:00 and returns at 6:45, 9:00, and 10:45, at least while we were there.) It is also close to a Walgreen's pharmacy, fast food, and the Arabian Night's attraction. Overall, for what we paid, we were very pleased. A couple things to note: The in-room microwaves are very small--only as a tall as a small glass, in case you're packing dishes to heat things. The tap water tastes TERRIBLE. Buy bottled. Breakfast buffet is nothing special, but we thought it was good. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Seliatopaz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Staff was super friendly- Location was great to all attractions--My family enjoyed the entire stay--Would come back to this hotel again and again

Reviews.Title: “For the price, you can't beat it!!”
Reviews.Author: goingplacessc
Reviews.Content: After reading some online reviews, I decided to take a gamble on the Seralago Hotel and Suites. It took us about 30 minutes to check in, but clerk was very nice and responsive to our needs. We stayed in a two room suite facing the pool. The room was clean and the bathroom was bigger than your average hotel bathroom. The grounds are well kept and the carpet in the room was very clean. The beds were comfortable and the room location was very quiet. The room was cleaned every day and security was everywhere. Felt very safe here. Definitely a very family oriented hotel. Had activities for the kids every day. Booked under the birthday package and received great goodie bag and balloons. Also received birthday cake from hotel. Hotel breakfast buffet was very good. Kids ate free and waitress (Diana) was excellent. Had wi-fi access in our room.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sandscjam
Reviews.Content: I was worried about our stay after reading some of the reviews. For the price we can't complain. Our room was cleaned every day we had clean towels every day. My husband broke the drain in the sink we called the desk someone was there in 10 mins. to fix it ! The staff was always cheerful and all spoke goodmorning to us! We purchased the breakfast buffet and all was happy with it! Eating a good size breakfast for cheep saves money at the parks (food is very expensive at the parks). Pool and hottub were great to relax in after long days walking. Kids loved the playground!! It's not a top ten hotel/resort but we mostly slept there and we will stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay...”
Reviews.Author: cplmac
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 days with in the kids suite and it was perfect. This hotel is very close to all the parks and many other attractions in walking distance. The hotel staff was very professional and friendly. There is a bar, resturant, small arcade and small store right in the lobby area. The price for this hotel is great for anyone and the service is top notch, I will be staying again. If you are going to Disney with kids I recommend this hotel, many things to do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price!”
Reviews.Author: jpsfay
Reviews.Content: Ok so its a little outdated but for the price it was worth it! We as a family enjoyed staying here it is so close to everything. It was very clean and quiet. The beds were super comfortable and the only downside was that there was not an elevato, but the front desk did ask if we needed our bags carried upstairs.We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrid. Felt sick to my stomach at the thought of staying a second night.”
Reviews.Author: truthabides
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply horrid. The room had a musty smell. The beds were uncomfortable. The door did not close properly - sunshine would beam through the door jam - even though the door was locked. And lastly, the sink in which you washed your hands after going to the bathroom and also brushed your teeth, was the "kitchenette" sink, where you were expected to prepare your food. To me the two do not go together. We were booked in for three nights. After the first night, I made my way to an Internet Cafe and booked my family in to another hotel. We could not wait to leave. We washed our clothes right away - as there was a musty smell to our clothes. I love travelling and like staying in various resorts/hotels... but I would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget hotel near Old”
Reviews.Author: HappyLyndsey
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked to stay in a different hotel and at the last minute it was changed by the tour operator to seralago, after reading reviews of this hotel i was extremely worried about where i was going. However when i arrived i was surprised to see that it was a lovely hotel, great for a three star. I found the rooms comfortable and quite spacious. I also loved the fact that i was in walking distance of old town, which is great we went there all the time. There was also a few restaurants within walking distance, like a lobster place, pizza hut, and burger king but most of all accross the road there was an IHOP, the staff in this restaurant were extremely friendly and each year i have been in florida i have gone back to this restaurant. There was two pools at this restaurant one with a poolside bar and the other was beside a play area for children. the hotel was never too noisy which i really liked as well. I would definately reccomend this hotel for people to stay in if they want a hotel away from international drive. i prefer staying on highway 192 as it is close to disney and not as built up as international drive is. the hotel also has complimentary shuttles for people who dont want to drive.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were fine, service great, nothing to worry about.”
Reviews.Author: vmorra
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was weary about staying here after reading the reviews, my husband booked it and didn't look up the comments about the seralago. I looked after the fact and begged him to change the reservation, I did NOT want to stay here. Well, needless to say, we couldn't change our reso. I was NOT looking forward to our trip. WELL, let me tell you, I was pleasantly surprized. The check in staff was nice, the room was recently rennovated and I saw security constantly driving around. Really, we only slept and showered here, we spent 1 day out of 7 lounging around the pool, it was warm and there was a nice kiddie pool too. Yeah, it is an older hotel, but I can't say anything negative. I am the first person to get grossed out about things and I was ok about the whole place. Sure it ain't the Hilton, but the price wasn't either. I will def stay here again next year. It's better than looking for something else in the same price range and beeing shocked at the state of wherever that might be.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From This Place”
Reviews.Author: JourneyIsLife
Reviews.Content: After standing in line for about 25 minutes to check-in, we got a room at the back of the hotel. The room had two double-beds, CRT TV, micorwave and a small fridge.There are very strange things about this hotel. First, the curtains are semi-transparent (the second layer of curtains are just for show and do not close). People can look into the room from outside, and it is pretty bright after sunrise. So, good luck expecting any privacy, or even getting good sleep past the sunrise. Secondly, the room had a cricket chirping all night long and we could not catch any sleep. Thirdly, the hotel does not have a coffee maker. So unless you bring your own microwave safe mug and coffee/tea, a painful place for the caffeine lovers. The carpet was quite dirty. To top it all, no internet access in the room. Fortunately, we were planning to stay at this hotel just for the night, otherwise we would have moved to a different hotel after a night. I would recommend other similar-priced hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “We Will gladly come back”
Reviews.Author: cookooforcocopuffs
Reviews.Content: Great value for a family, we requested the kid's suite, which had a king size bed and a western style sturdy wood partition which privately housed a bunk bed and twin bed. My girls just loved it! The beds and bath were clean, the only negative was the smell of an older hotel room. The location is awesome (close to WDW) and the breakfast buffet in the hotel was clean, reasonably priced and convenient. (KIds eat free) The pool was clean and the grounds were landscaped with care. The gameroom in the lobby was clean, from what we saw, all games were working. The gift shop had all the necessary items you could want. They offer a shuttle bus to the parks. I don't conceive that just because this is a converted "Old Holiday Inn" to be a negative. Even if you were to spend much time on the hotel grounds, I don't see any negatives here. We will definitely return to Seralago in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: rjhawk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 4 night stay at the Seralago. Looking at some of the previous reviews, I was a bit worried. But to be quite honest, the place really is not that bad. It is old and in desperate need of a remodel. But it is clean, cheap and in a great location. So if your looking for a cheap, clean place close to the parks this is it. Old Town is a short walk away as well as several good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and safe, nice pools, reasonable price, nothing fancy though.”
Reviews.Author: C0ld_in_Canada
Reviews.Content: If price and location are an issue, stay here. We took a suite for $67 a night (AAA rate on-line). LOCATION : Excellent, 2 minutes to Disney. Walk to restaurants and Old Town(amusement park with car show on weekends). ROOM : Huge and kept clean. However, old looking with uncomfortable beds. POOL : 2 very large warm pools, kiddie pool and 2 hot tubs, nice. STAFF : Very quick to respond to any concerns. Lots of security around. If your looking for something special for your vacation - stay at Disney or one of the more upscale resorts. However if your not as picky you can save a fortune by staying here. We stay here every year and always have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “If you can manage the sleeping part, it's a good deal.”
Reviews.Author: LaffTAF
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in September of 2008. I wanted to save some money while visiting the Parks. The hotel staff was very friendly. We arrived before check in time and they still gave us our rooms. We booked separate rooms but they still managed to get them right next o each other, which was very nice. The hotel room was clean. I really have one complaint with the bedding. The beds are horrible. I thought I could manage it after reading other reviews, but I can't stay in this hotel again. The beds really do feel like there is a thin blanket and just springs. One of our mattresses was actually split, but we managed. They cleaned the room daily and changed the bedding when we asked. They stocked the towels everyday with new clean ones. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant because there were cheaper faster places close by. Just an FYI, there are a couple $4 breakfast buffets right across the street and my 2 year old gets to eat free there. This hotel is within walking distance to Old Towne which was a nice place for small town-like shopping. There is a small amusement part there called fun stop too. I hope I helped; this is the first review I ever wrote!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Rojo1664
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel some years ago, when it was still the Holiday Inn, so knew the layout and the hotel. What is great that while it's a fairly inexpensive hotel, it is much nicer than most of the other hotels that come up in this price range. I liked it when it was the Holiday Inn, probably for the same reason, but of course wasn't sure what to expect now that it's Seralago. Well, it was just fine, as I was hoping. While I think it probably was just slightly better kept when it was the Holiday Inn, it's still in good shape. The center court yards are very nicely landscaped, and look great, and there are two heated pools, and two hot tubs, as well as a kiddie pool in one of the courtyards. The staff was friendly, the rooms kept nice and clean. The decor and rooms could probably use a little updating, but it's much better than most hotels in this price range. Remember, you are not booking a 5 star hotel here. So in summary, I think it'a above average for the price range it is in, and it's always been a pleasure to stay here any time I did, and will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “cricket hollow”
Reviews.Author: mine9
Reviews.Content: this was an old Hoilday lnn, stayed there many times through the years. But now as the Serlago last year we stayed there and the next room a 100 lb dog was our neighor , barking all day, all night had to move rooms, then we get up at mid-night in our other room only to see little black crickets playing all over our bathroom / living room floor. Well at 1am l was not impressed, so of the little fellows ran around and hid in the wall others ran up the inside of the bathroom door, l blocked them off with a towel and told hotel staff the next moring after not so good sleep and closing all our suit cases so as not to bring home unwanted pets, nothing from hotel except a can of spray and stayed in this smelly sprayed room.. Well yes the pool stayes open till midnight, and no the food there is not good, will l stay at cockroch heaven again ? Sadly l did because l needed a 2room stuite l new what to do this time but thats it , nope no more

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: DestinationDreams
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year's Eve at Seralago in a 2 room suite. We had 6 people and needed more than a regular hotel room. I was very pleased. The hotel is clean and the price is decent. Walking into the suite you were in a large living/kitchenette area containing a chair, pull out sofa, entertainment center with tv, table and 2 chairs, 2 bar stools, a pull out murphy bed, microwave, small sink, small fridge, and closet. The large bathroom was off a small hall between the living area and bedroom which contained 2 double beds, dresser, table and 2 chairs, tv, and a large closet. The suites all look out over the pool area which is nice. There is also a laundry room, exercise room, sand volleyball court, and a play area. The lobby has a game room, store, and pizza place. The location is easy for disney, adjacent to old town, and many shops and restaurants some of which you can walk to. This hotel is a lot better than Suites at Old Town and less expensive than some other "true" suites in the same area. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: astonvilla72
Reviews.Content: if what you're looking for is style and substance then this,definitely isn't for you,but,if like me,you are travelling from europe and all you want is for somewhere cheap,with a pool to relax in,for a couple of hours and then somewhere to put your head down after walking through the parks all day with a noisy nine year old,then this is absolutely perfect. not too far from the main disney park.there is a free shuttle service in the morning and three,return times in the evening.also,if you feel like leaving the parks early,then you can get the number 50 link bus in the main disney car park,which drops you right outside the hotel. also,if you decide to give the parks a miss for the day then old town is just around the corner with plenty to keep you amused for a few hours. as for the hotel itself,yes it is dated,but it is kept very clean and i actually found the 70/80's style of the hotel more relaxing,as opposed to the usual shirt,tie and stiff upper lip of more expensive hotels in orlando.this is what american hotels look like in the road movies i've always watched,so it actually added to the experience.the staff were always brilliant,with your typical friendly american welcome.sadly i won't be heading back untill 2010,but when i do,then this is where i'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “2-star at best”
Reviews.Author: matts8008
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was listed as a three-star, but once we arrived I was really disappointed. It should be rated as a 1.5 - 2 star hotel at best. We arrived at 6:30 PM and there was six people ahead of me checking in with only one employee at the desk, so this took nearly 30 minutes. The lobby had been remodeled and was nice, but the rooms were terrible. Very old fashioned, dirty carpet, mildew/musty smell that would not go away. I would have expected this at a 1 or 2 star hotel, but not at a three star. The location is great - maybe 5-10 minutes from Disney, and there was a large pool and playground for the kids. With tons of other nice, 'true' three-star hotels in the Orlando area (and dozens right beside this one), we will NOT be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel in Florida”
Reviews.Author: sunloverinatlanta
Reviews.Content: Best value in Orlando area. I've stayed in hotels, condos, and resorts in the area and this was the best value for the money. The pool and hot tub stayed open until midnight. They did not give out rooms by the pool unless you specifically requested it so that nobody would be disturbed. When you are walking around Disney and Epcot all day long, you get back to the hotel late and want to sit in the hot tub. This is the only hotel I have found that will actually accomodate you. It was quiet. Had a fridge. It was very, very clean. Looked like it was once a Days Inn or Holiday Inn. We brought our own breakfast food so we did not try the buffet. Very close to the parks and to shopping/restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “still a good place to stay but will not go back next year”
Reviews.Author: thegoodwillgirl
Reviews.Content: As I have said before we go to disney/ seralago every year. It is always in need of updating but it is clean and close to the parks and a lot of space in the room the kids suites are a great feature. But this year it was a mad house. we went the week of 12/2-12/9. this is usually a slow time and enjoyable for families. I dont know if it's because it is budget time and more people went but the hotel was full of bus upon bus loads of college and high school students from sports teams and every room was booked by them. It was impossible to use the pool the hot tub any thing. but i have to say at 11 on the dot the hotel closed the pool and all was quiet. our room however was a corner room and the metal staircase went along side our room. every time one of the stampeds of students went up or down the stairs our room shook.. my mother in law had a problem in her room with the maid staff waking her up in the morning asking what time she was leaving . we did not.....all in all we made it work but it was too much of a "hang out " place for our family, We will stay at a hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “would not return”
Reviews.Author: kresthart
Reviews.Content: Just returned from short trip to Disney with my daughter. We needed a hotel that was pet friendly (only a four pound dog). This was the first (and last) time I chose a "budget type" hotel. The room had a very musty smell. The carpet was filthy with burns on it. No soap, shampoo, conditioner, etc. Blow dryer did not work and actually came off the wall when I tried to pick it up. Our room type included a buffet breakfast. This eas "inedible" food. I never thought that you could ruin a waffle, but they did. There were actually patrons in the dining room that were paying for their meal- it was not worth oaying for at all. This is listed as a budget hotel and that is exactly what it is. You get what you pay for. It is well worth it to have an enjoyable experience and pay more.

Reviews.Title: “What A GREAT SUPRISE !!!”
Reviews.Author: ptdilligaf
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another Orlando Disney/ Thanksgiving trip. its our annual trip. let me start with I'm a usual 4 or 5 star time share user, but during the holidays you cant use timeshare property,so here I go looking at all these hotels and reviews, WOW, what a scary deal that is, you cant decide where to go, the reviews are bad every hotel I look at. NOW, the Seralago Hotel had some 50-50 reviews, the short story is, what a GREAT PLACE , CLEAN, FREINDLY, and the staff just as helpful as any 100.00 or plus anight hotel. (maybebetter). The pool, the rest./bar ect./ walkways clean, neat, plenty of security, The room, 1 bedroom suite, large, bathroom LARGE,cuzy tub, nice after walking all day, the breakfast nook is real handy, fridge. micwave, sink, barstools at the counter, DID I MENTION CLEAN, and remember this, in Florida if a room is closed up for a long time it might smell alittle musty at first, Its called Humudity, its Fla. turn the air on and open a window for a few minutes. Hats off to Seralago Hotel and staff... P. Malone, Lagrange, Ga.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience!!”
Reviews.Author: HHSH
Reviews.Content: I would NOT recommend this hotel to people because of the unprofessional staff and how they treat the questions or requests as an interruption in their day. My husband, bother-in-law, and myself stayed at this hotel because the service was really friendly and nice the last time we stayed there (about 3 yrs ago). From the moment we checked in, it turned out to be a constant battle with the staff. First, my on-line reservation could not be found because I apparently spelled my name wrong, but when I was able to settle in and check my email confirmation, my name was spelled correctly and all other info was accurate. Second, we asked about the shuttle to Universal Studios and was advised to 'just come down at 9am and hop on the shuttle'. Well, we came down at 8:50am the next morning and found out the shuttle picks up at 8:45am and we had to book it an hour in advance. Third, we booked the Casino Cruise through Seralago and confirmed at least 3 times if we were booked and good to go. For the most part, the staff ya-ya'd us and shooed us away. No surprise, we waited an hour for the shuttle that didn't show up and found out that no one called the shuttle to come pick us up. To rectify the situation, the gen. mgr would just need to fork out $150 for the taxi and we would've been fine with it. $150 to a company should not even be something to question when the company makes a mistake. The stay was very unpleasant and ended up checking out the 2nd day. We went across the street to the Holiday Inn, which provided way better service. The hotel and rooms were a lot nicer and cleaner than the Seralago too!

Reviews.Title: “Barely Passable”
Reviews.Author: 2_married_people
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at this hotel for 7 Nights This November, and while we weren't disgusted or turned away, we were a little disappointed we didn't spring for something a little nicer. This hotel is a cheap hotel, and so we didn't expect the finer things, like conditioner or a post-cold-war-era microwave, but we found that our rooms were cleaned a little worse as the week progressed, and the rooms were quite drab. Also on the negative note, the walls must be super thin because when someone was talking in the parking lot below (we were on the second floor) it felt like they were within striking distance. Also I should mention that the mattress we used was on the old side. On a more positive note, the hotel offers a free* shuttle to Disney's Ticket Centre, Within walking distance of some decent restaurants, and has friendly staff. *- The bus has a sign on the front that says "tips are part of the drivers salary" But if they are not tipped, one could argue, wouldn't they not be a part of their salary?

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with Seralago”
Reviews.Author: hegfam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Orlando. We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and were completely pleased with our stay. The staff is very nice, the room was immaculate (room 127). It is off season which makes it look a little abandoned, but we felt safe the entire time we were there. Took advantage of the large pool (towels provided at the pool) and hot tub while we were there, both were very clean and kept up. We had no need to contact staff except for check-in/out, but I feel like they would have tried to accommodate us if we had. The room has a fridge/micro along with iron/hair dryer, so we had everything we needed. The beds were comfortable, and housekeeping did a great job keeping the rooms clean each day. My suggestion if you get a room with a smell or don't like the beds, try a different one. I'm sure they would try to satisfy you. There's a mini-store for snacks/convenience items/subs/pizza and also a gift shop and restaurant and bar. The only downside is the time-share desk in the main office, but we didn't have a need to be in the office area, so that wasn't a problem for us. It is pretty easy to avoid him. No it is not a 4-star hotel, but if you are looking for clean rooms, on-site amenities, proximity to attractions at an affordable price, you should give Seralago a try. This was not our first stay here and it won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Run Away From This Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tlsousa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were seeing Disney with our 3 & 6 yr old boys. We checked out the reviews on line and it seemed like a nice hotel. WRONG!. Upon check in they gave us the wrong room. The exterior corridors were in need of cleaning and painting and I was expecting the smell of stale urine to be in the corner. They had people hanging outside of their hotel rooms just in front of their doors that looked a little shady and made me feel unsafe. We got inside the room and it smelled musty. We had booked the kids suite which has a seperate kids area and someone had actually written on the walls and the staff never cleaned it off. The bathrooms were dirty and the breaking point was when I laid on the bed and all I felt were springs in my back like they hadn't changed the mattress in 50 years. That was all I needed and we checked back out. We were there for 1 hr and it was horrible. Not even worth $20/night. We went across the street and checked into the Holiday Inn there and were told that they have a lot of people who come there after leaving the Seralago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great price”
Reviews.Author: haveacappio
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 nights this October, had found the hotel whilst looking for a cheaper hotel in Kissimmee. We have been to Orlando numerous times and wanted somewhere with a reasonable price tag. Got a really good deal from Expedia and weren't disappointed. Hotel was as expected really from the hotel website - we had a room with a King bed, everything was clean and housekeeping kept everything lovely. We had the advantage of a fridge and microwave - the room was near the parking area but we never experienced any noise and the staff were all friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: disneytraveler1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the internet for one night before we went to WDW. The pictures on the internet were great and we booked a kid's suite. When we arrived, we were very dissappointed. The room had a musty odor and was not very clean. I had to chlorox wipe everything before I would let the kids touch anything. The springs in the king sized bed were poking through the mattress. A sign in our room with a picture of a bulldog warned us not to open the door to anyone, leave our door open for any reason, and to feel free to call 911 when needed. Hotel papers we were given at check in stated to keep your car registration with you at all times as thieves can take them and pretend to own your car. Hotel security came around our room several times. My husband asked him if it was safe. He said yeah, but we are having to run some people out of the pool area. Needless to say we did not go swimming. We were afraid to stay here. It was late, however, and we knew it would be difficult to move. This place was not to the standard we stay in. It does not make you feel safe and was not clean. Cheap is fine as long as it is safe and clean. We then went to WDW Pop century which was clean and we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: tired_mom63
Reviews.Content: Cheap place. Cleanliness is tolerable for one night, maybe two. We stayed one night AFTER staying on WDW property. It's just an old Holiday Inn. The food court did not look appealing at all. It was a bit worn- all over. It was cheap, but for $20 more I would have preferred staying at an All Star WDW resort. But, if you're on a budget and don't mind a one star...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Citron444
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel at least once per month since we bought our annual Disney passes back in March. Before that we stayed at least a couple times per year. What's VERY appealing regarding this hotel is it's double bedrooms and it's KidSuites. I did hours of searching for anything like this and almost nothing comes up. You may find a few other hotels that offer double bedrooms but you'll pay a lot of money for them. The Kidsuites are perfect for those that want a room within a room and not pay a lot of money. We pay (including tax) for a Kidsuite around $60. This INCLUDES their all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet and drinks for FREE. This is a Florida resident special (the free breakfast). Book online through their website to get any of their specials. They have at least 12 different themed Kidsuites. And each one has at least a set of bunkbeds with a desk, it's own TV and a game console (call the hotel to find out what type of game console it is to bring your own games). Many of the KidSuites have a set of bunkbeds and another twin bed inside the little room. The bigger room has a queen sized bed, it's own TV, a table, two chairs another little room with the fridge, microwave and then another room (bathroom). For the double bedroom, you pay about $20 more. But we think the Kidsuite has everything we need. The resort has all the amenities you need. A really fun game/arcade room (which we haven't really utilized), two large pools, one with a separate children's pool, both have a separate whirlpool area. There are two bars on-site. One inside next to their restaurant. The other is a pool-side bar (not swim-up). We've never taken advantage of either of these since we really only use the resort to sleep - the rest of the time we are at Disney. They have a fairly large children's playground (all enclosed). The resort, also, has a cafeteria/grocery store if you don't want to eat in the restaurant. There are even tables inside this area if you want to pick something up and eat. The resort, also, offers shuttle service to the attractions. But since we drive up and park at Disney we don't take advantage of this. The location of this resort is perfect. It's literally right outside of the Disney MainGate about a mile away. Which was important because most people won't stay off Disney property because they don't want to have to deal with the hassle of driving far to a resort. But this place is more convenient than waiting for an overcrowded Disney bus to pick us up. Of course you don't ge the Magic Hours priviledge like you would if you stayed on Disney site. I mentioned the buffet earlier but it's one of the big reasons we stay at this location. My husband loves it. It's a hot breakfast buffet with a variety of goodies. What's great is that the restaurant really caters to families. It has TV's all over the restaurant and plays Nick Jr. or Disney at all times. It even has a separate dining area with picnic tables that the children can sit at and eat while coloring or playing games. In other words the children are entertained while you can enjoy an adult conversation over breakfast. I wouldn't recommend this place for a romantic getaway. This is all about families and children! The reason I gave it 4 stars is that the cleanliness is wanting. The rooms need work in terms of painting. Sometimes items aren't working properly (coffee pot, refrigerator not working, bad TV reception, plumbing leaks, etc.). It's outdated except for the fresh coats of paint they put on it. The TV's are really old, too. But again we choose it for the inexpensive price, free buffet and the room option of a Kidsuite.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Back to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Uncle-Axl
Reviews.Content: Last year I decided to treat myself and head back to Orlando. I hadnt been for 8 years so I was a little worried that I would have problems finding all thoses places that I loved. and to be honest the reason why I stayed in Seralago was because I knew where it was ... Roughly. onto the Hotel itself we was put right at the back of the hotel which we no problem for us, because at least we didint have to worry about making noise and disturbing other guests. The room whilst basic had everything needed to make the stay enjoyable, The Shower could have maybe done with a lick paint but that is hardly a major quibble. For the price I would definatly stay in this hotel its very reasonable but you have to realise when you book a stay in a hotel of this price range it aint going to be the 'Grand floridian' However for most people who simply use the room as a place to Sleep and relax after a long day at the parks it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Tripswith5kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Seralago for 6 nights in Nov 2007. We have 5 kids and at the time, ages ranged from 3 to 9. My main criteria for any hotel is cleanliness, room size, and price. Seralago meets them all. It may not be the newest hotel on the block (and the VCRs have to go), but our rooms were very clean and well-maintained. Everything worked fine, the staff was friendly, the rooms were large and comfortable. It's within minutes of all the Disney parks and I could save even more money (on meals for 7 people) by stocking the kitchen with at least breakfast foods and snacks for everyone. We are planning another Disney trip in Nov 2008 and I am definitely booking another reservation at Seralago. You simply can't beat the price for a 2-room suite! We are at the parks (Disney, Sea World, etc.) for most of the day and are basically at the hotel only to sleep. Who can justify paying triple the price at another "resort" when most of your time there will be spent sleeping anyway! If you will be spending most of your time in Orlando sightseeing, shopping, and park hopping - I defiinitely recommend Seralago.

Reviews.Title: “I Really Liked This Hotel. The Staff Was Very Helpful And Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Alexismom
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean as was the pool and entire hotel. They had a security team all around the hotel at night . the staff was very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my stay and will stay there again soon. The price was great and it is locatd within walkind distance of Old Town and many great restaurants as well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't visit the Seralago Hotel & Suites”
Reviews.Author: blazin62
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst exeriences I have had in a hotel. The beds were so bad that you could feel the springs in your back. The floor had a seperation in the foundation at least 2 inches thick which made the room smell of mold, we placed a pad of paper and within 3 mins the paper was soaked all the way through. We asked to be moved and was told they were over booked and were turning people away that had made reservations but not paid yet. The pool had a big chunk out of the concrete that I injured my foot and was told "swim at your own risk". We had booked for 2 nights and when we tried to get moved on the 2nd night due to the smell we were told "we will sanitize instead but never showed". The lamp in our room was a safety hazard and had to ask to have it removed ... the switch did not work and when you tried it smelled like it was burning. When we returned to our room on the 2nd day they had not replenshed our towels and when we called it took almost 2 hrs to get them. When I asked to speak to a manager about the problems I was told "whatever" by her. They advertize they are 6.1 miles from SeaWorld and actually they are well over 10 miles from SeaWorld. Right next door to this hotel is "Old Town" which to some is a nice tourist attraction, but if you are in the back of the hotel like we were it is very loud and is opened to the early morning hours. We found drunk people coming from that area cutting thru the hotel rather then going to the street which made us very nervous. Please save yourself the hassel and don't stay in this hotel. There are many hotels in the area in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family hotel”
Reviews.Author: botherfree59
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in July. We were allowed early checkin, all our requests were met and granted with a smile! It's not a brand new property, but it's very well maintained. The room was clean, and big enough for a family of four. Two double beds, sitting area, and kitchenette. Clothesline in the shower. Pool was HUGE!! and open till midnight, as was the hot tub, thank goodness!! Good for after those long days in the parks. Onsite restaurant, gift shop, video game room, nightly movies, a great family place to stay. You can get your Disney park tickets here, too, if you don't have them already. An EXCELLENT value for the price. We would definitely go back. I was a little hesitant to stay here after some of the reviews I read, but we had a great experience, and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Find!”
Reviews.Author: jhd28
Reviews.Content: Very Easy to find! Right in the middle of everything. Room was good. Pools were nice. Staff was nice. Restaurant for breakfast a little pricey. Loved having a little store inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ayuttaya
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed there between 17-24 July 2008. The deal was good and excellent value for money. The staff were great and all the facilities on offer was first class. Well located for Old Town and Fun Spot. At Old Town you can sample all the rides and shopping at reasonable prices. The Hotel is a very friendly one and ideal for families with children in all age groups. We made lots of friends there during our stay. Would I go back there again?...oh yes. The breakfast menu is varied and of good quality. Kids eat free, but expect to pay $12 per adult. You can eat cheaper across the road at The Poderosa but its low grade dog food compared to the Seralago. If you dont take a car rental, taxi's are available..but don't use Main Gate Taxi company...I got ripped off with one of the drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Value Priced Resort”
Reviews.Author: joujoukim
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my sister and two kids July 18 - 21. The rooms were larger than what I expected. The staff was friendly and helped with any questions we had. The hotel is a bit outdated and could use a make over but for the price we paid ($55.00 per night) we could not complain. A plus was the little store in the lobby. They had everything we needed for our short stay and we really liked the Cayman coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price1”
Reviews.Author: tfx5743
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms: the kid suites and a king size room. Both rooms were spacious. The kids (14, 13, 9, 8) loved the fort. The hotel is refurbishing in stages. The key locks are computerized but in summer the condensation can cause the room cards to not work. It was safe and clean. Keep in mind it is an old Holiday Inn. The location is awesome. The bedding was old, but ok as long as you are coming to stay for a place to crash. You get what you pay for. The breakfast buffet was not good and costly. It was crowded and alot of spanish speaking guests. It is good for a family on a budget. You have to check out in person.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Hilton,but I can't afford the Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Urbanherb
Reviews.Content: Hotwire rate 39$!!!!! What a fantastic rate for this hotel. Ok so it has seen better days but we had a fantastic stay! While we checked in, the security guard on duty, gave my boys a couple tokens each for the arcade and that kept them busy for a bit. Our room was at the far end of the second building. It was on the second floor and a little bit of a trek to get the luggage up to the room but no big deal.Our room was clean, had 2 doubles and a mini fridge. There was internet access in the lobby only. It was 15 min to Universal, 10 min to Seaworld and 20 min to Disney. The pools were clean and warm. There were sand volleyball courts and basketball courts as well. We drove to the parks and didn't use the shuttles. (If you have the transportation, use your own, no waiting and the 10 or so bucks is worth the convenience. We used the laundry and there was lots of machines to use. 2$ per load. 45 minutes for dryer. For 39$ I would book this place again in a heartbeat. Our family totally enjoyed it and my boys talk about going back all the time. As I said, it is not the Hilton,but I didn`t expect the Hilton. Do some research and know before you go! Lots of decent restaurants around. We didn't use the restaurant as I had read the previous reviews and the not so favorable reviews on the restaurant. The choices are endless up and down the strip. We ate at McD's a couple of times for breakfast as well as Ponderosa. We ordered pizza at pizza hut and had dinner at Smokey Bones, CiCi's Pizza and Chi Chi's.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: MhzTravel
Reviews.Content: I don't know what some other people are saying. My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights (May 15-19). We had a good experience. When we got there, the girl at the front desk was nice (she was a teenager). As we were walking to our room, the first thought that came to mind was "Omg, I hope it's not dirty like the people said on the reviews".. etc. When we opened the door, I was surprised. It was clean. We had two beds lol. But ofcourse only used one. The only thing I didn't like about the room was the bathroom, that was about it. Other than that. I have no complaints. Every morning we had breakfast at their restaurant. It was all-you-can-eat buffet. Their food is awesome. Although, there was an old man (that works at the ticket centre).. he was grumpy all the time and provided incorrect information. He pissed us off lol. Shuttle service was ok.. it wasn't ongoing. We LOVED Old Town Amusement park which was just (almost) next door. My bf and I ate went there every night just to eat funnel cake. I also liked the free soft drinks.. hehe. I took advantage of that lol. I also liked the flea market.. it was along the street. If we were to go back to Florida, I would definitely stay at Seralago again! Aww I miss this place..

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected in a 3 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mom22LincolnNE
Reviews.Content: I booked our room on line based on the "3 star" rating and photos on line. What a disappointment! The MOTEL is outdated. The "food court" was poorly organized, and took over 20 minutes to get our "fast food". The room itself was clean enough, though the refrigerator smelled musty, the parking lot was very noisy at all hours of the night, and our air conditioner made a horrible noise every time it kicked off. I would have been better prepared for this motel if it had a 2 star rating, as a 3 star we found it lacking. On a good note... the staff was great. They very nicely offered to move us to another room - however what I wanted was another hotel altogether, so checked out the next morning. They even called me a few days later to follow up on the comment card I had filled out, and seemed genuinely concerned that we had a bad experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate Experience, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: maythefal
Reviews.Content: While not an awful experience, this was definitely not the best place I have stayed at. Personally, I wouldn't recommend this hotel, but if you're only looking for a place to sleep, then you might like it. My friends and I stayed there from July 3-6. There were 11 of us in three rooms. Right of the bat we had our first issue. When we went to check in (only three of us went to the frontdesk to avoid having a large crowd) we were told that they had two rooms with double beds and one room with a king bed. We had actually reserved two rooms with king beds and one room with a double bed. We informed the lady of the error, and she insisted she was correct and we were not. Since we are not the kind of persons to make a scene, I gave her copies of our confirmations. We were then told that they did not have the rooms together (due to THEIR error), and offered no apologies. Regardless, we took the rooms. Now, on to the rooms. While they are quite big and comfortable, they "looked" dirty. They were actually clean, but gave the appearance of being dirty. The bedspread in my room had two holes in it, and the sofa sleeper did not have any pillows (none were left in the closet). I called housekeeping to request pillows, and they were brought up immediately, which was great. The rooms also have a mini refrigerator and a microwave, next to the bathroom sink. The toilet took a long time to fill up with water, and the bathroom is very small. The air conditioner worked great when cooling the room. We didn't use any of the hotel facilities, but it has a food court, pool, and playground. However, everything looks better in the hotel's website than it does when you're there. We did get a good rate for the rooms, so we can't really complain. We got our money's worth. If you are planning to be out of your room all day long, and will only be there to shower and sleep, this hotel is the perfect choice. Otherwise, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “This is below, "you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole099
Reviews.Content: The saying "you get what you pay for" is almost true with this Hotel, almost. Yes it was inexpensive, but totally grossed me out! I wish now I would of spent the extra money on a Disney hotel. We were in a time share resort for a week but we stayed in Orlando for an extra night, so I booked us here. It is an old place, but I figured because it is a "good neighbor" hotel for Disney, I thought it would be ok. Well I was wrong!! The beds were very uncomfortable (yes I know I'm not at home) and the room was not very clean. The water that came out of the shower smelled really bad. We went to the pool and I wished I hadn't! The pool was very gross. There was alot of dirt and who knows what in the bottom of the pool. The skimmers did not seem to be working. I will say one good thing about this hotel. The staff was very nice at check-in and were quick at bringing a crib.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Room”
Reviews.Author: mytripod
Reviews.Content: The room assigned to us initially was far from the main lobby and pool area, so I requested to be moved to a room close to the pool for additional charges. I think, being close to the pool made the room smelled like chlorine. The floor is nasty. The whole time we were there, we wore our shoes/flipflops. The remote didn't work and the toilet clogged up 2 days before we left. My husband called the front desk about the toilet and no one came until the next day when he found the bathroom floor flooding. They came, after we called and told them about the clogging and flooding. We were supposed to stay another night but we decided to find another hotel where we can be comfortable before our flight back home. During our whole stay, we were able to tolerate because we were gone from early morning until late night, so we only slept in there pretty much. I don't think they ever changed our linens too.

Reviews.Title: “clean place to shower and rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Floridaresident1234
Reviews.Content: I am in my early thirties and stayed here last weekend with my college aged brother and my husband, and two children ages 3 and 5. The kids loved it-great large pool, playground RIGHT by the pool, kiddie pool, gazebo covered hot tub. The rooms were very clean-I checked the bathroom toilet, tub, sink before use, and they were fine. Only 20 basic cable channels and a VCR...but we were more concerned with DIsney than hanging out at our hotel. Our furniture was by no means the type pictured on the web site, but that was no big deal as the room looked clean. The maid came in while we were gone to Disney and did a great job cleaning our room. When we stayed at a Disney resort (Saratoga Springs), their policy is they don't clean every day, so this was nice. The breakfast buffet has pancakes, eggs, bacon/sausage, fresh fruit, biscuits, etc. Florida residents eat FREE, so let them know if you are from FL. If not from FL, 2 kids eat free with 2 paying adults. Now, the a/c we kept running leaked on the inside and wet the carpet so watch this and do not put a suitcase there in case. The thing that I did not like is that our fridge was not plugged in when we got there. I plugged it in and it still did not work well (not that cool), so I called front desk at 10 pm. She said she'd send someone and never did. She asked "Is it even plugged in?" which leads me to believe that they unplug them a lot which is bad since it takes a while to get the freezer/fridge cold. WHen we left we still had the same fridge/freezer that was only as cold as our room temp. Front desk never did much to help with that. The snack bar has everything any Circle K, etc. would and the grill is low priced-burger and fries-$4. Our young kids liked it though since the pool area is so kid-friendly and I liked the price of $55 per night. One last thing is free shuttle to DIsney, but check the times. We wanted to go at a different time, so we drove. I saw the shuttle bus and it looked big and nice, as nice as the DIsney one we took when we stayed on property. If you want luxury, don't stay here. The beds arent as good as ones in your home, but we slept fine on them. If you want a low-cost place that is clean to sleep and take a bath and let kids swim, then you will like it fine.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to sleep at nite and hold your suitcases while you're off at Disney”
Reviews.Author: sircooksalot
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were looking for a nice, cheap place to stay while we spent the days in Disney. From the pictures, the Seralago looked nice and was very reasonable as far as price goes. It even featured a shuttle service. We thought we had gotten a great deal...that is until we arrived. The hotel was described to us by our taxi driver from the airport as "having its best days in the 60's" and he was right. The hotel looks outdated by a few decades. The rooms were neat and clean, but modern, they were not. They had bare minimum for a hotel room. Beds, TV, and Shower. The TV got about 7 channels that was in English. There was no wireless internet except in the lobby. The beds were awful. After spending all day at Disney it would have been nice to come to our room and fall into bed, but these beds have NO PADDING whatsoever. They are only box springs. But I would like to compliment the staff. They were nice and helpful. The cleaning ladies did a really good job and I accidentally left my computer and money on the bed and they moved it to make it up then put it all back neatly. I thought that was the best part of the experience. Do not be tricked by the "shuttle service". Yes, a shuttle runs to Disney...three times in the morning, then back to the hotel at night at 8,9, 10:10, and 10:45 it runs again. It's not continuous, it only runs at those times. And the worst part is that there are several other hotels all over the area it also runs. The hotel is in very close proximity to Disney, but taking the shuttle turns it into atleast an hour's trip. Some days it took us nearly two hours just to get to Disney. Getting home was the same way. Overall it was a good experience...but we weren't in our hotel that much...just to sleep and have a place to keep our stuff. If you're planning to stay here but not go do something everyday...there isn't much in the way of fun. There's some pools...and a playground that's under construction. Courteous staff, close to Disney, in walking distance of some fast food places, close to Old Town which is like a carnival/novelty place(as an aside, they have oyster shells that have pearls you can open up and make into jewelry). It's a cheap place to stay if you're in college and you have park hopper tickets for all the days you're there.

Reviews.Title: “BAD experience”
Reviews.Author: luv2cruise641
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and usually stay at 3 star hotels. So that being said we are not really picky. I booked through hotwire and did some research. The hotel seemed a little out dated but that was fine. We just needed a clean room for the night before and after Disney. We arrive about 10pm and everyone was nice at check in. went to our room-809. Ist off we had to lug all of our luggage up to the 2nd floor via stairs. We had a room facing old town and in the very back of the hotel. I think maybe this must be the bad part of the hotel because I wish we would have had the good experience of the other reviewers:) After arriving in our room I started unpacking and getting the kids to get their pjs on etc. We had to get up early for disney- Our kids are 9,7 and 6. As we started unloading everything and checking out the room here is what we found: 1. sink had water in it and a hair-facial or some other type-yuck! 2. an orange was left in the frig from someone else. 3. several hairs in the bathtub 4. room smelled very musty- mildew smell 5. vent in bathroom didn't work. 6. paint chipping around in the bathroom. 7. the jack on the phome was broken so I had to push it in because it was missing the part that keeps it plugged into the phone. My husband was not happy with me- I was the one who checked the hotel out and booked it online. We would have changed rooms at that point but we had already opened all the suitcasses and put the kids to bed by the time we found all of the issues I stated. I know we din't pay for a grand hotel but I was expecting CLEAN. I called down to the front desk and they sent someone to give us some cleaner to clean up the room. It was late by now-11pm and it was a guy they sent with a towel-- no cleaner- he rubbed the sink out with the towel and couldn't speak much english so we just wanted to get to bed and let him leave. I used the soap to try and clean it. We got back the next night from Disney at 10pm and let the kids swim till the pool closed -midnight. The pool was nice. They seemed to keep the grounds clean so i was so disappointed that our room was like a fleabag hotel- Worse than any I have ever stayed at. i will say the housekeeping person at least came in and cleaned our room while we were goneto disney. It still couldn't take away the mold smell. Our son is allergic to mold so he woke up sneezing each morning. We left that next AM for a Holiday inn express in Clearwater- that hotel was like night and day compared to this one. My husband left his leather belt in the room (at Seralago) hanging on the ironing board. we stopped back at the hotel on our way though after a 2 day stay in Clearwater and he was told by the fromt desk that it was not found. He has left things at other hotels before on business and they have always found the item and sent it in the mail to us. That housekeeping person that did such a lousy job got a nice leather belt. My husband is going to be calling and talking to the manager- he was so mad about the whole hotel experience that he left without asking for a manager. I didn't write this review to bash the hotel- though it may seem that way. I wish we would have checked the room out before we unpacke all our stuff. I know they have to have nicer rooms at that hotel or they would go out of business. If you plan on staying here- PLEASE go to your room and see it before you take out your stuff. Hope this helps someone!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: jmass
Reviews.Content: We just recently had a 4 day stay here and I found the hotel more than adequate for our needs. Overall the cleanliness and friendliness of the grounds and staff were very good. The pool was warm & clean, the hot tub was nice too. This is not a 4 or 5 star resort. It's a basic hotel with decent sized rooms and it is geared to families with small children. We got an awesome rate through Hotwire and I would definitely stay here again when visiting the area, for that price anyway. My only complaint was the pool side bar/snack shack was only open for the first couple of hours we were there on Saturday and I did not see it open again the rest of our stay. I don't think that they should advertise that feature if it's not going to be available.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: dholsom
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived in Orlando late. We were booked to stay at Howard Johnson’s and it turned out to be the single worst hotel I have ever been in (but that is another review). I hit the streets the next day looking for a room and came across this. We had a Suite (not the Kids Suite) and we loved it. This room saved our vacation. We were upstairs facing towards the pool. The hot tub made the end of day so much better. They also had a small buffet for breakfast that was really nice. The entire staff was courteous and helpful. We would definitely go back there!!!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: gatorfan87
Reviews.Content: We have been to Seralago in the past. My kids LOVE the KidSuites. This time, the room was very disappointing. Previously, the KidSuite was between the queen bed and the bathroom, and the dividing wall was about 6 - 7 feet high. This time the KidSuite was totally enclosed, with only a small gap over the door. The ark design was really cool, but it blocked the a/c from reaching the queen bed. We had to keep the a/c on high the entire evening, which ended up freezing the kids. The kids' mattresses were thin and hard, and all the pillows were terrible. The ladder to the top bunk was difficult for my 7 yr old to climb (there is no slant) although he has a bunkbed at home. The curtains did not close all the way, and the dead bolt lock did not close properly. We were surprised to see a mini-kitchen adjacent to the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. for the price”
Reviews.Author: canukbajan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in May. There were 13 of us in our party. Let me say the grounds are beautifully kept 2 nice huge pools with hot tubs , clean, plenty of towels and loungers to use fantastic. I must say the rooms are dated but clean. Upon check in we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff. Our rooms were OK we did have a few problems, the bathroom door did not shut as the top part was off the hinge and I sat in a chair and it was broken When I called to complain about this it was immediately fixed. Also we were unable to make outside calls, when I asked about this I was told I needed to give my credit card , which I did at check in and she told me it was not needed as I booked with West Jet Vacations and my room had been paid for. It would of been nice if they told me this upon check in in case I wanted to make outside calls. We also were not able to receive outside calls as it went straight to voice mail I called to get this fixed and it was done immediately although I do not think it was . We also would of liked fitted sheets on the mattress as every morning my kids woke up and they were on the mattress. The staff here are fantastic they are there at a moments notice when I complained about any thing and it was fixed right away. We got a fantastic price for air and hotel with West Jet Vacations and this hotel is in the best location it is near flea markets, stores, shops restaurants and Old Town. If you want a basic clean place I would recommend staying here. I did look into some of the rooms facing the pool and they did look nicer than ours the kids suite looked nice too. I do think I would request one of those rooms.

Reviews.Title: “nice price, clean room, good value”
Reviews.Author: HuntersReach
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel, clean, tidy, well maintained. Good location. couldnt fault it for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Year Of A Million Dreams”
Reviews.Author: gsbemcd
Reviews.Content: My family & I would like to share our holiday experience in staying in the Seralago hotel & suites. This is how we got on. We arrived on 13th May from Dublin to Atlanta, Atlanta to Orlando. Fantastic flights with Delta both times. We were met by our rep (Silvia) acting on behalf of American Holidays coming through arrivals, great stuff, easy peasy. However 1st negative point was at the transportation desk “Mears” based on the ground floor. We had to booked our return journey from the airport to Kissimmee & vice versa however our itinerary had only one detachable sheet though it did state in bold txt letters “a round trip McCoy airport to Seralago Kissimmee - Kissimmee to airport. The lady (Rosanna Montalvo) would not honour this & there was no getting through to her, it was lousy on her behalf. In the end we needed to fork out another $40 ?. Another point while at this desk when I joined the queue there was only 2 people ahead of me who were both annoyed at how slow she was working, by the time I got served there were 12, by the time I left 20. I personally find that this “Mears” setup is bad,…. What a way to welcome you to the USA !! On arrival home to Ireland I rang my travel agent who was only two nice and will refund any amounts pay extra, once my receipts are posted. Top Tip : Keep all receipts - you’ll never know. Finally got settled went outside for the “Mears” bus (9 seater plus 1 in the front) gentle man asked how many I replied 2 adults 2 kids age 3 & 11mths, fine give me your bags & hop on board, I got to the side entrance & I was amazed at what I seen - there were no seats left everyone was sitting in all seats, including some of the 12 that were behind me in the 1st queue at the “Mears” desk. I looked at my wife & said this cannot be happening, in the end another bus came within 4 mins, we were on our way - journey time to Kissimmee 40 - 45 mins. Arrived at Seralago, very impressed with what I seen on arrival, even though a lot of reviewers on Trip advisor and spoken negatively about this resort. The receptionist (Vianka) was excellent at check-in, very straight forward, no issues, we even changed our room type to a kids suite facing the pool & hot-tub, paid in full, great. Time is took to check-in 10 mins. We were even told to check our room once entered if we were not happy things would be fixed to our satisfactory. Things were great though. Hotel has a good set-up, with all staff been very pleasant & friendly, though sometimes a tad too friendly - (must be for the tips). There is internet access x2, ATM access, games room for kids etc, guest relations which sell all park tickets and not forgetting Orange County. There is also a food store combining a restaurant which sell fast food, there is a bar inside towards the back of reception & finally a store that sells all the nicky-nacky stuff like magnets, mugs, ash trays, Florida tee-shirts etc. The pool in area A (where our room was ) is a good size with the deep end been 9ft +. Room was great, but just probably a tad on the small side, though bear in mind we had 3 suitcases & 2 buggies or Strollers !!. The kitchen sink was shared with the bathroom, with a small prep area in the kitchen, fridge included. The AC is so cool, tip leave it on when you leave you room for the day. Note that there is no safe in the rooms, though you can store your valuables in the safes at the back of reception. This didn’t agree with us. The restaurant had 2 breakfast setups for the month of May (A) Bountiful Breakfast Buffet (Fri - Sun) & (B) Ala Carte Breakfast (Mon - Thurs), both 7am - 11am. The maids do a great service and deserve a good tip, we had Monica, great coming home to a made fresh bed. Thanks Monica, you were a star. Courtesy shuttle service operated by MCO express Free of charge (tip the driver when arriving at the magic kingdom if you are visiting for Disney world) Bus departs 4 times every morning from 07:40am to 12:10pm outside hotel and returns 3 times a night from 8pm to 22:45pm. Bus departs from bus lane 116 outside main entrance of magic kingdom. All details can be found in the reception of hotel. Normal Kissimmee service buses will bring you to magic kingdom outside seralago opposite side of road, single journey is $1.75, kids are free. Return service again outside entrance of magic kingdom look for route number 56 on the pole beside the blue benches. Transportation to the shopping malls take the Maingate transportation & not the yellow cabs, the meters will rip you off. Maingate are like buses but hold 10 people and baggage, but seats can be adjusted to fit more people. We got a great guy called Tim, couldn’t of been more nicer or friendly, tells you everything you ask about, and trust me he’s worth listening to. You got to book in advance for a journey hope you’ll get Tim, he’ll give you his card with his own mobile contact on it. Maingate Office contact is 407-390-0000. (if you get Tim tell him the guys from Ireland say hello) Fee’s to the mall return are $10 per person, kids under 3 go free. Fee’s with Maingate to Universal studios & Island of adventure are $14 return, again kids as above. Pickup at hotel, pickup at universal is route number 50, lookout on the pavements for sign. Hotels in Kissimmee only do courtesy service free of charge for guests to Magic kingdom, hotels in international drive do courtesy service free of charge to universal studios & islands of adventure. They are both in competition with each other. When we return we will do 1 week in Kissimmee with free courtesy service, and the other in international drive with free courtesy service. Inside Magic kingdom car park shuttle services all parks epcot, Hollywood studios & animal kingdom, though the monoline train also services Epcot as well. Places to eat in Kissimmee in the old town check out the Red Lobster (beside the arcade bungee jump area), they serve great steaks & Lobster in which was my 1st time tasting, wasn’t bad. Also you’ll have your fast food outlets KFC, McDonald’s, Burger King & Pizza Hut. Check out ponderosa they do buffet’s which are great. Take a bus ask to be dropped off or nears abouts at “Longhorn” steakhouse, nice friendly place to eat & drink. Another shopping area to go and see it Wal-Mart’s - what a store, you’d spend all day in this place. It has everything. So apart from the airport issue on arrival, our “dream holiday” was fantastic. The theme parks are great we even got to see Man Utd whip Chelsea in the Champions league final in a ESPN bar. This place is just not for small kids, it’s for big kids as well. If you going to visit the theme parks remember a few things before you do, 1, Review the parks on the TV in your bedroom there are at least 2 stations & the info is amazing before you visit. 2, when a thunder storm arrives & you happen to be in the park, run for cover because this will be a storm which can last for 20 mins, buy a poncho $7. 3, don’t buy phone cards in the theme parks - there are a waste of money and don’t work. 4, do fast pass or single rider for all rides as it’s much quicker. This was an honest description of our adventure of Florida from Seralago Hotel & suites to the theme parks to all kinds of transportation, from the negatives from the start, it’s not enough to keep us away. Would we stay in Seralago again, of course we would, it had 1 or 2 hiccups but not enough to keep us away. Role on Florida again, when my youngest reaches 4 & my eldest reaches 7. It certainly was “the year of a million dreams” !! Please feel free to email any questions you may have. Attached photos of seralago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: darcodcar
Reviews.Content: We took the kids for the weekend to Disney. This hotel was so very convienient to everything. Right next to Old Town. Go out the parking lot turn left and follow Irlo Bronson (Hwy 192) Straight and it takes you right to all the Disney attractions. The rooms (in building A ) were updated and very clean. It was awesome to have a poolside room overlooking the court yard with the pool, playground, hot tub etc. Great cafe/ store for those forgotten things. The staff was great, security was set and the price was awesome. Being a Florida resident we got a discount. If your going to stay there make sure you ask for a room in building A. Were all the ammenities are @. My only complaint was that it did not have a coffee maker in the room. But what the heck next time we'll pick up a 4 cup maker @ Wal-Mart for $10.00. Will definitely make it a routine place to stay when we go up that way whickhis several times a year.

Reviews.Title: “fair review”
Reviews.Author: chachazoom
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel acceptable for the money. Make sure you book a "poolside" room though, especially if you have kids. I found the staff friendly, however I didn't appreciate "guest services" being a front for "timeshare". They tried to nail us immediately, saying there was a special offfer for those checking in on this date. We're not from here and didn't know how prevelant the timeshare crap is but luckily, a very nice front desk clerk clued us in. The room was clean enough and the location is great, offering alot of dining, shopping and other entertainment close by. The free shuttle to Disneyworld was convenient too (signs are posted on the bus for gratuities). I found the restaurant okay but I think there are better deals close by. It would be worth eating there if you had 2 or more kids under 12. They offer snacks like fries and burgers and pizza at a reasonable price. Now the negative. If you have any kind of back problems don't stay here. The beds are old and hard. We don't have back problems but we still found the beds quite uncomfortable. Another minus are the greedy maids. How and when I tip is up to me. I made a point of asking a maid who would be cleaning our room and she said so and so cleaned on Saturday (the day we arrived, so obviously it was for someone else) and then another girl for one day and then the regular cleaner for our room for the next three. I sought out the girl that cleaned for the one day and decided to wait until check out day for the the other one and leave it all at once. I was rather disgusted to find a "note" the day before that was a thinly vieled request for money. I really didn't appreciate this and think that maids have no business leaving notes to guests. We rent these rooms and they are our "home" while we're there and I found this an invasion of privacy and did not appreciate the gist of what she was doing. My mother experienced the same thing here a year prior. I wonder if the management is aware of this? A gentleman took our e-mail address and said we'd be recieving a survey regarding the hotel and I thought I would take that opportunity however we have thus not received anything. Also the bar tender is about as charismatic as a rock. No wonder the bar was empty most of the time

Reviews.Title: “Better after we changed rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ichr4her
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our stay at this hotel. We were staying for a soccer tourn. at disney. Check in was great & staff was very friendly but our first room was horrible. We booked the standard room and just an FYI these rooms have not been updated and are extremely old, dirty and have the worst furniture out of every room in the hotel. It was the kind of room that you're scared to walk around w/out your shoes on. Needless to say I went back to the front desk and switched to a pool side room which was great! Very clean, updated, nice beds, bathroom etc. We had several of our teammates that stayed in the suites and they were very nice as well.
