I would more than likely stay here again because the rooms other than the basic standard room are a great deal and the location is very convenient to everything. So my only suggestion would be don't book the standard room.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Seralago!!Will be back next year”
Reviews.Author: sunflower1975
Reviews.Content: Me and my Partner stayed with my 3 kid's(ages 4,10 and 14)for 8 nights and we all loved it.It was a great price,clean and close to everything.Peggy was our maid for the entire stay and she kept it nice.The pools,hottub and area was clean,always security around,good food,friendly staff.I felt right at home there.Old town is next door,very awesome place to visit.The only thing that was inconvinent was the wireless internet wasn't in the rooms,had to go to the lobby.I will definately stay here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not a "Contemporary Resort"”
Reviews.Author: cherry3m2000
Reviews.Content: This is an old motel. The grounds inside the building quads are nice, but as soon as you step into the rooms or the lobby, you realize it is quite old and tired. The Good: Pool are and hot tub were nice. Price was reasonable. Location was good, right next to "Old Town". The Bad: Computers were down for registration so that took half an hour, with not much of a line. The room was tired. This is a two story, flat-roof motel that probably dates to the early seventies. The shower curtain really wants to get to know you while you are showering, I hate that. The mattress was torture, it felt like sleeping on a box spring. Linens and towels were threadbare. Strong musty/deodorizer smell in the rooms. We reserved a kids suite, but I was surprised to see a number of electrical cords strung along the wall in the kids area. Auxiliary lights/speakers in the bunk beds had missing knobs. The Ugly: Breakfast at the Vineyard restaurant came with the room (free with the Florida Resident Special). Others pay $18 per couple in advance or $25 per couple at the door, according to the website. It was truly unedible. I don't understand how a breakfast buffet on Sunday morning could be so bad. Cold, dry eggs, lumpy grits, cold sausage patties. The only edible item was the store packaged pecan spins. The waiter offered cooked to order eggs, so I ordered scrambled with cheese. I was served buffet scrambled eggs recooked with cheese to a nice brown consistency, nasty. My son said even the chocolate milk was bad. DO NOT get the breakfast buffet. Walk across the street to the McDonalds. Oh, and the two ice machines for our building never had ice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seralago Hotel with my Boyfiend and Son. The Hotel was far better than I expected. After reading some reviews before I went I was getting worried. I would like to say everything was great. Although the rooms were dated they were clean and spacious. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It was perfect for the 2 weeks we stayed. The pool was great. It was open until 12am which was fantastic as we could have a swim after we got back from the parks. There are plenty of resturants within walking distance of the hotel and I recommend Sizzling Grill over the road. The hotel was situated perfect for the Disney Parks. Also Walmart is not far. Also the hotel is great for disabled people. I am in a wheelchair and had no problems. The disabled room has a roll in shower and the bathroom is large enough to move a wheelchair around easily. Overall I would definatly recommend this hotel for everyone. I will definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Seralago”
Reviews.Author: Nickstar21
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself & 10 yr old son stayed for 4 nights at the Seralago-we had a wonderful time. The room was exceptionally clean; my son loved the kids suite. The pool and grounds were well maintained. It was also nice being so close to "Old Towne", a great place for kids and adults. The breakfast buffet was good, but I don't think it was worth $9/pp! All in all, we loved this hotel-it met all our needs and for the price, it can't be beat! I would recommend this to everyone, especially families.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon 3 night stay" "CJSMOM”
Reviews.Author: cjsmom1
Reviews.Content: This was my honeymoon. It was a package deal we got from the travel agent. We were on a 3 day 4night Disney Cruise vacation and stayed at Seralago {then the Holiday Inn} for the 3 days. We had an overall pleasant experience. The check in clerk was were kind and welcoming {unlike a specific person who I have spoken to over the phone as I have now made reservations and has questions} Our room was facing the pool area and was clean. It did have a smoke like odor, but after spraying some perfume and keeping the door open for a bit it was okay. The staff was also pleasant as we ate at the cafe and visited the gift shop a few times. We also decided to skip out on one of or Disney days and did a time share with the hotel to get free Universal tickets. After about 2 hours we were off to the park. It was great! Old Towm was something we did nightly for two nights or so. It was a nice relaxing thing to do together . . . a chance from the theme park hussle and bussle. I think my husband and I will do this one night alone just to be together and recreate the moments now without our 3 year old son. Don't worry we will take him but I want one night alone. It is a family reunion and so there will be people to care for him for him. My husband actually asked me if we were going to be staying at the same hotel since he like it so much. . . . OF COURSE!!

Reviews.Title: “great in price”
Reviews.Author: blancamike
Reviews.Content: It is nice for the price .I liked the sizes of the rooms and also the pools,hot pools. The only bad thing we had to complain everyday was transportation is horrible.We had to wait at a certain spot to get picked up and certain hour and sometimes we waited 3 hours or more with small children in the rain and lightning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: 1TAGUY
Reviews.Content: we really very much enjoyed our stay @ SERALAGO & I found it to be much better than expected. Not that I expected little- just that the hotel & staff far surpassed what was expected & the VALUE for the money was exceptional. I booked through the Single Parent Package a pool view room & received a nice large room along with some extras (like breakfast, game tokens etc.) - a very nice touch. The grounds, pool, & hot tub, were clean & well maintained, but above all I must mention the Staff were TERRIFIC! Fred (in Security)- very helpful with the Safe Box. Esmeralda @ the front Desk, always helpful & smiling! [a nice site to see when you check in @ 10:30pm! Our favorite was our server Diana @ the Vinyard Cafe. She is a true asset to SERALAGO- she was always friendly, knowledgable, & helpful! We were disappointed one of the five days we slept in & had Breakfast @ noon- elsewhere. We actually missed her! [they close for Breakfast @ 11am [should be a little later maybe-11:30-12n]. One night we ate from the Food Court & met a nice family from NC. It was a fun night eating back in the room watching Nickelodeon- my daughter really enjoyed it! Everyone from the grounds crew to Security always had a friendly hello which makes you feel welcome! The stairs, and stair areas could use a little updating- but not a real concern. We did not visit Disney, although that is their closest ThemePark. Sea World, Aquatica, Universal Studios & Islands of Adventure were only a short Drive up I-4 & easy to get to from the Hotel which we really enjoyed. Plenty of Parking as we rented a car. Great Location next to so many restaurants & OLD TOWN!! The last Day I think we [my daughter especially!] enjoyed the Best of all- Hanging out @ SERALGAO Poolside, Eating, swimming & making new frinds with your other Family Frindly guests from OH, NJ, & PA. As you can tell it was an awesome Vacation & my daughter can't wait to go back to Seralago!

Reviews.Title: “Warm pool but issues with staff & room - you really get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: SFBayBee
Reviews.Content: Arrived early on check in day and was told our room was not ready and to come back. Came back and had issues not very silly and incompetent desk clerk although Angel sorted everything out. Room was JUST ok, remote did not work and when we came from the parks, we were locked out of our room - issues again with silly desk clerk. Finally security let us in as it was freezing outside. The hallways were filthy and the rooms are dated. This motel really needs a facelift. The pool was the best thing. The jacuzzi was very old and dated - the bar you hold onto while entering and existing the pool was broken - you could break you neck getting in and out. It needs to be cleaned more often as well. I personally will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and all you really need”
Reviews.Author: kathieh724
Reviews.Content: I didnt know what to expect when I read some of the mixed reviews but it was a great price and we needed it only for one night. This hotel is in a good location and the staff at reception are friendly and helpful. This hotel is bigger than I thought and the pool area was nice as well as it had music and a tiki hut for snacks which was cute. The room was off the pool but with 2 double beds which were uncomfortable. The floors definitely need a good cleaning but other than that, if you are staying only for a few days, it's a good value. We were only staying for one night as we went to Epcot then to Clearwater Beach so I would recommend this hotel more for a family than singles or couples. You won't be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worth A Try”
Reviews.Author: NoBestWestern
Reviews.Content: At first we avoided booking this hotel after reading bad reviews. But after having a very bad experience at highly rated (very good reviews on this site), we thought of giving it a try. We got a better deal than this highly rated hotel and were greeted warmly by front desk staff. Our kids immediately felt the family friendly environment. Having gone through bad experience for first night of stay in Orlando, we requested a tour of available rooms in each category. And they very willingly agreed to it. Though property shows signs of age, rooms were clean and neat from inside. At $56/night 2 double bed room, it was a deal. We had couple of issues, but professional approach of staff makes us feel go again to the hotel (3rd time. First time we had stayed in hotel which was under different name. We realized that after we checked in). Issues were: - Water force was not quite sufficient in the morning on one of the day. But as soon as I complained, maintenance staff was knocking on the door to check the problem. Quite a quick response. - It was our first time at Cafe for morning buffet breakfast. Though we knew that kids eat free with adults, did not know that every cup of milk, juice and coffee was extra. Waiter also did not inform us when we ordered it. So it was surpise when check was presented. I raised the concern to cashier but went ahead and paid for full amount. To our greatest surpise, the cashier lady credited the card for beverages and called us at room to apologize that the waiter was new. So if you like family freindly staff and environment and do not want your spouses/dads/moms to get hooked on to their laptops every time you return to your room (good thing is that only lobby has wireless internet access, rooms do not), please visit this hotel. It is great experience for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: omie0715
Reviews.Content: The hotel could use some updating but if you just go to sleep it's a great stay, at least the rooms we had. The beds were comfy and the noise level out side was at a minimum. The pool was heated and it's walking distance from Old town. The only bad thing is that they do not offer continental breakfast, but all in all i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky & Stuffy!”
Reviews.Author: MRF21
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on expedia I was really excited about the price and shape of this hotel! Hmm when I got there it was a different story. Although I paid less than I usually do for this hotel, I quickly came to realize why this hotel was cheaper than others. Our room was dark and very musty smelling. It was extremely stuffy even with the air conditioner on. The beds were old and very uncomfortable. The pillows were worse. The light flickered in the bathroom making it seem like we were in a rotten motel. Very out of date room and low budget. The pool was small and often filled to the point where you couldn't lay beside it. People were outside our room at all hours of the morning making it hard to sleep. The front desk was helpful but the activities coordinator did not listen to a single request we had, rather he tried to sign us up for a time share presentation when we simply asked directions! The only thing good about this hotel is the location. I guess you get what you paid for but I'd rather spend a little extra for a much better place! Oh and the food in the cafe was expired and the bar was never open the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty worn out but it's still trying.”
Reviews.Author: avlea2
Reviews.Content: It's got its ups and downs, but the worst thing is staying on the upper floor & having to lug your suitcases up the REALLY LONG staircase. The rooms were overpowered by the drenching of Febreze, but the sheets were clean. The layers of paint were chipping off the doorjam & the carpet wanted replacing badly. The staff was friendly. Our sink drain was jammed upon arrival, but two cheerful workers came up and fixed it within the hour even though it was past 10 pm. A staff member brought up a crib quickly upon being reminded we had requested one. The pool area looks updated and quite nice even though we didn't get to use it. Because the prices are good, I'd recommend it if you could get on the main floor and you're not too demanding of everything being pristine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: msblonde
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the hotel, and it is within a few miles of Disney, which is convenient. Through the Ultimate Fares website, it was only $55 a night, and the room was clean, the employees were very helpful, and the hot tub was very relaxing. They had security guards that patrolled regularly, so I felt safe. I would definitely stay there again if I am ever in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for family on a budget”
Reviews.Author: aminna
Reviews.Content: My husband and me spent our las chritsmas vacation in Seralago Hotel. We love it!!! and my 2 childs too!!!. The pool was very clean, the spa was very clean too. Great landscaping around the property. Our room was very clean with 2 double beds, microwave, mini-fridge and a cabinets (small but excellent to keep organize your grocery items (to cook in the microwave.) Very spacious and well lighting parking. Security patrol in the hotel makes me feel save. I make my reservation directly in the web page: www.seralagohotel.com and this was the best option for us. When you make the reservation in the web page you can obtain a breakfast offer. For just $18.00, including gratuity, two adults enjoy a fabulous buffet breakfast, including coffee, a $25.00 value. You save over $7/day! Our buffet includes eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, and more. A great way to start the day and save! And the kids 12 and under eat free!! And the best of all: you can select a La Carte Breakfast or eat in the buffet. We use both options and are greats.... If you go to Ponderosa you pay about 3.99 each one in your party + coffee + juice + tax + gratuity, so if you are 4 you will pay about $25.00 or more. But in this offer you pay $18.00 for 2 adults and your kids 12 and under are free... We love it this hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly. I dont speak english very well but this was not a problem because the girl in the front desk was very smiley and freindly with me. She try to understand me and she was very helpfull with my reservation check in process. Other friendly girl was a lady name Scayra is an strange name but this girls was very friendly with us and thank God she speak spanish. The hotel has a small candy store that alsp serve pizza and other great snack. Also has a game room for the kids. We never use the shuttle service because we have our own rent car. MY ONLY TIPS FOR YOU IS: STAY AWAY FOR THE TIME SHARE COUNTER. THEY ARE VERY AGRESSIVE FOR THE TIME SHARE OFFER. BUT IF YOU JUST SAY !!NO THANKS!! THIS IS ENOUGH FOR THEY. SO DONT BE AFRAID FOR THAT... SO IF YOUR LOOKING FOR FRIENDLY STAFF HOTEL, GOOD BREAKFAS FOR GOOD PRICE AND STAY CLOSE TO EVERYTHING YOU CAN COUNT WITH SERALAGO HOTEL. LOOK MY SERALAGO PHOTOS..

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BELIEVE THE BAD REVIEWS”
Reviews.Author: kathytalksalot
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to book this place because I read some pretty bad reviews but I needed a place to stay with my husband and 2 boys (ages 17 and 10) that was affordable while we visited Universal and Islands of Adventure. We were very happy with the Seralago!! For a great price, It was very clean, the sheets DID fit the matresses fine, nothing was broken, it was spacious and my kids loved the arcade center. The pool was heated (hot!) It was really chilly when we were there so we made a mad dash for the pool (it had steam coming off it!) They provided pool floats (noodles).Hot tub was clean and relaxing. The staff was very helpful. The parks closed early so it was convenient being right next to Old Town. It was a delightful little carnival-like amusement park only one block down and we walked there and back. We had a great time and will definitely stay again when we visit my parents in Orlando and drive up to Disney in the years to come. We brought a few groceries, kept them in the fridge and had cereal and muffins, etc. in our room so we could spend more money in the parks!! It was fun!

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: UkJetsetter
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned when i read some of the reviews about this hotel prior to my holiday last year. Myself and a friend went on a girls shopping holiday leaving the hubbys behind and we stayed here for a week. On arrival the check in staff were polite and friendly, and 1 of the staff who was just going off duty took our bags to our room which was in the 2nd block. The room wasnt huge but it was a good size it had 2 double beds and it was CLEAN as was the bathroom (but the bathroom was rather on the small side) . Our room was cleaned and tidied everyday by hotel staff. The grounds of the hotel (in my oppinion) were in good condition, no litter but the paving on the 2nd block could do with a little TLC. The restaraunts offered a nice range of foods at all times of the day at good prices. The location is fantastic you are within walking distance of shops, bars, restaraunts and defanetly go to the old town for a night out especially if you are into cars and motorbikes. Oh and almost forgetting a 5min drive from Disney and 10min drive from the Shopping Malls (my fave). All in all we enjoyed our stay however I would not reccommend it for honeymooners, but if your a young couple, group of teengers, shopaholics or simply dont want to pay the Disney prices I would recommend that you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: tarch
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, Great location for all around things to do. However the rooms really need to be updated, built in the 70's you can tell. If you have kids and need some where in expensive and don't care about what the rooms look like then go for it., the pools where very nice kept and alot of security made me feel safe. Very helpful staff and maid service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in a great location - heated pool”
Reviews.Author: Mishy119
Reviews.Content: I booked the Seralago Hotel for 5 nights - at a great deal $45.00. Basic Room. I wanted the kid suites but they were $75.00 - do not do it, unless you will have more than 2 kids - its a basic room - same size - with a half wall - with the bunk beds and single bed. My room was basic - well worn, but clean. It had a refrigerator and microwave. No coffee maker. Room was cleaned daily. The back pool was heated and very nice. The air conditioner is loud on high - which was perfect as you could not hear anyone else in the rooms surrounding us. The front desk area was clean, updated and very nice personnel. Check in and check out was very simple and easy. The location is fabulous - a mile from Disney entrance, walk to Old Town which was a blast of fun. You can walk to various restaurants and stores. We did not try the shuttle service as we had a car. We did not try the breakfast or any of the food in the hotel. The gift shop was sweet and not too expensive. If you are looking for a place to stay cheaply - where you are not spending much time in your room this is it and its fine. I am sure there are nicer rooms, but for my price range - it worked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: dmglck
Reviews.Content: We scoured the internet for the best vacation package at the best price and fortunately, we found it. The price, location, amenities and staff all made for a relaxing stay at the Seralago. The kids loved the kids suite, pool and game room. We visited Universal, Hollywood Studios, Wonderworks, Al Capone's and Old Town all of which are a short drive from the hotel. The room could use some updated paint and breakfast at 8.99 was high in my opinion, but if they are the only criticisms, well then, you can't beat it. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat for the price”
Reviews.Author: beckyfromtennessee
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property 10+ times over the past 15 years. It was the Holiday Inn Maingate East until a few years ago. The Travelodge across the street is now the HI-MGE. Go figure; I think this property has much nicer grounds and pools. The pools were heated to a comfortable temperature for December. The courtyards around each pool were landscaped and maintained beautifully. The rooms are dated but very well maintained and clean. Some bathrooms have a second outside sink which is very helpful when a family is in a rush to get to the parks in the morning. The bathrooms look old, but are clean and functional. The rooms themselves appear to have been updated in wallpaper, paint, bedding, etc. The carpet is hit or miss. There is a minifridge and microwave in each room. The buildings are two stories and there is no elevator. Parking is very convenient and security patrols often. Ice machines always were in good working order. The front desk people are very pleasant. There are many restaurants within walking distance. There is a Mcdonald's across the street we drive through for a quick breakfast on the way to Disney. We look forward to a stay there in a few weeks. The grounds around the pools are just beautiful! We have stayed at the Value Resorts on Disney property and this is better to us than the All Stars but not as good as Pop Century because our room there seemed brand new. And it is about half the price of Disney resorts! If you are going to the theme parks and just need a clean bed and hot shower, this is one of your best choices for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in 8 years visiting Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: Old-Ford28
Reviews.Content: It's not the prettiest place, but for the money it is the best motel we have visited on IBMH (RT-192) in 8 years. We have tried a lot of the lowest priced motels on this strip and were very pleased with the room and service. The room was nearly new and very clean. It had an excellent TV and air conditioner. There was no musty smell that you normally have at the less expensive motels in Florida. We will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place! If U Have Kids You Must Get Suite W/Fort”
Reviews.Author: debbradavis
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 days and 2 nights Feb 2008. Rooms were clean and the kids LOVED the fort!!! Felt like they had their own hotel room! Staff was great! ALL of them from the front desk clerk to our waiter who stayed attentive to my 3 small ones. They really went far and beyond what my husband and I expected. There are nightly movies in a special room for the older kids,. I loved that they had a general store for milk, sodas, snacks. They have a game room for the kids, big and small. Overall, for the price, you just can't beat it! We always saw either securuty, personell everywhere. They have a laundry mat on premises as well which was nice and clean. I am not sure that someone without a family would enjoy this place as much as people with children do. This REALLY is a family hotel...... Thank you Seralago and staff........ I look forward to seeing you all soon......

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: gr8trip4U
Reviews.Content: On Hotels.com the review of the hotel talks about the 2 restaurants on the property, wireless internet, and many other accomodations. It also advertises that kids eat free! I called the hotel to get accurate directions as I was exiting the highway. The hotel employee told me to go north about 15 minutes from the highway. After traveling 20 minutes and not finding the hotel, I called back and the same girl told me I went the wrong way. I replied to her that she was the one who advised me of the inaccurate directions. When we finally arrived 45 minutes later, it was pouring down rain and so we decided to eat on the property at one of the 2 restaurants. When we walked into the lobby it was full of people trying to get internet access, because that was the only place to get it, not in your rooms. We proceeded to the restaurant only to find out it is open for breakfast ONLY. That was not stated on the website. The other "restaurant" was a deli/ convenience store and kids do not eat free there. But who wants to have a Saturday evening dinner with your family at a convenience store? The rooms were moldy smelling, but the colors were nice. The buildings themselves looked like they needed repairs and made you wonder how they ever passed a codes inspection. The hotel has a lot of potential, we just think it may not be manged very well. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: califyrman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful trip to Orlando. My family of three stayed at the Seralago for seven nights. We got an awesome price of $36 a night plus tax through Hotwire. When we travel my family usually stays at a Day's Inn or something similar. If you are used to this type of hotel, you will be very happy with this establishment. I was happy to find a micro fridge and a microwave in our room. This made it very nice for a quick and easy breakfast before going to the parks. We stocked the fridge from a close by Super Wal Mart. Driving time to Disney Parks was no longer than 10 minutes. There were no extra charges, such as a resort fee. There were two heated pools that we did not have time to use. We did use the laundry facility ($4 to wash and dry not including detergent $1 for this on site or $3 for a weeks supply at Wal-Mart). There is an onsite bar and restaurant which we also did not use. Our room faced the Old Downtown. There was a band playing one night that we were able to hear, but not too loud that we could not sleep. We were at the amusement park all day everyday and I don't think a plane flying over could have awaken us. It was about an eight minute walk to old downtown. It was very nice and offered a lot of things to do for the family; kind of like the San Francisco Wharf (Pier 39)blended with a Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk. Within walking distance there is a Burger King, McDonalds, KFC and a Red Lobster. Just a little further there is a $3.99 breakfast at the Ponderosa that was better than I would expect for that price. My check in went really fast, but I arrived late at night. I noticed quite a few tour busses. This facility is pretty big, not what I had expected. The street to enter the Seralago had a stoplight and the street is named after the hotel. I have no complaints with this property and I would stay here again if I were traveling to Orlando. The hotel room is a little outdated and not a perfect room, but it was perfect for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Old Girl”
Reviews.Author: Strwbrypop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Seralago about 18 months ago and could find almost nothing worthy about it. Although some things were better this time; desk personnel, cleanliness, etc., it is still an older hotel that is making do with good maid service and pretty poor conditions. To wit: The mattress in their kingsize was so broken down so as to give someone with a bad back a very painful few days. The shower managed to trickle and little else. Although towels were plentiful and bright white, they were bedsheet thin. It took a few to dry an adult body. The hotel gives the impression of someone hanging on by offering low prices and figuring that people would put up with the worn out aspects of the hotel for the sake of savings. However, as I travel to Kissimmee several times a year, I can attest that there are better bargains available, and more than just a few.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSunlover11
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed when arriving and wished I had booked with another property immediately! The poolside "Non-Smoking" room reeked of cigar smoke and had ashtrays everywhere! The room was clean but very worn and outdated. My seven year old granddaughter complained that her back hurt each morning after sleeping on the cheap mattresses. The walls are very thin too...I could hear everything going on in the room next door. I would not reccommend eating at the food court either. We ordered pizza and salad after a long day, it was horrible! Many of the arcade games took your tokens and didn't work. There was no one available there to make refunds or help. We were told that we had to go to the front desk for any problems in the arcade, which had a very long line. We cut our stay there by two days and headed to the ocean! Remember the saying "you get what you pay for"! In this case, I would say "you get LESS than you pay for"! I would suggest spending a few extra dollars and book somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel but Shuttle is Awful”
Reviews.Author: 4crest
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days at Seralago for easy access to Disney World. For the price, Seralago is adequate. Bed and bath are clean, front desk were helpful with our questions about Disney World, and the small grocery shop is convenient. The housekeeping tip envelope is borderline questionable to me especially when housekeeping knocks at our door despite the "Do not disturb" sign. But the real problem is not with Seralago. The most aversive experience was the shuttle company MCOExpress that Seralago has chosen to partner with. Seralago guests took about 60% of the passengers in these big buses yet we were picked up last, which meant that we were always standing in a crowded bus. The drivers of MCOExpress were NASTY! They angrily barked at guests telling them to have kids sit and adults stand, then crammed people tightly into the bus. One female bus driver yelled at this Asian tourist woman's face (2 inches away from her face) about her child having to find a seat. Another male bus driver in his microphone was complaining how a woman did not understand which hotel drop-offs the buses were going to. So the bus driver warned that he better not get any more complaints. Meanwhile, he also said to a crowded bus, "Perhaps you should reconsider your next vacation and go to Vegas instead". To top it all, he ends his angry tirade with "Tips are greatly appreciated." The lack of decorum with these bus drivers is incredible. So we left Orlando Florida with three big questions. 1) Why are these bus drivers so angry at the tourists? 2) Why is MCOExpress cramming the buses with so many tourists? 3) Why is Seralago partnering with MCOExpress?

Reviews.Title: “Good stay,good price”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller10077
Reviews.Content: I booked this reservation weeks inadvance, for a one bedroom suite.It was exactly as pictured in the photos. I also added another room to our reservation for another couple and this was accomodated. The maid service was excellent, and everyone was pleasant to deal with. We stayed over the Christmas holidays, so the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Older but nice!”
Reviews.Author: shrimpchic
Reviews.Content: Older but nice hotel. Front staff (check -in) was nice but extremely slow. Hotel was kept up in good condition for its age. Nice landscaping. Always plenty of staff around. New mattresses would be a plus. We stayed there for 5 nights. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, if that good”
Reviews.Author: JoeFal
Reviews.Content: Hotel looked a lot better from the front. The back is old an run down. The rooms need some serious renovations, and at best they were cleanish, but not really what I would call clean

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but cheap”
Reviews.Author: chrisinrochester
Reviews.Content: $69 room rate was nice. Staff was nice. Location was handy right on 192 so reasonably handy for the disney parks. All four of our party's rooms were very very stinky musty; otherwise clean enough. Beds were typical cheap mattress, cheap bedding. Furnishings and fixtures typical of older budget properties. The common areas seemed pretty good with a snack bar, a little store and what looked to be a decent pool. Again, the staff was amazingly well trained, prompt and polite. A model of customer service. Wasnt a terrible value, but I'll try someplace else next time.

Reviews.Title: “All around, good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: yiota14
Reviews.Content: This review is to replace a previous review, which has been deleted. It was deleted because the Seralago Hotel did a great job in resolving a discrepancy with the price I was charged for the room. I went from completely dissatisfied to satisfied. I am increasingly impressed that, after I left, I was contacted by the GM to resolve the problem. If you are coming to Florida for the whole “Disney trip” experience, then Seralago is the cheapest way to go because you are only really at the hotel to shower and sleep. If you are thinking about booking the breakfast with your room, think about this first: you are getting up early to go to the parks and beat the crowd. Who really is going to have time for breakfast at the hotel?? Why not just grab something small at the parks? Honestly, the buffet is not all that great, but the menu is okay. Just skip booking the breakfast all together and stop at Dunkin Donuts (down the street) and eat along the way to the park. Problem solved. Other than that, the hotel was okay. You get what you pay for, but I think in the end, this hotel is good to stay at if you’re in Florida for the “Disney” experience. OOOOhhhh and if you stay here, you HAVE to eat dinner at “Pacinos” which is on the same road as the hotel. It’s a big Italian restaurant, definitely a gem!!! We all ate every bite on our place. So stop there for dinner, you won’t regret it. Not to mention the VERY fun amusement park right next to the hotel. They have THE best go-carts ever, and a fun mini golf place too. And NO LINES! So, to sum up the whole Seralago Hotel; good and cheap place to stay, fun amusement park next door, and surrounded by great restaurants on your off-days from Disney. If you have any problems with the hotel, management is very good about resolving them. Just call instead of going to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality - Try other hotels before booking this”
Reviews.Author: Mikkimauss
Reviews.Content: This is definitely NOT a 3 stars hotel. 2 stars maybe, not 3. When I wanted to check in, we found out that Expedia messed up my reservation; the front desk staff was not interested in helping me (A lady with a bad attitude said: Next time book with us, not with Expedia). I had no choice but calling Expedia and put a nice Indian guy on the phone with that not very nice manager, the guy confirmed that my stay was paid and will send a fax with a voucher whithin 10 minutes and the front desk manager with a really bad attitude didn't belive in Expedia (their partner in business) and didn't give me the keys to my room until the fax came in. A very frustrating experience with a bad hotel staff with NO customer service skills or trining at all. This is an old Holiday Inn recycled with a new name, so the rooms are old, They are OK but everything (TV, Fridge, Microwave and VCR??Yes they have old VCRs!!!) mattresses and pillows were really old. They have a "Kids eat free" special which is a CATCH! The $8 breakfast buffet doesn't have anything but eggs, sausage, pancakes and 2 choices of old fruit. The price does not include beverages and a 15% for a terrible service is included in the bill. The bottom line: It's one of the worst breakfast you will have and the most expensive one ($25 for 2 people). If you don't have choice and go to this 2 Star hotel, you better try a nice, clean and modern Mc. Donald's accross the street for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the two room suite with my husband and four stepdaughters while we did the Disney thing! The room was clean and very good size. No problems with checking in or out. The only downside was the two beds in the bedroom were only doubles and not Queen size. Other than that it went great! We didn't use the hotel much due to jam packed days at Disney. But the hottub and pool were nice (we did use those a few time). That was in May, and we're going on a cruise in Nov via Orlando and are staying here again the night before we leave for the port! That has to say something on what we thought of the hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Value in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: KarenGregNY
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit sceptical. I booked the hotel as a package deal. My husband and I are both quite picky and I hoped not to loose my job as family travel agent! However, when I arrived, we were both pleasantly surprised. The lobby was bright and welcoming with a nice gift shop, tourist desk and food court. There was also a restaurant and bar. Although the bar is not open on Mondays and Tuesdays. The room was large and very clean. I did not have any issues that have been mentioned here about soiled linens and poor upkeep of the room. The bathroom was a particular standout. The maid service was prompt and reliable. An abundance of new towels arrived daily. The pools were advertised as heated, however I'm not sure they were. It could be that the hotel decided that it was still too hot in Orlando to put on the heaters -- it was 95 degrees that week. The tiki bar & snack bar had inconsistent hours and high prices. But the drinks and food items were decent. I would stay here again on another visit to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lizziebEngland
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Seralago a couple of times before and were really disappointed to see how run down it has become. The room furnishings were shabby and worn, the bed creaked and groaned every time you moved on it and the wall light was full of rust which was probably accounted for by the really damp, musty smell in the room. Most of the staff are not aware of the new policy of having safe deposit boxes in the hotel office rather than the ones in the room (which they are decommissioning) - so we wasted an hour waiting for a security guard to come to the room to show us how to work the one in the room (all the numbers bar 3 were missing on the dial) only to find out about the new policy when I rang to see how much longer we would have to wait for the guard to appear!!! It didn't fill you with much confidence that one would actually appear if there was a real emergency!! The lobby bar was only open Wed to Sunday and the one night we did try to use it it had closed at 9pm. The Tiki bar seats were appalling with straps missing on most of the chairs. We will not be going back and would not recommend it to any of our family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great last-minute choice!”
Reviews.Author: Devyl_Gyrl
Reviews.Content: My friend had stayed at the Seralago previously, and had a much better experience. When we originally tried to book a room, we were told none were available. We persistently called the entire way down to Orlando, until we finally got a "yes" from the hotel staff and were able to book a room for our entire stay. The rooms were not as nice as my friend remembered, but they were adequate. The pool was delightful, the kids LOVED the arcade. The food left a lot to be desired, but we don't plan on eating there next time. The staff was pretty friendly, and when I complained they were happy to try and help me work through the few issues I had. I'll stay here again (in fact, we're going to be there in December). If the service slacks off, we'll find someplace different ... otherwise, the close proximity to EVERYTHING makes this the perfect place to hang out in the evenings!

Reviews.Title: “Dirt cheap and kinda smelly.”
Reviews.Author: ElenaAP
Reviews.Content: I knew going in this place wasn't the top of the line, but it was ridiculously cheap and what I needed for the time I spent in Orlando. The location was ok -- certainly not great. Then again, like I said, it was dirt cheap. The room smelled like a pool, and it was a bit dingy and banged up. But there was a mini-refrigerator and a microwave (great for budget travelers). Plenty of parking and helpful staff (if you ask).

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a good experience..........”
Reviews.Author: SmokyMtnMan6643
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Seralago on August 15-17, 2007. I just want to say that we had the Kid's Suite, and were very satisfied. Front desk staff were very polite, and for the most part, helpful. We did have one instance where the front desk gave us some wrong information on the Disney Shuttle schedule, and we got stuck at Disney World, and had to pay $20.00 for another bus to take us back to our room at midnight, a bus which wasn't supposed to go to our motel. Went right in and told the lady at the front desk, and she told us there was no manager on duty at that hour, and she couldn't help us. The booklet inside the room said there would be a manager on duty 24-hours a day. Anyway, no help that night. But early the next morning, we went in the office and talked to Jan, the manager of the property about our problem. I must say that I was expecting an argument, but the manager was very professional, polite, and made everything right to our satisfaction....no questions asked. Very impressive. Beyond that, the location is great, the rooms are older, but clean, and our kids LOVED the kid's suite and the arcade. We left very satisfied, and plan to come again next year.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: granpeggy2004
Reviews.Content: My son and I and his friend and mother spent five nights there, just last week. The boys are 13 and they liked it just fine. The front desk people were especially nice and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. There were stores there to buy any thing that you wanted or needed. The location was close to all the places we wanted to visit. I could not communicate with the housekeepers since I did not speak her language. The bartender at the poolside bar was not well versed on the way to mix drinks, so we drank what he could mix. All in all, it was a very nice stay, and people should try to work with management when there are problems.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe what you see on the internet!”
Reviews.Author: canuckOttawa
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Seralago because we couldn't check into another resort until the next day. Hotels.com has photos of the hotel and a 3-star rating, so thought it would be a safe bet. WOW! Were we in for a surprise! Our room was dirty, bugs in the bath tub, a drain filled with hair and mattresses that were ripped. We have two young children (1 and 3) whom I didn't want to touch anything. When we checked out bright and early since we were uncomfortable and couldn't sleep due to all of the noise, the front desk never asked if we enjoyed our stay...maybe my face told the story. DO NOT stay at SERALAGO!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TLB18
Reviews.Content: This was NOT anywhere near as bad as some people have posted on here.... You will want to stay in the main building next to the lobby and facing the pool! We had a group stay here and EVERY one of our requests was met! The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was Blah. But there are MANY other options with in walking distance. Old town is right next door. You get what you pay for... You are not going to get a Ritz room for these rates. Heck you are not going to get a Hampton inn for these rates. This hotel is less then 5 minutes to Disney! If you are looking for and discounted place to sleep after a long day at one of the parks. This place is it! If you are planning on spending a bunch of time in your room you may want to look elsewhere. Rooms were basic older hotel rooms with not many frills. Pools were GREAT!! Make sure you request a room in the main building next to the lobby and ask to have your room facing the pool! These rooms were perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “stay here only if your on a very tight budget”
Reviews.Author: SHFT54
Reviews.Content: I consider myself a low maintence person. I never complain, but this hotel is not very nice or clean. I live in Miami, my girlfriend and I decided last minute to go to Orlando. We didn't feel like spending much on a hotel and this placed seemed like a good deal. It was very cheap, but we got what we paid for, there were cigarette burns in the comforter, the carpet was very and worn dirty(who knows how old it is), the mattresses were very uncomfortable, and everything was out of date.....it's basically a budget hotel from the 70's. Luckily we didn't spend much time in the room. It is however very close to the Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely terrible”
Reviews.Author: socalgummibear
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that Seralago is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at. Service was slow and inefficient. When I checked in, I had to wait in line for over 20 minutes since there was only one clerk at the desk. When I finally got to my room, I was suprised to find that someone else was already in my room. I went back to the front desk to have them clear up the problem, and after waiting another 20 minutes I was given another room. The room I was given was minimal and borderline clean. In the evening I was leaving the room and found that the door would not lock. I called the front desk to have them fix the door. Maintenance came sprayed some lubricant on it, slammed the door a few times and said the door was fixed or so it appeared. The following evening I was leaving and noticed that the door was not locking again. I called the front desk for repair. I waited over 30 minutes, maintenance never showed up, and I had to leave, so I had a travel friend wait for them. When I arrived back, I found that the hotel had put the security lock on my room as they could not fix the door. The front desk informed me that they could not remove the security lock until the next morning and gave me another room to stay in. I could not even get into my room to get my belongings. The front desk said that was all they could do, told me to have a pleasant night, and gave no apology. Luckily, one of my travel companions was able to open the security lock (questionable hotel safety ) and I was able to retrieve my belongings after midnight. The third room that I was given, I am happy to say had a locking door, but this was greatly outweighed by the stained, ripped sheets and dirty bathroom. I have to say this was the worst experience that I have ever had at any hotel and strongly recommend anyone considering staying here to think twice!

Reviews.Title: “I never took off my shoes”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_Island_Girl
Reviews.Content: Our softball team stayed at the Seralago because it was one of the host hotels sponsored by USSSA. If I could do it all over again, I would have paid the penalty and opted to stay at a non-sponsored hotel. We probably would have paid less than the so-called "discounted" rate and have gotten better rooms and service. Half of the rooms smelled; the first thing a lot of us did was get air fresheners. I never took my shoes off (get it?). One of the rooms had a faulty lock and so you could get in by pushing on the door hard enough. Basically, that meant you couldn't leave your room. Those guests eventually were moved to another room. The hotel does not have a business center, so if you need to access the internet or do any computer network business, good luck trying to find a semi-quiet place to work! The pool had hair weaves floating all over; it was quite disgusting. The property is really run down and the neon lights do not help. The only good thing going for Seralago is that it is close to other attractions and restaurants (I would not recommend eating at their cafe). Recommendation: look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for visit to Disney world”
Reviews.Author: ralfvd
Reviews.Content: The Seralago hotel is perfectly located for your trips to Disney; it is a 10 minute drive away. The hotel itself is somewhat old and you shouldn't expect too much, but given the price, it is more than worth it. It has two swimming pools which have late opening hours (10 or 11pm). Nearby are lots of restaurants and shops to get some breakfast, which is probably cheaper than in the hotel itself. Internet access is available in the lobby and free. In conclusion: if you just need a bed to sleep in and a pool to cool down from the Orlando heat, this is a fine hotel for its price. Don't expect any luxury and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: WirZwei
Reviews.Content: This place is great if you're on a budget. It's close, it's clean, it has a nice pool, it's been fairly recently renovated, and it has good shuttle service. So if your concerned about reviews panning this place, keep it in perspective. We booked this hotel at a jaw-breakingly low price and figured we were taking a risk - not at all. You'll have a great stay. (But I would request 2nd floor if you can - it's all Motel style)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: dibbledeedoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights and although the hotel is not brand spanking new, it is the basis for a good holiday - with all the essentials - and good service. Staff were sweet and helpful at all times, rooms were cleaned ever day; fresh towels, beds made; and the air conditioning was super. The food court is handy for drinks and snacks, and the bar does a yummy Pina Colada! The place has the appearance of being a little run down, but it really is a pleasant enviroment; an ideal location which is ideal for Old Town and Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: dragonjulie
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great from the the outside. As we pulled up it looked quite classy. The reception area was clean and bright and the staff were helpful. The room (we had the kids suite) was clean and of the same basic style as many hotels in this price range. The kid suite part was great for my son as he had his own TV. The bathroom area was large and clean. We used the pool a couple of times and it was clean and warm. There is a bar area within the pool which was a nice touch. There is also a small playground which my son enjoyed. The breakfast was OK. There is a buffet which really didn't have a nice selection for the price. The staff were really nice and helpful. One morning I asked for a fruit salad and a waitress, after checking the selection available, advised me against it as the fruit didn't look good. A welcome touch rather than serving up terrible food. The hotels best feature is that it is very close to Disney's maingate. Finding Disney was easy but finding the hotel again after was a nightmare. The disney resort roads are very badly signed and as you exit a park on a different road than you entered it is almost impossible to follow any map as you don't know what road you have exited onto. All in all a fairly pleasant stay and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Zoiezmom
Reviews.Content: Overall the property was a good place to stay, especially with kids. A few issues but nothing major. Small line at check in but we were greeted nicely and quickly on our way. We were on the 2nd floor. Didn't have any major issues with the rooms. It was pretty standard for a hotel. It was clean and smelled fine to us. Well stocked with towels and toiletries. The room had a microwave and small refridgerator. We were only there for one night but that would have been nice for a longer stay. There are 2 pools, 2 hottubs, a kiddie pool and playground. We walked down to the hottub that evening. Both pools appeared to clean. Plenty of chairs, etc. One of the hot tubs was empty and not working which resulted in the other being somewhat crowded. The kiddie pool was standard but looked nice and clean. Had my daughter been with us I'm sure she would have loved it as well as the playgrounds. They had 2 playgrounds. One was really nice, similar to what you'd find in a park. The other was pretty basic though. I don't think my 5 yr old daughter would have even been interested. The arcade appeared clean and had lots of kids enjoying it. The store also was a nice addition. I ntoiced a sign that advertised family movies played each night. They were all just released movies. A pretty good selection that would have definately appealed to my daughter. Like I said, overall this is a pretty good facility for the price you pay. If you're not looking for frills this should suit you just fine. The location is great. Right next door to Old Town and plenty of shopping and food within walking distance. I noticed they had a shuttle service to the parks but we had our own car.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff - easy on the pocket book”
Reviews.Author: FloridafunNaplesFL
Reviews.Content: We live in FL. and travel to Orlando several times a year. It's not the Ritz, but it does fine for a place to sleep for the night, as we are gone most of the day. Our room was clean and we had a safe and mini refrigerator. The bathroom area is just ok. It would be nice if they had queen size beds. I personally always like to stay in a pool side room. The pool area is fairly nice; they also have a mini food bar by the pool. I think they have refurbished the rooms closest to the front of the building a few years ago, by now they may have finished the rest located in the back. They have two pools. I like to stay at the pool towards the front as it is closest to the lobby, mini mart, and game room that my kids enjoy; plus I have a comfort level of safety towards the front which is inside the courtyard where the pool is located. We just stayed there June 07 and I can't complain for the price. In the evenings we would walk over to Old Town and on the weekend we had fun watching the car show. This hotel is very close to everything - whether you go to the left or the right -- several restaurants, stores, shopping, and a hop-skip and a jump from all the Disney parks. I've also stayed at 4 star hotels in Orlando which my family and I love. But, for the same amount of $$ in comparison we were able to extend our vacation several days because we got such a great room rate at the Seralogo. The hotel staff was very accommodating and pleasant. Would I always like to stay at a 4 star hotel? Sure, but sometimes with 3 kids my budget does not allow that. -- We still had a great time and we have a lot of nice memories from our trip without breaking the bank.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: ssvensson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Seralago Hotel and Suites for the last week in May 2007. Overall it was an ok experience. We were dissapointed upon arrival. From the front it looked nice enough. When we got to the rooms they looked worn from the outside, like they are in need of refurbishments. When we stepped into the rooms, similar situation. The room left much to be desired. The carpet was damp also which was strange. For the most part, however it was fairly clean. The maid kept it clean and neat throughout our 4 night stay. The hotel itself was more family friendly for those of you with small children. The decor was geared towards children. There was an arcade and a pool and jacuzzi. There is a small food court and a restaraunt that has a breakfast buffet. The breakfast buffet had a decent variety and was ok, nothing special, just ok. Fortunately our trip did not have us in our room very much so it worked out ok. We basically just slept there and took an occasional swim. Location wise, it is right next to Old Town, so you can walk and there is shopping and amusement rides, mini golf, etc. It is about 5 minutes from the entrance to Disney and about 15-20 minutes to Universal. So, If you are going on a trip and focusing more on the hotel, then I might not reccommend this hotel, however, if you were going just to sleep and then heading out to the parks, then it might work out ok.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here! (Unless you're brave)”
Reviews.Author: TeenTraveler123
Reviews.Content: I hated this hotel. My family and I actually left after the first night. Now, ok, the room was ok, not too bad, but certainly not nice. The outside of the hotel looked wonderful, but as soon as we rounded the corner we felt extremely unsafe. There were extremely rowdy and rough individuals all over the balconies. We actually pushed the couch against our door after a fight broke out outside because it made us feel unsafe. The lobby and main areas of the hotel were also extremely run down, and the outside (especially the pool) looked terrible. It looked like a great deal on paper, but in reality it was awful. When we cancelled our reservations the next morning, three other families were doing the same.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: lafprop
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about staying here because of the reviews. But we went ahead and booked a suite for 2 weeks. It was great. The hotel property is big .We had a poolside room and the suite is very large, not to mention the bathroom. Everything about it was great, the pool is clean and open to midnight which was great after a day at the parks. The housekeeping was great, the room was cleaned and always stocked. The food court was great when we got too tired to eat out. It is very close to Disney and in the middle of restaurants and Old Town. We were very pleased with this hotel and would tell everyone with a family to book it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellerCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We are 2 couples travelling to USA for the first time. Orlando was our first stop and having booked all our accommodation through the internet we hoped for the best. Having travelled by air for nearly 22 hours we were very tired and just wanted to get to our hotel ASAP. The hotel was a nice surprise. We had a pool side room on the ground floor near the hotel entrance. Everything was very neat and the hotel staff was very friendly and really went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. The hotel was conveniently located near to a lot of fast foods shops, supermarket and gift shops and it is safe to walk around there. There is also a laundry which is very clean. It was also a 2 minute walk to Old Town where there is a lot of stores and restaurants. The first night there was a car show on and the last night of our stay a biker night - which was all very interesting and nice to see. A bus picked us up every morning to the parks and there were different time schedules to plan your return in the evening. We also booked our trips to the theme parks at the hotel. For 1st time travellers to the area it was conveniently located and fulfilled all our needs. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on a budget, but who still wants a nice, clean hotel in walking distance of shops, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Stay Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: cardinalair77
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant about staying here in this hotel due to the variety of reviews, but once I got there and settled down I did not want to leave. The rooms were well kept. The pool was beautiful. And the best part about it was Old Town was right next door which gave me and my daughter plenty of things to do. Old Town has rides, old shops, car shows, miniature golf, it was great! I will definetely stay here again. I did no want to go home. IF your hesitant like I was just do it, you will not be disappointed. Trust me...

Reviews.Title: “Run don't walk away”
Reviews.Author: TravelDivaCharlotte
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read more of the reviews for the Seralogo resort (yeah right) before I drove from NC with two children. I stayed at this resort when it was the Holiday Inn back in '98. We booked the kids suite and really didn't have a complaint. Boy have things changed. When we checked in it was past midnight so to pass judgment on the grounds would be unfair. However, our room was on the 2nd floor and on the first floor there was a big garbage bin that some raccoons had decided to make their home for the evening. We had to walk around the building to another stairway to get to our room. That was the beginning of the end. We entered the room there wasn't anything special about the room. Just basics. That would have been fine however as soon as I sat on the bed my daughter notice some type of beetle/bug on my bed pillow. I tried to get it and missed it. Who knows where it ended up. I called down to the desk to tell them about the raccoons. I was told that security would be told to move the garbage bin. That never happened. The room was so old and worn down I didn't want the kids to touch the floor in their bare feet. The beds were horrible, it was like sleeping on the floor. I want to know when was the last time mattresses were brought. The bathroom was disgusting. Rusty door, bathtub never looked clean. Hair from previous visitors still in tub. I didn't allow the kids to take showers for the three nights we were there. The next day when we left for the parks I noticed the grounds. The grounds could be nice if they were maintained. There were palms that I know were once beautiful but now their poor roots were exposed and they just looked neglected. In fact the whole place needs renovation. My daughter begged me from night 1 to please find another place for us to stay. I did feel bad for her because she is somewhat of a germaphope and it must have been extra hard for her. Even my niece who ususally is very easy going was disturbed with the facility. The only upside of it was we were hardly ever there. I should have left after night one but I didn't think i would get my money back. I would never stay there again. I understand these reviews are individual perspectives but when I read some reviews that have this hotel listed as a '4' I wonder what some people are accustomed to.

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel stay was just OK!”
Reviews.Author: CSA.all.the.way
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off by saying that my family and I travel quite a bit and have stayed in MANY hotels.. so this is my honest review... My husband and I, along with our 6 year old son stayed at Seralago from April 21-28. When we first arrived and found our room, I immediately wanted OUT! I am not a picky person by any means but I didn't like the smell of the room, the stains on the carpet and the marks on the walls. However, after being there a couple of days, it didn't seem so bad. I basically made sure we all had clean linens everyday and towels. The pool area was surprisingly nice and well maintained. After a few days, I was not so bothered by all of it but I would definitely not pick this hotel again. The staff seemed friendly and immediately came to our rescue after finding out the toilet was not functioning. We really enjoyed out stay in Florida and made the best of the situation. I realize that I paid a modest amount to stay here so I just bit the bullet. I do not think that this place is in any way a 3 star. If you already booked this hotel, just make the best of it as we did.. If your considering this hotel, my advice would be to continue looking.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: jusandnew
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Easter weekend and St.Patrick's weekend. On St.Patrick's weekend I had the Magic card and they were going to charge me a totally different price , until I spoke with the manager. We were moved twice. The only room that was clean was the kids suite. The first room was nasty. The carpet smelled and dirty. Only 3 towels for 4 people. The room was very hard to find. We came back on Easter weekend. They did not have any kids suite , so we had a regular room. The door barely shut. Very noisey. Did not have enough towels. The room was very nastey. The people in the restranats and the little caferteria was very nice. Every time I call and stay I have the magic card there are no rooms , until I stay I will pay regualr price. We stay there 1 year ago and it was nicer. The rooms are old and NASTY. If you can get the kids suite then your room will be clean. We are coming back to Orlando in May and will not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Josie214
Reviews.Content: I'm happy to say I have a positive review, esp. after reading some of the negatives posted above. We stayed here during the busy Easter weekend. Granted the check-in time was lengthy, but there seemed to be plenty of staff working to speed up the process. I reserved a King, non-smoking room on the 2nd floor and was pleasantly surprised to find a very clean, in good repair room. We found no problems with any aspect of our stay. The mattress was adequate, but one should not expect top-quality furnishings in a hotel of this price-range. I did notice that the bed linens as well as curtains appeared to be fairly new or at least not worn. Our room was cleaned thoroughly each day. During our stay, we noticed staff continously cleaning and attending to the pool area, volleyball court and gardens. There are quite a few buildings to this complex and I imagine your experience may vary depending on where you stay and the age of the building. I would stay here again, but I would definitely reserve the King, non-smoking room again. We also had a small dog with us and they have a designated pet area, including "baggies" to clean up, which came in handy, as I didn't want our dog to ruin their landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the value”
Reviews.Author: miller8595
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our trip to Orlando, FL. We stayed at the Seralago Hotel and Suites. Actually, the name is deceiving. This is actually an old motel. The rooms were dirty - you could not walk without shoes in your room. The service was terrible. You had to wait in long lines at the front desk, only to be "greeted" by someone who is obviously annoyed by having to deal with customers. The beds were very uncomfortable. My husband had neck and back problems from sleeping on them. You could actually feel the springs in your back. Also, if you stay here, you should remember to bring shampoo, conditioner and soap as they left the same bottle of shampoo and same bar of soap for the entire week we were there. They are close to Disney, however, with the construction, this exit was detoured and it took us extra time to get back to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our purposes”
Reviews.Author: expat_in_Japan
Reviews.Content: I agree with the person who posted previously. I was worried about what we would find after reading reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. NO it's not a 5 star hotel, but we were rarely there, needing it only as a place to sleep between park visits. We had poolside suites on the second floor that were larger than more modern suite hotel rooms -- my family of 2 adults and 2 small children shared the sizeable bedroom, while my mother slept on the murphy bed and my cousin on the pullout. Would have been nice to have another bathroom but for the price, you make do. The pool was big and a comfortable temperature, the room was cleaned every day and a couple of small complaints we had were tended to immediately. Would have liked to have had some utensils/dishes in the bar area. We had the breakfast buffet every morning and it was ok -- standard fare. Wait staff was always helpful and friendly. There were some school groups there when we were there who were noisy in the pool until late at night, but one call to security and things were quickly toned down. One point -- when my Mom booked the place, the website said it was a kids eat free policy in the Vineyard Dining Room for breakfast and dinner. That was true for breakfast, but the Vineyard is no longer open for dinner. We had a group with a total of 9 children, and had budgeted for the kids eat free thing so were a bit concerned about that, but when we showed the website printout to the manager he quickly made it right. He reduced our room rate by an amount equal to the value of the applicable kids' meals for the week we were there. We were very pleased by his prompt attention and acceptance of responsibility.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: cbaire
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Seralago the week of March 12, 2007. I was very nervous about the place because of the reviews that were written about it. We were very pleased when we arrived, after a very long drive, to see a very clean and active place. The first morning, my youngest lost our video camera, he had put it down in the arcade room. I was so upset and the security helped us find it after being returned to the front desk. They were very helpful, nice bunch of people. We had a great stay and our kids loved it, they are 10 and 15yrs old. It served it's purpose for us after spending all day at the parks, we came home and enjoyed the pool and just chilled out. The fridge came in handy because we bought breakfast stuff at a local store and the kids ate before we left for the park. We came back to a clean room everyday! Yes the Seralago is older but we were not disappointed at all. It is a great place when you are on a budget. It is not a 5 star hotel but if you go into it knowing what you paid for..it was alot of fun! I would recommend with kids to book a poolside room. We were on the second floor as there was no issue with making the kids walk up a flight of stairs. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “good for families on a budget”
Reviews.Author: 1cat30
Reviews.Content: I was weary after reading some reviews, but was trying to save money on our vacation and took a chance on the Seralago. Fortunately, it turned out ok. There were a few minor problems. The keys we were given didn't work so we had to walk to the office and get new ones. One night we called housekeeping for extra pillows and they never came. The next day when I called they were there in 5 minutes. We had a room next to the front pool and lobby area and it was fine. The bed could have been firmer, but the room was clean and the location convenient. They say that both pools are heated but we found the front pool to be too cold to stay in. The back pool is at least 10 degrees warmer, but the spa was wonderful. We never tried the food court and the pool bar was closed until the day before we left. The staff was friendly but check in was very very slow. Check out took about 2 minutes, so that was nice. The movie theater plays family movies every night or you can rent movies to watch in your room(they are vhs and our vcr didn't work). It was nice to have a gift shop on site and Old Town is fun to walk around in. On Thursday night there is a motorcycle show and Saturday night is classic cars. For a good pizza, try Flippers. Overall, I would say that the Seralago will meet your needs if you are just looking for a place to sleep and enjoy the pool and spa after a long day of walking in the parks. If you are on a budget, Seralago offers a pretty decent bang for the buck. I would stay there again if I could get a poolside room again.

Reviews.Title: “great for 35 a nite”
Reviews.Author: terrie07Detroit.mi
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the seralago in mid feb 07 1st this is not a hotel it is a motel with lots of amenities they have a game room- a convenience store-a restaurant-a movie theater- 2 pools 2 kiddie pools 2 spas and a playground on site they also have sand volleyball and free shuttles to hte park above all the value was great we paid 35 plus tax on hotwire and if u want to go to the parks u cant beat this place also is on hwy 192 and there are lots of places to eat and a go cart place a few miles down the road also this hotel/motel is right next to old town which has shopping rides food etc the service is not that great 1st. we were placed in a room right next door to housekeeping and the workers smoked gossiped argued right in front of my door so i asked to be moved i was moved across the parking lot in room 531 which is suppossed to be nonsmoking but it is not then i was waiting for someone to bring me a key for another room and after waitng 30 min i walked to front desk and got it myself if all u want is a place to chill before or after the parks fine but if u want a nice hotel this isnt it this place does not have indoor corridors and the snack/ice machine area is not well lit nor does it have a camera over this area i wouldnt go get ice by myself for 35 it was great but not for 90$ or higher

Reviews.Title: “Has protential to be a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler,Kentucky
Reviews.Content: The seralago is in an excellant location, has wonderful staff, and with security protroling all areas I felt safe. The room needed a few repairs. It had broken floor tiles, the safe did not work, one light did not work, you could see under the door, and the HVAC unit was very loud, especially on the low setting. The bed had the hardest mattress that I have ever tried to sleep on. If the management would change out the mattresses, change out the HVAC unit, install a new door, do repairs to the room to inprove the appearance and functionability of the room, and offer wireless internet in the rooms. This would be a great hotel to stay in. I did not swim in the pool or eat at the motel, but they looked nice. I only needed a place to put my items, a place to take a shower, and a bed to sleep in. I did not get much sleep due to the hard mattress, but the facilities met my needs for the other two. If you stay here, the Ponderosa that is located just across the street from old town has a great breakfast buffet for $4.99 plus your drink.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: nicki21082
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the dollar. People have to remember you get what you pay for. We wanted a cheap hotel to just sleep and shower at. Other then that, we were out at the parks the whole time. It was cheap, clean and in a fun spot with alot of resturants, and things to do around such as mini golf and shopping. If you are looking for a hotel that's cheap, this is one to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: Jernie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for nine nights with no problems at all in Feb. 07. Although the rooms are average they are very clean . The staff are very friendly and accommodating to everything we required inside the hotel and as well our tours and shuttle arrangements. Shuttles were always on time and we really enjoyed our stay. An easy walk to Old Town and many good eating establishments . Good value for your dollar. E&J Alberta, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the front of the property”
Reviews.Author: miststuff
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels that can be good or bad depending on what part you are staying in. When we arrived we were put in a room at the back of the hotel, it was horrible, smelly, dirty and upstairs, not convenient as I have MS. It was almost midnight when we arrived and we were moved to 3 other rooms over the space of 90 minutes all in older parts of the hotel that were all equally horrible before moving to a side building that was at least in good shape but felt detached from the rest of the hotel. Yes this was inconvenient but even so the security guy moving us around was an absolute joy and made the experience less troublesome. We spoke the next day to the manager and he moved us within 2 days to a room facing the pool that was called a kids suite. This room was fantastic, clean, smelt just fine, no bugs, bright comfy furnishings, seperated bunk room for the kids with their own tv and game system, fridge and easy access to the pool and playground right outside. The staff are friendly and helpful, quite honestly I think overall the problem with the hotel are the areas that have not been upgraded and if you are in the main front building, you couldn't ask for better. There is a well stocked store with reasonable prices and also a take out to purchase pizza and other hot items which are pretty good. The inside bar was also reasonable, but the outside bar by the pool was not open at all when we were there and I found that disappointing. The pool was clean and great for the kids, we didn't use the jacuzzi tubs but they seemed fine also. The playground is modern and great for younger kids and fenced off safely. The hotel is just a few minutes from Old Town which is fun to go to in the evenings and on Sundays have bracelet specials for the amusement rides. Across the street just a little way down is Ponderosa, the perfect place for breakfast, I believe it's only $3.99 for a full buffet breakfast and the food is pretty good, a great inexpensive start to the day. You're also very close to all the dinner shows, Arabian nights is the closest from what I remember. I would definately recommend Seralago if you are looking for an inexpensive family orientated place to stay and just ask them to put you in the front section of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't call this a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FLJulie
Reviews.Content: I should have listened to the majority of reviewers rather than the last two reviews - if you are looking for a cheap MOTEL and don't mind uncomfortable beds this is it. Was very disappointed when our group pulled and saw that this was a motel - you access rooms from the outside not through a lobby. We had a block of 8 rooms which they assigned at the back of the MOTEL facing the woods - not good at all. I will say that the front desk was very accommodating and moved us into the courtyard area facing the pool area but I'm not sure why we aren't put there to begin with since the motel was certainly not full. The pool area was nice with a great sand volleyball court. Also be warned that the walls are very thin.
