If you are planning your dream Disney World vacation, don't make the mistake of booking this motel. If you are looking for the most basic of rooms and don't mind a motel setting you might be pleased with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Better Then We Expected”
Reviews.Author: saz_haras
Reviews.Content: After seeing the reviews on here, we was very concerned about staying at this hotel, but we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Check in was quick and was a very pleasent experience. We was offered a golf cart to help with our luggage but we refused as the room wasn't far away. The room itself was very nice and big and cleaned really well on a daily basis. The kitchentte and bathroom areas where both very clean. TV was of a high stanard. Didn't use the restuarnts but regularly got stuff from the small store on site and never had any problems with any staff member. In fact every staff member we came across always had a smile on there face and said hello. Felt very safe at the hotel as we were 2 females travelling. When we enquired about ticket prices for the attractions, not once where we pushed into getting any of the special deals where you had to go and look around times shares. Hotel is in a great location. 5 minute walk from Old Town and the Mini Golf. Loads of restuarants and fast food places all within walking distance. All in all we would most definitley stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: sportywhisper
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 nite stay at Seralago. Overall, everything was fine, and the price was right. The room is pretty basic, nothing fancy, but has everything you need. A/C worked great, beds are not like the Sheraton, but clean. Extra pillows etc delivered to the door promptly upon request. We stayed in a "poolside room", but it was actually on the 2nd floor of the hotel, so we had to drag our luggage up stairs, so if you want main-floor, make sure you ask for it in advance. Two huge heated pools, with DEEP ends (9 ft?) which are pretty empty during the day, and open till midnite! If sunbathing is your thing, it's great. Also, 2 hot tubs & lots of towels at the pool. Check in is VERY slow, although the staff was very friendly, and also kept our luggage locked up for us after checkout so we could enjoy our last day around town. My room keys stopped working on 3 different occasions (showed expired??) so I had to stand in check in line each time to get them reset. We took advantage of the "kids eat free" breakfast, (7-11AM) which included buffet OR a la carte--again, nothing fancy, but a good start to the day, but get there before 9:00 or after 10:00 AM or you'll have to wait in line for seating, or you can get cereal, danish & coffee or fruit at the little store off the lobby to avoid the "dining room". You have to check out Old Town (next door), and there's a great mini-golf course, and a "black-lite" indoor course within walking distance -- great for kids. Overall, the hotel served our purpose, the kids enjoyed it, and anything you may need was available.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing and a bit scary!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zan_Kitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for only 2 nights (we were originally booked for 7 nights). The property did not feel safe and it definitely was not as advertised. The motel's lobby and restaurant has been remodeled recently, and that, along with the convenience store, were nice. However, if you try to purchase tickets to the parks at the lobby, they will try to rope you into visiting a time share. We actually got our tickets for less money at the Epcot Gate than was offered to us for a "special deal" at the guest services counter at the Seralago. The room felt damp, there was corrosion from the air conditioning units outside of every room. The room was not adequately cleaned and there were definitely lots of "undesirables" roaming around the parking lot at night. Staying near "Old Town" is NOT a plus. There ARE lots of restaurants around, but you'll find that with most any Orlando Hotel. There is complimentary parking, but again, we found that with the next hotel we stayed at as well. This motel was actually depressing and took away from the magic that is supposed to surround a trip to the Magic Kingdom. We were also disappointed that kids only eat free if the adult orders the buffet (so if all you want is cereal or fruit, you'll pay for your child's breakfast) and that there was no internet access. The "free shuttle" only comes and goes a few times a day (we rented a car). Although the prices of this hotel are very inexpensive, and we were traveling on a budget, it was definitely a relief the leave this hotel and book ourselves into a nicer place. I would not recommend staying here by any means. On another note, if you visit Orlando during peak season, it may be worth it to you to stay at a Disney Hotel. They closed the gates at the parks by noon 3 days we were there, and only admitted Disney hotel guests and season pass holders after the parks reached capacity.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: LLyons
Reviews.Content: The room in general had a "worn" look...from the drapes and bed coverings, to the carpet, tv, refridgerator, microwave, and coffee pot. The walls needed a fresh coat of paint, and there were some dents in the walls and doors. The room had a strong musty odor that made it a very unpleasant stay. There was no dvd player in the room, and the VCR was broken. The breakfast was not worth the $8 per person. I have been happier with continental breakfasts in other hotels where you can help yourself to coffee, tea or cocoa without waiting for a server to set it in front of you. The scrambled eggs were tasteless, the bacon soggy, and the fruit came out of a can. There is a booth inside the main lobby where someone will try to offer you a "deal" for Disney tickets or shows, and after taking a half-hour of your time explaining how it works, you learn that in order to get the discount, you must attend a several hours session to listen to a time-share promotion! That was so irritating! The service at the front desk was inconsistent amongst the staff. There was a pleasant woman in her 50's who was very helpful and courteous; later in the day, a woman in her 20's who answered you abruptly and curtly. Too chilly and rainy to try the pool during our stay. but it did not look very clean or inviting. There offer only 2 shuttles to and from Disney per day...so you need to plan accordingly, and plan to make a day of it, as opposed to a few hours. It would be inconvenient for those with little kids who might need a nap.

Reviews.Title: “good as a bed only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dogcoat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when it was the holiday inn 3 years ago, and found that nothing had changed the rooms were still in the same condition, acceptable. They seem to be doing some refurbishment but it it aimed at the higher priced pool view rooms. Noisy outside as rooms which are not pool side are car park side, so every car alarm which goes off you hear, every foot step pasat your room you hear as outside corridors. We had a room by the ice machine and stairs which was noisy at night, but not a problem in the morning as we were up early each day. Limited bus service to disney, I would suggest contacting the hoel prior to booking as to what time they nake the disney routes, as we found they left first thing in the morning about 8am and did not return till 5pm or later. Diod not use the cafeteria restaurant, even for breakfast brought own food, and stored in fridge and then used microwave if needed. The bar never seemed to be open except after 7pm by which time you have been to the local off license store to buy some beer and store in your fridge. For a room only need, ideal, as long as you have a better hotel to head off to later in your trip to Florida, we did and we really appreciated it.

Reviews.Title: “They still owe me money! Rip Off!”
Reviews.Author: April75
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the Christmas Holiday and I can say I will never stay with them again. They never told us they will charge my card twice on everything and when we got back home I realized my account was overdraft thanks to them. I called the Hotel and they told me the charges should clear off in 5 to 7 days. Well, more than a week has passed and I still have the charges. Rooms are not that big, bathrooms need some renovation. My advise would be, if you still decide to stay here, make sure you understand all the charges and ‘deposits’ they charge to the account. They told me this was customary, the problem is they never told us…and we had two rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here-good experience again.”
Reviews.Author: epoirier
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and once again were pleased with everything. Our check-in was effortless. I asked about upgrading to a suite or poolside room but in the end decided our regular 2 bed room was enough for my husband, me and 12 year old daughter. The receptionist was helpful but not pushy. At first I wasn't sure about the location of our room since it was near the laundry area for the motel. I was worried about noise but the only time it seemed noisy was at shift change at about 7pm. The pools are extremely clean, the hot tub is just the right temperature for sore muscles after days in the parks. Loved that there were lots of towels available and some were even still warm from the dryer. I couldn't hear noises from other rooms but I also don't know if the neighbouring rooms were filled. Our room was very clean and the carpets cleaner than many higher priced hotels I've been in. The bathroom is small with the sink outside the room but good enough for a vacation stay. We had a microwave but it didn't work. We didn't complain since only tried it on a lark, didn't have the need to warm up anything. The fridge was nice and cold, and hopefully someone enjoyed the few beers hubby left that he couldn't finish before we had to leave. Our room was cleaned every day and it even seemed to be vacuumed every few days. (we stayed for 9 nights). We tried the buffet breakfast one morning and it wasn't that great so we didn't go back. We went to Walmart and bought fresh fruit, juice and croissants that we ate each morning in our room. We accidentally locked both key cards in the room, and had no problem getting a third at no cost. (I have been charged for this at other hotels). Air conditioning worked great but I did find it hard to get rid of the humidity in the air so not sure if that is just Florida or a poor working air conditioner. Yes, if I could afford a Disney resort hotel, or a 5 star hotel, I would not stay here, but Seralago has given my family 2 wonderful and affordable vacations.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but only if you can't fork out the money”
Reviews.Author: Palmbury
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in August for 4 nights and we are both in our mid 20's. I knew it wasn't going to be 5 star quality so I had no complaints with the "average" room. After leaving here we stayed two nights at a Disney Resort and oh what a difference, so glad we didn't come here last. We were allowed to check in early. No bugs or anything. You could see under the outside door though. Nice to have a fridge and microwave. We could hear every person that walked by and could sometimes here toilets flush, people cough, etc. The sheets totally came off the bed everynight which was a pain but luckily the maid did a great job. We never checked out the pool. The bar was lame as was the food court and arcade area. No thrills, but again we weren't expecting it. We opted to rent a movie one night from the movie rental there, most were gone or were 20 years old. All in all, average, no thrills. If we were paying a lot for this room a night i would have been furious, but the price we paid was worth it. It is also close to a Target and lots of restaurants so you don't have to stay in the room.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: B4iCMickey
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Seralago a couple of times. We have annual passes to Disney and live 1.5 hrs away. When we decide at the last minute that we want to stay at the parks for fireworks etc... we like to stay overnight so we don't have to drive home late at night. For that type of stay, the Seralago is perfect. We have a large family, so it's a little harder to find places to stay that will accomodate all of us and still be affordable. Both times we stayed in a large suite facing the pool. Once on the top floor, once on the bottom. It has a bedroom with 2 double beds and tv, big bathroom, kitchenette (small refrigerator, microwave, sink) and living room with murphy bed and full sized sleeper sofa and of course a tv. We put the kids in the bedroom and sleep on the murphy bed. The mattress on the sofabed leaves a lot to be desired. The rooms have all the basic necessities, soap, shampoo, towels, even paper towels for the kitchen and some plastic cutlery. I definitely would not want to spend more than 2 or 3 nights, but for our impromptu overnights, it has been comfortable and clean both times. There is a free breakfast included but it is only for I think 2 people, so not enough for us. And from a brief glance into the restaurant we decided we'd rather pay a little extra and get something we know we like. There are tons of places right nearby. That's a whole 'nother review because some are good, some not so much. The only negative we have experienced is at night it tends to be a bit noisy. Nothing that keeps us up, just a little bit of a nuisance. I think it is due in part to the fact that Old Town is right next door. (though my kids love having a view of the crazy bungee ride right out the window) Also, the first time we stayed, there must have been some kids running around during the night because in the morning we woke up to some sticky blue substance (paint, I guess?) on our window, in the key card slot and also saw it in the vending machines and on other windows. They also seem to have more security than I've ever seen at a motel, which reassures yet concerns me. We will stay here again in the same circumstances, but when we go for longer stays, we prefer something nicer. Overall, this place is a good value for the money, but would be a disappointment to anyone looking for a "magical" Disney getaway.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel with a couple of negatives”
Reviews.Author: LoveChicago
Reviews.Content: The Seralago is a huge 614 room hotel with a variety of rooms including suites and kids suites located in Kissimmee just a few miles from the Orlando attractions, where you will find most of the budget oriented hotels. We were originally in a deluxe room but that room was unacceptable (my friend heard lots of folks complaining about their rooms) so we upgraded to a huge two room suite which had a bedroom with two double beds, a living room, small kitchen and a bathroom. The suite could sleep up to 8 people as a murphy bed pulled out from the wall and the sofa also doubled as a bed. The room was very comfortable and we had no maintenance issues. The bedroom had reasonably comfortable beds, a TV, and a VCR plus a phone with a message light that we never did get to stop flashing. The kitchen had a microwave, coffee maker and small refrigerator but no dishes, glasses or utensils. The bathroom had a hair dryer, adequate towels, minimal toiletries (soap, shampoo), plenty of hot water and decent shower pressure. The living room had another TV and VCR in case two parts of the family want to watch different things, a sofabed and a chair. Our upgrade included a breakfast buffet each morning, the first morning it was pretty bad but the next three mornings it was good with lots of hot items including pancakes, french toast, eggs, bacon and sausage. And the waitresses were all extraordinarily nice. The hotel had a small snack shop where you could get some food plus a couple of onsite places to eat and two outdoor swimming pools. The negatives: The hotel shuttle only goes to Disney World a few times a day and then only to one park at a time, it stops at other hotels so it took us at least 1 1/4 hours to get to the Magic Kingdom using the shuttle. There was quite a bit of noise at night since all of the rooms were exterior rooms. Kids playing shuffle board at midnight, older teens literally throwing dog feces at each other on another night, someone pounding the metal banisters at 3 am. This is a definite drawback to this kind of hotel where all the rooms are on the exterior of the buildings. I don't know that I would stay here again but it certainly was an acceptable hotel and very economical in comparison to the Disney Resorts and higher end properties.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Rocky-Bear
Reviews.Content: Well, we were quite apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on this site. We had been rebooked here from Nikki Bird after it changed hands. We had previously stayed with Holiday Inn, Travelodge and Howard Johnson in the same area. We were pleasantly surprised, the Seralago was better than all of those. It wasn't the Ritz, but then we weren't paying Ritz room rates, and it was all that was needed. Check-in was efficient and friendly. We had an upstairs room overlooking one of the pools. It was clean, and well equipped with a fridge and microwave, coffee maker, iron and board, free safe, clock radio and efficient air con. There were plenty of towels replaced every day, and the room was well serviced. The swimming pool and surround were clean, plenty of sunbeds, the hot tub was hot, and there were loads of pool towels which was great. They even didn't mind if you took their pool towels off to the water parks and then returned them. We didn't use their restaurant as the hotel was within easy walking of plenty of places - there was a 24 hour Dennys if you were late back from the Parks, KFC, McDonalds, IHOP, Sizzler, and Ponderosa doing an all you can eat buffet breakfast for $3.99. Again, not high class stuff, but good enough for the kind of holiday that most of us are on in Orlando. If you needed them, there were also a Publix and Walgreens just up the road. I would say try to get a room on the inside of the blocks, overlooking the swimming pool, rather than on the outside looking onto the car park, to cut down on noise. We were perfectly satisfied and would stay there again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “large clean room,”
Reviews.Author: CTJohn
Reviews.Content: this is a standard two storey motel with outside entrances to the rooms. We were pleasantly surprised that the room was large, very clean and in good condition. The bathroom was a bit worn but clean. Lots of hot water, many towels and the room was made up well and cleaned every day. Air conditioning worked well and the unit was quiet and efficient. Overall, we were pleased with the hotel especially after reading some of the previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: lovindisney06
Reviews.Content: Okay, heres my review....we had been planning our vacation for many months and during that time I had read all the reviews on this hotel. Since they were both good and bad and the price was good I thought I would give it a try. We needed a room that had 4 separate beds and Seralago was the place. For a two room suite which included 2 breakfasts I was sold. When we got there they were very friendly and they had no problem letting us into our room early. The room was as I expected, nice, not a 5 star but definitely okay. We had a pool and hot tub right near us. The hotel has 2 pool and 2 hot tubs in two different places which was nice. The breakfast buffet is good, you can have eggs any way you want, bacon, sausage, home fries, fruit, etc. the price went up to $5.99 from $4.99 but try to find that price at any restaurant. One of the nice things is that Old Town is two restaurants (KFC and Red Lobster) away and we went there every night after the parks. Lots of fun! The pools at the hotel were nice and clean, the hot tub was great, the beds were comfortable. The only thing is that they did not call us in the morning when we had asked for a wake up call. But the room had 2 alarm clocks so no big deal. We had a jacuzzi tub in our room but we didnt use it. We personally thought that it was a great hotel and would definitely stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: NinaTh
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Toilet in bathroom did not work. Then next night leaked. Air conditioning extremely noisy and not much adjustment, choices either on or freezing cold. Pillows non existent! Have stayed in rooms near pool which previously were just OK. Will not stay again. Reception not very well organised.

Reviews.Title: “Never recommed this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Sindra
Reviews.Content: This place was horrible. Check in was good. Lobby was pretty. They gave us Room 607. We walked in and it was freezing and I'm from upstate NY and use to cold. Propt the door open to warm it up. It was an ugly room but we were going to a dinner show and had to get ready. Daughter took a shower and came out saying it's flooded. The shower leaked all over the place floor was covered with water and the ceiling was totally wet. I went to move something on the bed and stuck my had in something sticky! Not a good sign. Packed up and went to the front desk. They were very nice and moved us to room 104. Room was alot cleaner but in need of updating. Everything was ok till the next morning. Used the bathroom and the toilet was pluged. Forgot to mention it to my daughter and she used it. Once again water was everywhere. I'm glad we were checking out of this place. It is the worse place I have ever stayed. I beg anyone who reads this. There are alot of hotels in this area. Find one that is nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ivorygirl
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very dirty, hair all over the bathroom, dirty phones, food crumbs under charirs, etc., and the airconditioning units were filthy. My overall impression was that the hotel was old and needed not only a face lift, but their quality control concerning cleaniness is more than lacking. This hotel would not be my first, second,or third choice.

Reviews.Title: “Only just OK”
Reviews.Author: almond174
Reviews.Content: We were originally due to stay in the Nikki Bird but this booking was changed by our travel operator to the Seralago. We found the place to be rather shabby and dated but cleanliness, particularly in the public areas was good. The pools were large and well maintained with plenty of sun loungers and pool towels. The rooms were showing their age and could do with a total refurb. Our room was serviced every day to a reasonable standard but there is obviously a lack of thorough cleaning - for example a squashed bug on the bathroom wall (admittedly too high for me to reach!) was not cleaned off during our entire stay (21 days). We found staff to be very friendly and helpful and we saw none of the time share touts as mentioned in some other reviews. Overall it was just about acceptable but we would not visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Reccomended”
Reviews.Author: oo7
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Disneyworld and started looking online for hotels. When we came across Seralago we thought "this place looks nice and such a great price." How wrong we were... The second night there, they left our door unlocked and available for anyone to come and go as they please. And don't even try to add an extra night to your stay, we found that to be nearly impossible. We got back to our room one night to find that our keys didn't work. After being out all day in the sun, at 10:00pm we had to go all the way to the front office just to wait for almost half an hour to get new keys. Their idea of making up for mistakes is offering you a free breakfast for all the guests in your rooms. Good thing it was free, because it was definately not worth paying for. All I can say is that we will never stay here again. The only good thing I have to say is that our room was clean and the area was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Patriciap
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Seralago and had an absolutely wonderful time. The Kidsuite was really cool. It helped that there's a Kids Eat Free Program too. The pools are huge and the location is tops.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: MEC44
Reviews.Content: We rent 2 rooms for one night. Upon arrival are check-in went smooth. However the rooms we had did not meet the standard on a 3 star rated hotel. * Toilet in one room did not work - was given another room. * Carpets in all 3 rooms you did not want to walk on with shoes * Hair in shower(s) * Soap sump in bath room. Given the operation, we would not have stayed even 1 night. We used Orlando--- to compare hotels. We have stayed at a few of the other 3 star rated hotels and this one was not even close. Based on this rating system used by Orlando---, we're not sure we would use this site again...

Reviews.Title: “strange”
Reviews.Author: wwhassouna
Reviews.Content: we were in miami before we decided to travel to orlando the next day . It was my wife , her brother and me . I was very much interested to go to orlando but did not know anything about the locations . We booked Serelago for $60 per night not including breakfast . The lobby is gr8 parking for free and we got a room on the ground floor . we had a rental car so proximity was not a main concern . the hotel was not very secure in terms of entrance to the premises but orlando turned to be all the same . the pluses are the price for 3 in a room , the availability of many restaurants in the area .

Reviews.Title: “Never would stay again”
Reviews.Author: eeyore73
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at this hotel for one night on July 23rd. I was extremely disappointed in the hotel room. This hotel is old and needs a serious makeover. Upon arriving in the room, my children of course took off their shoes. Within minutes their feet were black. That totally discussed me. The bathroom had hair and dust all over it and not just in the corners. The one good thing was that i did not see any bugs. It certainly was not worth the $70 that we paid for the night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Safire119
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay in Fla. for only one night, so we figured that the Seralago would be alright. The photos on Expedia seemed decent enough, so we gave it a try. Big mistake. Their "non-smoking" room reeked of smoke upon opening the door, which by the way, had a broken latch. The towels did not look clean, and even had some stray hairs tangled in one of them. Speaking of hairs, there were a few more on the bathtub. As I was getting under the sheets, I noticed a few red spots on them as well. I immediately came to the conclusion that they barely cleaned the room. The least I expect of a hotel room is that it's clean. I didn't even get THAT much out of this place. Needless to say, my family and I were VERY dissatisfied with this hotel. The grounds of the hotel and the lobby are nice enough, but the room, which is the most important aspect to me, was horrendous. Equivalent to a super cheap motel with a lazy cleaning staff. I'm not a very picky person, and I've stayed everywhere from motels to 5 star hotels. This place is the worst place I've stayed in my life. Bottom line: it's just not sanitary, so please go elsewhere (unless you LIKE filth and grime).

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL RSORT BUT”
Reviews.Author: GRANDOF2
Reviews.Content: My 13 Family Members and I Stayed Here For 9 Days RESORT Was GREAT Store Had Everything Needed People Where Fantistic Pools Where The Best Yet. But HOUSEKEEPING NEEDS TO BE INSERVICED IN CLEANING A ROOM There Was A few Days Where All Of Our Rooms Where Not Touched By HOUSEKEEPING And There Was 1 Or 2 Days That We Had No Towels And Had To Call The Desk Who Was Very accomidating I Have No Complaint Except For Housekeeping. All In All We Ejoyed This RESORT Emensly We Plan On Returning And Staying Here Again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at Seralago in Kissimmee and couldn't have wished for a better holiday. I was a little bit worried after reading a few bad reviews but we couldn't fault it in any way. The rooms were clean, with fresh towels daily - we stayed in a Kidsuite and my two girls aged 11 and 9 absolutely loved having their own bit of space and privacy - it meant they could watch what they wanted on their own TV. The pool and jacuzzi were lovely and warm with ample sun beds and towels. The hotel showed films each evening for the kids which gave us some time to enjoy the "specials" in the hotel bar. We only ate in the restaurant one morning for the buffet breakfast, which I must say was lovely, but we found it too filling to eat so much first thing on a morning!! The hotel shop was so well-stocked with bagels, croissants, bread (and toaster), danish pastries, cereals that we had more than enough choice for breakfast and the snack bar was great too. The location is perfect for visiting all the Disney/Universal parks and a short 10 minute stroll into Kissimmee Old Town with lots of restaurants, gift stores and supermarkets along the way. What a wonderful holiday we've had. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: JAB40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over memorial weekend. Price was great for a no frills hotel. Clean, friendly and a great location for all the parks. Only problem we found is that when we were leaving we found our door wouldn't lock and so it had been unlocked the whole weekend without us realizing. Once we told the front desk they were great and comped one night stay for us. We will definately stay there next time we go to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “It did the job without any flare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel in the suites when it was the Holiday Inn and loved it. This visit, I took just my two sons and stayed in a non smoking room. We were assigned room 1017 which was clean but showed some signs of wear and tear. Most notably, the bathroom had an assortment of dead mosquitos stuck to the ceiling and there was some rust at the base of the door frame in the bathroom. The sliding lock to the connecting door to the adjoining room was broken, but the botton one worked with some force. There was security visibile driving around on golf carts which is a plus. I got a great AAA rate by prepaying online for the room. I can't complain. THe room was clean and did the trick at a nice price. For a stay in the Orlando area to enjoy the sights and attractions of the area, I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two week stay with my family at this hotel and found it to be fantastic. The room was well kept and clean, the bathroom was just as good. The reception staff were very helpfull - sorted out a room mis-understanding without a problem. After my daughter had a fall the security team came to administer first aid to clean and dress her grazes - thanks Paul you did a great job. I can't say the breakfast buffet was that good - I found it expensive and the food was cold but the staff were helpfull and friendly. The food from the Peoples Choice was good - I recomend the pizza's. The staff working behind the bar were very friendly and helpfull - Thank you ladies. The pool area was good and there was a plentiful supply of clean towels to use poolside. The Spa was also good to help relax after a hectic days sight seeing. All in all I found my stay at the Seralago to be a positive one and I would be more than willing to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Overall not bad”
Reviews.Author: Tyalana
Reviews.Content: Just got back.Like most after reading the reviews on this hotel we had mixed emotions on whether we should stay there. We were pleasantly surprised. We stayed in section C in a room with 2 double beds which had renovated rooms. Our room was clean but small for 2 adults and 2 kids. I got a Canadian military discount at this hotel so for the price I could not complain. I found the best price by using there hotel website not a online travel agent. Our trip was very busy and the hotel was just a place to sleep. The hotel is close to Walt Disney World but it is best to rent a car. The hotel disney shuttle was good but it is very busy there over this period and having a rental car gave use much more flexablity. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is not worth it. You can get a cheaper and better breakfast buffet just up the road at the Ponderosa Steakhouse. We had our toilet backup and they responded within 5 minutes to fix the problem. If you have a rental car one hint to use for getting to Disney. Go straight through the lights when you leave the hotel and take this road to the next set of lights. Turn left and your on the Osceolla Parkway. Just stay on this highway and it will take you into disney and from there follow the signs to the theme park you want. There are no tolls and it beats all the traffic on 192 (Irlo Bronson Hwy).

Reviews.Title: “Good family fun and food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with my two boys ( 7 and 10) made a mad dash to florida over Spring break planning on spending 2 nights in Orlando. Seralago was advertised a good family fun and it was. Our room was older with things cracked and peeling but we're low maintenance people anyway and, since we had beautiful weather, we were only in our rooms to sleep, shower, etc. The kids loved the big pools. And the food and drinks were shockingly nice and more than affordable. We had an on-time shuttle to and from Disney and truly enjoyed our brief stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time”
Reviews.Author: brearfox
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 3/30-4/6 and had a great time. My first room was facing the parking lot and door did not close well so I went to the desk and they gave me a beutiful room facing the pool. It was nice to just walk out of the room and the pool right there. They were very nice and I would stay here again. But only pool facing rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All !!”
Reviews.Author: philnkris
Reviews.Content: We almost didn't stay due to the lousy reviews here, although we were traveling on Spring Break and had little alternatives. We weren't about to spend 400 a night, and we had out kids with us, ages, 4, 6 and 8. So we tryed it out, got a great AAA rate at 89.10 a night and stayed 3 nights. We had a blast, very clean, not fancy but the room had a room within it made up as a fort with bunk bbeds, a tv, a game console etc. Our kids thought it was great, the food is priced well, there is a very nice convenince store with every thing you need and a good pizza and hoagie place too. We think the Hotel is great, sure it's a little older, and a little rough around the edges, but not so much that saving 300 a night would make up for. The biggest draw back is the pool, very old and plain, large olympic size 9.5 deep although no diving allowed, the spa is old as well and the water was gross. So we went to wet and wild for the day, with the money we saved we did an extra park and had a blast, after all your only there to sleep anyway. Don't be afraid, try this place, it's not the ritz, but then its not motel 6 either. Trust me, if your with smaller kids, it's fine. If you want a mint on your pillow, bring your own mints or go to the peabody at 600 a night. Good Luck, and have fun,

Reviews.Title: “very racist staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my young child last june. For the price the room size is good, however the staff was very racist. Went into the store in the hotel the clerk put my money on counter and diodn't acknowledge me. Thought she was having a bad day but every visit to the store yielded same results. Complained to the manager and was brushed off. Then lost a day of my vacation because the safe in room malfunctioned and it took the security half the morning to repair safe. Security when he did arrive walked right in my room without saying good morning or asking what the problem was. Didn't get a look from him until he overheard a conversation I was having which revealed I was in law enforcement. Very bad experience at this hotel. If your African American wouldn't advise you stay...Treatment is bad...

Reviews.Title: “Would be nice if improvements are made”
Reviews.Author: pinkus06
Reviews.Content: The room had chipped and peeling paint. One of the wall sockets in the room had been falling off and the wires were hanging out exposed. The sheets were dirty there were black hairs on pillows when bed should have been clean. The food in the hotel was terrible they are definatly not worth eating at unless you want upset stomach and runs. Single person staying by myself was scared because it would get loud and noisy outside of room late at night when trying to sleep. Strange men would walk by and stare into room if curtains were left open once. The service at front desk was terrible wait was like a very long time. Shuttle service was inconvient when it came to pick up from disney world you were stuck there all day till 6:30 at night. And bus would get so full people would have to stand when obvious they should have had more busses. I would not go back there unless improvements were made.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough, but certainly not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: mjt328
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Seralago from February 16-23, 2006 and were generally satisfied wtih the experience. This hotel was part of our Noli Tours package and for the last-minute price we paid, I wasn't expecting 5-star accommodations, merely something middle-of-the-road, and Seralago met those expectations. On the positive side, the room was clean and well-applianced (colour TV, clock radio, microwave, oversized bar fridge, coffee maker, iron, ironing-board), and everything worked including a very nice shower which never suffered from lack of hot water. Lots of dining and shopping options were to be found within 10 minutes of the hotel, with many in walking range. Enterainment options were equally as accessible. Hotel staff was friendly, polite and efficient, and parking was ample. On the down side, the hotel shows its age somewhat (worn carpeting in several places, walls in need of painting), and is very large (nearly 650 rooms) and impersonal. Vending machines in our wing didn't work worth a damn. The layout is reminiscent of Holiday Inn and Howard Johnson properties of the 60s and 70s i.e. rooms arranged on two floors in very long rows. Final comment: while Seralago would not be our first choice of hotels in the greater Orlando area, we would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: joefrommontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from March 6 to the 13 for 1 week 2 adults 2 kids. Asked for 2nd floor room they let me choose between 2 rooms.The room was not modern but very clean the housekeeping staff are great.The pool was always clean and warm.The location was great lots of places to eat and shop.Minigolf next door,old town,close.The one problem I disliked was the beds are starting to sag they need new ones,other than that its a good place,I would return next year if i get the same price.$390am from alpharooms p.s pool rooms cost more but why waist money you cant see the pool from the ground floor anyway there is a feance and bushes 2nd floor Better view.Over all a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay in Florida”
Reviews.Author: MONTYDRUITT
Reviews.Content: We stayed last year and it wasn't the best hotel in Florida we had stayed at. Previously, we had used hotels on International Drive but fancied a change and tried Kissimmee. The hotels is "functional" and the first room we were given was dirty. However, to the hotels credit they did move us without an argument. I would recommend this hotel to families who want a "cheap & cheerful" option close to Disney. Anyone else, try I-Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids.. not for a young couple looking for a quiet vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are in our late 20's/early 30's and looked on Trip Advisor to book our hotel for a week vacation. The Seralago looked nice from the pictures, had fair reviews on trip advisor, and the prices were decent. When we pulled up to the hotel and into the main lobby we both had a funny feeling. The building was worn down. We originally chose a poolside deluxe room... No, no.. there's no deluxe in this room. Very small, uncomfortable beds and furniture falling apart. We knew that we wouldn't last 2 days in this room let alone a week. We decided to check and see what else they had upgraded (for $40/night) to a 2-room suite. MUCH better! However, basically at this hotel you get alot of teenagers with school groups and children. I know we were in Orlando but we weren't expecting it. The pool area is loud from open to close and the location is fair. Not too many places open late close to it on Rte 192. Although there is a Target and the local chain resturants around. Some Advice... if you choose this definitely get a suite!!! You'll be very dissapointed in anything less. And second. We have finally learned our lesson that you get what you pay for and will be staying in hotels closer to Universal/I-Drive that may be a little pricier but are worth it! So for all you young people without kids... take our advice. Spend a little more somewhere else and you'll be much better off.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: sheluvsblu
Reviews.Content: For those of you who stayed at this hotel and loved it, I wish we could say the same. We had an awful experience. The hotel is seriously rundown. The first room we were directed to smelled of mildew, had soiled furniture, a worn out bed and ugly, old mismatched furniture that was likely purchased decades ago. The front desk was nice enough to send someone to take us to another room. We walked to another side of the hotel passing cracked pavement and wobbly balcony railings to another room. We had to wait while the person struggled to open the door with the hotel key. After a few good knocks, the door opened and we entered another smelly room with loud air conditioning. This one appeared a tad cleaner. We were ready to call it a night when a huge roach scampered right pass my feet. That was enough for us. The place was just too dirty. We checked out. On the bright side, while they did not seem shocked or motivated by our complaints, they did let us leave without issue and we found a beautiful hotel somewhere else. Also, we were told that the hotel is due to get a renovation. But for now, this place is good for those looking for a motel 6 type environment. Although, frankly I once stayed in a motel that was better.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seralago this past weekend (March 3-5th)and were pleasantly suprised. I was very nervous because of the reviews I had read online, but all turned out great. We stayed in the regular guest room with 2 double beds and our room consisted of a large 27-inch television and VCR, microwave, mini fridge, coffeemaker, sink and a cabinet for storage. The room was clean and accommodating. No musty smells, no mildew in the bathroom. The only concern that I had was the electrical wiring. Out of 6 outlets in our room, only 4 worked. (& 1 was questionable and only worked when it felt like it) The bathroom light would flicker off and on at random also (which was very amusing when my husband took a shower and thought I was turning out the lights on him) & the outlets were actually protruding from the walls some. (like they weren’t anchored into the stud) That is my ONLY complaint about the hotel. My daughter was staying @ the Disney Swan & Dolphin hotel for a cheerleading competition (with her cheer team) and their rooms were $249 a night. For that price, the only difference in hotel rooms was a very nice paint job, goose down comforter, a soft bed and astronomical prices in the restaurants and bar. The Seralago had very good prices on food and bar drinks and everything was very tasty and well put together. The wait staff and hotel staff were very nice and accommodating also. We had absolutely no complaints. The hotel also has a heated pool(2), hot tub, fitness room, arcade, kiddie pool, basketball and tennis courts, beach volleyball as well as a daily movie screening in the Orlando Room. This hotel is very reasonably priced and we would definitely stay here again. As for some of the reviews that say to ask for the newly renovated part, I was told the entire hotel was renovated 2 years ago, so there are "new" and "old" rooms any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Request a room in the renovated section”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5, 3 children and 2 adults stayed here the first week of February. We had to change rooms twice and finally were really happy with our suite overlooking the pool in the newer section of this hotel. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. Breakfast at this hotel was poor so we did not attempt to eat there again for lunch or dinner. This hotel is close to Old Town which has alot to do for the kids. We were in Florida though mainly to see Walt Disney World. The shuttle to Walt Disney World from the hotel is really efficient and convenient. The pools were well maintained as well as the hot tub. I was really hesitant is staying here as I had read a mix reviews, some not so good. This hotel is very reasonably priced and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place ”
Reviews.Author: daisyduke76
Reviews.Content: We just got back Saturday. We loved the double suite room. Staff very accomodating and friendly. We had to move out room twice as it was smaller than anticipated and it was in the older section which smelt musky and needed definite upgrades. When we looked around the hotel we found the renovated rooms at the back overlooking the pool and tennis courts. The staff gladly moved us to a vacant suite. Breakfast was the only meal we had, not so good so we only ate there once.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me its better than Disney Resorts”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the seralago was a good hotel. They had alot to do on the growns and there were alot of stores and malls around. Wal mart was even down the road which was cool just in case u forgot some things like i did. It was great that the pools stayed open until 12 so after a long day at the park u could take a fine dip. I reccomend the hotel it was pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “2 1/2 stars maybe?”
Reviews.Author: tbkvpool
Reviews.Content: We used Hotwire to get a "bargain" price here. Hotwire rated it as a 3 star but Priceline rated it a 2 star. Priceline was closer. The price Hotwire got us was not much of a special---companion travellers drove in and got the same price! The room was clean and the location is great but the breakfast buffet was awful! Eat at Denny's or IHOP down the street. The noise of the air conditioner could blast you out of the room---if your neighbors in an "adjoining" room don't. IF you want just a bed to sleep in between visits to WDW this place is ok but use TripAdvisor to compare prices before choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. Everything was perfect and the staff was very friendly. We can't wait to go back. Give it a try, you will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional, unimpressive, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are about what you expect for the money, but the staff and general attitude that permeates the place is less than welcome. I arrived late--about midnight--and was treated as an interruption. Further, I expected to be closer to the Disney entrance--there are dozens of places that are actually "close"--but not the Seralago. If you're going to Disney, DON'T go Seralago--it will dampen your spirits!

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Everything as promised”
Reviews.Author: SeeTee-27
Reviews.Content: It's not new or fancy, but it's clean, comfortable and very, very affordable. Especially with Canadian dollars at par! The facility is well maintained, our two-room suite was exactly as shown on the web site, and the pools are fantastic. The services available on site make it very convenient and as many other reviewers have pointed out, the staff are friendly and helpful. Even the time share tour desk works well... and the tour itself is low-key, low-pressure and quite tolerable....well worth the discount you get for the tickets if you can "just say no". We visited at a relatively slow time and the place was quiet... it's a huge facility and must really hum during spring break.

Reviews.Title: “A Glorified Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Seralago Hotel & Suites in Nov. 2005. From what I saw on the web it looked okay. I read some reviews and decided it was a safe bet. Boy was I wrong. Our room was standard size but dirty looking. The bathroom was disgusting. The shower was stained and there was mold growing in the tiles. Even the lobby and the pool were extremely disapointing. The web site makes this place look way better than it is. It is no more than a cheap Motel 6 type place. It is rated 3.5 stars but it is more like 2. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful deciving”
Reviews.Author: itsmelll
Reviews.Content: The entrance way is much better looking then the rest of the buildings. This was the a Holiday Inn before it changed names to Seralago and when I got my first room it smelled moldy. The second room was OK, new TV old bathrooms, rooms number are deciving...room 434 is on the first floor! It is only a 2 story hotel like a days inn, but yes 2 seperate buildings. They do allow dogs. They do make sure you know they are not responsible for theft of your car or valuables because it is noted on your parking pass!

Reviews.Title: “nice staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in the Seralago. The first room we were allocated was horrible, it had a glass panel door which meant everyone walking past could be seen and didn't seem very secure.After returning late from the theme park the group of young men in the next room were having a party with about 20 guests the noise was unbearable and the kids were scared, the interconnecting door did not help much either, by 2.00am we had had enough and went to reception and asked to be moved which they did straight away, no hassle. The security guards showed us some different rooms to make our choice from and they couldn't have been more helpful, we chose a room in the 400's on the second floor overlooking the pool. This was so vastly different from the first room, it was clean, spacious and had been refurbed and was very QUIET.The rest of the hotel was great,it is a lovely pool and spa with plenty of space for everyone and the location is really good as there were things to walk to and an easy drive to Disney and Celebration.I would definately stay here again but would always ask for a room on the second floor facing the pool nearest the main lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price-hard on the back-you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for seven nights. The hotel is dated as many are in this area of town. Overall on a scale from 1-10 its about a 4 or 5. Sure the staff did their best to keep things reasonbly clean. Things are just worn out. The beds are like sleeping on a worn out hide a bed mattress placed on a sheet of plywood. If you have a bad back avoid this location. If you are not too picky and are ok wearing slippers inside (gross carpets)and can stand a poor mattress..this is a place for you, the price is very good for a budget and the location is excellent. Note to owners of this hotel. Renovate the rooms, add a decent mattress and people will be willing to pay alittle more you have a better location than most on the strip. Your staff is good...its just this renamed old Holiday Inn needs some TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place at a great price with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pcuff1980
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights in November and I have to say that the staff here were excellent, very friendly. I also have to say that the rooms are exceptional value for money. I couldn't fault this hotel at all, only the location lets it down since we didn't find Kissimmee that great to sty in an ended up moving to International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget friendly hotel - would definately recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Seralago November 19-23 and had a great time. I was very nervous after reading some of the reviews; however, I was pleasantly surprised when we checked in. The hotel staff was very helpful and did everything to make you feel welcome. We had a kidsuite - the room was clean & did NOT smell at all. The single parents package worked well for us also. Service was great, staff was great also the room & pool/hottub were clean. Plenty to do outside the hotel-minigolf next door, restaurants, Old Towne & gift shops. I would definately recommend this hotel & would stay here again in the future. **perhaps the others that have complained expected a 5-star hotel?? Not quite sure how they had problems!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ,clean,secure,quiet,economical,excellent service.............”
Reviews.Author: Vince1
Reviews.Content: We are from Woodbridge Ont,Canada located just 10 minutes north of Toronto and im very proud to say that the stay at Seralago was beautiful and the people who work there are terrific..The price was reasonable and the grounds were clean as my room was..Security is 24 hours and the grounds were patrolled throughout.However i would definitly book there and with no hesitation stay the extra week for the fun we had becuase Disney world and all the attractions were within 20 minutes from this hotel.The pool was very warm and very inviting and the only thing i wasnt pleased with was the internet.The internet was the biggest negative but the hotel made up for it...Lots of nearby food outlets and lots of fun at night..We have two small children and entertainment was more then enough till 10pm at night...Check it out or email me for more info.........

Reviews.Title: “Good Find - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kurlee
Reviews.Content: Seralago was truly a pleasant place to stay! The staff went out of their way to make sure our visit was nothing short of terrific. The kids eat free program was a real $$ saver and our children loved the Kidsuite. The two pools are huge and there is even a mini grocery store which came in really handy because the rooms have microwaves and refrigerators. Will look forward to returning to the Seralago. You will not be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Second Time=Strike Two”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, My boyfriend and I decided to give the Seralago a second chance since they sent me a gift certificate to use due to an inconvinience that caused us to be relocated to a different room on a previous stay with my child. I knew what to expect, so I made sure that I booked a poolside room, beings as though those are the ones that appear to be renovated and kept the most clean. Well, when we arrived at the check-in desk, I realized I forgot my gift certificate. I tried to explain what type of gift certificate it was, and who issued it, etc. I finally was told it would be alright to see if I could get it faxed to the hotel from my home. While I was waiting on this to happen, I overheard a front desk clerk (whom by the way did happen to be friendly during our last stay and was actually the clerk that relocated us to a different room the last time since our room had some maintenance problems) telling her co-worker that she had "Never seen us before". Very classy thing to do while a guest is still standing in front of you--talk about them. EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS THERE! I was not looking for a free stay, as I booked two nights and still had to pay for the second night, since the certificate was only good for one night.But in a nutshell, I was able to get the certificate faxed through. They did honor it, and the room was okay. This stay was satisfactory, but please teach your employees to not talk about their guests while they are standing right there. I will not be staying there again, the rude employee ruined the experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “Seralago - Kinda Yucky”
Reviews.Author: ddouceus
Reviews.Content: Oct 7 - 11, 2005 First, I would like to say that the staff is to be commended. They are nice, helpful and friendly. My children enjoyed the breakfast buffet and it was a great value when added to the room. ($12.00 per day for 2 adults and 2 children) Also, kids eat free for dinner as well. I also liked the fact that the laundry room was well light and clean. Unfortunately, I will not be staying at this hotel again until it has been updated. Here are some reasons why. The first kidsuite room that my family and I checked into had such a bad musty, mildewy odor that I had to request we be moved. At first, although unpleasant, the smell was not so strong because the air conditioner had been turned on full blast. Before leaving the room to go to Downtown Disney we turned down the air a bit, by the time we came back the smell was horrible. The next morning, I had to request we be moved. The next room was not really any better. Housekeeping needs to keep an eye on things. There was feces on the wall of the bathroom and mold/mildew in the corners of the tub. Nothing a mixture of 1 part Clorox/ 5 part water couldn't fix. (Good thing there was a Wal-Mart nearby.) The rooms, carpets and bed covers really do need to be Febreezed. The malodor is very much present. The beds are not comfortable at all. Old age is causing them to sag and is causing the coils to come through. The whole time I was there, I kept thinking about the Dateline or was it the 20/20 special on filthy hotel rooms! Not too good.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpalago.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. Maybe I am picky, but let me say this: This place is NOT clean, despite other posts. Its a dirty motel. You enter the room from the outdoors. This helps the mold in the rooms to fester. Dont let the pretty picture on the internet fool you. The rooms are NOT bright, nor SPACIOUS. The mattresses are bowed from age, the rugs are dirty and the bathroom is gross. Suffice it to say, I stayed long enough to call another hotel, and got the heck outta there. Yes, the lobby is ok. Most hotels have an ok lobby...but you don't sleep in the lobby, so who cares? This is the kind of hotel that people might rent for an hour or two, if you know what I mean. Don't stay here..its disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this older motel last week in September 2005. The decor was showing signs of wear but was spotlessly clean. All staff were friendly and helpful and the ameneties were good. We are happy to recommend this motel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very so so”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great location but the 30 year old hotel is showing her age. the rooms "we looked at few" were damp and smelly in need of updating. the hotel staff though were very good and were the saving grace of our stay.not sutable for families,the pool stays open until midnight which atracts male parties and we heard of "ladies of the night" on the complex while we were there.the weekends were the worst being woke up as the young americans didnt finish making noise till 4 am.

Reviews.Title: “The outside is great...too bad you have to stay on the inside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The grounds were nice. Unfortunately, the room was horrible. It smelled bad, the carpet was nasty, our key stopped working and we were locked out of our room, the cabinets were falling apart and we were constantly picking up pieces of broken wood crumbs off the floor, the bathroom floor was filthy and had dirt and mildew in each corner of the wall, and to top it all off there was a hummungous cockroach in the nightstand drawer between the beds. Maybe it was as bad as it was because we stayed in a standard room, which seems to have not been renovated, and didn't pay extra for a deluxe room or a suite, which appeared to have been renovated. I'm not sure, however I am sure that my family and I will never ever stay at this hotel ever again in life.

Reviews.Title: “no problems at all”
Reviews.Author: lorrainehunter
Reviews.Content: My 13yr old son and I stayed at the SERALAGO HOTEL in Kissimmee in July 2005 for 2 weeks and we cannot fault the hotel in any way.We are from Edinburgh in Scotland and this was our 4th trip to Florida each time staying in different hotels.On our 3rd trip we drove around and stayed in 6 different hotels/motels so we are able to compare.We chose The Seralago ourselves from the web and though it had mixed reviews decided to see for ourselves.Turned out we made a great choice!A great hotel for the family, good pools, great room, friendly staff, the girl who cleaned our room every day was brilliant.And right next to the Old Town.We didnt book a car for this trip and again another good decision.The local bus serice was EXCELLENT cheap and reliable.A pass for the week was only 12 dollars, a real bargain!.The local bus even goes into the Disney bus station.We did use a couple of taxis to go to dinner shows and they were cheap as well.Please note, unless you are going far afield, say Kennedy or Busch Gdns, you can save a LOT of money by NOT bothering with a hire car.We didnt miss a car one bit! Also there are now proper pavements all around Kissimee and lovely shaded bus stops too.We will return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seralago from July 14-18. After reading some of the other reviews I was a bit nervous, but am pleased to write that I was completely satisfied with our stay. The room was clean and had no smell at all to it. The bathroom was spotless. We didn't hear any of the guests around us and had restful sleep on each of the nights we were there. Having the refrigerator and microwave was a huge plus for those evening snacks or quick breakfast items. We ate at the hotel's breakfast buffet the first morning. It was good but didn't have a huge selection. We highly recommend the breakfast buffet at the Western Sizzlin about a 1/4 mile down the street. As we rented a car, we did not use the shuttles to the parks, but the Seralago website had a detailed schedule of times. The pools were clean and not crowded on the days that we used them. The staff provided excellent customer service. They were all polite and very helpful. All in all we had an excellent experience at Seralago and would consider staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and pretty OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: mumof323
Reviews.Content: All staff were extremely pleasant, the kidsuite was pretty good although could have done with a lick of paint particularly in the kitchen and bathroom. Would have preferred a kettle rather than a coffee maker. The maid particularly gets lots of stars as our room was spotless each day. Pool is lovely, breakfast a bit pricey and not much choice. Good pizzas though. All in all would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location but was surprised this hotel got 4 stars to be honest.Rooms were clean except for carpet but furniture tatty and old.First room they gave us had a dead cockroach in it and was right by the entrance used for all hotel employees with much zooming around on golf cart type buggies.They changed us with no problem to a quieter room but it was very gloomy and dark.Pools are good with plenty of clean towels and lots of sun beds.Location right by Old Town was great and was the hotel's saviour really.The hotel was clean but really needs a good update decor-wise. Pro's: Clean (except for manky carpet) Good location Good pool Cons Tatty Dingy Tattiness made it appear dirtier than it actually was sadly. Some rooms could be noisy All in all hotel was unoffensive and adequate but I would rate it more as a 2 star than a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Not 3 stars!”
Reviews.Author: countdown48
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel as part of a package deal and was very nervous about what it would be like after reading many of the reviews. The rooms are very old and dated. The bathrooms are what need the most attention; for me when a bathroom isn't "right" then the rest of the room feels dirty. The rooms were very musty smelling and damp; housekeeping did a so so job of cleaning but didn't overexert themselves. It was very convenient having the little fridge and microwave. We used the pool and there were plenty of towels available. The convenience store was very overpriced. The fitness center was a joke...a treadmill, a stationary bike, and a stair stepper...all of which were very dated. The location is good; it is close to disney and not a difficult drive to Universal, you just hop on I-4. One of the worst things about this place is that the walls were PAPER thin, you could here everything from the rooms around you. I also didn't feel very secure staying there. Overall, I would give this place a one star, about the same as a motel 6. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, but stay away from Ponderosa's breakfast buffet because it was bad and not worth the $3.99 plus drink charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: annhe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seralago hotel the first week in June, 2005. The first thing I have to say is that the location of this hotel can not be beat. It is right next to Old Town and there are many restaurants and other attractions all around this hotel. It is right on 192 which provides access to many activities and stores including Target and Walmart supercenters. The location gives you easy access to all the theme parks. The hotel also has a dining area and another food court. There are a couple of large, nice pools, whirpools, kids pools which are well maintained. The rooms are basic but very clean. They all have microwaves and small refridgerators which came in very handy. The hotel staff was very, very friendly and helpful. They do have a free shuttle to Disney but we rented a car so we could go where we wanted, when we wanted. Because of the location of this hotel, it was very easy to get around. We really enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay was aweful!”
Reviews.Author: funmommacomb
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel was rated "3" stars, I would give it a 1 1/2 to be nice. The rooms are old and dingy. The have a musty smell and the carpeting is filthy. When booking a 3 star hotel I would expect something very nice. Wrong. The outside entrance of the hotel and lobby look nice, after that it is all downhill. The employess do the bare minimum. No special greeting or friendly hello. Housekeeoing takes forever to get anything--hours. Bathrooms are filthy. Landscaping around property is shaby, needs weeding and mulch redone. Kiddie playgroung is all weeds! Needs to be cleaned up put some sand in. Pools seemed fine, but didnt use them. Shuttles were convieient and on time (Not run by Hotel). Ambiance of hotel was horrible. All you see in all the windows are the backs of the curtains, which look like white sheets. Not very nice at all. None of the drapery is open, just looks aweful. Rates were cheaper than others, but you can defintley get more for your money. Website is also very misleading. Would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellect Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from vacation and had the pleasure of staying at Seralago. I had read the some of the reveiws prior to our departure and was also a little concerned about some of the complains, as the hotel looked so nice on the internet when we booked it. I'm pleased to say that we were not disappointed, but in fact very pleased with the hotel. The staff were very friendly, the rooms were neat, clean and fresh, with lots of towels. The pools and hot tub were clean, warm and again lots of clean towels at the pools. The food at the restaurant was excellent and best of all kids ate free!! Service was great!! We didn't use the Food Court much but it was convenient to be able to pick up milk for the room fridge when you have children with you. We didn't rent a car on our stay this time as the hotel offers free shuttles to the Disney attractions and I wouldn't hesitate to do this again, it was great not to have to worry about car rentals and traffic. We are also able to book shuttles to Universal Studios. The hotel is very central and with Old Town just next door we probally woudn't have used a car. Overall an Excellent Experience.

Reviews.Title: “If you have doubts, don't ignore them!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I try to be fair about my opinions regarding hotels according to the price I pay, and what I expect considering the price I am paying. I will first say that I got a bad deal because I paid $69 per night and have learned that people are getting this hotel for a lot less. Generally that is a cheap hotel stay, but in the Disney area there are a ton of hotels at this rate or lower. So with that said.... our first room smelled really bad. Although I wouldn't say it seemed dirty or unkept, the bathroom floor was sticky (which I think I later discovered the cause of and I will get to that!) The bathroom itself... at one time there was something sticky stuck to the back of the bathroom door and whatever it was had been peeled off, leaving the sticky stuff still on the door... which also had a lot of black hairs stuck to the door. Kind of gross. On the second day there (after we were all unpacked of course) the toilet overflowed... not just overflowed, but wouldn't STOP overflowing and continued to overflow into the carpeting. I had to crawl through the mess to get to the toilet to turn off the water to get it to stop. I called the front desk who assured me someone would be there right away, and an hour later I had to go up to the front desk and remind them that I had called at which time they said maintenance was very busy with other rooms... (red flag???). They gave me another room, upstairs all the way on the other side of the property, not near the pool (which I was paying for a poolside room). I asked what the chances of upgrading to a suite were and was informed that would cost me an extra $40 per night so I declined. Room number two was better, didn't smell so funky and we could deal with it, however, the refrigerator (which was a deciding factor for me staying here) didn't work very well, there were never "fitted sheets" put on the beds at any time. Instead there were flat sheets that were somewhat tucked under the mattress (when they were large enough to tuck under the mattress...) On a good note, the hotel had a decent sized pool and it was heated so my son enjoyed that. The hot tub was nice and hot... however on the one day that it wasn't turned on and I actually had a look at it, I noted that without all those foamy bubbles you could see a lot of dirt and grime floating around in there. Not sure how often it was cleaned. Can't comment on the cafe because every time we thought about going to it, it was closed. It is only open certain hours. The location is great. Old Town is practically right next door, there are plenty of restaurants nearby and shopping, and it was very easy to get to and from the parks. We did not use the shuttle service so I cannot comment on that, however I did look at the schedule for the shuttle and remember being thankful that I had my own car. Would I stay here again??? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Sceptical after reading some of the reviews but..........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: April 10 - 15 was my stay and not alot of complaints but after reading the reviews before leaving was a bit concerned. There are 2 large pools, ours was very warm, the hot tub nice and there was a volley ball court also and at the other large pool there is a kiddie pool with play area. Thre are laundry facilities but I didn't use them but many others did. The convenience store outragious for prices we just went to walmart for what we needed. The rooms were worn but clean no ants, bugs etc. Security checking all levels of hotel thru the day and night. Housekeeping kept towels stocked and placed kids special blankets and stuffed animals on nicely made beds. The room was to have a murphy bed plus 2 queens and a pull out, it was less the murphy but worked for us. There was a coffee maker, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, microwave and bar fridge and the bathroom was kept clean daily. It was quiet in the evening even though the pools are open until midnight. The breakfast menu items and buffet at the vineyard cafe were great. The arcade room was nice to have but can be expensive if you allow it. Nice gift shop, but convenience store very highly priced so we used walmart for our items. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “A+++, Wonderful, More than we expected, Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful surprise. We were not expecting much for booking over the internet but we were pleasantly surprised to find a very clean room with no bugs, odors, or bad furniture. It not only was clean and safe but had a microwave, mini-fridge, coffe maker, and blow dryer waiting for our use. We liked it so much that after check out we came back two days later and stayed another night. The staff was very accomadating and cheerful. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone, it was truely a nice place to stay for the little bit of money it costs.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I feared what I would find, since I only heard of it through the internet, but I was pleasantly surprised. It is very children-oriented. If you are going to stay at an offsite resort at a reasonable-priced hotel, this is the one. The pool is heated, which is good during sping break. We used the onsite convenient store a lot. The rooms are clean. I stayed in a standard room, not the kids suite. The refrigerator came in very handy. Be prepared to ride for a while on the bus (complimentary transportation) to DisneyWorld. You will make several stops. The Guest Services department in the hotel was not very friendly, but the hotel staff was pleasant. It is difficult to find the hotel if you are not familiar with the area. There is a lot of construction/detours that will not be done anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On check in we were given a room someone was already occupying. The next day I asked if we could stay 5 days instead of 3 and the MANAGER said yes. It wasn't put in the computer and we found out 2 hours before check out on the 3re day that the hotel was booked and we had to be out. I called 7 hotels from the room and they were all booked. We checked out and drove and kept stopping at hotels until we found one. What a hassle and disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Great place to stay for the price. Clean room and clean linen every day. We will stay here again. The breakfast is great!

Reviews.Title: “8th time-going down hill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the 8th time my family and I have stayed here. We checked in on Easter Sunday. It has gone from a fun family atmosphere to an average resort that needs a major face lift. I guess if we had not been there so many times some things would be intolerable. As a Holiday Inn there were activities going on for kids and a certain level of food quality, room quality and cleanliness. As the Seralago, our room had paint peeling, water leaking from the ceiling and a broken toilet. It definately needs updating. The hotel staff was friendlier than I have ever had in the past. The food in the food court was awful. Barely etible. The breakfast buffet was really good and free. The Guest Service Manager, Robert, was rude, unfriendly and did not seem to care if you had a problem or not. No promised return phone calls or any assistance whatsoever. The maid was terrific. She did the best she could with our room. It smelled nice and for the first time in 8 years we had a good room location without having to complain first. They took out the kids theater and put in a very tacky wedding chapel. The outdoor pool bar was never open that I could see. The arcade was ok. My kids loved the pool. It seemed clean. I love the location, right next to Old Town. There is plently to do within walking distance including Pirates Cove mini golf, food places, and Old Town-a great place to go. The area is going down hill it seems and so is the hotel. Year after year it gets a little worse. There was security everywhere. Makes you wonder why they need so much. We may need to try somewhere else next year. As a travel agent I am unsure if I would even recommend this place unless you are just looking for ok accomodations, good price and a good location. I was mainly upset about the rude guest services manager. Customer Service goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: kathp1978
Reviews.Content: This has to have been the worst hotel we have ever stayed at. We stayed here for to weeks in november 2004. The hotel only seems to have short stay guests at this time of the year, so during the week it dead. When we stayed there was a big collage American football game on, and some collage kids stayed at the hotel. They partied all night next door and on the walkway in front of all the rooms. We were kept awake 'til 7am by them for two nights. The rooms were of a really poor standard for a Holiday Inn and the staff were no better. We asked for help with our bags when we checked in but did not get any. Five days before we were due to leave I requested a late check out as our pick up for the air port was not 'til 3pm and i was told that would be fine. On the day of check out the maid arrived to clean the room at 8am, the the head of house keeping called at 10am asking what time we were leaving the room, and I told her 3pm.
