We were called 5 minutes later by the receptionist and told we had to leave the room by 11am or pay for an extra days stay.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two adults three kids stayed here the week before Easter holiday. This hotel is just ok, there was nothing spectacular about it. Kids eat free with a paying adult, however the restaurant food was so bad we ate there only once. Close to Walt Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Value, Slightly Worn”
Reviews.Author: SaintPaulPete
Reviews.Content: Our family, two adults and 4 year old twins, stayed for the first three nights at the Pop Century Resort on the Disney property. There are real advantages to staying on the property but the hotel room was small and after the kids go to bed there isn't much to do but watch the TV quietly or take turns going to Downtown Disney. When we planned our trip we wanted to have the last four nights in a suite where the kids could sleep while we watched TV or read in the living room. We checked the prices on a number of web sites and finally, with the help of Trip Advisor and it's reviews, decided to stay at the Seralago Hotel and Suites, formerly Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites. What we found was a slightly worn around the edges hotel that was maintained pretty well. The rooms were a little worn but very clean and pleasant. Our living room was the size of the whole room at Pop Century. Along with that, the bedroom was bigger again than that and there was a big bathroom. The kitchenette had a small coffeemaker, small refrigerator and microwave. All perfectly adequate for our needs. The best price we could find was $79 a night compared to Pop Century at $62 with our AAA discount. I don't think that they discount the suites there, but at $79 they are a bargain for families. We enjoyed our stay and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a low price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I have been to this hotel three times in the last four years. Last time we stayed there was June 2004, we booked our room with an Entertainment card which I had accidentally left at home. The staff was exceptionally helpful and allowed my parents to send a fax of their card so I could receive the discount. They also let us add on a few more days at the discounted price. . The first thing my son said when we arrived last time was "This is my favorite hotel , I love this place". The grounds are nicely landscaped and they have two large pools and a small sandy play area with a wooden jungle gym which my son loves. They also have a very clean laundry room next to the back pool. The rooms have always been very clean but worn. ( I don't replace my carpet as soon as I get a stain on it and I don't expect hotels to either. ) We love the mini- fridge and microwave in the room for breakfast and late night snacks. Two out of three times we had new fluffy pillows on the beds and the other time we received extra pillows within five minutes of the request for more. The location is great. There is a light at the entrance to the hotel and by going straight thru the light we can get to any of the Disney parks in 10-15 minutes. There are also a lot of restaurants, gift shops, and Olde Town nearby. We plan on going to Disney one last time April or June of 2006 and will definately be staying here again. This hotel may not be the most modern with everything new but it truly is a great place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Laurasioux
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now called the Seralago and if you look at the web site you would think that it is a nice place. Wrong! It is a real dump of a motel. Extremely noisy from the carnival just across the parking lot. Not too clean, uncomfortable beds, etc. I agree with the other reviewers--this place needs to be updated. The breakfast buffet which was included in the price of our room was lousy. The best thing I can say is that we didn't waste much time eating breakfast and that it was nice to have a fridge in the room. Don't stay here. I'm sure there are plenty of other places for the same low price of $75/night. It really is worth it to have a good night's sleep after touring the parks all day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Deceiving Hotel!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was so deciving on the pictures we saw on the intenet. The rooms were dirty and the staff there were rude. The managers need to go to customer service classes. Our toilet was so dirty with urine stains around the bottom of them. They have a so called kitchen which the laminate was peeling off so my 18 month old had to be watched so he didn't put anything in his mouth. The hotel was so outdated and needs some serious wrok done. While we were down the the hotel changed managment you would think for the better(no way). The cafe was horrible our first day we got lunck down there and there was no food left and it was expensive for what they had to offer. Never again! Please read this and I hope you take me serious and Please DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! It took them 2 days for them to bring us up a crib which was brought to us dirty. It looked like a truck ran them over. I sent that back outside. I had called down to the front desk and ripped the manager's ear off. They then sent up the same guy and we watched him out the window and get this he turned the mattress over and used the same sheets. Please keep driving if you want a good vacation with no headaches!!!! This was like the ghetto hotel!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay if your a family on the run”
Reviews.Author: altimagirl84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled here January of 03 for our Chistmas gift to each other. We did not have a lot of money so we found this hotel in a great location, very reasonable in price. We arrived early afternoon and were promptly checked in. We were supposed to have a king size bed but the room they gave us did not. Plus, our room was on the 2nd floor (NO elevators) and was out in the boon-docks! I then buzzed the front desk and they sent a mainteance guy to pick us up in the golf cart and move our luggage for us. They moved us to a room right across from the pool, very close to the lobby. The room still only had 2 double beds but at this point I was tired and really didn't care anymore. The hot tub was never really crowded when we got back from the theme parks which was nice to relax after hours of walking. There were kids all over but what do you expect from a family hotel. There are many positives about this hotel: -Heated pool that closed at mid-night (during the winter months) -Acarde for the kids (and adults) with video games and my favorite...air hockey :) -The free shuttle to the parks worked out great as we did not rent a car. The pick up times were reasonable too. The only thing that stunk was bouncing from park to park to pick up the other hotel guests. When your tired, you just want to get back to relax in the room. -The hotel is on a very very busy street. However, there are your choice of restaurants to eat at. Also, there are many activites to do...for adults and children. There is mini golf, a carnival, go-karts, etc. on the main strip the hotel is on. -Each room has a microwave and a fridge so if you have soda, water, snacks it's nice to be able to store them and enjoy without leaving the room. There are a few downfalls which are expected: -The restaurant was always busy in the morning but the wait was never really too bad. -Be prepared that the cholrine in the pool and hot tub is VERY strong. My bathing suit (being a few years old) was literally eaten-thru. On our check out I filled out the comment card and they sent me a free night stay voucher. -Also, the pressure in the shower was not that great but it worked. What do expect when probably over 100+ people were trying to shower? -Hotel rooms look and feel old. But, it's a room that was cleaned daily. You always had fresh towels and a fresh made bed. You can tell the hotel has some age and is in need of renovations but it works to sleep in. If you want rest and relaxation do not come here! However, if your a family trying to make the most out of your Disney vacation this is a great place for a decent price. Your not going to get 5 stars of service but the hotel staff will help with any problems. Treat them the way you want to be treated and they will help you to the best they can. Overall, if I were to go to Florida I would stay here again. The people were polite and the location was great. The cost wasn't really expensive so it was affordable, even for a poorer family. Thanks for reading this review!

Reviews.Title: “I beg you! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What really makes this HI lame is the contrast between their Shangri-La web advertising and the reality when you check in to your room. This is an old-line HI, it looks like it dates from the 60s. The "Kidsuites" are a joke, they're just a portion of the room fenced off with cheesy stockade fencing. Not to sound TOO snobbish, but the crowd was about 1/2 regular families and 1/2 low-lifes or very young adults. One night I took a walk to the laundry and saw some 20-year old guys cooking from a hibachi on their pick-up's tailgate. A couple of nights I witnessed surly-looking young guys in their do-rags strutting around the parking lot, talking into their cellphones. Looked to me like a deal was goin' down that night!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best. Doesn't deserve the Holiday Inn name!”
Reviews.Author: robertj1277
Reviews.Content: I was barely able to tolerate this place but I did. This place was built in the 50's and it's still in the 50's. I saw very few signs of big renovation projects. Not much security to start so park your car right in front of your room if you can. Complex is huge with two nice looking pool and is well landscaped. When I walked into the room I was not amused. We luckilly did not find any bugs like some others. Bathroom was disgusting. Floor looked like it was from when the hotel was built. Bathtub was filthy and mold and rust was all around faucets and floor. VCR must have been form the 80's if not before. It did have a fridge and a microwave which was nice. And the beds were quite comfy after I got used to the place. Thank goodness I didn't have to spend my whole Florida trip here or I would have been more dissapointed. Sell the place H/Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: HampshireJdon
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas at this hotel to escape the UK weather. Sadly the Florida weather was disappointing but the hotel was not. We had been anxious, having read the reviews, but found our room to be very clean, well serviced and the staff were always helpful and polite. The pool area was clean and well maintained and although the room was not over large, there was a fridge, microwave and regularly replenished tea and coffee. It was not luxurious but in view of the cheap rates perfectly adequate!

HotelInfo.Name: Seralago Hotel and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 5678 W. Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy (US192), Kissimmee, FL 34746
